reviews.review:
This place is amazing. :)  I had asked the conceirge for a restaurant recommendation when I was planning my Vegas trip and they had recommended this venue.  It was a totaly splurge for my boyfriend's birthday and to compliment the dining experience, I had tickets to Cirque du Soleil's "O" after dinner.

The restaurant is hidden, and is the only restaurant at the Bellagio that does not have signage for the restaurant facing the Bellagio pool.  We had to ask hotel staff how to locate the restaurant, as to there not being any signage for the restaurant inside the Bellagio as well.

The restaurant is an experience for all the senses.  The decor is beautiful and I had requested a window seat for my dinner reservation.  You are able to enjoy the Bellagio fountain while dining.  

Service is impeccable.  We had a very knowledgeable and gregarious waiter.  It was definitely worth the splurge.  The total bill came out to be over $300 dollars including wine.

We had both ordered filet mignon (I opted for filet mignon with foie gras) and a side of tempura, a side of truffle mashed potatoes, and a side of creamed spinach.  (I can't seem to recall our starters nor dessert.)

It was a great experience and we can't wait to return to Prime.

I had a fantastic experience at Prime.  The food was savory, well prepared, and the presentation was very nice.  It is very expensive, however, and only a few select tables get the views of the fountains.  

We started out with orders of Salmon Sashimi and Ribbons of Tuna.  Both were incredibly flavorful and exceeded our expectations.  The Ribbons of Tuna comes with a radish and ginger marinade that completely rocked my world.  I was not sure if I would like it or not, but I ended up using bread to soak some of it up once we finished the tuna.  I highly recommend it!

Everyone in our party ordered steak.  I opted for the special which was a bone-in filet.  The steak came out cooked to perfection and I savored every single bite.  Fantastic!  It was not the best steak I have had, but nothing has ever held a candle to the Wagyu steak I had back home.  I really wanted to try it here, but I just thought it was too expensive ($30 per ounce).  

The side dishes are very good, and the portions are large enough to share.  I opted for the Tender Broccoli with Truffle gouda fondue.  It was rich, and I couldn't finish it.  By then I was already full from the appetizers and steak.  

Our service was top notch, and I expected nothing less.  I have little doubt that we will be back again soon!

Went here for the first time on Monday night. UH-MAZING! I don't usually go to restaurants like these..but since I was in Vegas for work, the boss took us here. We got to sit right where they show the water show. It was pretty great :] . They ordered an onion soup for me because I can't eat seafood....fantastic. So cheesy..mm!

I ordered the filet mignon..AOSDOAJDSOJ
It just pretty much melted in my mouth!
Never tasted anything so amazing..

My sister also ordered the truffled mashed potatoes...best I have EVER tasted. It was amazing.

Of course a very pricey place.

It was the boss's girlfriend's birthday that day. Usually restaurants would bring out like ice cream, or a slice of cake..NOT HERE.

THEY BROUGHT A FULL CAKE. It was HUGE. I was so shocked..and...it was delicious :] 

DEFINITELY RECOMMEND!

Terrible and bland, don't come here unless u want slow service and poor quality food for the price u pay.  From appetizers to steaks to sides everything was mediocre at best.  Nice place but plenty of better steakhouses in Vegas, pass and thank me later

I chose Prime as the location to propose to my girlfriend yesterday and I am thrilled that I did. From the reservation a few days before all the way through they were kind, courteous and extremely helpful. I initially picked Prime for the location and knew that I wanted a seat on the patio where we can watch the fountains go off. They sat us at a table close to the water and right in the center. Could not have asked for more.

She ordered the 18oz ribeye and I ordered the beef short rib. We shared a side of the fingerling potatoes. Everything was delicious and exactly what you would expect from a fine dining experience. The bread basket has three bread options... sourdough, pretzel and a sweet raisin/walnut I believe. I have to say that I could have just ate bread and would have been thrilled. It was sooo good.

They brought out a beautiful little desert with Happy Birthday inscribed right as the fountains were going off as I had requested.

I look forward to returning to Prime down the line and know that I will receive top notch service and food.

Thank you to the staff (Charles-manager, Jesus-waiter and the rest of the team) for making our experience one to remember. You guys are awesome!

4.7 stars.

Superb staff, discreet and alert. One of the best staff anywhere. We were originally mis-booked at 2 separate tables, but when our party raised this with the hostess, she re-arranged house seating to accommodate our party within  5 minutes - seamless service at its best.

Best steak in Vegas - enjoyed this steak over Smith & Wollensky's and Capital Grille. 

Seamless service throughout entire meal - party of 15 was attended to by a team of servers without interruption. Members enjoyed their meal at varying pace within the party, while service remained completely unobtrusive yet attentive. One of the best dining staff I've ever experienced.

Gorgeous, opulent decor. Luxe floor-to-ceiling drapery, larger-than-life floral arrangements.

I brought my wife here for our 4 year anniversary and we got a seat close to the window that looks at the Bellagio fountain. Good atmosphere and a nice restaurant inside. The service was good and the waiters were friendly. We ordered a Caesar salad to start off, which we shared and I didn't like their dressing at all. My wife got the French Onion soup which she really liked. For our main course, I ordered the Rack of Lamb which was amazing. I really liked the sauce they put on it also. My wife ordered the Ribeye which was equally as good. We also had sides of steamed asparagus and mashed potatoes which both were good. We opted for no dessert as we were pretty stuffed. I was a little surprised that the restaurant didn't do anything at our table since it was our anniversary and I let them know that when I made the reservation. Usually a nice place like this will bring you out a plate of chocolates or a small dessert but we got completely stiffed this time. Overall the dinner was pretty good, but a little pricey for what it was ($217 after tip, no wine or alcohol at all). We said that we lived the meal and the view of the Bellagio fountain, but not somewhere we would be craving to come back to.
Wonderful experience!!! the service was fabulous, food so delicious, wine amazing!!!! Oh and the view...simply the best!!! It puts the Myrtle Beach location to shame!!!!

I want to eat here everyday! We had a great dining experience and enjoyed our meals. I had the ahi tuna and the boyfriend had the kobe steak. They have a nice wine list and I though the service was great!

Could not have been a better and more perfect wedding anniversary celebration.
Came in from LA and spend hours researching the BEST dining location for ambience, food and service.  Wow, so many choices.  Settled on Prime and hoped for the best.
Chris, a maître d at Prime, was instrumental in helping assure us of a window side table. Class act...thank you Chris.
Pedro, with the caring and on the spot support from Natalio made sure our evening was memorable. 
The food was second to none and included what we felt was THE highlight dish, that being the Short Rib. The Rib Eye was ok but a little tough, appetizers choices were a great Cesar, awesome carpaccio with steak tartar.
The only let down was the sommelier who gave us a bit of cold shoulder, probably due to the fact we brought a very special 25 year old bottle of wine. We gladly paid the $50 corkage fee to enjoy our special keepsake, but would have loved to enjoy the same courtesy and caring service provided by Natalio and Perdo....Thank you gentlemen. 
Will DEFINITELY be back when next in L V.

This place surpassed my expections. Not only did they have our table ready when we arrived 15 mins early but the service was excellent.

Everything we ordered was top notch except the lobster bisque it was a bit too salty for me.

We ordered the signature seafood appetizer which was delicious. And we all got the surf and turf special.  We got a side of truffle mashed potatos (EXCELLENT) and creamed spinach. We didn't go to crazy when it came to desserts because we were so full but we did try the trio of sorbets.

I highly recommend it best meal I've ever had in vegas
My fiance took me here for our one year anniversary and it is one of the best in Las Vegas. The ambiance is great and the food was amazing. Will definitely be going back!

What a beautiful place to have dinner. The fountain view is not to be beat. The service was over the top. The food delicious. 
I am gluten free and they had a special menu. I was there with a party of nine people.  The side dishes are shareable and every dish that was presented at the table the waiter leaned over and told me if it was a safe dish for me to eat. 
It is extremely pricey restaurant but was well worth it.

We always visit Prime when we come to the Bellagio, and it never fails to disappoint. We visited in January and had the opportunity to sit outside. It was such a meal to remember, seeing the fountains from such a beautiful angle with just a few other tables. 

The filet, potato sides, creamed spinach and shrimp cocktail never disappoint. We also enjoy the foie gras and shellfish platter for appetizers. Yes, it's pricey, but well worth it!

Fantastic. My Outlook calendar had messed up our reservation and they went out of their way to seat us nonetheless. The sommelier was knowledgeable and friendly and the staff top-notch. Most importantly, the food was delicious.

This is one of the most beautiful rooms in Las Vegas and one of my favorite restaurants, so when my best friend asked where I wanted to go for my birthday, Prime was my pick.

We requested one of the tables for two up against the windows overlooking the fountains and I was kind of surprised that the place was packed on a Wednesday night. Even the outside patio was full. Fortunately, I do have a casino host to take care of things like this.

In any case, the food and service are just superb here. Just my opinion, but once you are at a place that is using the best ingredients and knows what to do with them, the rest is just what kind of ambience you are looking for and other very subjective things. We wanted to talk and have a laid back evening without blasting music and a low douche factor.

We were served an amuse of salmon on cucumber, which was a fabulous start. I had the tomato and burrata salad, which was perfection. It's amazing that something so simple like a perfectly ripe tomato can taste so wonderful, although most of the time I'm just used to whatever passes for a tomato in CA.  My friend had the seared foie and said it was in her top 5.

For our entrees, I chose the surf and turf special- lobster tail and a filet that was at least 3 inches thick with a tablespoon of lemon spaetzle, while my friend had the peppercorn New York. Both were cooked medium rare as asked. Two plates of heaven.

The sauces are really standouts here. I could have had a glass of the soy/ rice wine. It was perfect with my lobster and the filet. 

For sides, we had fingerling potatoes, cream corn and tempura onion rings. Only the onion rings didn't hit it out of the park- they were just OK.

As you would expect, the service was friendly but professional and I really did appreciate the server mentioning the price of the specials. The surf and turf was $118 (hey, it was my birthday!), but it can be awkward in a group or business dinner if someone has to ask. I've been burned a couple of times.

For dessert, they sent out a trio of lemon tart, vanilla bean ice cream and a chocolate mini-cake. Yum!

While Prime is one of the more expensive steak houses in Las Vegas, it is certainly a great pick for a special occasion or when you just feel like treating yourself to a lovely evening.

My wife and I dined at Prime a couple weeks ago. She had a beef filet cooked perfectly to her liking. I am a vegetarian, and they had wonderful offerings for me, including a vegetarian tasting menu. Prime not only offers a separate vegetarian menu, they also have vegan and gluten-free menus.  Do not shy away from Prime if you are a vegetarian. They have thoughtful, creative, seasonally driven selections - you will not be limited to broccoli and rice, or a salad. Think of it, if you have a group of six, or eight, chances are someone in the group will want some sort of alternate menu and Prime can take care of you. As a vegetarian, Prime is among my favorite restaurants along with with Michael Mina at the Bellagio and several of the restaurants at Wynn/Encore, including SW, which have vegan selections. Of course, atmosphere and service at Prime is exquisite. Corkage at Prime is $50 - of course, wines you bring must not be on their list. I highly recommend Prime for steak lovers and vegetarians.

I came with in hungry and with an open mind, being a huge steakhouse fan.  They charge a hefty price for their steaks; and the steaks are very good.  However, the steaks are nothing special.  I had the ribeye, and my date had the filet.  Both were obviously quality cuts of meat, but just nothing that would set either apart from other steakhouses.

I did not appreciate the attitudes of the snooty staff and hostesses.  This place is over-the-top pretentious, which is to be expected, but I just felt like there was an ora that was disgusting.  In Vegas, I've enjoyed Guy Savoy and Joel Robuchon which are other even higher-end restaurants.  There was a warm feeling with the service and I felt like their guest for a special treat.  At Prime, they made it feel as though I should be thankful to be served and seated in such a prim and proper, "high" class environment.  

Prime is trying to be something that it's not.  This restaurant is located 45 yards from a wheel of fortune slot.  There is nothing privileged about working/eating there.  We're not in Paris folks, we're in Las Vegas- king of the nobody doing his best to act like he's somebody, and paying the credit card price for month's to come (LV is my favorite city in America).

Finally, the $100 seafood appetizer platter was a complete waste.  The oysters were terrible (relative).  Prime needs to lose the attitude, and focus more on special food that matches the price.

Fioe gras with jalapeño and apple was awesome!  A must. 

Skip the ceasar, to much citrus.  

Rib eye and filet were great!    Ask for rare plus!  

To full for dessert.

Beautiful restaurant looking at the Bellagio fountains. Great wait staff, very knowledgeable and attentive. Now, just a quick bad note, my husband got the peppercorn steak, which was not great at all. A little over done and the pepper flavor over took the steak in a bad way. My husband was too nice to send it back. 

BUT, the lamb made it a 5/5 for both of us. It was a perfectly done medium rare. With a tomato sauce on top. Since my husband had food envy and it was a generous portion, I shared with him. This was the best lamb either of us have had. It's been a few months since we've been there and I'm still telling everyone about it and dreaming of it!

Food, location and service all ten stars across the border. Kristine our bartender was helpful and friendly. Amazing steak house with an unbelievable view of the Bellagio fountains ! Worth the investment

In this week for dinner.  Good but not great.  I don't mind the prices, but I do expect to be blown away by a $63 filet.  It was fine, but just that and wouldn't come close to even making the top 25 for me.   Same with the scallops - nothing wrong with them - but just good, not great.   

It is a nice setting and if you are close to the windows the view of the fountains is a bonus.  The service was very good, our waiter very attentive and pleasant.  

$400 (w/tip) for 3 - that was salads and mains and a few glasses of wine,  no desert.  

Again, overall it as fine; but not a place that makes my list of great places to have a steak.

This place is a very good dining experience. The greeters, waiters, managers and chefs are all on point. It has to be good to be in Vegas, and even better to be in the Bellagio. The steaks are super well aged meats and always cooked to perfection. I have eaten here 10-12 times and ordered something different each time. It has always been great. They have a huge seafood platter served as an appetizer. Its HUGE and has oysters, mussels, large prawns, lobster, and some other fish varieties. It serves the whole table as an appetizer from 2 to 10 people and is incredible.

Highly recomment you stay away from the buffets for one night and check Prime out.

I had made reservations for Prime to celebrate our anniversary.  In the reservation, I requested a table on the patio overlooking the fountains.  When we arrived, we were offered a table on the patio, but it was such a terribly hot day, that we declined.  The hostess kindly seated us inside by a window so that we could still see the fountains.  I didn't even ask, as I figured those tables would have all been taken.  I was thrilled that she did that for us.  The service was second to none.  I was thoroughly impressed with the staff throughout our meal.  They really make you feel special.  We ordered drinks (which were made perfectly).  We then ordered appetizers.  I asked for the beet salad and my husband ordered the pea soup.  Both dishes were great.  I ordered the surf and turf special and my husband got the dry-aged ribeye.  We also got the whipped sweet potatoes and the herbed peas.  Wow.  The surf and turf was unbelievable.  The filet was so tender and cooked perfectly.  But, the lobster tail was probably the best I have ever tasted.  Everything else was also tasty.  My husband really enjoyed his steak.  Although I am a dessert person, I was too full to indulge in anything else.  But, we were presented with a dish with "happy anniversary" written on it with four gourmet chocolates on it.  We had never mentioned this to our servers.  It was such a nice and thoughtful surprise.  Overall, we had an excellent evening.

After getting an email from an employee several months back I decided to give it another shot. The food was great and so was the customer service.  Close to being 5 stars, but not quite there.  Maybe next time.  What I will tell you though is that it will be a good meal in a good location with service you would want.

Eating at Prime will always be remembered as one of the best nights of my life. We were there to celebrate our anniversary. We made our Friday night reservations three days in advance and only had a 5:30 or 10:00 option. I am glad we went to for 5:30, because we were able to see the Bellagio fountains by day and by night. They were also able to give us a seat on the terrace which was amazing. Every bite of our meal was unbelievably good. Our steaks were perfect. They offered some incredible sauces. My favorite thing was honestly the white truffle mashed potatoes. WOW! The staff was great as well. Our experience here was nothing short of incredible and worth every single penny.
Very sophisticated food and service.  I highly recommend the filet and lobster.

Hostess very polite. Waiter Russell extremely professional/polite. Busser did his job but didn't look like he wanted to be there. Overall good service.
Food - 6 oz filet mignon with blue cheese (just know that blue cheese topping is an extra $10). It was a nice cut, very tender and the sear was good too. I ordered these potato fingerlings. My wife called them high class french fries. Overall, excellent food.
Ambiance - old school decor, 40's style furniture and design overlooking the Bellagio fountains. Appropriately dimmed for dinner.
We (and many others) were dressed appropriately for this fine dining experience; however, I noticed (although a sign says "No shorts"), there were some guests looking like they just came from the pool. I guess they're more lenient during the summer. Idk.
I'd like to say that I'll be back, but I'm not baller status and there are too many restaurants in Vegas that I want to check out. So maybe, we'll see. Nonetheless, I had a nice experience.

We recently visited Prime Steakhouse on May 27th and it was the the most disgusting meal I've ever had. The steak...or what they call steak...was uneatable. We spent over $350 on this meal and I would have to say I regret it each time I think about it. We had a great experience a few year back. We wanted to experience it with our kids and was almost a complete let down. If it wasn't for the fountain view I don't know what I would of done.

My wife and I spent our first anniversary in Vegas last weekend and had dinner at Bellagio's Prime Sunday night. We're both lovers of steak and felt it would be a good way to start the night.

From the moment we arrived at the restaurant we were well taken care of, we got a booth immediately in a quiet room with a few tables that looked out onto the Bellagio fountains. While we couldn't hear the music outside, it was still nice to look out and watch the fountain shows while we enjoyed the atmosphere.

We opted to skip appetizers as we wanted to ensure we would be able to finish all of our respective dinners. I had a bone-in rib-eye while my wife ordered  filet mignon. Both were perfectly cooked, and had some of the best flavors I've had in steaks.

The real treat however was the sauces they brought out. At first I was appalled a steakhouse would suggest a sauce, let alone bring out three, but I skeptically tried each one on some small pieces of my steak, and boy was I happy I did. Both the bearnaise and pepercorn sauces were very tasty and worked well with the steaks adding flavor but not overpowering them. The real winner was the house rice wine sauce however; they could have served the worst steak ever and paired it with this sauce and still gotten me to finish it. 

The gratin potatoes we ordered as a side was extremely tasty as well and was more than enough for the two of us. Again, the house sauce was an amazing addition to the already delicious gratin. We got a look at the rest of the sides when a neighboring table ordered one of each and they all looked equally delectable. I look forward to trying the ginger sweet potatoes and the truffle mashed potatoes on future visits.

One thing to be careful of though is if you ask for water and only want tap water, be sure to make this clear to your waiter. We asked for water to go with our drinks and got an $8 bottle of Fiji water.

Glad I wasn't looking forward to eating here, or else I would have been really disappointed. The decor, ambiance, and service was of course amazing (as in all the restaurants in the Bellagio), but the food (mainly the steak) was not on par. I had the ribeye wagyu steak and it was the worst I have ever had. It was strange, some of my pieces would be really dry and then other pieces would be overwhelmingly marbleized and fatty. I couldn't get a happy medium piece. The soy based sauce that came with it helped it a lot.

Other than that, the stone crab appetizer I had was very good and fresh. I didn't like the seared foie gras (I prefer the smooth spreadable kind, this was the lumpy really livery looking kind). I had a taste of the butternut squash soup which was excellent. The mushroom side was perfect, but the truffle mashed potatoes was lacking in truffle. For dessert I had the poached pear and the coconut souffle. The poached pear dessert seemed a little bland to me. The souffle was really good and it was nice to have a coconut variation of it. I don't think I will find my way here again (sticking with CUT next time).

www.anitaeat.com
One of the Steakhouses in Las Vegas.  What makes this place special is the White Waiter Service.  Truly amazing dining experience

Dinned there with my family. The food was very good but nothing really special. We ordered few salads, pea soup, asparagus, risotto, baked potato, salmon and most of it was good. The only thing I would skip is the asparagus salad.
The service was excellent!
I recommend the restaurant. Maybe I didn't give it 5 stars because I don't eat meat.

We celebrated our 1st anniversary here and they did a great job making us feel special. We had a seat by the window for the water show and a sweet "happy anniversary". The lobster and filets were very good! Cooked perfectly. The steaks come with 3 sauces and they are all very uniquely delicious.

Atmosphere and staff are phenomenal! Friendly and attentive. We sat outside and got an awesome view of the Fountains of Bellagio. Luckily it wasn't too hot and so happy we got that opportunity. It was prefect for our party of four. I ordered the roasted baby beets and it was amazing. As far as everything else -The scallops and lamb chops were good. Steaks were delicious and were on point (as they should for being a steakhouse). Yukon gold puréed potatoes and Mac and cheese were yummy. 

Overall - loved this place from start to finish.

Wow, my filet was amazing, as were the three sauces they came with. The wait staff was great (except watch out of the up-sell which seemed to occur more than my last car purchase) and the view spectacular. All in all a wonderful experience.

Was hoping to give this restaurant 4-5 stars being it was Jean-Georges restaurant in Las Vegas.    Dined here with a group of 5 for our last evening in November, looking forward to a memorable A+ dining experience.  Our concierge at another hotel had recommended this restaurant (among others) when we asked for the best steak house in LV.  The indoor atmosphere was luxurious, overlooking the famous Bellagio fountain with a spectacular view.  It was tastefully decorated and the service top notch, unfortunately the dishes we ordered were not. Be prepared, the wine list is extensive, and expensive, but expected of a restaurant of this caliber.  I, and several others, decided to try the Caesar Salad as a starter.  We were stunned such a mediocre salad could be served at such an acclaimed restaurant.  The tired & limp romaine lettuce was thinly chopped with what looked like small store bought croutons, no joke.  The croutons didn't even look house made.  There was no shaved Parmesan or Pandano, just grated cheese throughout.  The taste was lack luster store bought, no wow factor at all.  We all agreed we could find this salad in just about any super market deli, very disappointing. Next, I ordered the peppered New York steak, medium rare, as my second dish.  The steak was over seared on the crust making it very difficult to cut through, like cutting a piece of leather, leaving the steak to be tough and chewy.  I've had much better steak elsewhere for less.  Other diners in our group had similar dishes with less than top notch results.  We were on a show schedule and didn't have time to send back any dishes, so we stuck with what we had.  This dining experience left us thinking that maybe signature restaurants ride too much on the coat tails of outdated reputations, using location and aesthetics to make up for the quality of food served, seemingly over rated.  Not sure if I would spend big bucks to eat here again when there are so many other great restaurants in Las Vegas.

Two years ago, I had a pretty disappointing experience with this restaurant's hostess, which left a sour taste on our experience despite the great wait service and food. 

This Christmas holiday, my family and I decided to give it another shot. Our experience with the restaurant's (different) hostesses had greatly improved, and I was very impressed with their patience, kindness, and professionalism. The hostess kindly told us that while we had requested a fountain view, it is based on a first-come, first-serve basis, and for the moment they were all taken. She suggested another table, but first made sure to give me and my parents an opportunity to decide whether we were comfortable with this table or not. We were seated in the center of the dining room and still had a view of the fountain outside. The wait service was fantastic and the food remains amazing (tip: get the foie!). I'm impressed with this restaurant's management, it's willingness to make the necessary changes, and its employees for their professionalism and tasteful service, from beginning to end. My family and I are certainly looking forward to coming back soon.

One of the best restaurants we have ever been to! Fantastic ambiance , very chic and classy, the food was beyond amazing. Dry aged rib-eye and the beef short-rib were excellent. The Caesar salad was delicious as well. We had a lake view table and the view was breath-taking. An amazing place for a romantic dinner. The staff were extremely polite and professional as well. I definitely recommend this restaurant.

Best steak ever!  Came with Japanese peppers that were a culinary delight - never had anything like it.  Crab mashed potatoes were good but not worth the extra money compared to regular.  

Went on a busy night with no reservation and took patio seating which had terrific views of the water.  Did get a little mist when the fountains went off but views were worth it.  

No decent wines under $100 so if you are a wine enthusiast be prepared.  Service was excellent.

I ate at Prime for dinner recently. I ended up dining alone and that might affect some of the ratings. I ate the Duck L'range which was excellent. The only problem with it was that the portion was just too small (particularly for the price). I kind of felt like I needed a second entree. Sides were good too. The ambiance is amazing. Truly a stunning restaurant with great views right on the Bellagio lake. 

My only gripe was the service. It was just not 5-star. Of course they sat me in the back which probably was a big reason why. Just felt like I was an after thought the whole night. Definitely disappointed there. I would like to go back and try it again and see if I get better service if I go with someone this time.
I'd like recommend this place if you are looking for a fine restaurant with fabulous view. I'll give 5 stars for Short rib steak and truffle mashed potatoes.

Albeit  it is a steakhouse, if you wan the BEST Roasted Chicken in Vegas, this is the spot.  The food here is amazing.  

Here are my favs:

Arugula Salad
Veal Chop
Roasted Chicken
Chickpea Fries

Reservations are necessary and dress fabulous.

********************* 1124 ********************* 

      My parents have celebrated their anniversary here a few times. They love it here each and every time. 

      Prime Steakhouse is an Award-winning, 3 Michelin Stars of Jean-Georges in NYC, and many more restaurants offer a modern steakhouse dining with prime steak, seafood,  lamb, delicious sauces, sides and award winning wines list. 

       Luxurious decor, chocolate brown and tiffany blue curtains - the elaborate beautiful design of designer Michael DeSantis. There're gorgeous pieces of artwork are on display including 3 paintings by Carlo Maria Mariani, George Deem and Michael Gregory, as well as a canvas  by Joseph Raffael. 

      A garden patio provides the perfect outdoor setting for a tranquil dining experience where you can enjoy the breathtaking view of the Bellagio water fountain. 

     At the Prime Steakhouse, executive chef Sean Griffin, a veteran of  the Four Seasons Hotel Beverly Hills and Nero's at Caesars Palace in Las Vegas. He was at Bourbon Steak in Scottsdale. Now the executive chef of Jean Georges' Prime Steakhouse at the beautiful Bellagio.

      A few dishes we always love: 

- Steak Tartare & Carpaccio, Tarragon Aioli & Grilled Crostini 

- Caramelized Scallops, Green Vegetables, Spring Onion Vinaigrette & Chili-Lime Crumbs

- Dungeness Crabcake, Sweet & Sour Peppers, Celery Salad

- Veal Chop, Potato Confit, Kale Sprouts & Onion Cream 

- Dry-Aged Bone-In Rib Eye

    Service is always excellent to the details, although we didn't care much for the photographer kept asking if we want our pictures to be taken! 

    Prime Steakhouse at the Bellagio is 1 of my family  favorite steakhouses in Las Vegas.

I had the chance to dine here a while back but I didn't get to write my review. 5 star restaurant hands down, the food, ambience, service, and atmosphere is all amazing. Our waiter was so professional and helpful with the wine list and menu. The filet mignon, truffle potatoes, and vegetables are all so fresh and prepared exquisitely. We sat water front on the patio, while enjoying two bottles of wine. This was the best high quality restaurant I have ever been to. Our bill was over $800 but worth every penny. You pay for what you get, especially in Las Vegas. Just made another reservation to come eat while we stay at the Bellagio!

Started w/ chilled seafood platter which will gladly be customized upon your request. We dropped the clams and muscles which increased the shrimp, stone crab, king crab, oysters and lobster. I had the dry aged 18 oz bone-in fillet which was cooked perfectly however was not hot when served (I don't risk spit service thus do not send anything back unless it is inedible ). For sides we ordered creamed spinach, truffle mashed potatoes, and onion rings. Desert was creme brulle and coffee which was awesome. Service was incredible, waiter was exceptional. 4 stars instead of 5 because of steak temperature.

Without a doubt absolutely delicious but be prepared to open your wallet ... We had the bone in aged rib eye prepared medium rare ($ 71), the side dishes of creamed spinach ($ 17) and gnocchi ($ 17) with an asparagus salad and French onion soup for starters. Everything was delicious. The steaks were served with 3 side sauces: peppercorn, bernaise, soy ginger, and they complimented the meat very well. Coconut soufflé with chocolate sorbet for dessert. My only complaint would be the offensive prices on the menu but it's Vegas ...

This place is truly amazing! My girlfriend and I went to Prime to celebrate my birthday and everything was nothing short of perfect! 
1.) The table was awesome! - They sat us right by the side of the Bellagio lake so we can watch the water show. 
2.) Service was impeccable! 
3.) Food was simply amazing! - I had the rib eye and my girlfriend had the fillet mignon with the fois gras. They were awesome! I would also recommend the green peas with mint - delicious! 
4.) The lava cake is irresistible! 

My only disappointment was that I ate too much for brunch at the Bellagio Buffet and I didn't save enough room to try the appetizer! I recommend Prime to anyone who loves steaks. I will definitely pay them another visit when I return to Vegas!

Well, this is a first for me, in writing a review where the experience was so poor on entry to engaging the restaurant that I can't even comment on the food.

Tonight is our 10 year anniversary, so I thought it fitting that we go to an iconic location while in Las Vegas, The Bellagio.

Prime is their center field front row top steak restaurant, or so they market themselves.

The idea is a traditional steakhouse in an ideal setting with indoor and outdoor dining while viewing the majestic Bellagio fountains.

I took the time to call this afternoon and secure a late reservation (9:30pm) indicating clearly the importance of the date and asking for a special location.

When we arrived, after walking through the Bellagio AKA Grand Central Station meets Disneyland's crowd, we approached the hostess stand.

Now a restaurant selling itself as a top notch experience should have a direct human interaction upon entry, not two teenage girls working behind a desk.

Worse, what clearly must have been the assistant manager walked past us, ignoring us on the way to take a phone call that was obviously more important than acknowledging their guests.

While we stood there dressed in suit and my wife's beautiful gown, we endured the conversation that consumed the attention of both "hostess" explaining to the fat man in shorts and an untucked polo shirt, that he was welcome to come in later but needed to wear pants.

Now at this point I have to laugh at the irony. Clearly Prime's reputation is strong enough from a perception standpoint to bring clients in, and the stuffy 'dress code' is there to enhance the "exclusivity" if you will. All the while the service is worse than the worst McDonalds restaurant. What a joke.

We finally connected with one of the hourly employees at the front counter and they proceeded to try to negotiate with me about wether we had actually requested an outside table or not. It was the equivalent of a conversation with a night club promoter about what it would take to get he table you want. Happy Anniversary I guess... 

The good news is we went to the bar where a very friendly, competent and quality old school bartender provided real service. We ordered a glass of champagne, settled the check and informed person number 6 that I had to interact with that we would be going elsewhere.

They quickly back peddled, all of a sudden a front row table outside was available.

I politely informed them that we would be going elsewhere.

The four employees were huddling around with the real manager and watching to see what we would do. I doubt they expected that I would take the time to share the truth about the experience on line.

Look, here is the bottom line. When you are heading out to an expensive dinner, especially for an important event, and preparing to spend a considerable amount of money, you deserve the absolute best service and mentality. There's no entitlement here. Just because your restaurant is overlooking the Bellagio fountains doesn't mean it's automatically any better than a revolving restaurant exploiting its view to sell you overpriced food.

The restaurant is down stairs from the Bellagio Esplanade, it's a stuffy, dark, cave like environment with a very heavy small of cooked and worked over food. Think senior retirement center cafe with expensive decor.

If you want my advice, there are a dozen steak houses in town, all much better in every way. I would recommend the SW at Wynn or Carnevino at Pallazo. Of course I can't speak to the food since I couldn't stand the mentality. I can only tell you about the smell and the attitude. Both stink.

Try the bar I guess then high tail it out of there before they take your cash and feed the snob beast.

Better luck elsewhere.

This is by far my favorite steak house. I had the bone-in filet mignon and my boyfriend had the porterhouse. Both cuts were excellent. It was just the best! Truffled mashed potato is highly recommended. It just melts in your mouth. Everywhere I go, if I see a beef tartare or beef carpaccio on the menu I always get it. With that being said, Prime's was the best I've had so far. The dining experience is not just about the food but also the service. The server was on-point. He was not too much or too little.

Das Steakhaus im Bellagio. Das Lokal ist im Untergeschoss gelegen, ein Teil der Tische hat direkten Blick auf die Wasserspiele vor dem Casino ebenfalls gibt es noch ein paar Tische auf der Terrasse über dem künstlichen See. Dieser zusätzlich Genoss erfordert jedoch eine zeitgerechte Reservierung. Das Steakhaus selbst bietet vor allem natürlich Steaks und einige Fischgerichte bei gehobenem Service und entsprechendem Ambiente. Die Preise dafür sind natürlich entsprechend hoch. Ein Novum bisher hier in Las Vegas, war die Frage des Tischkellners, ob bei einem Gast spezielle Allergien bei der Speisenauswahl bzw. der Zubereitung zu beachten sind. Die Speisen waren ausgezeichnet, der Service war vorbildlich und es gab sogar einen guten Espresso zum Abschluss, was ja bei dem landestypischen "Bodenseekaffee" wirklich eine Ausnahme in Restaurant ist.

Excellent. We sat on the patio and enjoyed every minute of it except the couple in front of us who were way too frisky. I had the 18oz ribeye and my wife had the lobster tail. My steak was superb and so was her lobster tail. We shared a side of mac and cheese, very good. The staff was awesome and we had no complaints. It is pricey but well worth it.

I didn't have to pay, so the 5-star rating doesn't reflect prices. The filet mignon was tasty and super tender, sides were awesome, and so was the key lime pie (on the smaller side, but that's ok, I was already full). Good cocktails, and nice ambiance, with a friendly staff.

Love this place! Definitely worth it to get there early and request a table with a view of the fountains. I had a filet mignon that was cooked perfectly rare as well as the foie gras with lychee purée. Absolutely delicious and you can't beat the ambiance!   The service was wonderful as well.

One of the top five meals I have EVER had in my life.  My friend has eaten here before and he wanted me to experience this amazing restaurant.  We had a nice table off to the side with a partial view of the fountains.  Since it was my first time at the restaurant my friend let me have the chair with the view.  We decided to share our plates.
1.  Steak Tartare:  This was the main reason why I came.  It was magical.  The punch of flavors was amazing.  You pick up different flavors all over your palette.  
2.  Crab Cake:  The subtle flavor of the crab was allowed to shine.  The spice was just right to add to and not take away from the crab.  
3.  Beat and Goat Cheese Salad:  This was the only item all night that I liked, but wasn't blown away by.  The quinoa and pumpkins seeds were not my favorite.
4.  Peppercorn Rib Eye:  We both loved the Rib Eye, but we agreed that the next time we come we would opt to get something else.  We felt the peppercorn wasn't needed on such amazing cuts of steak.  
5.  Veal Chop:  Best veal I have ver had.  The meat was perfectly cooked and juicy.  The meat was outstanding on its own.  It didn't really need the rich sauce that accompanied the meat.  
6.  Cream Spinach:  Excellent
7.  Truffle Potato Gnocchi:  Flavor overload!  Incredibly reach and decadent.  
We skipped dessert and opted to have a cappuccino instead.  We ended speaking with a lovely group of ladies at the next table visiting from England and we joined them for coffee.  
One thing that I LOVED about this experience - we were not rushed.  We arrived at 9 PM and left the restaurant at 1:20 AM.  We were able to savor every bite and enjoy our company over an amazing meal.  After the restaurant emptied out a bit my friend moved his chair to the other side of the table to see the fountains too.  Wonderful experience.

Loved the view and everyone is really nice.
I had the bone-in ribeye and it was very good. The Prime Car drink was awesome

Two standouts: foie gras appetizer and the house photographer.
So, first, an embarrassing confession--no one at our table ordered red meat. I should have ordered the special of the night: a bone-in filet. Instead, I started off with a craving for duck, but our server squashed that desire by telling me that the duck l'orange was prepared in slices and did not have a crisp skin And he hadn't heard many good comments about it. He recommended the pork chop, so I got that, and I regretted it. When the server inquired how my pork chop was, I told him it was just ok--did not have much flavor. the accompanying mushrooms, on the other hand, were delicious. The server said, "well at least you like one of the things, right? " Uh, okay... I really didn't expect him to do anything, and yes, I was the dunce ordering a non-steak dish in a steakhouse, but our server's lack of concern over my enjoyment was a little disappointing. I've actually had better service at The Outback. And, we overheard the server at a nearby table say, "Whatever you want, I will make it right for you". Wished we had gotten that guy. 
As an aside, my family always stays at the Bellagio, and service at this hotel overall is at a pretty high standard, so I guess I was expecting more out of this restaurant--it was our first time here.
The interior looks like Sleeping Beauty's chamber with powdery blue drapes. The music is really awful--I just have to point this out, and it is disappointing that they don't have a cocktail menu.
Crab cakes were very good, and the sea bass was cooked perfectly with a lovely, delicate, slightly gingery sauce. Potatoes au gratin were rich! Butter & cheese galore. Ginger sweet potatoes were silky smooth and had just the right amount of sweetness. Sorbet looked much better than it tasted--perfectly scooped orbs, but the mango was too tart, coconut did not taste like coconut.
The house photographer (who looked just like Wendy Malick from Just Shoot Me) took gorgeous pictures of my family--she really directed us--made us get out of our seats, place our hands just so...my father has stage 4 cancer, so this is why the photos meant a lot to us.
Will not return to this restaurant and can't say I would recommend it, but I savored every bite of my foie gras and we'll cherish our pictures.

As Borat would say, "Veddy Niceee." Was it the best steak I've ever had? No. But, it was very good.

We went there on a relatively-slow Sunday night. We didn't make reservations because honestly, we didn't think we'd need any. We got there at 8:30 and asked for a table for three. Even though the dining room looked busy, it wasn't completely full. They asked if we had a reservation, we said no, and they put one in for us for 9:00 and told us to come back at 9:00. So, we went and gambled, then came back and our table was ready right when we got there. I appreciate promptness.

The dining room is a tad on the small side, but dark and cozy. The chairs are nice and comfortable, and the tables are large. I felt underdressed in a T-shirt and jeans. Though they don't "enforce" a dress code, they have a sign that says they recommend a jacket for men. Not sure what the dress code for women is, but I'm pretty sure my T-shirt and jeans didn't quite make the cut.

Unfortunately, we didn't get a table by the window. We could still see the water show from our table, but we couldn't hear the music. I'm sure if we had a reservation well in advance, we probably could have requested a window table, but oh well. But yeah, if you make reservations, ask for a window table! They're really nice and the water show comes on every 10 minutes or so. It's a nice little distraction during dinner, y'know?

Anyway, our waiter was the bomb. Generally at these uppity-steakhouse places, the waiters are a tad pompous. But, ours was awesome. He cracked jokes with us, told us what the specials were, and answered any questions we had about the menu. He also made great wine recommendations as well. He was great!

We each got a steak as well as a few sides (a T-bone for my friend, filet for my bf, and some kind of regular steak for me). Our food came out in about 20 minutes. My steak was very good -- moist, juicy, and flavorful. My only small complaint is that it was a *tad* overcooked. I asked for medium-rare, and it came out a little more on the medium side. All of their steaks are accompanied by several homemade sauces. My favorite one was their house sauce, which was some soy-based sauce. It was so yummy! For sides, we got the creamed spinach, asparagus, and sauteed mushrooms. The sides were an OK size. All three of us could split them, but a bigger helping would have been great. The asparagus was not good at all. They were overcooked and more soggy than crunchy. I was disappointed because that's one of my favorite veggies. The creamed spinach was good, but could have used some garlic or other flavoring. The mushrooms were by far the best side dish. They were flavorful and so delicious! If I had known that in advance, I would have gotten two orders of the mushrooms and passed on the asparagus. 

We passed on dessert, since we were all pretty much full. When the bill came, it was a tad over $300. Not bad for the three of us. All in all, it was a positive experience. I probably wouldn't go there again, seeing as how I don't go to Vegas much and would like to try a different steakhouse next time. But, I definitely liked it and would recommend it to a friend.

OMG, it was delicious! If you are looking for a fab steak in Vegas, look no further.

I dined on the patio, which is a total must - AMAZING view of the Bellagio fountains.

The staff were superb. Very friendly, knowledgeable, and attentive.

The bacon wrapped shrimp were huge and oh-so-delicious! The caesar salad was a bit unique in that it had mustard greens. Tasty dressing to boot. The filet mignon was huge! Perfectly cooked and super tender. And it came with sides of sauces. I have a serious love for bernaise and the bernaise here most definitely did not disappoint. Go with the bernaise! Lather it on your steak! And for sides, I had the mushrooms and truffle potatoes. The truffle potatoes were positively divine. Creamy and delicious. And the mushrooms were a fabulous compliment to the steak. I had zero room for dessert, but the desserts looked delicious.

I thoroughly enjoyed my dining experience here. Prime is truly a top notch experience. A total Vegas must-do.

A group of friends and I went to Prime on Saturday night and while it was ok in many respects, it was really disappointing for the price.  I am from LA and used to high-priced dining, but this place was unbelievable.  They did not have any affordable wines on the menu, and the prices for steak were unbelievable.  $65 for a filet that arrived well over-cooked and very bland.  The wines were very overpriced, and the side dishes were pedestrian and incredibly expensive.  

I have been to many of the Bellagio restaurants, and expect it to be expensive, but the others are much better than Prime.  Even though Picasso and Cirque are expensive, they are great.  Prime was average in terms of the food, decor, and service, but incredibly expensive.  I would avoid it.

I've eaten here three times.

Twice with the same person, once with a friend of out of time.  When I informed the hostess that it was my friend's first time in the Bellagio and her first meal in vegas, she went out of her way to get us a table next to the glass windows overlooking Lake Bellagio and the dancing fountains.

The interior of this place is gorgeous.  Silver meets blue meets creme.  Gorgeous, unusual color scheme.  Intimate lighting.  

The first time I went I was a vegetarian who still enjoyed seafood, so I had seafood, flown in that morning from Alaska.  The seafood sampler I had for an appetizer was varied and fresh!

The New York Peppercorn Strip Steak I've had the last two times rocks -  The seasoning is well done and the steak is moist.  

Our waiter also rattled off all the ingredients in the sauces as well as brought all of them out so there was no having to pick and choose.  

My partner in crime, a connoisseur who literally travels the country/world in search of quality steak, considers this one of his favorites simply for that reason.  

And yes, the truffle mashed potatoes are indeed yummy.
Super classy atmosphere. Great food. Obviously it's an expensive place. You could probably find similar tasty food elsewhere that's not as pricey.

The setting, service and steaks exceeded expectations and are among the best I've experienced. Dinner here was definitely a driving factor and the primary reason I planned my return trip to Vegas. I typically don't order steak but last year a filet here changed my life and convinced me that beef is possible of trumping all when prepared properly.

To celebrate a special occasion I made reservations in advance to secure a seat along the windows which allows you to enjoy the Bellagio fountains throughout your meal. Our server Beau set the bar for service. He was personable, knowledgeable and attentive without being overbearing.

He suggested a moderately priced wine which paired perfectly with the 8oz filet I ordered. Although the truffle mashed potatoes are delicious, they are sometimes offered with lobster, which is divine. 

This place is expensive, but true to the cliche "you get what you pay for" So if you're looking for an experience and not just a meal I highly recommend Prime. It just might change your perspective on culinary quality.

I got back from a fantastic meal at Prime two nights ago.

A few girlfriends and I were looking to try one of the fine dining restaurants in Vegas, and with so many to choose from, we decided on Prime given its location next to the Bellagio fountains and rave reviews on Yelp.

We started our evening at 8:30 and were a bit befuddled that we had to wait until 8:40 to be seated, despite having reservations and arriving a few minutes early.

This was a minor snag, as the decor and ambiance of Prime quickly trumped that.  Prime is located quite literally next to the Bellagio fountains. Even though we were not seated by the window, our party of four still had a great view. The dining room was dimly lit and featured gold accent moldings and beautiful sweeping windows.  This set the tone for a rich meal, complete with a large variety of wines, good menu variety, and more.

Having waited tables myself, I quickly asked our waiter for recommendations. As a general rule, I've always done this and it has served me WELL. Waiters want you to go home pleased (their tips depend on it), and they know what is popular.  Although they may not say outright if something is bad, they WILL tell you what is very good or perhaps make an alternate suggestion.  Our server began by saying everything was delicious (as you could expect in this type of restaurant), but did point out the menu highlights. Of the list he told us: the truffle mashed potato, the filet mignon steak, one of the steaks served w/ bone, scallop entree, and sole.

We were in the mood for a meal with some punch, so we started with the bacon wrapped shrimp (incredible! One of the highlights of this meal!), and crab cakes to share.

The bacon wrapped shrimp themselves were large and the order came with four shrimp. The bacon and green sauce it came with were lovely; the bacon itself was so hearty and smoky that I didn't think it was possible to have such great, varying flavors in a simple slice of bacon. The shrimp was tender.  Right on.

The crab cake was also excellent and was served atop a type of cabbage slaw and avocado.  Not overly "crabby", but great taste and a good size cake to share with maybe one other person.

We were having a hard time picking out wines, being as none in our group could be called a wine expert by any means.  Many a night of Franzia and Barefoot gulping means my pallet was no match for the variety and quality of wines Prime had to offer. Our waiter did a great being patient and recommending some of the cheaper California wines.  In the end, we went with a delicious California Pinot Noir bottle for $75.

Finally, our meal.  Three of us did the Peppercorn New York Steak, which came complete with caramelized red onion and three dipping sauces. The fourth in our party went with the Caramelized Scallops.  We completed this with the acclaimed truffle mashed potatoes (aaahhh-mazing!), creamed spinach, and asparagus.  The steaks were definitely on the spicy side given the peppercorn, but were not overbearing. Our wine, along with the sweetness of the onion and muted, sweeter dipping sauces made the amount of spice just right.  Out of the three sauces, the soy-rice wine stood out as the clear favorite, just as our waiter predicted.  The steak was fresh, cooked to a medium rare perfection, and delicious.  The peppercorn rub was mouth watering and spiced just right.

Amazingly, the scallop dish was the most memorable of the entrees. It was served in an amazing caramelized sauce that was so good I found myself mooching sauce to dip my bread in. (Sorry, Shayna.  I've done worse.) ;P This might be my next dish here.

The truffle mashed potatoes were also delicious, as was the creamed spinach.  Of the two sides, however, the truffle mash was definitely more appetizing. The potatoes were creamy, and literally melted in your mouth.  My mouth is watering just remembering them.

Since we were celebrating a birthday, our server was kind enough to bring out a delicious chocolate cake free of charge as we waited for our check.   Here, service was a bit slow, and we had to ask a busser for assistance on more than one occasion in order to make an 11:00 show. We quickly realized this was because our waiter was preparing the cake, but I also noticed he was assigned seating on the opposite side of the dining room. Having served myself, I know how bad it sucks to be serving a fine 3 course meal with tables in opposite directions, or simply having too many. This is a potential area for improvement, however, our waiter was very kind and patient with us as we took forever to order, so perhaps we also had a part in this.  I will admit, we took forever to order.

Overall, this was an exquisite meal and made for a wonderful night out for our friends. Be prepared to drop some cash here-with wine, sides, and appetizers, our meal came out to $125 a person, not including gratuity. I highly recommend Prime for any special occasion or a night on the town.  Well done.

It has been a while since my wife and I have been to Prime.  Their remodel was worth the wait for sure. The lighting and décor is perfect. Exactly what you would want and look for in a high end steak house. Sunday we came in and had an exemplary meal and really enjoyed the short ribs.  If you haven't been in a while it is time to try it again.  Excellent service from start to finish. Our servers were skilled and well versed, especially Andrew and Wayne.  We had a great chat about their extensive whiskey selection.  Andrew's knowledge was impressive to say the least.  If you are looking to dine on a budget look elsewhere but as they say, you get what you pay for.  As Vegas locals we don't make it to the strip as much as we would like but Prime is worth the trip.

Some of the best service in Vegas. Personally got escorted to my taxi as I was running late for a show. 2 fat thumbs up guys!

Great food on the pricey side but well deserved. Amazing views of the fountains if you can get them. Great establishment for a special occasion.

Peppercorn New York Steak, mashed Yukon Gold potatoes, Lemon Parmesan Caesar salad.
Most know that I eat steak unlike many others that live on this planet. I'm not only honored but extremely happy that as of yet this steak was the best steak that I have ever had so far.
As chef Jean-Georges mentioned on a commercial for the steakhouse in my Bellagio suite, every decent Chef can cook a steak, but what complements it are it's sauces or condiments. Many will agree with this, and few will disagree. But those who know where to get great cuts of meat, aged to perfection, know that salt-and-pepper and a good grill will always equal to a good and some even say a great steak. But what put this steak over the top, was the chef's recommendation to try his house sauce. I am not talking about some sort of steak sauce/barbecue sauce. I am talking about his signature steak sauce or juice as some may describe. Along with trying this steak with the other three common sauces normally used on steaks, his shined through with brilliance.
Accompanied with a very well matched and seasoned subtle mashed Yukon Gold potatoes and a Caesar salad that I will never forget. This made for, if not the best but, one of the best meals I have ever had in my lifetime so far.

For a romantic dinner with a show, Prime is a primo place for just that type of situation. The restaurant sits right behind the Bellagio fountain show and if you are fortunate enough to get a window seat or sit out in the patio, it can be a very romantic evening. Even if you sit in the middle or back areas of the restaurant, you have a decent chance of seeing the water show as well but just not to its full potential. 

The service was simply amazing as most of the fine dining establishments in Las Vegas, however the food is a little hit or miss depending on what you order. AND like most fine dining in Vegas, it is extremely pricey as I had the custom made surf and turf style dish. 

The waiter for our evening made some excellent suggestions as far as cuts of meat and even some unique sauces which I tried and were amazed with. Again, service brought Prime up a notch with me otherwise I might not have rated it as high. 

Our group ordered the seafood bonanza (not the actual name but that is what it felt like) and it was simply crazy. From crab legs, jumbo shrimp and oysters ... just a hodge podge of seafood. It was good but I am not a fan of most of that stuff except the shrimp. 

I was also tempted to have the lobster bisque which I always enjoy at restaurants. The presentation was very nice however the soup itself was way too rich for my taste. Because of that, I didn't finish it which is very rare for me. It should have been toned down quite a bit but the lobster in the soup was very tasty. 

I did have the special order of the surf and turf which was a 6oz Kobe beef strip along with a lobster tail. The Kobe beef could have been cut with a spoon and simply melted in my mouth, I was amazed. I did order it medium as I like my meat but it came a little bit under but I didn't care because it just blew me away. The lobster tail was very good but what put it over the top was instead of using the butter, I tried this butter/shallot emulsion and it was amazing as well!!! 

Sides are a la carte and I do recommend the spicy mac & cheese. Never made it to dessert but that is ok ... I am stuffed. 

Soup: So so 
Main Course: AMAZING 
Sides: Great 

Favorite dish: Kobe beef (medium-rare) with lobster tail in the special sauce (which comes on the side). 

Go out and EAT!

I don't think I can judge this restaurant fairly until I have a second visit. I was here last Saturday for a wedding dinner. There was about 25 people in our party. The service was okay, not great. To be fair, yes we were in a large party but also if you can't provide superior service for that many people you probably shouldn't accept the challenge. A few of us had to ask for our drinks 3 -4 times before getting them. I asked for a simple ice tea 3 times. The ambiance was beautiful and the food was great! My filet was cooked perfect, so tender it melted. The bearnaise sauce was awesome! The creamed spinach, Yukon gold mashed and sautéed mushrooms were delish and I could have ate them all night long.

Five stars for the service and view of the fountains.  Beyond that less than average food at inflated prices.  Oversold on the lobster which was not good... two bites and I was done.  Tartare was raw meat and chives... with lime wedge on side.  no quail egg.  Disappointing.

They made a decent martini.

Arrived 5 minutes before reservation time. Sat 20 minutes before being seated. Ordered dry aged ribeye with Mac n cheese and a Chimay. Ambiance and decor were top notch. Received steak and was just ok. Was fattier than expected however. For as much as I paid for this steak was, I felt underwhelmed. Mac n cheese was a bit too sharp and runny. Service was great.

Oh My Gawd!  The best steakhouse that I have ever visited.  I have been to many around the US and globe.
The service and the knowledge that each server has is unmatched by any other restaurant.  
The cuts of beef are awesome and are always cooked to the temp that you request.
When in Vegas, please stop it.  It is costly, but well worth it.

I love steak and I promise you will not be disappointed here! We came here for my cousin's bday while visiting Vegas. It is located in the Bellagio and it is a high end steak house. Like every where in Vegas, the place is pricey, but the quality of food is also there.

Our party was seated promptly and we had 2 tables. The service was amazing and one of the steaks was overcooked and our waiter took it back and made another without any issues. The view is nice because you can see the fountain from our table which went on every 15-30 mins or so. 

I had the Bone-In Rib Eye medium rare and it was cooked to perfection. It wasn't too rare and most importantly, it wasn't overcooked. The steak had just the perfect amount of fat in it and the quality of the steak was good too. I would definitely pay the price for this steak again!
Gorgeous and romantic interiors.  Spectacular food.  Exquisite service.  Bellagio fountains.  What more could you ask for?

Make a reservation. This is an absolutely outstanding dining experience from beginning to end.  Anything on the menu is great. The rack of lamb is perfect. There is nothing about Prime that I wouldn't recommend. Excellent service and staff. Worth the price.

Ever wondered what the holy grail of steakhouses looks/smells/feels and most of ALL TASTES like? Yes, you guessed it--Jean Georges can do no wrong! Absolutely EVERYTHING from the minute you walk into the restaurant to consume and experience is 10 notches above top notch.

Going through the meal chronologically--
 
The wine list needs to be tackled by someone with experience or a sommelier. Do not attempt to navigate this if you're a novice!
 
The freshly made bread basket has a mix of pretzel bread, nut/raisin loaf slices, and an awesome sourdough with room temperature butter that spreads very easily and is of the FRESHEST variety you can get when it comes to tableside bread and butter
 
Get off your high horse aversion to salads/vegetables and order one of these:
*Market Tomatoes -- the Burrata in here can kick the CRAP out of the kind made in most multi century old Italian institutions
*PRIME Chopped Vegetables -- a classic that's light enough for you to handle the onslaught main course
*Roasted Baby Beets -- the pairing of yogurt, balsamic, and hazelnuts almost belongs in a great brunch place but works well pre-main course
 
The clear standout in the meat department is the filet mignon. There's no rivaling this steak in terms of the meat itself, cooking technique applied, and balance of seasoning. However, should you choose to order something else:
*Roasted Organic Chicken -- the crispy skin, balance of seasoning, and tender meat will send your taste buds to new heights. The unfortunate side effect is that It will forever make you scoff at grocery store roast chicken.
*Braised Beef Shortribs -- this could easily fall in anyone's legit list for a last meal dish. Its fatty, juicy, and tender chunks of meat are euphoria inducing. DO NOT hit up a club after this because food coma is absolutely expected!
 
Side dish standouts:
*Ginger Sweet Potatoes -- clearly in a league of its own. This has converted sweet potato and ginger haters alike.
*Tempura Battered Onion Rings -- this raises an important question: why don't more places tempura batter?
*Glazed Market Mushrooms  -- a nice blend of unique mushrooms (not just garbage white/button mushrooms) in (what tasted like) a red wine reduction
 
Dessert
The Valrhona molten chocolate cake -- the quality of chocolate used here will make you think twice about ordering this anywhere else in the future
 
Some parting words--give this place the respect it deserves and show up wearing something nice. No doubt your girl will (cause she understands that sorta thing), so you should too.
If Yelp allowed 6 stars, Prime should get 7!

It's so funny how the best meals are often the ones you don't plan for.

Was having drinks at the Bellagio with some clients and this turned into dinner. We popped into Prime and managed to score a lateish sitting with minimal wait time.

This was my first visit to Prime, and I'll say it has now usurped SW @ Wynn as my favourite Vegas steakhouse. 

The decor is understated and classy, dining and conversation noise seems muted due to the room set up, the service is comfortable and professional and the food is just bloody superb.

We enjoyed a few dry aged rib eyes (absolutely massive - see photo) which were seriously well cooked and not overly fatty (no reflux the next morning - awesome!).  The mushroom, asparagus and spinach sides were also completely up to par.

The only area where SW has Prime beat hands down is the bread basket.  The SW bread basket comes with piping hot, freshly baked bread ranging from cheese&bacon, olive to sourdough etc.  The Prime offering was actually a tiny bit stale and nothing to write home about.

All in all, Prime is a very classy, comfortable yet upscale steakhouse and an excellent experience.

It is definitely not cheap (steaks start at $70 - our bill for 3 people before tip was $580ish with one bottle of mid level Cab) but definitely worth a visit.

mobile review
Wonderful, delicious, perfect, fabulous. Expensive but very much worth it. 
I believe this is the best fine dining experience in Vegas. The caviar service was perfect, our waiter was a sweetheart, the steaks were perfect, the truffle mashed potatoes and potato gratin were delicious. The coconut soufflé was also perfect. Our lovely waiter even brought our family a complementary dessert!  ( we were celebrating ) Oh and the location is perfect too! The only bad thing one must prepare for is the cold, unwelcoming hostesses. But once you get past them-it's wonderful!

We ate at Prime for a party of four last Thursday. Let me say, I eat at a lot of steakhouses, and this was one of the first where I really had some sticker shock looking at the menu. Easily most expensive steakhouse menu I've seen.

That said, to some extent, you get what you pay for here. The service is EXCELLENT and the ambiance is perfectly upscale. The food is top of the line. Tuna Tartare and Bone-in Filet were both standouts. 

All around, outstanding dining experience.

The service was great, the food was good, but the people around us were the worst! I've never felt so uncomfortable eating dinner with my family. These people acted like they've never been around a 3 year old. Who, by the way, was fully occupied watching cartoons, and being quiet. I felt the stares the whole time. We had to cut our meal short because of these rude people. Someone actually had the nerve to come up to my dad and ask us to turn off the cartoons! WHILE WE WERE PAYING THE BILL! Also, the restaurant was pretty loud to begin with. The volume of the cartoons weren't even turned up fully. You would assume people who come to spend a good amount of money on food would have manners & mind their own business. But, no. We talked to a manager who was completely understanding, & while speaking to a manager ANOTHER person came up to my Dad interrupting my father's talk to the manager asking what his problem was! I never want to eat here again. It's not the food or service, it's the people.
service and food was awesome but here is the catch, any steak more than $30 tastes the same. (no matter if it is aged, organic etc ...) and basically you pay extra for service and the name ;)

We come here every year for the outstanding seafood platter. This item is not on the menu. You have to order it by name. Just identify you want a seafood platter for however many people are in your party. It is absolutely phenomenal. Look at my picture for a reference. The steaks and seafood are also top notch here. Accompanied with truffled mash, you have a spectacular surf and turf!

I proposed here, and the staff was totally willing to help in any way, and made the evening unforgettable. Beautiful experience, and absolutely incredible food. Worth the price, because the experience is priceless. Pork chop and chicken are terrific.

We were staying at the Bellagio and heard good things about Prime, but overall left a little disappointed.  The food was good, but not worth the almost $300 we spent on our meal (for 2 people).   The service was decent and the restaurant was pretty, but like many Vegas restaurants, I felt like they were trying too hard to set an upscale ambiance.  I should say that I don't eat steak so I am probably not the best judge of a steakhouse, but my husband ordered the filet and thought that it was just ok.  The wine list was great, but again, very expensive

I ordered:
The shrimp cocktail: 4 shrimp, really good cocktail sauce, but it cost $22
Boston lettuce salad: really interesting combination of herbs, avocado, and lettuce with a tasty dressing, probably the best thing I tasted
Slow baked salmon: Really good piece of salmon and cooked perfectly
Creamed spinach: classic and good
Mashed potatoes: very buttery and addictive

My friends and I ate here on our first night in Vegas the last time we were in town. Two of my friends had been before, but this was my first experience. When I first walked into the restaurant, I was immediately struck by the traditional cushion-y blue velvet chairs and all of the heavy draperies. Stuffy, perhaps, but also beautifully and tastefully done.

I would recommend dressing up, as most of the men were wearing jackets. Of course, they won't kick you out if you show up in jeans, but it's a classy place, so dress appropriately.

We were seated right in front of the window, which provided a lovely view of the Bellagio fountains at night. So pretty! This was one of my favorite parts of the experience.

Trying not to over-do it on my first night of eating in Vegas, I ordered the Market Tomato Salad and the Scallops. I had a lemon martini to start, and it was fantastic. I asked for more savory than sweete, and the bartender made the drink perfectly. We ordered a Trimbach Riesling for the table, and this very dry riesling from the Alsace region in France has become one of the white wine staples I keep in my home.

The burrata on the tomato salad was perfectly creamy and balanced well with the fresh tomatoes. I've had some mediocre tomato-mozzarella salads in my day, but this one was perfect. The scallops were perfectly seared, and the capers added the appropriate level of salty bitterness to match the sweetness of the scallops. Delicious!

One of my friends ordered the filet as she always does, and it was a perfect medium, with the perfect level of charring on the outside. I tried a bite and dipped it into the peppercorn sauce. It was fantastic. I had a bite of creamed spinach as well, and it had just the right amount of acid to counterbalance the cream.

Enjoying conversation with friends while watching the Bellagio fountains at night capped off the evening. I can't wait to go back on my next trip to Vegas.

I haven't been here in two years but I can still feel the filet mignon melting in my mouth. The ambience of the indoor dining room is above par, although due to the glamour that is Vegas it pales a little in comparison to some of it's nearby counterparts. The wine list is extensive and fair and their white chocolate martini is one of the best I've ever had. I started with The steak tartare. Of the five times I've had this dish this ranks second (to Tony Bourdain's). The entree was amazing. The truffle mashed potatoes seasoned perfectly, the filet melting in my mouth. They asked my party if we would like to move to the terrace for dessert with water fountains. The chocolate Lave cake was intense and could have used a little more ice cream ala mode. Overall one of the best meals of my life.
This place is really amazing. You are facing the fountains of the Bellagio and the food is delicious and really worsts the price. The service is great too.

I've almost finished my "tour" of Vegas' top-rated steakhouses and I'm putting Prime at #2. It's flawless. My friend's porterhouse was insanely juicy and tasty, while my lamb was similarly delicious.

The food cannot be faulted and is on a par with my current #1, CUT, but I prefer CUT because it's more laid-back: Prime is formal. If you're not wearing a jacket you might feel a little under-dressed.

I took my fiancé here for his birthday dinner, and we had a wonderful meal with fantastic service! I started with the delicious beet salad and had the filet as my entree. The filet was perhaps the best steak I've ever had...and we are from a city that prides itself on its meat so there is definitely a list to compete with! He started with the onion soup and got the surf and turf for his entree and was thrilled with all of it. We also split the mushrooms and gratin as sides. I didn't love the potatoes but he did; the mushrooms were delicious, though! I had mentioned it was his bday when I made the reservation and they surprised us with a TO DIE FOR molten cake and homemade ice cream. The service was also excellent -- very sociable and knowledgeable. Russell and Scott were the best! Although this was of course on the pricey side, the next morning, he woke up and thanked me again for the meal so it was worth it!

We were seated promptly and we got a great view of the fountains. I really liked the view but I didn't really enjoy the decor it was dark. A little too gloomy for me. We ordered our food and it was good. I ordered the sea bass it was good but I wish they told me it was lightly breaded because I probably would have chosen the salmon. Our server was not good at all. We had to pour our wine 4 times and this wasn't cheap wine. In a restaurant like this you would they would be on point. The desert was pretty good we ordered a couple dishes and we enjoyed every single one of them.

PROS: Desert, view of the fountains
CONS: service, decor

Loved it. Amazing views of the Bellagio fountains and great ambiance. Great steak. I got the filet, friends got the rib eye and porterhouse, one friend for salmon. Everyone was happy with their food. The Yukon mashed potatoes were great, as were the Mac n cheese and mushrooms. Skip the asparagus, it's very meh. Great service.

This place is worth every penny. We had a fairly expensive dinner (final bill for dinner with tip was $400 for 2 of us) on Friday nite of Memorial Weekend. We made our reservations by walking by the restaurant on Thursday nite, so it was kind of last minute. They had a sign that the dress code was business casual or something like that. We took note of that. We had Friday 5;30pm reservations which we didnt mind since we like to eat early anyway, so it was perfect. 
Got seated very fast, right by the window, looking at the fountains. It's odd to see the fountains dancing, but not to hear the music for it though :), just didnt have the same effect. 
Our waiter was an older gentleman, with superb service skills. He suggested items, described them really well, same with wine. We were going to order a bottle of good ol' Joseph Phelps, but he suggested something else as well and we tried it. Weren't disappointed! (would like to point out that we are frequent wine tasters so feel to have some ability to distinguish wines). 

For appetizer we had shrimp cocktail (huge pieces of shrimp, I could barely eat it all). Main course was lobster (amazing!,and 8oz was just right) and fillet mignon (for hubby, rare, excellent!). The side dishes were great as well, the truffles mashed potato was to die for, as was the crunchy potato! For dessert we shared the chocolate cake (melted chocolate inside and ice cream on the side). Yum. 

The only complaint - as we tried to dress as best as possible, I was astonished to see a couple at the next table wearing 'jean's'. And another guy at another table as well. Com'on..Why have the sign up if you aren't going to enforce it?
