('Jacket Preferred') As we were leaving, there were people wearing evening gowns for godsakes, why would you wear crappy jeans to a place like this??? 

I would definitely go back to this place on our next visit!
One of the finest steakhouse in Las Vegas... I have been there many times and it gets better each time.. Fantastic!!!!!!!

This steak house is worth the splurge.  I treated my husband to Prime for his 45th birthday.  We were seated in their more intimate dining room, a remarkable view of the fountain show...the best seats in the house!

The kale Caesar salad was surprisingly good.  It's the perfect summer salad.  My husband  was completely silent as he inhaled his  French onion soup.  Afterwards, he had a huge Kool Aid smile.  The salmon,  NY steak, mac and cheese,  truffled potatoes, and chocolate cake were all stellar.   The view was extraordinary!  A table elegantly placed  near a window  with  gorgeous  panoramic  look into the  dancing waters of the Bellagio fountain, and the strip in the backdrop!

Love  it and going back for more!

Wonderful service, classy atmosphere & the food as amazing

the beef tartare & carpaccio was delicious.
i highly recommend getting the truffle mashed potatoes.

a very nice view of the water show too. i loved it here.
my new favorite place to eat in Vegas~

I've been to Prime several times, with different friends, for different occasions.  We don't stay at Bellagio, but always made the trip to Prime.  Had I been yelping when we first started going there, this would be a 5 star review.  2 times ago, 3 of us went, for my birthday, and noticed the decline in the food.  Still,the service, and having desert and coffee on the Terrace afterwards, with a front row view of the fabulous fountain show more than made up for it.  The last time (2011) when I called to make reservations, I stated that we would like coffee on the Terrace, after dinner.  I was told that you could now have your entire meal on the Terrace!  That was great news, except that you could not reserve a table there, but could take your chances.  Why??  I was calling 2 weeks ahead.  Ultimately, we were seated outdoors, as requested.  Our waiter, Luis, I think,  was RUDE and he and the mini waiters helping him, were slow and inefficient.  Our meals finally came, and my daughter's steak was wrong.  She ordered a medium rare, Kobe filet mignon, and was brought  a dried out, well done, New York.  The waiter was upset, and insisted that was what she had ordered.  The New York had never even been considered, and we told this idiot, when we placed our order, that we were anxious to compare the regular filet that I ordered, to the Kobe filet.  He said the kitchen would be "mad" if we sent it back.  We sent it back anyway. Pretty brave on our parts!  It took 1/2 hour to bring what she had actually ordered.  In the meantime, my meal, and our sides, were getting cold, so we ate from my plate.  Our bill was over $400, for 2 people.  I didn't want to raise hell, and spoil what was left of my daughter's birthday dinner, but did email the manger when I got home.  I gave her a detailed description of our experience.  As the manager, she should have appreciated  the polite, constructive and honest feedback.  Her email back said that she was sorry, and was looking into the matter.  She said she did not want to lose us as future guests to Prime, and would I please send my phone number so she could call and discuss the matter further.  I sent my phone number, and never heard from her, again.
Great food and drinks all around. The truffle here is a must try. Great selection of wines pair nice with the excellent choices of entrees. All orders where finessed to perfection.

We celebrated a birthday dinner during our stay at Bellagio.  Service was excellent.  Usually we order the dry-aged ribeye but decided to try the A5 wagyu ribeye.  It's expensive at $45 per ounce but definitely worth splurging.  We started with the seared foie gras, and the perky toe crab salad.  And then had a 9 ounce wagyu ribeye.  Perfectly cooked medium rare and lightly seasoned. It was accompanied by 3 sauces but didn't need anything as the wagyu beef was flavorful and tender

I was with a dining party of three. The experience was good; however, our overall impression was three stars. My Filet Mignon with grilled Serrano chilies was to my liking. It was preceded with an Onion Soup appetizer. I had mashed Yukon Gold potatoes with my steak. The Ribeye steak was judged to be ok, not in keeping with Prime's reputation. A Shrimp salad was deemed very good. A Broccoli side dish was considered strange, it was seasoned with fresh mint. Not to the liking of those who tried it. Our waiter was genial, yet we had a feeling of strained politeness from the waitstaff team - and a collective sense of moving our party out as fast as possible. We chalk-up this experience to "been there, did that."

As a vegetarian, this restaurant is all wrong for me. However I came here for dinner w/ 4 others and didn't pay a dime of the bill so I was fine with it. The others (rest were non-vegetarians) seemed to enjoy their food and our waiter was excellent. The place was quite nice and we had a great view of the famous Bellagio watershow so I was entertained as well as enjoying the several side dishes/appetizers that I ordered (obviously couldn't order the steak) and washed it all down with decent wine.

My wife and I went here for our 5th anniversary. We had requested fountain view seating when we made our reservations 2 months before arriving. When we arrived, we were told the seating wasn't available for at least an hour after our reservation. We decided to just be seated instead. They seated us right next to the kitchen entrance which was horrible. My chair was constantly hit by servers without any of them apologizing. Our drinks were never refilled including our water until after we were already finished eating. The only reason why I'm giving 2 stars is because the food was excellent.

We recently took my parents to Las Vegas for their 37th anniversary. We stayed at the Bellagio, went to see the incredible show O and had dinner at Prime. Mind you my parents do not get out much and this was a special occasion that we wanted to be special and enjoyable. The show was amazing the hotel was beautiful however dinner at Prime was not a good experience to put it politely. My mother's steak came out like shoe leather. My sister ordered the lamb medium well and that came out like shoe leather. The service was just as bad. Once the food was served, the waiter never returned to check on us. We had to catch the show so we were on a time crunch. The next day my mother called the restaurant and explained what happened and they said to leave a name and number and they would check the ticket and get back to her. We are still waiting. We are not complainers but again wanted this special occasion to be a nice experience and the restaurant did not try and correct the situation. The lack of customer service is what is most disappointing, not typical for a nice hotel in Vegas.
This is my favorite restaurant of all time! I have never had a dinner this amazing before. They have the best filet mignon you will ever eat, well worth the cost!

Best steak house in Vegas in every way. Bone-in ribeye and new york steaks were just perfectly done. I must mention their excellent and extensive wine list. A bit pricey, but absolutely worth it. We had a table by the lake and it was surprisingly spectacular.

5 stars all the way. Beautiful elegant. Loved the experience. Food cooked perfectly.  Waiter was friendly, when I asked few extras question about dairy free desserts and a few more about the menu selections he answered every question. He did have to ask about the dairy free ice cream for the chocolate cake... 
 Knowledgeable friendly staff.. they also have a photographer going table to table asking if you want pictures. Not once was the conversation my dinner mate and I were having interrupted. At one point a bus boy or someone that hadn't approched us the entire time came to the table and gave me more water. The waiter was a little confused about it too and asked how our meal was and if we needed anything. Everything was great and look forward to going back.

Chef Jean-Georges Vongerichten's Las Vegas steakhouse is one of the top dining experiences on the Strip. The darkly handsome restaurant inside the Bellagio overlooks the hotel's famous dancing fountains and provides an extra treat for diners. Not that they should need it, however, for the food here is world-class. Let's start with the steak, since that's what Prime is all about. We sampled the filet, a 10-ounce cut of wonderfully lean, pungently flavored meat ($67) that was oh-so tender to the knife and meltingly tasty in the mouth. We didn't find it required salt, pepper or -- God forbid -- any kind of sauce. The Caesar salad was a yummy accompaniment, and the French fries were amazing: fried golden brown, crunchy on the exterior and packed with a rich, potatoey (is that a word?) taste. Yes, we enjoyed some appetizers and our bread, but we really just kept raving about the steaks. They have some other entrees on the menu, but honestly, please do yourself a flavor (pun intended) and order a ribeye, t-bone or filet and savor your wisdom. By the way, the bartender is darned good, too; he made the best dirty vodka martini we've ever had. And he did it several times, too! Add into this fabulous mix very attentive yet unobtrusive service and we highly recommend Prime for your special night out.

I had to find an anniversary dinner which had amazing food with equally amazing views.  I was a little skeptical of Prime because I've been to the other restaurants on the Bellagio waters, and they were nothing to write home about.  

We were seated outside, overlooking the fountains.  The dry-aged ribeye was a party.  My wife and I were trying to figure out what made each bite so good, but at the end, we came to the conclusion that it was just damn good.  I've had Mortons, Flemings, etc. and this steak ranks higher than those places.  

The wife ordered the Chilean seabass, and it was just alright.   The fish was flakey, but there was not much taste.  

I'm comfortable giving this place a 5, even with the mediocre fish, because our dining experience was everything we hoped for.

This was a splurge for hubby and I's 15th wedding anniversary. We sat outside on the patio which was amazing for me, but I really love the fountains. Even though we had reservations two weeks in advance, we were told it might be about twenty minutes(we got there about 10 minutes before our reservation). Which is fine, I know there are limited seats outside and people will stay and chat. When we were first seated, it took our waiter a good five minutes to ask us what we wanted to drink. It took probably 8-10 minutes to get bread to our table.   Not a great start!  We were decided what we wanted to order and sat there for another 10 minutes or so before our waiter came back and yes, our menus were closed on the table that whole time.  Our appetizer came fairly quick but our steaks took quite a while. We had the crab cake which i thought was pretty incredible. We saw a few tables who sat down after us get their food much quicker then we did.  Whatever, though, it was our anniversary and we had a great view of the fountains. I ordered a medium 18 oz t bone steak which ended up being more rare then I would like, and hubbies medium rare porterhouse steak looked medium. Steaks were tough to cut with the knife provided but melted n your mouth. It was delicious, as was the sauces they provided.  Our water glasses never went empty and that really was the only attentive service we received.  We were asked if we wanted coffee, which I replied yes, along with a dessert menu.  We got our menus right away and it took at least 20 minutes for someone to take our order.  When the waiter took our order, it was another 20 minutes before we got our creme brulee.  The waiter simply forgot because I looked up at him when he walked by our table and the look on his face was one of oh s*&^% forgot their desert.  He did apologize and since it was our anniversary, it was complimentary.  I was in great company but the amount of tip left on our bill reflected our dissatisfaction with our service.  Our total was $192 for the crab cake appetizer, two steaks, two baked potatoes, and some coffee.  Just a warning, they do allow smoking as it is outside, which can be not so pleasant when the smoke is blowing in your direction.  We also had a rowdy group at the table next to us who were quite loud and obnoxious but I understand the restaurant wouldn't want to lose a customer.  We had to ask for our check, as did everyone around us, so I guess that is not unusual.  For the ambiance, and hubby's company it was an enjoyable evening. I loved being so close to the fountains and enjoying them go off every 15 minutes.  We never got any spray and it was a bit windy while we were there.  If we decide to go to a high end restaurant for our next anniversary, we will probably check out another place.
pricey, but worth it.  steak was cooked perfectly and the atmosphere was very refined/classy.

Amazing meal.  It all starts with them keeping the reservation time within a few moments.  It was crowed around the bar but the hostess was quick pleasant and sat us immediately...with a great view of the fountains out the window.  The waiters were great.  Attentive and never rushed you, even with people waiting.  I started with Ribbons of Tuna - so amazing.  The sauce was excellent and made the dish.  I also managed to "test out" my friend's Steamed Shrimp Salad.  Another hit.  So fresh were the seafood portions of these dishes.  My entree was a dry aged bone-in rib eye done medium rare.  Cooked perfectly and it was delicious.  I enjoyed much more than when I went to CarneVino.  We got sides of Yukon Gold Mashed Potatos and Gnocci - both again...excellent.  No room for dessert but overall a great triumph!

I ate here with my wife and really enjoyed the experience. We were given recommendations, but not pushed into anything in particular. We really wanted to sit outside to watch the fountains but it was SO HOT. We had to ask for a table inside within 2 minutes of sitting down. We were very fortunate and landed one of the few tables with an unobstructed view of the fountains inside. Everything we ordered was prepared to perfection down to the wine recommendation. I only wish we had saved room for dessert.

I'm so torn on this place. The food - dang good...really really dang nabit good. Service - forget about it. I have to say that the manager and sommalier took care of us at the end when they realized how much of a jerk our server was but it really did leave a bitter taste in my mouth.

3 of us went to this place instead of our usual tried and true Delmonico's at the Venitian. First thing we did was assess our budget. Looking at all the numbers, we figured we could spend just about $500 on our meal. We decided to go food heavy and budget on the wine (well, for this place that meant $100 for wine). 

Our server came by and I told him that we were on a wine budget and that we only had about $100 to spend and asked for some suggestions:

me: '...can I find some good dry, full bodied reds for about $100?'
jerk: 'If you look HARD enough'

I'm all, are you for real right now? Then he starts going down the wine list (which is huge and pretty darn impressive) and picking out all the ones that are $100 just based on price. So I tell him that I read numbers really well and that what I want is a suggestion.

Then we start ordering and my friend asks if they have lobster tail for the table to share. Jerk says they have small and large sizes even though it's not on the menu and then says he'll be back with the prices. Comes back pretty quickly and says, 'the large is $168 so you guys will probably want to small one if you really want one'. My buddy is pretty pissed at this point and just based on that comment he orders the large. Jerk doesn't let it go and tries to convince my friend to order the small saying stuff like, 'it's better for you to order the small one'. At this point we are all pretty pissed, but it's been over a year since I've seen my friends so we try to brush it off.

The sommalier suggests a VERY nice silver oak for like $108 that turns out to be a really good wine so we're kicking back and enjoying our wine and the appetizers that came out super fast. The crab cakes were very good as well as the stuffed mushrooms. Everything cooked well with great flavors.

The steaks were also on the money. I'm partial to bone-in ribeyes and this one was really really good. Rare-plus is the way to go if you want to full juicy flavor of this bad boy.

I slow down after eating almost half the steak and start wondering where the lobster tail is... I wave down Jerk and and ask him when the lobster is coming and he runs off and comes back and tells me 10 minutes. So I start digging into him why it would take so long and find out the he never put in the order. What's worse, he tried to blame it on my buddy, saying that we weren't sure if we really wanted to order or not and that's when I had enough and went off on the guy. I can be an a$$ at times and this called for all my a$$ness to come out, especially since I was fueled w/ Patron and Silver Oak. I chewed him out and asked for the manager.

Manager finally comes and she apologizes and all that stuff but at that point we were seriously fed up. I mean, I went on a rampage, brought up the service, asked if they were racist, asked if they didn't serve young people, you name it, I accused it. 

The only thing that kept us from leaving was that the food was so dang good. I couldn't leave my perfectly cooked bone-in rib. It just didn't seem right. I'm sorry.

We ended up getting the lobster tail right away (delicious), ordered another side (on top of 3 others we ordered) and got 3 desserts. Molten cake - awesome, some italian cookie thingy with icecream in the middle - awesome, creme brulee - good. 

At the end I figured we completely blew our budget but the manager came by with the bill and it was far less than about 1/3 of what we should have paid. I think they comped everything but our steaks and appetizers. 

Was it worth the price? Not sure. Was it good? Heck yeah. Would I go back? Only if my friend pays again.

I don't know how I feel about Prime. Sure, the location can't be beat. However, the restaurant itself is large and is not intimate or romantic. My girlfriend and I sat down at the last seating (10 pm) and there was still plenty of commotion. The decor is very old fashioned and seems outdated and like I am in my grandmothers dining room. 

I prefer modern decor in an intimate setting where you can enjoy conversation and not feel rushed . This is not Prime.

As every other review points out, the food is good and so is the wine list. The highlight from out meal happened to be the salmon sashimi appetizer, it topped sashimi from Nobu.

We were staying at the Bellagio and I was bound and determined to have dinner as close to the fountains as I could.  The Prime was the prime place just for that.  (no pun intended : ),  The patio was closed due to the chill in the air. So,  we were seated right next to a window where the water was no less than 5' away.  From the very second we stepped into the Prime up to paying the check...it was an absolutely stunning evening.  The service was impeccable, classy and just what I was taught how it should be.  I ordered the beet salad and it was so good.  There were roasted beets on top of yogurt, no doubt.  LOVED the combination and never had thought of putting those 2 foods together.  My husband ordered the french onion soup which he said was the best he's ever had!  We both ordered the 16 oz. rib eye, med. rare!  The steaks were served still hot and perfectly cooked to our liking.  They put 3 different sauces on the table but, the steak was so good that a sauce just wouldn't do it justice.  Not a sauce person much anyway.  We had a side of the mushrooms and chickpea fries.  Excellent!  And all the time we were delicately devouring our dinner, the fountains entertained us over and over.  

This is a restaurant that will be revisited over and over by us.  It's pricey and I guess one has to pay for the view, as well.  But, such a lovely indulgence!

This restaurant is fantastic, very elegant and very stylish.

The food is really good and the service is top notch. The portions are quite large, but that's how it's usually in Vegas.

I had the 18 oz bone-in rib eye steak.  There was a choice between the Bellagio buffet or this steak restaurant.  Wanted to save this place for a special moment, but the wait at the buffet was 45mins.  Hunger was a factor and there was a big price to pay for it as well.  The decor like the previous person mentioned is phenomenal.  A look out the window has you looking out to the lake / water show.  

The steak was pretty good, but I still have to compare that Ruth's Chris is still better, even though they are a chain.  Although I usually order the New York steak at Ruth's Chris.

Apparently they revamped the restroom to allow for more than on individual.

Long due review here. Took my girl here for a special occasion. Made a request to be seated on the balcony when I made my reservation. We got seated promptly. Service was attentive and food was great. price is a little steep but you should already know that before deciding to dine here. it's definitely a experience and very romantic place. btw, she said yes...

Reservations a must. Great food. Had their special Kobe steak. It was beyond good as the meat just melted in your mouth. The sides were average- nothing stood out. Extensive wine list. Order a recommended red that complemented the food well. Decor was beautiful. We had 12 people in our party so we received a small room to the side. Felt like a rockstar walking in.

This place has two of the three qualities of a great restaurant.  Quality of food and ambient atmosphere.  They lose out where price is concerned but if you want good dry aged grade a beef with the Bellagio water and light show in the background, you're going to have to shell out some clams.  This place also knows about foie gras and truffle mashed potatoes if you're into that sort of opulence.

Great food, but the service was totally horrible. Our waiter was "Bob" and he was very tacky. First, we brought our own wine and expected a corkage fee. This is typical. Bob seemed as though this bothered him. Was very snooty about it and said couldn't cork anything on the menu. He would "send his guy over". "Guy" comes over and is totally cool. None of our wines were on the menu. He made recommendations as to what to drink first. Cool! So rest of dinner was fine, food was great. Still picked up on this weird snootiness from Bob the whole time. We get our check, pay, sign. As were sitting there in the middle of our conversion, he flat out interrupts us, sticks his arm in front of our faces to take the signed check before we even left. Absolutely unprofessional and rude. You do not cut me off mid sentence and take the check from our table before we leave. This is not Denny's. I really wish I would've known that he was going to pull such tacky behavior before I tipped him. Will only patronize Mastros from now on. Prime pales in comparison.

Last night, our bill for 4 people was $820. 

...and i'm not a food snob. I'm saying this because of the following bold statement of the day: IT WAS AVERAGE. 

So, did I miss something? I simply don't understand why it gets so many high ratings. It was very disappointing, to say the least. My steak was so incredibly dry that it tasted like something from Denny's (...yeah, gross). I'd rather spend money at Ruth Chris's or Flemings.  Anyways, let's get to the details. We ordered the following: 

1. Seafood appetizer (came with lobster, shrimp, oysters, crab, and clams) -- not bad, the seafood tasted quite fresh and delicious. I'm a fan. 

2. French onion soup -- please, do not burn the top of my soup. The top (the bread and cheese part) was so burned that I could actually taste it while drinking the soup. Uhmm, no. 

3. T-bone steak -- my steak was DRY. I asked for medium, but it was honestly well done. For $70, please do not overcook my steak. The others in my group agreed, their steak was overcooked. Major negative. 

4. Side dishes: macaroni and cheese (the cheese was WAY too strong), asparagus (good - but honestly, how can you go wrong with steamed asparagus?), sauteed spinach (ew - do NOT order this, the sauteed flavoring is just weird. trust me), baked potato (...it's a baked potato, nuff said) 

5. Caesar salad - standard. 

Honestly, i'm a huge steakhouse fan, and this has got to rank as one of my bottom choices in the future. Like I said, Ruth Chris's and Flemings tastes much better because the steaks are juicier and prepared with more detail. If i'm going to be paying $70 for a steak, the chefs should be sure to cook a steak medium if requested. This is just super disappointing...

So this steakhouse was pretty good, but to be honest STK @Cosmo or SW@ Wynn or Botero @Encore are better.  I had the bone in Filet with the crab mashed potatoes that was the chef's special for the evening.  Both were very good.  I started with an heirloom tomato and mozzarella salad, very good, but hard to mess that up.

Creamed spinach was very boring and lacked flavor. I had to add salt to it & was missing the 'creamed' part of it.  Mashed potatoes were too soupy for me, was like baby food.  But the creamed corn was a definite winner.  Their peppercorn sauce was rather boring for me.  

We asked for a table by the window or water so we could watch the Bellagio water show.  We go the furthest thing from it.  Some lady came and asked if we wanted our pictures taken at the table...TACKY...where are we Disneyworld???  They also were over booked or something b/c towards the end of the meal we felt pressured to 'hurry up and go'  like they needed the table.

Very upscale atmosphere, business meeting dinner rather than a date place {stk is a date place}.

see pix of my salad

This place was amazing. I took my girlfriend here for out 2 year anniversary and she loved it. I had made reservations months in advance in hopes of the patio dinning area which I got. The servers was great and friendly.  The food fantastic I had the salmon, she had the lobster tail and we shared the bacon potatoes.  The view of the fountain was amazing. Highly recommend going.

Excellent service and presentation. Spectacular view. Wine list mostly a rip off although there are a few pearls hidden.
Steak is mediocre and should be better from such a gorgeous high end restaurant (steaks tasted like choice not Prime in my opinion ). Not as good as last time I was here about 1 1/2 years ago.

Loved the place, the view, the lamb chops and the service. 

I didn't really like how to order sides, theyre like ala carte style so it's like 12-15 $ each side. 

And my bf ordered the bone in prime rib that was 30 days aged and he said it didn't taste aged at all, it was 70$. He eats steak all the time and didn't enjoy it but we were really hungry and in a rush so even though the waiter offered a new piece,  we didn't have time to wait.

They took of our wine off the bill which was nice.

The best steak hands down!  Service is the best.  I ate here twice, once outside and it was so magical because of the fountains.  There is mist from the fountains be warned.  Inside was amazing and everything we ordered was made perfectly. The best.

Known for its views of the fountain show at Bellagio, this is not a restaurant that only has a view, but food to match. Unlike places I have visited that have a great view and leave you feeling like the meal itself is an afterthought the opposite is true here!
After a few bites you'll soon forget to look out the window! 
The dining room is luxuriously appointed with a plush and resplendent feel and a definite flair towards the romantic without being overly so. It's a great place for friends and family as well as couples. 
Having said all of that, the food really is the best part here! The NY strip, steamed king crab, bacon wrapped shrimp, bone in filet, truffled mashed potatoes, the beet or tomato salads, all favorites and reasons I come back on nearly every trip I'm here. Come splurge and Salute, they have delicious cocktails!

Probably the greatest steak I have ever had. The Filet Mignon was perfectly cooked. We were seated right next to the windows over looking the fountain. It was an amazing night. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a great memory.

What a restaurant! Incredible wine list, sampled some of the best white and red wine that I've had. The seafood sampler appetizers were incredible, including everything from crab and shrimp to mussels, oysters, and clams.

On the day we were in, they had a special which was a 10oz bone in filet, and it was incredible. Perfectly charred while tender and medium inside. Not that it needed any sauces, but they also brought 3 nice options, one with some great spice. The chocolate cake dessert...how can you go wrong?

Five years later, it's still good! I'm actually glad I reread my previous review because I got to order the creamed corn again even though it was off menu. Our waitress checked with the chef and he made a pretty standard version. Looking back at the pictures, I wish I had the fancier one from before but all is good.

+ easy to make reservations through OpenTable (I requested a window seat this time if possible and we got pretty close but not exactly)
+ excellent service by the entire team (including the hostess that generously took a few family photos for us)
+ thank you myVegas - got to redeem for 2 complimentary glasses of champagne

This is truly a special occasion type of place. The wine list is extensive and very expensive. On some pages you can't tell if it's the year or the price of the bottle, haha.

+ tuna ribbon appetizer - very interesting twist on the classic tartare
+ roasted beets - with apple, ricotta and quinoa
- bone-in ribeye - I should've listened to myself from 5-years ago and not ordered it again
+ FILET - omg so good! (no bone-in this time because they are changing providers)
+ truffled mashed potatoes - still just as good!
- creamed corn (albeit it was by special request, doh!)
+ roasted butternut square - surprisingly good with the chili and toasted pumpkin seeds

We went here last night for dinner. This place is the essence of fine dining, so dress the part and definitely be prepared to spend some money. We chose this place based on the fact that it had great reviews and it had outdoor patio seating right on Bellagio lake, so we could be RIGHT in front of the fountain show. 
We went there around 7:15 and were seated almost immediately. First we stopped by the bar to get ourselves two dirty gin martinis. They offer blue cheese olives which is a HUGE plus in my book. However, the martinis for $17 each and not blowing my mind is what disappointed me. But hey, that's why I always order extra olive juice on the side. We were seated right next to fence leading out into the water of the lake. We had about 2-3 people taking care of us. All of them were very attentive and useful for helping us decide what to order. 
For an appetizer we got the steak tartar and carpaccio with an aioli sauce. HOLY MOLY was this orgasmic in my mouth. Extremely fresh and decadent! A must order! For dinner I got the sea bass. My boyfriend got the rare filet mignon (on the bone!! Something I've never seen before) and a side of mashed/whipped potatoes. The portion sizes were EXTREMELY generous, which made the prices (around $80-90 for the filet and $44 for the sea bass) worth it. The filet came with some sauces that I wasn't really a fan of for steak purposes, but I could definitely see them being great with other kinds of food. However, nothing could compare to the merlot reduction sauce we had at mon ami Gabi the night before. The mash potatoes were out of this world, and I'm not particularly a mashed potato fan. Dessert was surprise birthday treat. Some lava brownie with ice cream and a fudge decorated concoction with "happy birthday" and a candle. Very tasteful but couldn't be finished after our exquisite dinner. 
Throughout the meal we were amazed by the spectacular fountain show. At times we could actually feel the water mist. Just like the night before, the Vegas sunset during an outdoor dinner is beautiful. We watched the sky light dimmer down as the surrounding building lights slowly light up. However, I must say that if you end up dining indoors, you won't be disappointed. The decor is made of deep and light blues. It's quite magnificent. 
All of the staff are professional and eager to please. You can tell by looking at the menu and tasting the food that chef has put A LOT of thought into the menu and likely makes a great effort to use he finest and freshest ingredients. Our main server, Paul or Kevin I want to say, was extremely useful and refreshingly honest in helping us decide what to order. He didn't try to push us into buying the most expensive items or getting more than we wanted. Also, I want to say thank you to the gentleman who actually walked me to the bathroom and opened the door for me, so I wasn't wondering around like a lost puppy, HAHA! 
The only reason I don't give this place a full five stars is because of the prices. Although the portions are quite generous, I've experienced other amazing quality food and service at other steakhouses in other expensive cities like New York and DC, and haven't seen prices THIS high. However, Prime is an indulgence nonetheless, and there's no doubt in my mind that you won't walk away extremely happy with your experience there. 
Overall,  I'm a very pleased customer. Last but not least, if you're an M Life member like me, just give them your M life member card when you get your check, and you'll be able to add points to your M life account...so your expensive indulgence will probably benefit towards a comp later :)
ENJOY!

The service is phenomenal.  Jesus & Lisa were our main servers.  They were very attentive and helpful.  The hostesses were super nice as well.

The food was cooked well but I'd have to say the experience of where you are dining is what you are paying for.  I wish when kitchens are using any kind of hot peppers on or in a dish they would state it on the menu,so I could have them left off/out.

The Gratinee Dauphinoise potatoes were much more flavorful than the mac n cheese, so even if you dont care for potatoes.... get them.  

Definitely worth the trip & cost for the experience of it.  Thank you again Jesus, Lisa & hostesses for being so nice & attentive!

Of course the view of the fountains from the patio is lovely as is the restaurant itself.

After trying so many steakhouses, Prime is only mediocre. The atmosphere to Prime is really romantic and has a good feel to it. It makes you feel like a classy person when you're in Prime and that goes for the price of your food as well. For the price and the taste of your food, you can probably get better steakhouses(Craft or SW ). 

I did quite enjoy having the sauces on the side which give it a nice little spin to it. However, I only end up using one and we never got one of the 4 sauces( the miso-mustard). I was a big fan of the soy-rice wine sauce which was a winner for me(I believe there was garlic in it) Moving on, the steak was good quality but it didn't exactly differ too much from other steak houses(including Mastro where I get Porterhouse as well) for a more inexpensive price than I would rather go back to Mastros. On a side note, what did win for me in Prime was their sides. Their sides were one of the better sides that I've had(way better than SW) in my opinion. The mac and cheese which was layer with lot of truffle(yay) was quite awesome and so was the mash potatoes. 

Oh the service was wonderful and they didn't charge us for a bottle of wine that we brought(usually it would be $50 so be warned)...probably because our bottle of wine was too cheap for them :p. Whatever the case, I like that they didn't charge for us it. The dessert were okay. 

You can give it a try when you are in Vegas but the winner for steakhouses for me is definitely Craft. I do highly recommend bring a girl to a date here since it is quite the place as you can even see the bellagio's water show which was a +.

Had a great day at the tables, so my friends and I decided to hit up Prime. Wow...is all I have to say.

I highly recommend the bacon wrapped shrimp, the truffle mashed potatoes and the porterhouse. The BEST mashed potatoes I've ever had.

Found this to be one of the highest ranked steak houses in Vegas through my 'Zagat' 2007 book.

I started off with their Foie Gras and thought it was above average but not exceptional.

I ordered the Porterhouse medium-medium well and it came with a trio of sauces for dipping. I was not impressed with the steak, again I would say above average at most. I did like the soy based dipping sauce but it almost overpowered the natural flavor of the steak. So with that said, I could of used practically any meat and dipped it into that sauce and it would probably taste the same. I didn't care much for the other sauces including the bearnaise. (bearnaise, usually is my preferred sauce with a steak)

On the other hand, their Truffle Mash Potatoes.. I must say is impeccable! The texture was on point and the amount of actual truffles (not truffle oil) is right on the money. I'd take this over the steak!

As far as the decor, I must say this place is very upscale. Try getting a window seat, its got a great view of the water/fountains.

My review of Prime can be summed up very simply... so-so steak, not that great sides, and the waiter spilled something all over my back .... the manager offered NOTHING but an apology for my soiled dress shirt. I've had way way better in Las Vegas. Save your time and money and clothes.

Prime is a quiet decadent experience.  

Call ahead and make a reservation with a table near the window.  Not only is the food and service impeccable, this is the best place to see the Bellagio water show, which plays every 15 mins after 8 pm.  It's an emotional experience from the windows and ambiance of the restaurant.   If you're here in the summer, they have a patio where you can have a romantic dinner on the terrace over looking the water.  

When you're in Vegas, it's nice to get away from the lights for a few hours, and devour a decadent meal.  The decor here is subtle, reminds me of the London West Hollywood.  Warm candle light, with hints of modern styled art deco patterned glass on the ceilings, and the walls.  Luxurious velvet curtains in deep browns and periwinkle, and fresh cut cymbidium orchids (my favorite).  

RECOMMENDATIONS FOR FOOD: 
You really can go wrong here, but Here are my faves from the menu: 
-Succulent Lamb Chops 
-Bone in Fillet 
-MUST TRY Warm Shrimp Salad.  (Worth coming into the bar and ordering this with a glass of wine)
-Side of Crab Leg

RECOMMENDATIONS FOR WINE: 
If you've won big at the slots while you're at Vegas, by all means indulge.  They have an extensive wine list, some rare French wines that run over $60,000!  If you're looking for robust red wine at a reasonable price point, try Faust, Cabernet 2006.  

Sometimes you get what you pay for, and at Prime, the ambiance, the service, the food does not disappoint.  Indulge while you're in Vegas.  Life is short;  Live a little.

My boyfriend and I visited for my birthday and I was very impressed.  The atmosphere was wonderful and we sat in a secluded library overlooking the Bellagio fountains.  We shared a steak that was one of the best I have ever had.  Jean-George is one of my favorite chefs, especially after eating at his restaurant in New York.  He truly out did himself and they suprised me with a delicious chocolate desert.  I highly recommend this place to anyone celebrating a special occasion, although I was a little dissapointed they didn't offer to take a commemorative picture for us to by like they did the bachelor party at the table next to us.

I wish I could eat this meal every day! (Though it would be horrible for the waistline)

Had the opportunity to sit out in the patio where you have front row seats (from the back) of the fountain show.  The location was enough to make this a 5 star location.  Every 15 minutes, you are enchanted by the fountains of Bellagio.  What else do you need?  You can get full of that! But luckily, this place serves amazing food as well.

Seafood Platter:  A medley of raw oysters, raw clams, lobster, king crab legs, mussels, shrimp and a mixture of dipping sauces.  The oysters were extremely fresh and sweet.  The lobster was cooked well.  Not chewy.  The king crab legs were brine-y but also sweet in flavor.  The shrimp may have been one of the best shrimp cocktails I have ever had.

Filet Mignon: Ordered medium rare and it came out medium rare.  What a shocker.  No matter where I go, it's always so hard to get a steak delivered to your preference.  The meat was tender, not salty.  Dip it in their special soy dipping sauce, which the waiter said goes well with anything, and you are in carnivore heaven. After the platter,  you don't have any more space for the whole filet but you will want to eat it all.

Truffle Mashed Potatoes:  Creamy, rich goodness with the essence of truffle throughout.  SOOOO Good.  A must try when you are there.  Sprinkles of truffle on top.  Be shady and just scoop the top layer so you can get all the truffle flavor that your taste buds can handle.

The service was also amazing.  Waiters (and waitresses) were very attentive: always refilling water, refilling wine, providing details of the dishes and always asking if everything is OK.  Very polite and also very personable.

Had a great time at Prime.  The location was already amazing but the food and service topped it all off.

Not impressed
Just ok. Was expecting mouth melting steaks, and all I got was an outrageous check.

Went to a rehearsal dinner in August 2011 at Prime. The place is beautiful. Everyone was in place and the guests all looked fantastic. 

The food was of course really expensive and the portions were small. We all took a group photo.. and each guest got a copy that was very nice so we could remember the evening. 

Until the manager realized he had made a mistake and they were not paid for. He immediately took all the photos back and told us if we wanted them we had to purchase them for $40!! 

All in all it was a good time, long walk for Aria Hotel but I would say it was worth it.
Dry aged rib eye medium was perfect.  Plus i got them to make us lobster mashed potatoes--yummm.  Expensive but you get what you pay for service was spot on.

Outstanding steakhouse. I'm usually not one for 'top dollar' kinda restaurants but I was in Vegas and it was my girlfriend's birthday. We just came out from the Pacquiao Bradley fight and has reservations here.  
Let me say, I would normally have been taken back by the prices, but since I was 'in Vegas', I figured I would just roll with it. 
Conclusion: I spent a lot of money, however, I really enjoyed the experience and the food. 

I had the filet mignon, and my gf had the lobster tail. The main entrees wee great.  The sides were also exceptional. They were pricey for side dishes but they did not disappoint. 
The best part was the 'house sauce' steak sauce. I forget the name but it was a ginger-soy sauce., that was crucial to the overall party going on inside my mouth! 

Scrumptious, to say the least. 

Now, one thing j really didn't appreciate at first was the photographer chick that shower up at our table and asked us if we would "line our procured taken".  
Look, my gf is Asian and as you should know -- Asians like to take pictures. She is no exception. So, there we were.   "taking pictures".
The initial result there was a $70 cost. But, the nice part is we have a 4 pack of nice pictures of that moment -/ which was very forced. ..  By the photographer. 
Anyway, it was still very special and since I was 'in Vegas' -- I rolled with it and had a great time. 

Thumbs up, Prime!

Early dinner (5pm) due to early start the next day. I'm not a 'meat person' but there are certain places like Prime... "when in Rome, eat the steak"
I did a surf & turf. The meat was good!

The view was great, the tables were lively but quiet enough to have a conversation. The decor- decadent and a nod to another era. 

Get the freakin chocolate cake

THE BEST STEAK I have ever had. BY FAR. The steaks are perfectly cooked here EVERY time I go. They give you three sauces to eat your steak with. At first I though it was odd that they were serving three different sauces with steak but it really caters to each individuals taste buds and is a brilliant idea. The restaurant ambience is perfections with their drapes, curtains, and dim lighting. Most importantly the view from the restaurant is breathtaking because you can see and enjoy the bellagio fountain show up close while you're eating. The sides here and everything they serve is cooked to perfection. I go back every year now, whenever I got to Vegas!

One of my favorite restaurants in the city. Probably the best steakhouse. Husband and I were there for our 1 anniversary on July 4th, 2010. 

FOOD
We both enjoyed the Filets, Au Gratin Potatoes, which were the most delicious, decadent foods I've ever eaten. The Bearnaise sauce was the best I've ever experienced. They also brought a few other sauces like a peppercorn mustard and another I can't quite remember...all good.

SERVICE
Spectacular. Helpful and always attentive. They brought us a little desert for our anniversary and made sure we always had everything we wanted.

ATMOSPHERE
It's dark, plush and very romantic. The place settings and dinnerware were of high quality as expected. We sat next to a window overlooking the fountains of the Bellagio. It was after 7pm so it was dark and the lights were beautiful. When you make your reservation ask for a window seat or the patio (in the summer).

OVERALL
First, the filets are easily the best on the strip. The price is a little on the high side as compared to other places where you can fill your stomach. But it is a high-end establishment for a high-end clientele. If you're the type of person who is concerned about $8 bottled water, then Prime may not be the place for you. 

If you can drop around $200-300 (two people) for an excellent meal and it doesn't deplete your entire vacation fund, then I probably don't need to tell you that this is a must. Highly recommended. Go here, enjoy life because it's probably one of the best experiences you'll have.

BIO
Jennifer(27) and Chris(31) are Vegas fanatics. Enjoying multiple trips every year, they continuously search for new and delicious findings Las Vegas has to offer.

I dined here last night and it has to be one of the most amazing restaurants I have been to yet.  I was seated in a cozy corner that still over looked Lake Bellagio.  The staff were exceptional. I enjoyed a traditional steak and lobster meal but Prime takes it to another level! I was too stuffed to have desert but I here it is amazing. Dining here is a must.
You may not go wrong!!  For years now, its been exceptional....Probably the best steak west of the Mississippi
Phenomenal food, phenomenal service. You pay for quality as you should. Do not gripe about cost in a place like this. Go ,enjoy, tell friends how amazing it was

It's been four years since my last review of Prime. I'm saddened to say that it has lost a star. I said it was a classy restaurant in my last review. It has lost some of its class. It use to be a quiet, intimate atmosphere. It now has a hectic feel to it. The background noise is terrible. But to the dinner. We love the chilled seafood platter. It is still good but the crab legs were soggy and size of the platter has decreased by a third, with an increase in price. 
My wife had the Australian lobster. It was cooked perfectly and was delicious. I had the dry aged bone in ribeye. I always order it med+. It arrived undercooked. I did not send it back but probably should have. The sides have always been excellent. We split the steamed asparagus and mashed potatoes. Still excellent. Prime is still one of our favorites and I'm sure we'll be back. It's just sad to see an old friend decline in quality.

Messed up our reservation that was made over month in advance. The lobster tail was below average, looked like something from outback instead of a top notch steak house. The lamb gave my home boy the runs and the truffle mash was just okay. Overall the wait staff was good.

Went here our first night in Vegas. Right on the fountains at Bellagio which is cool since you can see the shows from a good seat. Food was good. Ginger sweet potatoes were awesome and so were their other vegetables. Steaks come with a number of sauces. Dessert was good as well. It's a bit pricey and it didn't feel it blew me away.

Located inside of Bellagio, I picked this steakhouse because of the reviews I saw on Yelp.  When we arrived we were shown right to our table.  

When I opened the menu I was struck by how simple it was, there weren't a billion choices it was just simple and to the point.  Our server was very attentive to the details and we had an awesome dining experience.  Our waiter also reminded me of the butler from Mr Deeds.  When I came back from the restroom, I didn't notice anyone around me when I went to sit down.  But as I was moving my seat forward there was a slight push from the back, I thought I had bumped into the seat behind me.  I turned around and there was our server, whoa like super sneaky.  When I told the waiter of my stomach not feeling well, he suggested right away soda water to help settle my stomach.  He also very patient with my lack of knowledge to pair which red wine to the filet mignon my dad was having.  We also ordered the Ribbons of Tuna, Truffle Mashed Potatoes, and Creamed Spinach.    

The Ribbons of Tuna was a very nicely designed dish.  The tuna sashimi was top grade because there were no lines running through them.  There was finely chopped avocado at the bottom of the dish with a sauce containing yuzu and a slight hint of spicy oil.  It was delicious, so light and tasty a great way to start a meal.  

I specifically requested that the butternut squash soup be brought out as my entree since that was going be my main course.  And the staff brought it out exactly the way I wanted to.  The filet mignon came with three sauces the soy rice wine was my dad's favorite.  The Truffle mashed potatoes were fluffy and had little chopped up pieces of truffle which brought a nice texture to the dish.  I wasn't able to try the creamed spinach and it looked ok.

Overall the service was spot on, attention to detail is the way I like it, and the food was outstanding.  O yeah we also got a nice view of the fountains outside which was like the cherry on top of the ice cream.  I highly recommend this restaurant and its a great stop in Vegas.

Always an enjoyable evening at Prime. This time we dined with a dear friend alfresco on the lovely patio while watching the beautiful fountains of Bellagio. Ambiance makes all of the difference and this was over the top! We highly recommend the patio if you are lucky enough to score one of the few choice tables. We dined later in the evening which probably why we were able to land the choice patio seat. Prime has always been rated as one of the top steakhouses in Las Vegas but they also have a great selection of seafood. My seared rare tuna steak lightly coated in pepper was among the best I've had. My spouse and our guest shared a beautifully prepared 10 ounce filet but certainly could have chosen many other prime cuts that looked utterly amazing at the surrounding tables. Large selection of sides to share made our meals complete. Service
Is certainly among the best too with multiple attendants hovering over us in a respectful manner. It's a "prime" experience dining a Prime.

Prime; one of the top four steak houses in Vegas.  A pantheon of beef.  Where Bacchus reigns over a 500+ selection of to die for wines.  Where the "brown" libations are over the top.

At Prime, the menu is seasonally updated.  The fall of 2012 features an outstanding, air flown colossal stone crab appetizer (three huge claws the size of your hand with a pile of knuckle and leg meat).  Heaven and at $75, and worth every penny.  Sweet.  Perfect.  The steak tartar on a platter of Carpaccio is delicious but slightly unbalanced with over the top Asian spice heat.  Finally, the bacon wrapped shrimp.  Wow.  The fat of the bacon permeates the rich, sweet flesh of the barely cooked through shrimp.  Outstanding.

Beef mains are to die for.  Japanese A5 Kobe cuts of beef (4oz minimum $35 per ounce).  Sublime if you don't over indulge.  A four to six ounce portion is enough for anyone.  Offered in a strip, rib, or fillet cut.  The rib is the most flavorful.  DO NOT ORDER THIS IF YOU WANT YOUR BEEF COOKED BEYOND RARE.  You are wasting your money as the fat will melt during cooking and the beef taste like any other piece of beef.

The 30 day dry aged, bone fillet is excellent.  Huge umame finish without tasting edgy.  Soft and tender.  The veal chop is equally good.  Sweet, deep beef flavor from free ranged calves.  Double cut, perfectly seared and moist throughout.  

All mains come with sauces and sides.  They match and are very flavorful but do not pass on ordering some veg and off the menu potato dauphinois to share.  Sides are perfectly cooked.  Rich and refreshing.

Killer wine list with great depth of cult wines.  Great values to be found at higher price points (best priced Screaming Eagle in Vegas). Outstanding cognac selection.

Service is excellent.  Friendly and extremely efficient.

Note:  Unlike most Vegas restaurants, for reservations, you MUST be a high status member of Mlife to book the best tables and times on short notice.  If you use OpenTable, make your reservation at least 60 days in advance  Outdoor and window tables where you can view the incredible fountain show at the Bellagio are very difficult to secure.

A truly memorable experience in Vegas not afforded to everyone.  Do whatever it takes to try it.  

A dozen plus visits since my initial review.  Extremely consistent.  Highly Recommended.

Escape Vegas to an elegant tranquil and refined space in the Bellagio. If you're organised book early and request a table against the window with a view of the Fountains. Staff that understand what good old fashioned customer service is - and exceed it. The food is nothing short of exceptional. The best steak my wife and I have ever had, and we've eaten at a lot of great steak restaurants. Silky smooth truffle mash. YUM. Expensive yes, but with food, service and wine this good - you're in Vegas, so who cares??!!!

This is one of the best steakhouses we have been to in sometime. Sat outside on terrace which overlooks Bellagio fountains, food was fantastic, and service was even better.

Highly recommend if you are in Vegas looking for a great dining experience.

Finally made it out here for dinner and loved it! It was so much fun to watch the watershow up close every fifteen minutes. (Starting at 8pm). We sat outside (8:30pm in July) and it was a bit too hot. Next time for sure we're sitting inside.

We got the gulf shrimp wrapped in bacon appetizer. It was just okay - wasn't blown away like I thought I would be after reading all the reviews. I think maybe it was a little overcooked since my shrimp wasn't as succulent as I would have thought it to be and the bacon was a tad dry.

Steaks, however, were really good. We got the filet mignon and the porterhouse. Filet was soo soft, melted in your mouth. Porterhouse was equally as amazing. I actually preferred the steak without any of the sauces. 

For sides, we got the broccoli and mashed potatoes. Both were good. Nothing too interesting about the broccoli (how exciting can broccoli really be now), but the mashed potatoes were good. I can only imagine how good the truffle mashed potatoes are...next time! 

Overall, food and scenery made for a great meal.

It's hard for me to review anything in Vegas because theres nothing authentic about that city and I love the authentic experience of food.  

The food is awesome and quality for the money.  The drinks are good.  The watershow is fun.  What more can I say?  it's not my thing but it does not miss the mark.  

Get a window seat.

We made reservations for Prime for my birthday. Easily the most beautiful and elegant restaurant I've ever eaten at. I felt like I was in a movie. Dim lights, sunset, the Belagio water for fountains every 15 minutes, and the wait staff treated us like we were the most important people in the world. There was a photographer to take pictures ($70 for the small package). The food was absolutely to die for. The best steak I've ever eaten, hands down, and the desert left me in heaven. I highly recommend this restaurant for any sort of special occasion dinner. And if you're looking for somewhere to propose (as my now Fiancé apparently was) this is the perfect place to do it. As there is a wandering photographer, it's even easy to get pictures of the proposal!

When my girlfriend told me that she was taking me to Prime Steakhouse, the first thing I thought of was, "God, that's selfish of you (she loves steak). Why not one of the more well-known restaurants on the Strip if you want to go the expensive route?" The name of the restaurant wasn't exactly impressive to me. 

My impression of the place heightened as soon as I saw the interior though. This is actually quite classy! Then, to top it off, we had a nice window view of the Bellagio fountain and of the Paris hotel.

Phuong, our server was also quite helpful with his recommendation of the 28-day aged rib-eye steak with crab mashed potatoes. He also recommended that we pair it with a pinot noir, which we did. The meal was splendid. I only wished that he had mentioned how big the rib-eye steak was going to be... It looked like it could be a 32-oz steak. Wow. Ok, I can eat, but not quite that much. I ended up boxing half of mine to go. I especially loved the crab mashed potatoes -- what a perfect combination of two of my favorite food: shellfish AND mashed potatoes (the perfect side dish for steaks, in my opinion). 

We also ordered a key lime pie for dessert with espresso. I enjoyed the pie a lot. It came with a thin layer of rock sugar in the middle. Crunchy and sweet, like candy. 

Next time, if we come here again, I'd like to split the surf and turf. It appears a more reasonable serving per person.

Food is good, but not much beyond average. Honestly preferred the meats at Wynn buffet. Service was fine, but not particularly accommodating ( my mother was very cold, we asked to lower the AC but they wouldn't budge ). Prices are very, very high. I would never return here personally.

BF brought me here for our anniversary dinner...may just have to keep him a bit longer.

I will not let the little blue tiffany's box on the table cloud my judgement of Prime :)

Since the BF 'knows' people, the chef came out and greeted us at what had to be the best table in the house, gorgeous views of the Bellagio fountain show.  The Chef then sent us out a Kobe treat he whipped up....oh my.  Kobe on top of Shitakes with a spicy black pepper mustard.  Oh baby!

After that we had the 'fondue', which was delicious but quirky as I didn't get a little pot of cheese but rather a eggroll looking - cheesy treat

BF got the surf n turf :)  Filet and Lobster, I just got the Filet.  Was cooked perfectly and so tasty.  I do recommend trying your steak naked before tasting all their great sauces - it is mighty good naked.

We tried the mushrooms and Spicy Mac&Cheese for our sides.  I fell in love with the Mac&Cheese and BF is now on a hunt for the recipe.

At the end we were surprised with a lava cake and homemade icecream...what a treat.

Would definitely come back - everything was delightful.  Food, Service and Atmosphere.
Absolutely amazing quality food. The tuna tar tar was exceptional . Pricey but worth it. Very classy and service was great as well.

My boyfriend and I came here for our anniversary dinner last Saturday. First off, the place is very busy so making a reservation in advance is a must! We were lucky to get in as the guest service manager at the hotel we were at (Encore) worked his magic to get us a table in such short notice. 

Prime is truly fine dining at its best, everything from the food to the ambiance was amazing. We both had the filet mignon, I had the 10 oz. and he had the 12 oz. For sides we ordered the mac & cheese, truffle mash potatoes and the chili broccoli....the truffle mash was heaven!! 

After dinner they even brought us out a desert with "Happy Anniversary" written on the plate with chocolate (compliments of the restaurant!) Needless to say, the staff went above and beyond to make our dinner extra special. This is a great place for a romantic dinner for sure, 5 stars!

Great service, food, and ambiance. They offered to hold c*&% when I went to the restroom. Request to have dessert & drinks after dinner on the terrace overlooking the fountains. Don't order the signature shellfish platter, $50pp. I didn't care for the butternut squash soup or artichoke salad. The braised veal was the best, then the veal porterhouse, then the lamb chops, then the filet mignon. I'm more of a rib-eye guy. The meats were tender and flavorful and liked the sauces. Dessert was good too. Liked the banana bread, chocolate cake, and cable cars. Did not care for the cheesecake so much.
And guys bring your purse, they have little tables where you can place them.

Best dishes I had: braised veal, scalloped potatoes with gruyere, truffled mash, lamb chops, veal porterhouse, cable car, banana bread
Amazing! First time we ate here. Would definitely come back. Excellent service and food came out fast.

My friend and I got the bone in steak along with some side broccoli mushroom Mac n cheese.  I order mine medium and my friends medium rare.  My meat of course came out meaty while my friends was chewy with tendons kind of like it was gamey.  Service was knowledgable.  Had a problem with my friend's bone in steak and talked to the manager about it.  It was my friend's birthday too as well so we made the best of it.

My gf & some good friends treated me to this place for my bday dinner!
Reservations were made for 5:30pm. Things came up so we pushed it back to 6pm; they had no problem with that and were nice about it. A friend ordered a ribeye, and about 10 minutes later asked if he could change his order to a porter steak. They allowed it and were also very nice about it. A+ for service here.
A steakhouse in the Bellagio... It was very nice & elegant, as one would expect from the sounds of it. We were seated in our own private room around a round table.
We ordered
- Porter steak: a friend & I ordered one. Delicious. Huge. Parts of my medium-rare steak were more so rare (a friend said it was still moo'ing), but I didn't mind. My friend's medium steak had parts that were more so medium-rare - he didn't mind this either. 
- Filet Mignon: My gf & her sister got this. I honestly thought it was the best piece of filet I've ever sank my teeth in.
- Ribeye: it comes in an 18oz and a 28oz. My friend is a big eater and he mentioned that he should've ordered the 28oz.
- Mac & cheese: AWESOME! I ordered it with my porter, and I thought it complemented my meal perfectly. Yummmmmmyyy.
- Asparagus: Fresh
- Broccoli: Fresh
All in all, the meal was a very memorable one for me. My steak & mac/cheese was delicious, and service was top notch. Very, very pricey. I do remember my porter steak being around 58$ on the menu, and the other steaks being of similar price. The side dishes were all around 10$ or more.
*One of my friends wanted prime rib in particular and at a place called "Prime" Steakhouse, you'd think they'd have it, right? Wrong.
**Advice: I'd suggest that you order ur steak to be cooked at one level higher than how you normally ask for it. Ex. If you like urs cooked at medium rare, ask for medium.

Okay, this is only my review of the bar within Prime.  So you've gotta take this with a grain of salt.  

It was eh.  The bartenders were rude and gave us a funky vibe.  My cousin and i wanted to stay and eat, but were so turned off by the atttitude of the bartenders.  

I'm sure we'll eat here some time.  Its unfortunately that our first impression was so bad.  Again, i'll eat here... but there is no sense of urgency and its not a priority for me to try this place. Sorry.
Typical steak house. Very overpriced but you pay for the scenery and service. Still a great date night. 18 dollars a martini.

10 years ago, I had a perfectly scrumptious dinner here.  I wanted a repeat on Dec. 16, 2015.  Didn't happen.  The steak I ordered to be pink inside, not runny red, turned out to be red in the WHOLE middle of the filet mignon.  I had to eat only the outside edges of the steak.  Even the $14 baked potato was not baked to complete softness.  Come on!!  Everything is overpriced, of course, as is expected in a tourist town, but please make the steak to order and bake your darn potatoes long enough.  Gee.  The servers were nice, but could have come by the table more often.  The restaurant was gracious enough to provide a special request I had made in advance for my disabled sister and I do thank them for that.
Excellent service coupled with amazing food. I had surf & turf; best ever. So much flavor,no need to dip the lobster in butter. 5 stars plus

I was in Vegas this weekend and had reservations at Prime for myself and 5 friends. We showed up on time and were sat immediately. Our server was knowledgeable and very attentive.

The wine list was 24 pages long! I had a glass of Rhumbauer Chardonnay ($15), an 8 oz. Filet ($40), a side caesar salad ($14), and potatoes gratin daphinois ($8). The filet was hands down the BEST STEAK I HAVE EVER HAD. It was tender, flavorful, and cooked to perfection. The caesar salad was a little lemony, but still very tasty. The potatoes were amazing. Basically potatoes au gratin, but with several different cheeses (Gruyere, Reggiano, etc.). However, one of my friends ordered a $150 Kobe ribeye, which was overcooked. He didn't send it back, but I'm positive if he had, it would have come out perfectly.

We had an amazing view of the Bellagio fountain show and we weren't even directly by a window! This will go down as one of the best meals of my life.

Great restaurant for a romantic dinner, especially if you can get a table overlooking the Bellagio fountains.  Great food, albeit pricey...very knowledgeable and attentive wait staff and friendly hostesses.  The restaurant is a little too dark which makes it hard to even read the menu.  Their seasonal key lime pie is sublime as are most of their desserts.

Very unimpressed with the service and food. They overprice just to be overpriced, and I know it's Vegas, and I'm fine dropping cash on a nice meal, but they could do a much better job. I got steak, potatoes and asparagus and have had equal quality at a much lesser restaurant. Our food took an extremely long time, which I can handle if they just let us know, but we got the 'it will just be 2 minutes' about 3 times for a total of 30 minutes (that was after we had already finished appetizers).  The waiter was condescending and snobby, which sucks because I was hoping for a nice night with friends. Was just very disappointed, I would recommend you try somewhere else. If you are going for the view, eat somewhere else and come back to watch the fountain.

Prime is a rare treat, it's not very often I get to eat a place of this caliber so I'm very fond of it. The restaurant itself is dimly lit, with super comfortable chairs, and a lovely view of the Bellagio fountains. They enforce the dress code pretty strict here, most places in Vegas will let you in wearing just about anything. This is a 1 or 2 page menu place, alot of expensive steaks, and sides you would expect in a high end steakhouse. The iced shell fish platter here is killer!  It's a quite beautiful piece. My wife had a bone in fillet which was fantastic. Don't ask for a wine recommendation from the waiter unless you won some serious cash  at the baccarat table. The pretzel bread served before dinner also blew mind.
beautiful restaurant, request outdoor seating when it is nice,  food was good, not great, service varies, sometimes it is great, last time was very average.

Considering that this is a fine dining restaurant, I felt disappointed by the service and quality. The service was sub-par, as the hostess let the door actually hit me and walked onward to the table, and we had to constantly wait to seek and ask for a waiter to refill our water. As for the food, for the first time, I did not want to completely devour a steak, and I LOVE steak. However, I do have to say their lamb is quite delectable. Despite the good lamb, I will have to say this is not a first-choice restaurant in Vegas for me.

I went to Vegas last weekend and found out my parents were going to be there as well and decided to mooch of them for an evening. Starving college student ya know? Well fortunately for me my parents and their friends were going to the Bellagio to eat at Prime and then see the show "O" which is amazing by the way! 

First of all, this restaurant oozes high class and high expectations. I enjoyed the ambiance and loved how you can view the water fountain show while enjoying your intense meal! 
Despite the fact that everyone at my table ordered the filet, I decided to go with the braised short ribs. 
Eh, they were okay, but my mom's filet was to die for. Thats why I only gave 4 stars. My meal was good but not as orgasmic as my expectations and but my momma's was perfect.
Dessert was fantastic. I got the chocolate cake! 
If you an afford it, GO!

Very elegant atmosphere, steakhouse dining at its finest with prime steak, seafood and lamb accompanied by fabulous sauces, sides and meticulously selected wines. Breathtaking view on the fountains of Bellagio from window tables. I savored a Porterhouse.

Prime at Bellagio, the last night in Vegas, heads above the meal we had at Gorden Ramsey Steak. Atmosphere, service, and food were all A1, and our server Phong was very attentive without being overbearing, we didn't have to ask for a single thing. Champagne, wine, french onion soup (the best I've ever had) and a shrimp cocktail with 4 huge shrimp, 2 filets perfectly cooked with a shared side, and a shared dessert, and the bill was $309 including a 20% tip. I would definitely return.

Service was very slow. Waited an hour for surf, turf and salmon. We almost left. Note:It was not crowded at all.

Food was ok, quality/taste did NOT match price. Ruth Chris does a better job. Hotel staff hyped the place up, don't believe their hype.

Pictures taken table side where great, the photographer was awesome, staff was nice. We won't be back, better places to eat than this. View of the fountains didn't make a difference.

This is a soft 3 stars. I was pretty underwhelmed by Prime. 

I ordered a medium 12 oz fillet and it was a lot closer to medium well than medium. Had it been a lesser establishment, I might have sent it back. I didn't want to cause a scene, though.

In terms of sides, I really enjoyed the herbed fries -- they were quite tasty and a good complement to the steak. Dito on the house steak sauce -- it was the best of the four sauces they presented.

Oddly enough, the highlight of the meal was the seafood platter appetizer -- huge crab legs and lots of lobster. Very tasty.

They should maybe rethink the name and change it to (sub) Prime or something -- a steak house should excel at steaks.

What a great romantic dinner.  Service was impeccable throughout, felt like we had 2 waiters taking care of any need from drinks to ordering. Food was delicious!  Salads are big enough to share with a blue cheese dressing that felt homemade.  My wife's filet was cooked a perfect medium rare.  She thoroughly enjoyed the 3 side sauces that come with all steaks.  I had the peppercorn steak which was awesome.  A ton of flavor and tasted like a char on the outside but warm and moist on the inside. The sides were also delicious and plentiful.  Truffle mashed is a must have while the Brussels sprouts were also good.  Great wine selection but best part was the availability of wine by the glass.  Although common at most steak houses their list had some great choices.  We had the 2008 silver oak which nice and smooth.  We were so full that dessert was not an option. However to put the cherry on top they brought out a chocolate soufflé with ice cream on a beautifully prepared plate. I had forgotten that I included my wife's birthday on the reservation.  Overall this dinner was perfect.  Yes this is not a cheap meal but you definitely get your money's worth!

Prime Steakhouse was awesome.  Went in this weekend with some friends.  I have heard a lot about this place, but it really is a top of the line steakhouse.  It is as pricy as they come, however, you get what you pay for.  I strongly recommend this to anyone with a taste for good steak.

I'm giving Prime 5 stars, even though I was very disappointed at first...

Either Prime or Bellagio restaurant reservations somehow lost my reservation I made for my anniversary night. I called that night to inform them we'd be 15-20 mins late, that's when I found out they weren't expecting us. So of course, they already gave away the window seats I requested. It was an understatement to say I was upset. I made these reservations weeks ago...

However, when we arrived, the prime windows seat for 2 people were taken, but there was one still left, and they sat us there. Even though for some reason, the traditional water show did not go off, we were delighted to get the table with the view.

Dinner was phenomenal. From the rib eye to the chocolate cake at the end, it was great. The restaurant is beautiful. Our server, Beau, was attentive, efficient, and friendly, ending our dinner with a complimentary dessert to congratulate us on our anniversary. 

A definitely must...
Thank you, Prime Steakhouse staff!

We had dinner at Prime Monday night, St Patricks Day to celebrate our Anniversary. We both ordered the dry aged prime rib steak, which was excellent. Started with squash soup and Seared Foie Gras both were good. The ambiance is fantastic with the Bellagio surroundings and the memorizing fountain... stunning. It is very pricy, but inline with higher-end Las Vegas showcase restaurants.  

So the negatives: I started the meal by ordering a dirty martini with blue cheese stuffed olives, it was very good. The problem is they started slamming down plates as soon as the drink was served.  I hardly had time for a few sips before the super fast service started.  It was Go Go speed racer style service. It felt very rushed. The rushed plating and service made the experience feel very touristy. The waiter forgot our wine order, we had to remind him. This seems especially bad for a fine steak house to fail to service up the ordered wine with the main course., a fat juice steak, that begs for a big red wine. I would assign most of our negative experience at the hands of the waiter... he seemed distracted and lacked the finer art of high quality service.

I give this place 5 stars. It was the best filet I've ever had. I ordered it rare and it came out perfectly. However, my fiance had the filet also and ordered it medium rare. It arrived way overcooked and had to be sent back. The second attempt was only slightly better. The server was overly gracious and happy to accommodate us. However, I will have to subtract one star because my fiance did not like his filet as much as I did. The sides were standard for high end steakhouses, and the creamed spinach was quite good. The decor and touches are top notch.  You can also view the Bellagio fountains from the side windows. Overall, a great place for a special, romantic occasion.

I had one of my best dining experiences in Las Vegas at Ptime. The food was excellent and I'll never forget the truffled potatoes, even if they were "just" the side order.

Discreet but attentive service, perfect location with a grand view of the Bellagio fountains, a large wine list gives me many reasons to come back next time I'm in Vegas.

Great steakhouse in Las Vegas. Make your reservation early and request a seat by the windows to see the water show.  The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because it's tacky to have a Photographer come around, take your photo during dinner and then haggle you to buy the photo. That seems more appropriate for an amusement park than for Bellagio's steakhouse.

I have had the pleasure of eating at Prime several times and each time it just gets better.
The staff is friendly, knowledgeable and fast.  
The food is outstanding!  I have never had steak like Prime's before, nor have I ever been able to find anything that comes close.
My last visit I had the Coconut Souffle after it was suggested by a friend.  I'm someone who doesn't like coconut, but this was one of the best desserts I have ever had.
The prices are high, but it is totally worth it.  I am more then happy to put in the extra overtime at work just so I can go to Prime when I'm in Vegas.

We went for a company dinner and all of us ordered different cuts. There have been occasions where one of the steak weren't cooked properly but all 5 of our steaks were cooked medium-well when we all asked for medium-rare. 

For such a high end and pricier place than other better steakhouses (SW, Gordon Ramsey, Craftsteak) I wouldn't expect something like this. Our waiter said that's once you cut closer to the bone it'll be med-rare but we cut the med-well steak to show him but he didn't really offer anything to compensate us. The sides were all really salty and the desserts were nothing special.

If you want a good meal go to Gordon Ramsey or Craftsteak.

I went with my husband  to prime on July 4th. We were seating on the patio and had a spectacular view of the bellagio fountains! The steak was excellent and we had great service. Would definitely recommend for a romantic date night spot!

- Call ahead at least a day or two (for a weeknight) prob a week or two for weekends
- Ask for a lake view
- Dress code: no shorts, nice jeans ok, collared shirts
-Estimate for two people with 4 alcoholic drinks $260
-The bigger the party the further away they seat u from the windows.
- And DON'T stuff your self with bread (i know, I know it's my weakness too)

I called to make my reservations and said it was my B-day ( i lied.) I just REALLY wanted a nice table with a lake view. And it totally worked. My BF and i got the coolest lil booth facing the lake. I don't really care for meat. But Holy @#$%! The Filet Mignon was SOOOOO good and the Yukon mashed potatoes and creamed spinach purrrrfecto!. 
I even got a comp'd dessert (which I'm ok with cuz i lost big at the table at the Bellagio.)   The service was as classy as it gets. Dare i say this was the best meal i've ever had.  Meow.
