I've only been to Vegas maybe twice since I've turned 21. In those few visits, I made it a point to try at least a couple of top-rated restaurants, Prime Steakhouse included. This dinner was specifically in honor of my boyfriend's best friend's 40th birthday. We requested window seating and were luckily seated at a table that gave us a front-row view of the water show at the Bellagio. 

Bacon-wrapped shrimp - plump, juicy and accompanied by a sweet, delicate passion fruit mustard and honey.

Foie gras dumplings - musty taste of liver slightly masked by thickness of the wrap and sweetness of figs.

Truffled mashed potatoes - haven't experienced a failed execution of this dish at any restaurant.

Filet mignon - one of the juiciest, well-seasoned cuts of filet I've ever had, even compared to Ruth's Chris.

Bone-in ribeye - had a bite since it was my boyfriend's steak, but tender and perfectly seared.

Glazed market mushrooms - an excellent side to any steak meal.

I could do without the small services of shishito peppers as they did not add much value to my meal. 

Overall, one of the top steakhouses to which I have been!

I don't even know where to begin w/ this place.

First of all, it's beautiful.  Second, the staff is soooo nice - and not fake nice - like genuinely "I like my job" nice.

But I digress.

We ordered some Malbec (yeah, I know) to start.  
We had the gruyere fritters (WTF!!), parmesan crusted chicken (which was gigantic, btw), and a filet and by the end of the meal, if I'd had pants on, they would have burst.  Literally.  Luckily I had on a dress, so I was safe.

They brought out a chocolate lava cake and vanilla ice cream w/ a candle on it for my birthday (YAY ME!), and which I devoured in about 30 seconds flat.

I have nothing bad to say about this place.  
Except for maybe enforce your dress code.  Who let the douchebag w/ a tee shirt and ratty jeans in?

Totally not worth the price.  Typical filet - nothing special.  Creamed spinach and potatoes au gratin - nothing special.  Service - terrible.  OK, to be fair, OUR server was terrible.  We were seated and it took him 20 minutes to come take our order.  And by then a table of 15 was being seated in a private room near us, and our waiter disappeared at that point.  I guess he realized that better service to a table of 15 would bring him a bigger tip than from  a table for two.  What a joke.  So, while we waited for our meal, we watched as the private party's order of drinks and then appetizers arrived first.  We finally got our steaks, and after our meal we waited for 10 minutes before our waiter showed up again - at which time we decided to skip dessert and just get the bill.

STEAK lovers paradise!

this place was PERFECT...I loved everything about it...the decor totally screams steakhouse and the food was well worth the price! Expensive to say the least, but didn't expect any less from a steakhouse inside the Bellagio! 

Celebrated a birthday there. It's great for intimate dates or if you are looking to make an impression on your significant other! The food was brought out on a cart all fancy and covered in silverware! The manager actually came to cut our steaks for us to make sure it was cooked to our liking! After the fabulous dinner they escorted us to the patio for dessert compliments of the restaurant for the birthday we were celebrating. The patio was sooooo nice..we ate dessert over looking the Bellagio fountains at sunset so the fountains were lit up and sooo pretty! It is a beautiful restaurant and I totally recommend taking your guy/girl for a date there if visiting Vegas with someone!

If you're looking for authentic fine dining, look no further. Dress up. The Filet Mignon is the closest thing to perfect. Excellent presentation that lives up to its elegance. Probably one of the best, if not the best steak restaurants in Vegas. Just GO! You can't go wrong.

It was good but not great. Let me start by saying we do not normally spend $300 for the two of us to have dinner. Steak, a bottle of wine, and a couple of sides.  The best I could compare it to was a recent dinner at Ruth's Chris which was under $200 and we enjoyed much more. However, this is not Ruth's. It's nicer in most ways.  The environment is very nice. If you get a window table you get awesome views of the Bellagio water show. Our table was ready without a wait which was nice.  Service is good but we felt rushed and had to slow things down a couple times. For that much money I don't want to feel rushed.  So, again we don't normally eat fancy. We are Chili's and Chipotle type people so take that in to account. To us this meal simply wasn't worth the cost. I would rather eat 50 meals at Chipotle, LOL!  Seriously though, if you want a very nice atmosphere, good service, and good food this is a good spot.  If you want to impress your date bring her here!  I just don't think it's worth the cost to ME. Oh ya, I had the tomato salad and it was especially good. Unique, large and VERY good. It stuck out more than anything else we had. Otherwise just good.

My husband and I went here for dinner after our wedding and were so impressed! we started with the shrimp cocktail, and the shrimp were massive! The cocktail sauce was on the spicy side, but still so delish. We both fell in love with the crispy fingerling potatoes...they were incredible, made with a bacon-onion marmalade and just SO GOOD. we both ordered the filet mignon as our main dish and they were cooked to perfection. I order mine medium rare and let me tell you, it was fabulous. the sauces the steaks come with were all tasty, but our favorite was the soy-rice wine sauce. it was unreal. I can't say enough good things about this place. the food was to die for, the service was fantastic, ambiance was incredible...I could not recommend this place more!

Showed up at this nearly EMPTY restaurant shortly after six on 7/7/2016, without a reservation and was given a table in hot hot outside, not in direct viewing of the water, even though those tables were available (those tables are apparently for the "beautiful people" who had not yet arrived) practically immediately.  Was given the wine list and menu and our overbearing waiter wanted to get my wine order even before i was able to look at the menu or hear if they had any specials.  I asked if there were any wines on special as the wines on the list are over-pricey.  He said no and that i should consider wines by the glass or half bottles.  The 2012 Husic Estate Cabernet Sauvignon was listed at $65 per glass. Now, i don't know how much wine is in the glass, i suspect NOT MUCH, but since the bottle retails for less than $100 and the restaurant likely got the bottle for around $60, i'd say that was serious gouging.  Suffice it to say that the wait staff was so haughty, snooty, overbearing and money-grubbing, that we opted to JUST LEAVE and NOT get any of the overpriced items on the menus.  We went to Olives, also at Bellagio, and were taken care of by a wonderful Chris instead.

Prime has the winning combination which is great food in a scenic location.

The location feels very secluded and separate from the chaos of the strip. The restaurant is on the lower level along the fountains. We made a reservation and were able to get a table next to one of the large windows in front of the fountains. The table was even set so that my husband and I were both facing the beautiful view. 

The feel of the restaurant is swanky and regal, but without being stiff and pretentious. The design of the restaurant was very appealing. 

Our service was good as you'd hope it would be in a restaurant like this. Our waiter insisted on taking photos of my husband and I when he saw me doing my Yelp thing. The waiter and server were never far, but not in a hovering manner. 

Before coming here I read so many articles talking this restaurant up and the food lived up to the hype. I had the 10 ounce Filet Mignon and my husband had the 14 ounce Peppercorn-Crusted New York Strip. We shared the Gratin Dauphinois. 

The Filet Mignon was perfectly prepared, tender and flavorful. The 10 ounces was more than enough meat. The Peppercorn-Crusted New York Strip's peppercorn crust was delicious and seasoned well. This steak was also well prepared and flavorful. The Gratin Dauphinois was a sizeable portion for two. There was plenty of cheese sauce in the dish and broiled on top. Delicious.

One of the unique things about this steakhouse is that they bring out three steak sauces. The sauces offered were Soy-Rice Wine, Bearnaise, and Peppercorn. I loved all three and enjoyed trying them on both of the steaks. The meats didn't need sauce, but I always love a good sauce.

We finished the meal by splitting the Apple Pie with Maple Ice Cream. It arrived bubbling and hot. This appears to be a dish that is freshly prepared with each order.I loved the flavor of the apple pie and the delicious maple ice cream on top.

Having been to a few of the steakhouses now I would rate this among some of the best. The food is great, but the view and puts it over the top.

It was my 30th birthday and I wanted to go somewhere out of or norm and figured after wanting to go here many vacations before FINALLY splurged to eat here, but unfortunately the hype fell very short!

We made reservations for 5:00 and I was disappointed there was no confirmation call or e-mail to say hey your reservation is booked, etc. I had to call and I guess call me crazy, but it's that extra little touch that at least makes you feel special.

On a bright note, my wife and I did get to sit outside on the patio in the nearest table facing the fountain which was an experience to say the very least. It really felt VIP like to sit that close to the fountain and with a sun burn getting the mist from the fountain show upon its completion was an added bonus.

Collectively we had the same problem with our steaks. We both ordered the filet mignon medium and it was more of a how to cook steak diagram. The ends were burnt, the middle was far from medium, and that just didn't cause for a great feeling. We also ordered crab mashed potatoes which were way too buttery and the crunchy potatoes which certainly lived up to that, but that's NOT a good thing. It was too crisp on the outside and mashed in the middle, but the taste honestly just wasn't there.

The worst feeling overall was hearing my wife feel like she didn't belong there. It seemed from the very beginning the staff felt that as well and displayed that all through the meal. It seemed they looked down on us and my wife even said one of them ran to our table after we left just to make sure we paid. REALLY? If I was in the right mindset I would have dealt with that, but honestly Karma is a you know what.

Truth be told they can continue to prepare sub par side orders and wow with a chef who clearly didn't know a medium prepared steak without us. Now drench your house made steak sauce in that Prime!

I have eaten here about 8 times and I can safely say this is the best steakhouse that I have been to. I have also eaten at the neighboring Picasso which is great but doesn't come close to Prime(unless you are talking about the art on the wall). While not cheap (and not meant to be), Prime is flawless in terms of food, atmosphere, service, and has a comprehensive wine list and knowledgable sommeliers.
While I am not a fan of ordering massive seafood platters where the restaurant gets huge margins on serving you a couple meager crustaceans on a heaping bowl of ice, I must say Prime's shrimp cocktail and Florida stone crab (when in season) are as good as it gets. Their accompanying sauces are also phenomenal.
The steaks are nothing short of perfect. I usually go with a small 8 oz. filet which is cooked rare plus and is very dense yet tender and consistent throughout. Their steak sauces are unparalleled. My personal favorite is the soy rice wine sauce... simply amazing. Their sides are solid - I keep it simple with mashed potatoes and asparagus.
I have read some reviews of Mastro's in Bevelry Hills which gets 4-5 stars per review. I have eaten @ Mastro's twice and was not excited by my meal either time. In my opinion I would eat @ Prime any day over Mastro's and I could not recommend a finer steakhouse in Vegas.

We ate at prime almost a year ago, and I forgot to leave a review. Very large portions, very accommodating and awesome staff, and one of the best meals we've ever eaten in our lives. It was pricey, but definitely was a big part of our amazing Las Vegas experience.

Not impressed at all!  Specifically made reservations here to celebrate a special occasion for a friend more than 3 months ahead of our stay.  Asked for fountain view seating, outdoors if possible, and asked  for a special dessert item.  We did indeed have a fountain view, in the corner with another couple (not with our party) practically sitting on top of us, with my back to the view.  The outdoor area was open but that request was not noted on our reservation in their book (although it was listed on my email confirmation) and was full.  The food itself was of high quality, cooked to perfection, and very tasty in and of itself, but ruined by bitter sauces.  I could not finish my sea bass as the sauce was literally making me feel sick.  My guest enjoyed his steak but again, the sauce garnishing the plate left a lot to be desired and enough of it saturated his filet that he could not enjoy it nearly as much as he should have.  The dessert item was available and they did bring out a petit tray of complimentary truffles with a candle for my friend, which was appreciated.  Overall though, not worth our time or money.
Everything about this place is first class. Sure, you will pay for it but it's worth it to experience royalty on special occasions.

Prime is a wonderful example of perfect service, matched with a lovely setting and great food. 
Our reservation ran over a half hour late but having a drink at the bar with a great bartender appeased the situation. 
If possible, request a lakeside table as it is the best view to watch the Bellagio fountain show. 
The steaks are of the best quality and all of the appetizers are excellent. I suggest ordering a few to share with the table. The oysters were perfect (I understand the irony of seafood in the desert but it's that good). 
Look around and see the other diners enjoying every last morsel and once you eat a meal there, you too will understand. Definitely plan ahead and make a reservation as it is always packed.

Not impressed.  While the food was delicious, the waitstaff was below par.  Our waiters were also serving a group of ten as well as another good size table and a table of two.  They were more concerned with the larger tables, which of course they get an automatic gratuity.   They stopped by the smaller tables just twice.  A buser filled our waters repeatedly but trying to get any other drinks was pretty much well pointless.  The atmosphere is beautiful and romantic but most tables do not have a view of the fountains which is a shame. They also seem to rush out the smaller tables as well.  We were done under an hour.  Not much time to sit and enjoy, seemed more of eat and get out.  It could have been our waitstaff but I just was not impressed.

Prime Indeed.

Name really says it all.  Located in Bellagio, we asked the concierge to recommended  a dinner place inside and she directed us to this magnificent restaurant.

Prime is located inside and front of the hotel next to the famous water fountain.  Upon going down the escalator to the restaurant, we immediately saw the upscale and classy vibe of the place.  The host was able to seat us on a Saturday evening without a reservation.  Husband and I felt a little under dressed for the establishment and were lucky that they still seated us.

We both ordered the bone-in ribeye, shared creamed spinach and sauteed mushroom sides.  The food came out to be amazing!  Steak was juicy and flavorful.  It came with three pairing sauces and my favorite was the red wine~ It was a yummy!  Portion was so big that we both only ate half of our steak.  

Although we didn't sit near the window with the fountain view,  I was still able to see the spectacle.  It was so grand that each time the finale of the fountain erupts, it lit the window area with bright mellow yellow and it was gorgeous.

Recommended: Dates. Business,  Engagement location, Special Night out.

Definitely call for reservation and request a window seat.
Always have had good experiences at Prime.  They have high quality meats and good service.

A beautifully furnished steakhouse with amazing ambience; with gorgeous drapes that hug the tall windows outside of which you can see the Bellagio water fountain show at dinner time, perfect table settings, excellent menu selections of not only steaks but also seafood and chicken entree choices, Prime is THE steakhouse to be in Vegas to celebrate a special occasion.  
This is the spot where you can feel like a real adult who's "arrived", ready to plot your genius plans with your comrades right before (or after) you conquer the world. While there to celebrate a friend's birthday, I felt that Prime is one of the classiest places to dine, truly a creme de la creme place to celebrate any special occasion. We were treated superbly well by our server who was charming and gave sound advice as to what wines to complement with the types of entrees we planned to have as well the types of side dishes that would work best with the entrees.  
Another high point was the professional photographer Grace walked among the tables offering to take (and sell framed) photographs of the patrons, and I'm so happy we took her up on the offer as her control of the lighting effects on camera, the way she was able to "direct" us and take the photos made us 5 already beautiful women look even better in the photos that turned out.  Her service/product provided a wonderful keepsake for all of us from this special birthday occasion.
In hindsight, although I loved my 14-oz New York steak (medium well is perfect) and its soy-ginger reduction, 14-oz was definitely WAY too big for me (eyes bigger than stomach, what can I say :-).  If you are 5'6" woman like me who usually can barely finish a 8- or 10-oz steak, I'd stick to the 8-10 oz steak selections, not to mention the super yummy sides will take up room in the belly too.
Watch out for the very expensive wines (by the glass, I ordered a $40/glass Cab to go with my entree). The wine was delicious but they are definitely on the premium price side even by the glass.  Ask for corkage fee if you can bring your own wine.
Overall, a beautiful place to dine with excellent food and service.  Would love to go back again.

Took my man for his 33rd birthday dinner and this place did not disappoint. I made a last min reservation by phone 4 hrs before going but only because it was a Monday night and we didn't expect it to be too busy. The place closed at 10pm that night and I was able to get a reservation for 2 at 9:30pm, the hostess had mentioned that they were actually busy for a Monday night. The moment you step foot into the restaurant the light is a lot dimmer, and to the right is the restaurant Bar top with about 8-10 stools and to the left the hostess stand. The restaurant decor was fancy with lots of paintings on the walls and pretty blue ceiling to floor curtains that are pinned to the walls. Once we were seated the waiter came to the table with menus and gave us a few recommendations. My bf ordered the bone in ribeye and I ordered filet mignon, they were absolutely delicious! Cooked perfectly on the outside but yet juicy and tender on the inside. Neither were overly seasoned! For our sides we ordered the Mac and cheese, gooey and creamy and has to be one of the best I've had, and the creamed spinach. The creamed spinach wasn't amazing, was a little bland but ok since it was a healthier choice. They do start you off with sourdough and raisin bread with butter in the beginning and both were delicious! We each got a cocktail, one steak each and two sides to share and the bill came out to 220.00 without tip. It was well worth it and more importantly, worth it to see my boyfriend satisfied. We would definitely come here again!

Disappointed in this restaurant sad to say. We had a party of 9 and arrived at 6 pm on a Saturday. Seated promptly for our reservation. Server seemed a little snooty and when asked to customize a salad basically a Caesar with a different dressing seemed very put off. The onion soup was tasty but lukewarm.  Our filets were requested medium but came out undercooked. The fries and onion rings that came out at the same time were cold. Once our steaks returned 5 minutes later  they were cooked appropriately and were very tender and well seasoned. The sever rarely checked on the table. The sauces served with the steaks were very good. If we had not been with a large party I would have sent back our accompaniments to have them at the proper temperature but didn't want to delay the table. Overall a disappointing experience for a highly rated restaurant with a high ticket price.

The patio dining was spectacular. You are treated to a semi-private viewing of the legendary Bellagio fountain every half hour while you dine. 

The food was spectacular, albeit expensive. The filet was thick and cooked impeccably. Although it was well seasoned and stood on its own, you are provided three seperate sauces (Bernaise, peppercorn and a ginger/soy) to enhace it if you so choose.

The service was helpful and professional as expected. It was a bit of a dissapointment however to be told of an intriguing truffle (flown in that day from Australia) risotto special and then being informed 5 minutes later that it had sold out.

The patio dining is what pushed this experience over the top and made it worth the considerable expense of about $150pp with tip and drinks.

My colleagues and I went here to celebrate the end of a successful conference and this was the perfect place to do that at. We could all agree it was a delicious dining experience!

Our group started with the seafood tower as an appetizer and we were all going ga-ga over it. The crab legs, lobster, shrimp, and oysters were all fantastic. FYI, you can choose how many people you want to order it for because it does come with a ton of seafood. For example, our group size was 12 people but we only ordered the seafood platter for 5 and it was still enough for all of us. 

My favorite dish of the entire night was surprisingly the Market Tomatoes which contained burrata cheese, arugula, balsamic vinegar & basil. This was truly heavenly. I've already been craving it multiple times. 

For my entree, a colleague and I shared the Dry Aged Bone-In Ribeye. This was wonderful and cooked to perfection - ordered medium. 

Dessert was also delectable, order the donuts or bread pudding. You won't be disappointed. Wow, now I'm wanting to relive that meal over again. Go enjoy it for yourself!

The number one romantic spot in Las Vegas hands down. Especially if you get to sit on the patio or by a window. Beautiful views of the fountains. Husband thinks this place has the best steaks. no other restaurants steaks can compare to Primes. The Lobster is delicious & Huge. Definitely worth the $250.00 for two people. We will definitely be back!

This place has an awesome steak and ahi tuna! But sad to say THEY GAVE MY PARTY  a HORRIBLE service! my experince with prime was 7 years ago and i couldnt shake off the horrible memory.. We were celebrating for my friend who was leaving for the navy, i give the ambiance a 4 star and the food a 4 star. everything was pricey but worth every bite. The thing i did not like most was the service! Just because our party was young and we did not order bottle service the waiter decided to ignore us! After we left the restaurant we approaced the person in charge and told them how horrible the service was. all he said was " what can i do to make it right" , like all he cared about was giving us comps thinking we were these snooty little rich kids who just wanted to complain. All we said was NOTHING we just wanted to inform you, because our intentions was not to get anything for free we just wanted to inform the person in charge of the horrible waiter... Would I dine again at PRIME? perhaps i really did enjoy their food and Prime Patio is to die for giving you an awesome view of the fountains as you sip on your coffee..

I'm not afraid to pay up for a great steak. For the nosebleed-high prices they're charging here (the filet was listed at $62 bucks...I had the porterhouse which was less??) this should be one of the best steak experiences you'll ever have. It's nowhere close. In fact, it wasn't even in my top 50. Just another Las Vegas corporate-restaurant shaking tourists down for as much money as possible. 

Skip it.

Great steakhouse! Nice and friendly staff. It was an anniversary dinner, and everything was perfect! A nice spot near the fountain view windows, a delicious steak, and a nice anniversary dessert from the restaurant. My only reason for not giving it 5 stars is that I made reservations 3 weeks in advance and still had to wait to be seated. Also the steak knives were dull, I ended up using my fork to cut my steak, but that shows how tender and delicious the steak was. Great job on this one guys!

My wife and I ate here a few years ago, while staying at the Bellagio. It's a classic Prime steakhouse that's very luxuriously decorated.

The steaks are all prepared correctly, have good marbling, and are very tasty!

We tried to Beef Tartar for an appetizer and thought it was amazing. The mixture of the chilled beef, sauce, pepper and capers made for a very yummy dish. My wife typically orders her steak 'Medium' and even she loved it!

This is one of the Best Steakhouses I have ever been to.  I had the aged ribeye and tried the in bone File minion which was beyond words, They were both excellent.  The ambiance is also good so I definitely recommend it to anyone who wants a great steak...

This restaurant is incredible! We made a Friday night reservation a month in advance and requested a patio table overlooking the Bellagio fountains. I knew it was a long shot but I figured it couldn't hurt to request it. When we arrived they did have a patio table for us and it was an amazing experience. They start you off with a bread basket that has this delicious pretzel bread. It is so good! We had the bacon wrapped shrimp appetizer and they were fantastic. But the best part of my meal was the truffle mashed potatoes! Best mashed potatoes of my life hands down! They were out of this world! I also got the New York Steak and it was very good. The service was wonderful and the view from the patio watching the fountain show was something I will never forget. Can't wait to come back on our next trip to Vegas!

This is the definitely in the top 3 meals i have ever eaten in my life. The gf took me here for my birth day on nov 28 and it was amazing. We got a table next to the window of the water fountain show on the strip. We started with cocktails margarita, and some remy martin in a snifter(super nice to have for dinner). We ordered the steak tartare with carpaccio. Alli have to say is order it and you won't regret it ! Next was the tomatoe and mozarella with a side of pesto salad wich was simply amazing. The main course was the 18 oz cut rib eye and she had the rack of lamb both were cooked to perfection and quickly finished. The restraunt knew it was my birthday so they brought out a birthday cake that i didn't even want to eat it was prepped so good. All i have to end it with is go and eat there and i guarantee you won't leave dissapointed. !

What an amazing experience.  The service is top notch, the view is astounding overlooking the Bellagio Water Show, and the food is par excellence.  My family went for dinner on Christmas Eve and everything was just so well done it is difficult to express just how good it was.  Firstly the bread that comes is exquisite, there is a compilation of breads with a chive salt and butter and the rolls are hot and fresh and perfect.  The salads seemed steep for a side salad but in reality, they are nearly a full meal in themselves and really we did not need a salad and dinner but we did not realize it would be so big.  I had the mixed fall vegetable salad and it came with a whole wheel of goat chevre with delicate vegetables in a vinaigrette.  My father  had the Caesar Salad and Butternut squash soup which were dynamite.  My mother had a truffle salad and it was just a touch woodsy for my taste.  Where this place really shines though is the steak, oh the glorious steak.  I had the mammoth 18 oz bone in ribeye cooked medium rare.  For $66 it was an absolute bargain.  The meat was so flavorful and tender and perfectly cooked, no gristle and perfect melt in your mouth fat.  My father went one bigger and had the 28oz steak and even though he had it cooked to well done it was still tender and juicy.  My mother had the Short rib which was a bit over salty but still really good and sweet.  The side dishes were also very good, the Brussel sprouts are well worth getting and the gnocchi is so soft and pillowy they are truly heavenly. We also had the macaroni and cheese which was standard fare but good and the potatoes dauphanoise which were just a bit dry and over done.  
In all though for the service and truly reasonable price for the amazing meal that you get this place is well worth a visit for some special occasion, indeed I wish that I was rich enough to eat here every night I don't think I could get tired of all of the truly exceptional food and atmosphere that this place provides.

My husband and I were celebrating our first anniversary and doing dinner and a show. I looked up Open Table reservation availability, and the place seemed to be booked up from 5:45 to 8:30, which overlapped with our show, so I made our reservation for an early dinner at 5:30. I just want to note that throughout dinner, the place was only half full, so I don't know why Open Table said it was booked up. Was it to promote exclusivity? I don't know.

Anyway, I had written in our reservation that a view of the fountains would be appreciated. The first table we were escorted to was against the wall and in a corner with a slight view. It was an OK spot, but considering that pretty much every other table was empty with no one in sight, we requested to be seated more centrally at the window. Our request was met with some trepidation as apparently that particular table was booked. Again, half-full restaurant at 5:30. It still confuses me. Anyway, finally we were moved.

We were greeted by...a sommelier? A waiter? I'm not sure. Leaning towards waiter. He was not particularly friendly. When my husband asked for a recommendation, he was kind of gruff and short. Not the best sell. He gave us the wine list and we ordered two drinks (lemon drop for me,wine for husband). After this, he disappeared, and another waiter (Asian, bald head) took over in his place. Maybe the first waiter was covering for this one? In any case, neither of them introduced themselves. In fact, in the ten minutes between them we looked at our menus and then the second guy showed up. His greeting was, "ready to order"? In most places, this would be really no big deal. But if you're a steak house who prides yourself on service and class, introductions should always be made. Not to mention you're in the Bellagio and it's not even particularly busy.

We ordered. Went with truffled mashed potatoes and a tomato salad with burrata cheese, filet mignon for me and rib eye for my husband. We wanted to also try the macaroni and cheese but the waiter was particularly judgmental about this, telling us everything would be more than enough. I'm sorry, but if the waiter is not asked this particular question, they should not comment. This is not a tapas place and maybe we wanted to sample a little of everything? Especially if people note it should be tasted. I was really turned off by this. Personally, I didn't eat all day so that I could indulge in everything that I wanted. He kind of made the decision for me when reciting back what we ordered.  I was incredibly uncomfortable and felt judged for my appetite, so I didn't put up a fight and told my husband to keep quiet as well. I've been to many fine steakhouses and this has NEVER happened before. 

The food is what deserved the stars, but the service negated a lot of points. The truffle potatoes are worthy of all the praise. The salad was delicious. My steak was a little red for my liking, even at medium rare, but still yummy. I liked that the steak came with three sauces to sample, and really enjoyed the house speciality sauce. It was a bit of a soy sauce Asian blend. My husband also enjoyed his steak. Interestingly, I noted that a woman to my left got the same steak, but the same waiter offered to...cut it up for her? And to my right, the first waiter who was so gruff with us, was practically kvelling and gossiping with the two older ladies next to us.  Did we look like degenerates? Um, answer is no. I had on a beautiful dress and my husband a beautiful Italian suit. But nevertheless, it seemed like we were targeted as...not big spenders? Not worthy of attentiveness? Who knows.

The only star at that restaurant is the waiter that comes around and refills the water glasses and removes the dishes. He was friendly and chatty and we would have rather tipped him 20% than the guy we did.

At the end of the meal, we were given a free dessert in celebration of our anniversary. It was ok. More chocolate cursive letters than dessert. But hey, it was free. This pleasantness was again negated by having to wait for the check for 40 minutes. Once the waiter had collected our credit card and finally come back, he tried to hand it to me. The name on the credit card is clearly one for a man.  It exemplifies the lack of polish here, as at any other fine restaurant, the credit card would be handed back by name to the person who possesses it (and it's pretty easy to tell who did between the two of us and similarly so if you note the person handing it off to you before you swipe it). Even places like TGI Friday's do this. 

Anyway, I would never come back to this style over substance establishment even if the truffle potatoes are at the top of my favorite foods to eat in Vegas. There are better places to dine. Even in my hometown of Philadelphia, Del Frisco's outclasses this place by miles!

Love this place! Great atmosphere great views of the fountain. .  And though this is a steak house,  we both had the Ahi Tuna and it was cooked perfectly to a melt in your mouth perfection. .

Will return and try the sea bass, it looked amazing!

Decor: 
Top notch - fancy french, very clean & classy

Service: 
A serious professional wait staff.  I have a rule: if the waiter is older than my dad the food is going to be awesome!  They also sat us window seat to have an amazing view of the Bellagio fountain show.

Food: 
WOW!  This is what I would envision as a last meal type of place!  Yes, really it was that good. 

Price:
Be ready to drop 300.00 for a really nice meal for two people.

I had reservations for 7PM.  I was promised a table overlooking the fountains.  My party and I arrived a little before 7 and the place was packed, the bar was overflowing with people.  I checked in with the hostess and was told it'll be a moment while they set up our table.  Ten minutes later she tells me that there are no tables available overlooking the fountains.  I said it fine, just seat us anywhere.  Finally, thirty minutes later we were finally seated at some cramped up table next to the restrooms.  How lovely. 

Service was slow.  Food was whatever.  My brother ordered the special surf and turf.  Lobster was way rubbery and dry.  His steak was alright.  I ordered the special kobe beef plate.  It had 3 oz of each rib eye, filet mignon, and boneless sirloin.  A total of 9 oz of kobe for $240.  It was the most expensive plate I ever ordered.  And sadly I wasn't really that impressed by the food.  I had ordered them medium and the filet was beyond well done.  Sigh.  I had nothing to say about our sides and starters.  The wine we ordered was the only good thing about the meal.  I usually am a big fan of dessert but I was so thrown off by the food that I had to skip dessert.  

For our party of four, our bill ran out to a little over $600.  Thank God it was comped by the hotel (thanks to my mom's love of the slot machines), otherwise I would have had to make a run for it. I suggest dining at Michael Mina or Picasso when at the Bellagio.  Prime Steakhouse is for old folks with limited taste and too much time and too much money on their hands.  I feel a little bad saying that, especially since it seems like so many other people on Yelp enjoyed this place.

I haven't been to prime in a few years with the huge selection of steak houses in vegas and we went last night with some people staying at the Bellagio and it was excellent!  All the food was great the the few steaks we had and the tuna and all the sides were all great.  The only reason i'm not giving this place a 5 is that they have an old school dress code requiring pants and my father in law had to get a "loaner pair" from them.  As long as you wear pants, this place is great!!!

Will you still love me
When I'm no longer young and beautiful?
Will you still love me
When I got nothing but my aching soul?
I know you will, I know you will at PRIME STEAKHOUSE! - Lana Del Rey (young and beautiful)

Honestly if I wasn't able to secure an outdoor patio table, I wouldn't have eaten here. The view was a very big draw for us so I'm happy it worked out.

Pros:
-as expected, the view is spectacular
-it's not as hot as you think, the slight breeze from the water helps
-the bread and caesar salad was very good
-great picture opportunities

Cons:
-they only had one main server (with many sous servers) to take orders and give out the checks for the entire patio area of like 9 tables (we had 2 hours set aside for dinner before the show and we ended up being a little late)
-if you don't order a steak here, don't expect much as the seafood is just average here
-dress code somewhat enforced, might be inconvenient for people walking around in the crazy summer heat all day wearing shorts

Overall, I did have a good time with a few hiccups in terms of service but my steak + foie gras was good so I was happy. It's a good experience to try once but with so many steakhouses in LV, this is a one and done for me.
BEST STEAK I'VE EVER HAD. EVER. It was better than MGM grand mansion and it doesn't usually get better than that.

While I have yet to dine at SW Steak at our hotel, Encore, I feel confident in saying that this is steak and steakhouse the way that it should be done. Never have I been to a restaurant that nailed down both ambiance, service, and steak so well. The restaurant is gorgeous, and as picky as I am, I have ZERO complaints about anything. I love that they still require jackets, and bonus points for COMFY seating! The sauces only compliment what is already a perfect steak, and this place has only cemented my love for chef Jean Georges Vongerichten. If I could levy one criticism about this place, it is the fact that they deserve two michelin stars and they have none, which is the fault of the Michelin guide, not this superb dining jewel.

Went to Prime for my bday when in Vegas. I gotta say the food was good but the waiter was one of the worse i have ever seen. I was really surprised to see that at a high end restaurant like that. I felt like he was pushing me to buy stuff from the menu and at the end i left him a 20% tip and said thank you, he had nothing to say and didn't even say goodbye, when he was right there when we left. I guess $55 is not enough tip for him. 
Very dissapointed at the waiter Prime has working for them.

My wife and I along with another two couples at here for dinner one night.  It was very fancy, classy and elegant.  The server was fantastic, very polite, knowledgeable about the food and items on the menu.  Showed genuine concern that we were having a good time and our food was cooked as requested.  

Everything was great.  It is expensive but the food was worth it.  Steaks were perfect.  We enjoyed it, and spent a lot of money in the process.  

Must make reservations.

shrimp cocktail
summer vegetables salad
dry-aged rib-eye
creamed spinach
with some big Californian cabs with the view of Bellagio fountain show.

We had a great time and we'll be back.

The meal was pretty good but for the price ($200 each with drinks and appetizers), I expected just a little more.  I had the ribeye which was impressive but not the best I've ever had.  It had decent flavor and was actually quite tender.  My friends each had the filet. They seemed satisfied but not blown away.  They had three different sauces to go with the steaks.  This isn't really my style as most good steakhouses let the meat speak for itself.  Also, I found it odd that even though we ordered different cuts of meet, we got the same sauces to go on our meet.  Shouldn't a world class chef be more creative?  Also, the server was unable to tell  which sauces were better for each cut.  

Their wine list was impressive and had all of the Napa wines you would expect to see and most other good Caliornia wines.  We went for a bottle of Justin Isosceles.  It was a very good bordeaux blend that paired well with our steaks.  

The server was friendly but might have been more appropriate for casual dining than a fine steakhouse.  He joked with us that our table was typically one of the worst in the restaurant because it was one of the only tables without a view of the Bellagio fountains.  We were a group of successful 20-somethings so I'm used to not getting the best service but to make it blatant that the hostess gave us the worst table in the restaurant sort of ruined the meal.  Honestly, we hadn't even realized the other tables had a view until he said this and never would have even realized it was a bad table but once he said something, we were left wondering why we were given a bad table.

Gorgeous restaurant, maintains a classic elegance and steps of service worthy of its namesake. Hospitality was great, food was exactly what it should have been. Highlights were the dry-aged rib-eye & lamb with bolognese. Creme brulee & warm. Chocolate cakes were on point. Check it out, take your time, drink some wine..

The food here is amazing! It was our second time here! If you have the chance to go here when you are in Vegas GO! I had the AHI and I was so pleased! I am pretty picky! The ahi ribbon which is an appetizer is a must have to! The staff is amazing to! I can not say anything negative!

I was there for a work dinner...I sat next to a co-workers wife who I did not know. We both ordered the 8oz fillet cooked medium; they both came back rare. We sent them back, which was no big deal, I had my sides on my plate and hers on her plate. They returned both our steaks, unfortunately they did not replete them on new plates AND they put my steak on her plate and her steak on my plate, we only knew this because we had different sides. VERY amature. Our server could care 'o less...he was probably upset that the wine we ordered wasn't $300 a bottle. I pointed out the error, they were semi-concerned. I didn't really complain, but wasn't too happy. The manager came over and apparently knew what happened, she graciously took both of our meals off the bill. I was appreciative. I would still not go back.

Simply excellent. Great food. Great service. Great decor. In this restaurant, you're able to watch the famous Bellagio water show while enjoying an 18oz dry aged bone-in ribeye. 

Bottom line, if you want a great steak and a great steakhouse experience while on the strip, check this place out.

Our Vegas trip is not complete unless we go there. The great food, ambience and staff. Between my friends and i, we ordered close to everything on the menu and we never had a disappointing experience with the food or the portion sizes. Looking forward to our next visit.

Beautiful restaurant in the Bellagio overlooking the amazing fountain show that just never gets old!  A friend of mine and I ate on the patio last evening and had a great experience.  The service was polished and professional and the food was amazing.  We started with the shrimp cocktail and the crab cake...both solid choices that could have been a meal in themselves.  I enjoyed the halibut entree and my friend enjoyed the sole entree - both flavorful, fresh and delicious.  We shared a side of the ginger sweet potatoes and loved them - absolutely divine!  The Rouge cocktail was the way to go too. 

If you're looking for an amazing meal in a sophisticated atmosphere with a view of the fountains, Prime is the place for you!

The service was impeccable. The server was basically at ur side always refilling our glasses. We had a great view and the atmosphere was very tranquil and pleasant..the food was absolutely amazing as well. I had a bone-in ribeye that was delicious, then golden mashed potatoes were great as well.. Would definitely come back soon.
Best NY Strip steak that I have experienced so far; good atmosphere, great service ad outstanding food...!!!

Love the place, It's inside Bellagio underground..kinda lol. I havent been here in years (last time was in 06). Decor was nice, it gives me that romantic feel. The food was great, like, It's REALLY good. The BEST lamb chops I've EVER had. Of course I've had other food as well but the lambchops makes me want to come back for more! Serve only the best of wines. The service was GREAT, it had to be! I saw Michael Jorden here from us, he was literally right next to us.. that was cool lol. But You know what they say, Big names does come first. They gave him our table the night prior. But it's okay.. he didnt know. besides, who were we comparing to him? We're only big names in the Poker industry, but him? world wide.

I never though that I could not enjoy a big bunk of lobster. But I guess it's possible. This place was just really pretentious without anything to back it up. Granted, we were a big group of 20-somethings but the place was pretty empty so I don't think a bad attitude was warranted. 

I think the theme of the night was quantity over quality. The shellfish platter was full of giant pieces of seafood that tasted like it came out of a freezer/buffet line. The lobster was really rubbery and flavorless, but it was cute that they de-shelled it in front of you. Perhaps I should have gotten steak at a steakhouse (who knew?) The creamed spinach and mashed potatoes were good, but nothing memorable. The creme brulee was really good (isn't it always) and the chocolate volvano souffle was also good. 

But i don't think anything would compel me to come back here. Even the deco is stuffy and pretentious. Boys, come here in a suit.

Amazing meal. Hefty price.... But when in Vegas...
The steak was tender, cooked to perfection, service was timed perfectly. The wine? Fantastic! As a bonus, we bumped into mike Tyson, who was also dining there. If iron mike eats there, it's got to be good, right?

Holy Chihuahuas!

I've been in Filet Mignon heaven. 

The service?  Impeccable.
The sides? Everything was wonderful. Tender. Fresh. 
The bathroom?  Clean, fresh smelling and no water drops on the mirror!

We had Filet Mignon, squash soup, asparagus, potatoes, lovely fresh salad.  

To celebrate our special occasion we were given a chocolate rich cake concoction with vanilla ice cream.  We also ordered the creme brulee - nice and creamy,  no sandy texture or plastic aftertaste -- crisp on top - not soggy!  

It was pricey  - but that was expected  -- and it was worth every penny!  

Here is what gave the push to 5 stars from me.  Hardly anyone knows how to make a filet well done without giving  a disclaimer, then burning it to crisp, or keeping it pink/red inside.  It is a true and skillfull chef who is able to cook a filet well done without having to excuse it by adding a disclaimer or begging the patrons to have it be butterflied.

Will go there again. And again. And again.

* I just want to add that I was not allowed to each chocolate cake (I'm a dog, after all ) but those with me did - and they enjoyed!*

My wife surprised me with reservations here for our anniversary on our last night in Vegas. The dining room has a great atmosphere - comfortable arm chairs with dim, romantic lighting - and we were seated at a table with a great view of the Bellagio fountains.

After each ordering a glass of wine, we started with the bacon-wrapped shrimp for an appetizer. I had the 8-oz filet and my wife had the slow-baked salmon and we split the Yukon mashed potatoes. All of the food was fantastic and the service was equally good. They gave us dessert menus, but before we had a chance to order one of the servers brought out their signature lava cake dessert that had "Happy Anniversary" written in chocolate sauce...what a great ending to a great meal! When it was all said and done - wine, appetizer, entrees, tax, and tip - the bill came to $200.

If I had to find a complaint for Prime it would be that there were only three shrimp in our appetizer, which was about $20, and that they charged us $8 for water (Fiji).
One of the nicer restaurants you'll find in Vegas or maybe anywhere. Seafood tower appetizer was terrific. Aged rib eye very good.

First off let me say that the food at Prime is impeccable.  The ambiance, view of the fountains, stellar.  So why the two stars? We came here for a friends 40th birthday.  It was a special fun night.  Our waiter Thierry was so rude and condescending.  Truly awful.  I wish that we would have just asked for someone else.  The lady that started us out was so amazing then we had to endure his constant scowl and bad attitude.  Considering my husband and my bill alone was 700 plus dollars and there were 6 other people with us I'm sure our table spent an ample amount of money to have to put up with this nonsense.  Not pleased.  

The food was all great 
Tuna ribbons 
Salmon sashimi 
Mac and cheese 
Oysters 
Dover sole 
Truffled potatoes 
Creamed spinach

Bring your high limit AMEX cuz ya gonna pay big bucks - and it is worth it!
Wine list - is stellar - food is outstanding - get the seafood appetizer.

Request Russell - "bad Russell" that is (self proclaimed) but is a great server just asked him!

Extremely tasty food, recommended.

Ambiance and elegant environment will set the stage for a lovely evening out.

I ordered venison; I believe there's a good chance deer will at sometime take out my car (and me?) on the highway - so I'm getting my payback against deer on the front end.

The service was what one should expect from the elite restaurants of the world.  A head waiter, who's been doing it all his life, supported by a contingent very qualified sous servers and bussers.

If you plan on splurging on a top-rate meal in Las Vegas, you won't be disappointed with Prime.

Okay, Prime has the best steaks in town. We go there every Christmas, making a reservation early so we can be seated by the window and watch the "Dancing Fountains." Beyond the steaks, virtually everything on the menu is enticing and the service impeccable.

Now, if we can only ban fanny packs and T shirts in hotels like the Bellagio itself, it would be great (okay, not a part of the restaurant review, more of a social comment).

The steak at Prime was a little above average. After adding in the high prices, I would say this place is nothing more than average. The service and waiters here are top notch, but the food quality is definitely not worth price. 

I had the Veal and was not impressed. I've paid less for much better Veal elsewhere. There are better places in Las Vegas that you can dine at for a better price.

It's been about 7 years since I ate here, but I must say I always recommend this restaurant to people because I had a perfect time with this fine dining experience. I took my girlfriend at the time for her birthday here, booked the reservations in advance and told them it was her birthday. The service was great the second we got sat... I had the filet mignon and it was cooked medium rare the way I like it, it was perfect. Desert they brought my gf a cheesecake with a candle and it said Happy Birthday in chocolate on the plate. I was happy knowing I didnt have to remind the server it was her birthday, they were on their best service standards in my opinion and I would love to take another future gf to this establishment soon.

I fully enjoyed my dining experience at Prime!  Beautiful restaurant, plush furnishings, romantic lighting, all first class. We were lucky and got a table with a fantastic view of the Bellagio fountains. 

Service could not have been better. Our service team was attentive but not annoying. Everything was timed perfectly, dishes cleared properly, etc. 

I started with the black and blue martini. Gin and blue cheese stuffed olives with a sprig of rosemary. It was good but the rosemary was overpowering. Gin is so aromatic already, I felt like it was ruined with the rosemary. I quickly pulled it out and enjoyed the rest. 

They bring out a complimentary bread basket. Pretty basic with two types of bread and regular butter. Nothing special. 

For my appetizers I had the bacon wrapped shrimp. They were absolutely delicious and cooked to perfection. I also had a wedge salad. It was good but pretty standard as far as wedge salads go. I have had better. 

The steak that I ordered was great. New York strip medium rare. It was done perfectly and had great flavor. You can choose peppercorn or some type of glaze on your steak. I chose peppercorn but should have ordered it plain. They bring out three kinds of sauces with the steaks, so it's probably better to try the steak plain and add sauce on your own. It didn't disappoint though. 

For sides I had baby brussels sprouts with pear and bacon (a special that night) and also had potatoes gratin. Delicious!! 

Dessert was a very slight let down. I had the pumpkin creme brûlée. It was more like pumkinless creme brûlée but still good as far as a creme brûlée goes. 

They have nice restrooms within the restaurant. Anyone familiar with Las Vegas restaurants knows that having restrooms within the restaurant itself is a treat. They also provide Molton Brown soap and lotion. Nice touch! 

I will definitely return to Prime at Bellagio. 

Enjoy!

Another wonderful dinner at Prime Steakhouse in the Bellagio!  I highly recommend the Wagyu beef sampler... 3 ozs NY Strip, 3 ozs Filet mignon, 3 ozs ribeye.  Also, John Burke, the sommelier, does a nice job of matching your wine preferences to your meal.  Thanks Prime!

We are locals and visited this restaurant for my birthday early on a Friday night- we had reservations. The food was exceptional- bacon wrapped shrimp, beet salad, wedge salad, short ribs and garlic soy steak, asparagus, au grautin potatoes plus 1 mojito and 1 cosmo. The flavors of each item were amazing. 

So why not 5 stars? We were shoe horned into a corner next to 2 very large parties and the service by our main waiter was lacking. The other waiters  were very attentive.

Would we return- yes after we save up money as this is definitely an over $300 meal for 2 people.

I don't like mashed potatoes.  However, 3 words for you.  Truffle Mashed Potatoes.  

The restaurant is everything everyone says it is.  Romantic and fantastic. Go.  Try it. You will not be let down.

My husband and I dined here this past weekend before going to see "O" while in town. He had been once before with a group in the private room and raved about the whole experience so I was excited to try it. 


The ambiance and decor is absolutely stunning, as was the view of the fountain. Super romantic and very elegant. We actually had the same server (initially) that my husband had previously but my husband remembered him because he provided such great service. I believe his name was Danny. We picked out a bottle of wine and perused the menu. After we ordered the wine, we placed our order with someone entirely different, he did not introduce himself other than to say 'I'm Danny's assistant' when we looked at him with confusion. Ok fine- they are busy so makes sense. But we literally never saw Danny again at our table. My husband and I both assumed it was because we ordered a moderately priced bottle of wine and as soon as we were labeled as not big spenders we were ignored. Just because I'm not spending thousands of dollars here does that mean I don't deserve excellent service?? Don't get me wrong, the assistant was very nice but it just wasn't the same experience. 

Our food was very good - I'd say 4 stars. Started with the hamachi which was divine. Then we each had the butternut squash soup which was just ok. Kind of bland and very stingy on the mushrooms. It came with maybe 4 mushroom slices when that was listed as a key ingredient on the menu?? I ordered the filet (wish they offered a petite version) which was well executed but not the best I've had. My husband had the dry aged rib eye and he loved it. We also tried the brussel sprouts and mushroom sides. Be warned - the brussel sprouts come with potatoes even though it's not listed on the menu. We don't eat potatoes and would not have ordered them if we had known. Mushrooms were delicious. 

My biggest issue wasn't the service snub or the fact that we have had better steak for less money. It was overall service. Only one word to describe it: GLACIAL. Our food took FOREVER. After we ordered we looked around and noticed that no one in sight had food in front of them. That's a scary sign. Our appetizer took 45 minutes to come out. It was 5 slices of raw fish. What takes so long?!? Finally at 9:20 I had to inform our server (Danny's assistant) that we needed to leave by 9:45 at the very latest to catch the show. He had a look of panic on his face but said sure he'd do what he could. Our steaks came quickly after that and we did leave on time so I appreciate the efforts made but we were so rushed we didn't get a chance to enjoy our expensive meal or finish our wine. Instead of it being romantic it gave us a slight bit of anxiety. My husband didn't even try the sides because he didn't have time. 

I wouldn't advise people not to go, but if you do just plan to make it a 3 hour event.

This review is longgg overdue! Visited Prime Steakhouse on Valentine's Day. My boyfriend made reservations a month in advance to celebrate both the holiday and our two year anniversary. I couldn't have asked for a more romantic and beautiful setting to celebrate these special occasions! Prime Steakhouse at the Bellagio was truly a wonderful experience.

First off, the ambiance. Breathtaking. The inside of the restaurant is dim and decorated beautifully. Glass windows gives you and incredible view of the fountains and of the rest of the city lights. Dress code is formal, so ladies, make sure to put on a nice dress and your sexiest heels, and men, a dressy shirt and tie is suggested. Seating indoors seemed great, but my boyfriend had reserved a table for us outside on the balcony/patio. Wow! That's all I gotta say. You are sitting right by the water, where the Bellagio fountain show takes place every 15 minutes. This was truly and amazing and breathtaking view! Your table is under heat lamps so being cold is not an issue, and it's also decorated w a candles to set the mood. Very romantic! Would definitely recommend trying to reserve this section. Holds about 5-6 tables.

Now to the food, delicious! We started off by ordering the shrimp cocktail, served over a bed of ice with wasabi and its cocktail sauce. So good! The shrimp is cold and fresh and definitely very tasty. My boyfriend ordered the filet mignon and loved it! He said it was cooked just right and the sauces it comes with adds the perfect touch to it. I ordered the Parmesan Crusted Chicken, comes with white asparagus and lemon basil butter. It was good, but very big! Such a huge dish! I couldn't finish it and left a little more than half in my plate. Very filling because of its size. Order if you're hungry or maybe share it with someone. Huge! 

We also ordered the truffle mashed potatoes to share. Mouthwatering. The mashed potatoes literally melt in your mouth and the truffle oil tasted so good! A definite side you must order! 

As for drinks, we each had a cocktail, which I believe was called the Jasmine. So good. Very light and refreshing, great for a lightweight like me. :) I had 2 glasses! 

Dessert was a must! We had a chocolate soufflé cake that came with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Of course we finished it all! Amazing!

I really loved this place! If you are looking for a classy, romantic night out, Prime is the place to be! We even saw a guy propose to his girlfriend during the fountain show! So beautiful! 

Reservations are very easy by either calling the restaurant or booking online through Opentable. Hope you enjoy the restaurant as much as my boyfriend and I did!

Really a 4.5. Obviously the food is fantastic, only knocked it down .5 because it just feels a little stuffy inside and that isn't my thing. Tuna Ribbons and Steak Tartare - amazing. My filet mignon was cooked nicely (medium rare) and I love all the sauces they bring for you. Sides are ordered separately, and our waiter did lead us astray saying they were individually portioned. Uhmm NO. 2-3 people can easily split them, especially the mashed potatoes, which are more like liquid gold. Also worth trying: the wild mushrooms.

Dark dark dark restaurant. The food was good - the bread is freaking amazing, the mashed potatoes and asparagus are pretty standard, the Mac and cheese is all cheese, and the butternut squash soup is great.

This was just fantastic.  Ate with a group of 6 and had impeccable service.  Water and wine glasses never left wanting.  The restaurant is very classic and demure.  And, as many note, you can see the fountains well from some tables.

On to the food:

We had the seafood tower.  Usually, the lobster is the star, but in this one, it was the crab for me.  The shrimp were perfectly cooked.  

Crabcakes was probably the most disappointing dish.  Serviceable, but not what I expected.

Had several sides.  The stars were mac n cheese and onion rings.  Will defintely get these 2 dishes again.  My wife had the filet and lobster.  Filet cooked PERFECTLY rare.  This was textbook, and no black on the outside, which was a feat for such a thick steak.  The lobster was one of the best I have had.  I had the bone-in ribeye, which was another perfect medium rare.  Excellent flavor, the dry aging came through.

The wine list is extensive, and pricey.  We had Italian at our table and all choices were excellent.  Port for dessert was actually not as bad price wise.  But, expect to pay if you are a wine drinker, as is common on the Strip.

Overall, a very expensive evening but one that we will do again.  If you are a steak fan, highly recommended.

I will say, the bathrooms were underwhelming for such a nice place.

This place was easily the best place I've eaten at in Vegas. It's located in the Bellagio, not too far out of the casino. Me and a friend had a table right by the water, while the water show was going on. It was the coolest table-side entertainment I'd ever had. Steak was terrific, as were the sides. If you've got the money, try it out.

mmmmm, i was pretty unimpressed with prime. came here for dinner before clubbing at the omnia to celebrate a friend's birthday, so we were ready to eat (to pad all the alcohol..) the reservation was made about 4 weeks prior for table of 8 with a view of the bellagio fountains - no promises they said, but they'll make a note. i was pretty disappointed with our view - only 3 people could see the fountains at all, and with a very limited view. meh.

on to the food - we all got apps (foie gras for me) but others had oysters, steak tartare, salad, basically one of each from the appetizer section of the menu.  there was basically silence as we ate our food - there was nothing to say.  usually its a good sign because people are focused on their food and tasting it, but not with this group. we just didnt want to be rude... the apps werent very memorable. my foie gras wasnt complemented super well with items on the plate, and was more grainy than usual. bleh. on to the entrees..

since we were at a steakhouse, most people ordered steak. i got the short rib instead (cant eat much steak).. which ended up being a dry hunk of short rib that wasnt very tender, but quite salty! i was pretty disappointed. no imagination on the plating or accompaniments either. bleh. people seemed to at least enjoy their steaks - hope they werent overcooked.

overall...i didnt feel special at this restaurant. being a jean georges establishment, there was no refinement in the service or dishes that they served. everything was just 'all right.' their redeeming dishes were, with consensus from the entire group, the french fries and bread pudding. isnt that sad? the 2 bottles of wines we got were good, as well as the dessert wine, but they didnt produce those, did they. sigh.

i will not be returning here given the plethora of amazing dining options in vegas.

Excellent service. This place has great views  of the Bellagio fountains, makes for an beautiful romantic setting. The dry-aged rib eye is amazing :) If your ordering wine the Ferrari-Carano Merlot is tasty.

One thing NOT in short supply in Vegas is Steakhouses! And Prime is up there with Ni9e, SW and The Palm. But, nobody has the view like Prime has. It is one level below the main floor looking right onto the lake and the fountain show. Pretty damn exciting. Single guys should bring a date here. 

I however, was on a business dinner that turned not too friendly, but that did not detract from the food. I had the smaller fillet, Medium Rare, some dauphinoise potatoes that were very good and the usual wine accompaniment. Service was outstanding. Nobody intruded when I was taking to task a supplier, and when things lightened up they came around doing what wait staff do. 

Atmosphere outstanding. The steaks were very Prime and it was a great eating experience. Forgot to ask if they had a blender. Maybe next time!

This is also a place you will want to take your time with--again if you are with someone

Hmmm...beautiful steakhouse, gorgeous chandeliers, ornate curtains and fabulous decor. Don't let the decor distract you from the food. Very average at best and service was simply standard, nothing memorable whatsoever. Lamb chops were gristly, and I don't know about that overly spicy and salty mint jelly, spread on top of each chop, I wish they had left it on the side or forewarned me that they were served with jelly.  Breaded chicken cutlet was overly sauced and too lemony for our liking.  The spring split pea soup and iceberg lettuce salad were just okay. That about sums up our dining experience.

My husband and I went here to celebrate his 30th and we were VERY impressed with the food here.

While it is expensive (expected), the food is excellent. It is the best filet mignon I've had - perfectly cooked with a fabulous flavor. 

We split the mac n cheese and truffle mashed potatoes which were both DELICIOUS.

While we were a little disappointed that they didn't give us a window seat when we called to request one, they made up for it by giving my husband a free dessert for his b-day!

While we couldn't go here on an average night, it was the perfect place to celebrate, and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a good steak dinner in Vegas.
Bone in filet was awesome. Truffle mashed potatoes too. And a glass of Glenlivet. Perfect dinner. View wasn't bas either.

This was one of those dining experiences when I knew from the time I was greeted that it was going to be a special dinner.  I made reservations as a Yelp friend had recommended well in advance of the date I wanted.  I had a ticket to see 'O' at 7:30 and this was one of the Bellagio restaurants that I never went to and also one that opens at 5 giving me plenty of time to enjoy dinner and not worry about making the show on time.

I was seated promptly after a few parties ahead of me.  I was taken to a side room in the front--not one of the coveted center tables directly overlooking the fountains--but it was a really nice room and I could see much of the fountain show in any case.  My servers were Team #18.  I'm not sure if the waiter gave me his name or not.  If he did, I missed it.  He asked about drinks, gave me the menu, and explained some of the things on the menu.  I was also brought a nice selection of bread and some butter.  The bread had been warmed nicely.

I started with the tomato gazpacho.  The bowl had several groupings of avocado, celery, some peanuts and other goodies.  Onto this vegetable grouping, the server poured the cold gazpacho.  He then ground some fresh pepper on the soup and I was off enjoying the first course.

For the main course, I got the 14 ounce filet with bone in cooked barely--blue.  It was accompanied by two shishito peppers.  I also got a side of gratin dauphinois with Comté, a gussied up name for potatoes au gratin.  When I saw Comté, I knew this was it.  It's the kind of cheese I always buy for eating at home.  The steak was done exactly the way I like.  The potatoes were excellent.  A very pleasant side dish that I almost finished.  With the steak, the waiter brought a platter with three sauces, peppercorn, a classic Béarnaise, and their house soy, rice wine sauce.  Of the three, I liked the soy, rice wine the best but I used it sparingly.  I'm generally a purist when it comes to steak.  It really doesn't need a sauce.

For dessert, I got the coconut soufflé with chocolate sorbet.  The plating was beautiful.  The soufflé was perfect and the round of sorbet on a small bed of toasted coconut was a perfect accompaniment.  

Now as to service--it couldn't have been better.  It was top notch.  The server was a friendly gentleman and the bus person was quite efficient.  I had a fresh glass of iced tea before I finished the first one.  The plates were cleared promptly and when my server said the soufflé would only take 7 minutes, he was correct.

The maitre d'hôtel came around twice during the meal to check how things were and we chatted for a bit.  It was a grand meal and I'll be returning.  This would be a great anniversary dinner.  I think I'll make the reservation soon!

Lauren C's review of Prime described her waiter as a "Jeeves Wannabe," and she couldn't have been more correct.  And when I told the Sommelier I was taking the Level 2 exam after passing Level 1, but that I wasn't a "real" sommelier at the time, he practically scoffed.  The correct response is: "Good luck!"  I told the same thing to the Sommelier at Gary Danko last week, and he gave me his business card and asked how he could help.  THAT is how you treat a customer!

Being a top-service-rated restaurant, even if it's super-high-end, means having servers that are professional, and knowledgable, but also cool and who act like "real people" at the same time  Example:  Go to Gary Danko.  It's a high end establishment, but people are just cool.  No snootiness, and they have a natural flow to how they interact, with a sense of humor as well.  Perhaps I was at Prime on an off-night, but other reviews have confirmed the same attitude.

To Bellagio's credit, however, I must say that my experience at Picasso two years ago was unbelievable, and the service at Picasso blew me away.  Furthermore, the wine pairing at Picasso was one of the best I've encountered in my life.

My Prime experience was overall a good one, saved by the bartender (I had a glass of wine at the bar before dinner, he picked one blind and I guessed it), and the unbelievable bone-in filet.  There was a little too much "rub" on the filet, as I'm a pureist with my steaks (like to have several bare bites before I go to sauces).  That said, I did try the four homemade sauces, which are pretty incredible:  bernaise, soy reduction, a mustard sauce, and peppercorn.  The bone-in filet is ginormous, and is an amazing cut of meat.  At $60, it's probably the best bargain on the menu, because a cut of that quality and size is very rare.

Wine list is great, although they only have one Rioja; which shouldn't be the case with a list of that size.

This place is first class all the way. If you go, be sure to make reservations and come early to make sure you score on a lake side table to watch the fountain show. It is absolutely incredible! Our Waiter was an older gentleman and was very knowledgeable about everything on the menu. We didn't get any wine, but had a couple of cocktails (cosmos) that were literally the best I've ever had (think of that perfect shaved layer of ice on top). 
Went here for Thanksgiving dinner - my brother had the turkey dinner complete with stuffing and sweet mashed potatoes. I didn't try his because mine was so good I didn't want to waste any bite of fullness on someone else's food. The older heavier watier was looking more and more attractive as I ate my beef. I actually thought as I was eating that if someone cooked for me like this on a regular basis I would do anything for them including marrying them! HOLY GOD this is GOOD FOOD!!!!!!!!! 

I had the beef from Australia - the fillet. And the sauces that went with it were out of this world! (Peppercorn, and 2 others that were creamy). 
For the appetizer, we had the chilled seafood platter - lobster, king crab claw, mussels, clams, oysters, shrimp, lump crab meat - all ready to eat! No peeling or cracking involved! It was also amazing! The total bill for the 2 of us was 300. Not bad at all for what we got. I highly recommend this place.

We started with the bacon wrapped shrimp. Can't go wrong with that and the sauce was perfectly paired with it. Most amazing and delicious filet!! Tender, moist and the flavor was perfect. The au gratin potatoes were creamy and filled with cheese and onions. The asparagus cooked to perfection and not smothered in butter which is preferred. Mushrooms were seasoned to perfection and not overly greasy either. Nothing like a perfect dinner while watching the fountains outside. The service was excellent and they were readily available without being annoying.

Pros: 
steak is perfect 
Fountains
Atmosphere 

Cons: 
Condescending waiters
Failure to take drink orders 
Overpriced- go to carnevino's at palazzo for a better meal at a better price

Service was top notch! We were lucky to get a table with a view of the fountains which made me add an extra star. Food was good but not amazing justify a $300 bill for 2 people. Overall it is a very nice and romantic place but if had equal if not better steaks for much less.

I had dinner tonight at 7pm with my family(3 people)when the brunette hostess was very friendly to take us to our table . The service and food was great when we spent around $800.00 bucks with wine, caviar, Main course and dessert. Everything was perfect who came for first time at Prime. Normally we are frequently client at SW at Wynn. However, the reason I'm giving 3 stars is because after our dinner finished around 8:30pm, I asked the blonde hostess if my family and I could go to outside to take a picture and she was rude and said we couldn't. She said that if I wanted to take a picture, I should have asked before dinner. More training to care the customers....
Porter house! Great stuff and wonderful view outside next to the water show. Perfect for romance.

Not worth the money.  Went here because it was at Bellagio. Expensive and steak was not seasoned and  chewy. Side dishes were small and something I could make at home.  Lot better steak house in Houston,  where I'm from.  Never going back.  Good service though.

Was greeted with a warm welcome at the door seated promptly.  Had a great seat right next to the window by the lake and the famous fountains. Ordered a la carte tried the beef Tartar it was great, next came a Heirloom Tomato salad with age Balsamic it was perfectly seasoned and the Tomatoes were still really good even though it is late in the Season, loved the aged Balsamic rather than a reduced balsamic.  The steak was perfectly seasoned and cooked well.  The wine was great went perfect with the steak.  Desert was tasty.  The evening was great service was perfect had a great time

Best steak on the strip!

Great (romantic) atmosphere!!!

Professional Servers.  

High Price is well worth it!!!

I see lots of good reviews here....  but last Saturday Prime at the Bellagio was not on their "A game".   The steaks were not good.  They did mess up the order on one steak.  Two of the steaks were cooked to the wrong temperature - and missing flavor.   What was really weird, is that when things went bad our waiter went into hiding.  He let others on the staff apologize and try to fix the problems.   The mixed drinks and the wine was spot-on good.  However for a "upscale" steak house in Vegas....  they missed the boat...  sooooo disappointing.  They should be embarrassed to put those prices on the menu and let steaks like that walk out of the kitchen.

I like a good steak.  This restaurant had decent meat, but they chose to mask it quite heavily with sauces and/or crusts.  If it a quality meat, it should stand on its own.  Sauces and crusts are good, but only a small quantity.  There was just too much.
The service seemed good for the other patrons, but not for us.  We were the youngest in the restaurant, or at least the youngest looking, and that is what probably led to our lack of service.  That being said, I was dressed as nice if not better than most with a classic suit and tie.  Passing busboys were of more service than our waiter, who took our order and gave us our check.  I am a decent tipper of at least 20% for average service, so this guy judged us and spent more time with older customers.  Oh well, why dissappoint him with a generous tip.  I did, however, let the manager know that I wanted the tip money to go to the busboys because they did our waiters job.  He offered me a complimentary meal, but I declined.  Why should I have to deal with high prices AND no service.  There are other better steakhouses that I will review shortly that are head over heels better than Prime.

My husband and i went to Vegas for our honeymoon, and when we travel, we love to eat. This was THE best steak we had in town. We got there a little earlier then our reservation so we were able to change it to seat outside, front row seat to the water show, and perfect romantic night! We loved the food, and the scenery! The service outside on the patio could use some improvement but overall we were very satisfied!

I was very lucky to eat at prime and have my dad pay the bill. 

I've eaten at nice steakhouses before such as Mastro's and BOA, and I've concluded that most top-of-the-line steakhouses are very similar in their menus. Other factors are what can make the difference, such as service and ambiance.

This place does have spectacular views of the Bellagio Fountains, but inside the design was a bit tacky. I get it, I get it, it's supposed to feel like an opulent steakhouse from many decades ago with chandeliers, columns, big drapes everywhere, and waiters that bring food out on rolling carts. But for me, it was a little stuffy and got pretty old after a while.
