My impression of this place is that it's trying very hard to be a classic fancy steakhouse. But I was just left with chairs that were uneasy to maneuver and a waiter who seemed kind of absent. I've had better waiters at a Chili's while ordering nachos. This guy was only at our table a handful of times, while an army of other people kept our water glasses filled. He didn't check on us nearly enough  throughout our meal and wasn't very personable. 

(And they could stand to update their bathroom)

At Mastro's, you do get amazingly attentive service in a more modern and classy place. Although, just as at Mastro's, you do get an amazing steak at Prime. 

As for the food, my initial impression was of how small the menu was. There are maybe a dozen entrees. There are a large number of side dishes to choose from, though. 

I would say that the sauces--particularly the bernaise--make the steak entrees very good. I ordered a filet mignon medium rare. It was cooked nicely, with a juicy and red interior, but the outside of the steak was dry. 

The sides are nothing to write home about, except for the black truffle mashed potatoes. These are whipped clouds of carbohydrate perfection. The earthy black truffle is generously shaved on top and is abundantly stirred throughout. (But let's be honest, you could shave black truffles on anything, even a twinkie, and it'd be delicious.)

Eating at prime was a wonderful experience and I do recommend it. But as for its rank among other steakhouses, I would say it falls toward the upper middle. With Mastro's still on top.

What could be said about Prime that hasn't probably been said already. The restaurant is beautiful with views of the Belliagio Fountains. The service is fantastic and our professional servers were friendly, attentive, and very helpful with the menu. After a couple of masterfully executed cocktails at the bar our group was seated.

John Burke our Sommelier for the evening has an incredible ability to pair wines with everything you are eating weither it be Seafood, Steak, or Salads. He knows just what your palate and especially your soul needs.

I ordered the seafood tower, tomato and mozzarella salad, aged bone in rib eye (medium), and the donut tower. All accompanied by Mr. Burke's selection of several incredible wines. A monumental meal.

Our table of 6 had everything one could desire to eat and drink. The bill, hold your breath. 

$2,880 with tip. Worth every hard earned penny.

Best steak house in Vegas by far. Try the fillet or porterhouse. The sides make for an excellent meal. Very professional staff and nice atmosphere. Warning : Random photographer will harass you for pictures once every 30 minutes like a panhandler.

I went to Prime for the first time. It was good but maybe I was biased  because  we had Delmonico Steakhouse  the night before.  
The service was definitely  lacking. They would come by then just dissapear and would have to  constantly  wave them  down. While the bone in ribeye  was tasty it was smaller and about 20 % more expensive  than  Delmonico.  
They  definitely  know how to prepare  a steak.  I would  just expect  the service to reflect  the prices they command .

This should be a 4.5 stars, not quite a five, but pretty darn close. This was the best meal we had our last trip to Vegas. There was 6 or us and we sampled a wide variety from the menu. The wine list was excellent, at Vegas prices, but a very good selection, we enjoyed a couple of bottles that were well presented. I enjoyed a Delmonico steak that was as good as I have had anywhere, melt in your mouth excellent, someone else had the duck which I sampled and it was also done perfectly. Those that had room for dessert were also pleased. 
It was an excellent meal, the service was the only reason I did not give a 5 star. Our waiter was a little overwhelmed with all of his tables. The food came out at a perfect temperature, but was a little slow between courses. We also had to wait a while to order. The table he was taking care of before us had 8 people and it seemed that each person needed to discuss their order in detail with multiple questions, most were answered to the previous person at the table, IE: what salad dressings , how much pink does med well have , can I super size my fries..... really, it must have taken 15 minutes for them to order, the waiter was exhausted afterwards and we were starving. .. For a restaurant of this caliber, the wait manager should have stepped in and taken our order, it was obvious we were starving and he was dying at the next table.

Great place to get a prime steak, hence the name.  Standard steakhouse decor, so much so that I hardly recall the details.  It's what you'd expect when you are paying $150+ dollars per plate.  No surprises here.  I'd recommend it.

The absolute best bone in ribeye i have ever had.  Sides are also delicious -- potato gratin is on point!  Service 5 stars.. Everything about this steakhouse is top notch including the view of the bellagio fountain.

We celebrated our anniversary here. Very nice and good atmosphere. Food was delicious and the staff was great. They even brought us a complimentary dessert as a surprise for our anniversary, which was very thoughtful. We had a great time.  We got sat at a table with a window seat and watched the fountains front row and center.  Worth the $ for a special event.
Comimos atún sellado y cortes americanos, deliciosos. Además la vista de las fuentes del Bellagio es privilegiado. Un lugar con mucha clase

This place is so over rated. I really wanted to love it and I really tried because I was taken there as part of a large group and our host had the greatest intention in taking us all there. I had the salmon dinner and it was dripping in butter, like there must have been an entire stick dropped on it during preparation. News flash: people that order salmon are usually health conscious individuals that are trying to make a lean and healthy choice, not usually want a stick of butter dropped on in prep. I will say that I ordered the hot chocolate/lava cake with vanilla ice cream and it was amazing! However the coffee that I ordered to go with it was absolutely awful. So they have a long way to go before they put all the puzzle pieces together and live up to the 5 star reputation that they strive for.

Perhaps a 4.5 would be most appropriate, but then again this was one of the best steakhouse experiences I've had. The dining room is stunning, intimate, and inviting and has gorgeous views of the Bellagio fountains. The service was friendly, knowledgeable, and attentive. We completely splurged, and went from classic caviar service to appetizers, entrees, and deserts. The steaks were cooked perfectly, dry aged and juicy, with a nice selection of sauces... though they didn't need them. I was told the lobster was as succulent as could be, but I am allergic and could not try it for myself. The shrimp cocktail, however, was excellent so I believe the comments on the lobster. The side dishes - the element that ultimately defines the overall success of a steakhouse for me - were perfect. The onion rings were battered, seasoned, and crisped to perfection. The mac & cheese was ooey gooey. The creamed spinach was fresh and not too creamy. The warm chocolate cake was heavenly.

This is easily one of the best steakhouses in Vegas, and the fountain view might just push it to the top if that's your sort of thing.

Our party of four arrived a little early for our 8pm reservation, but the hostess had us wait just a minute while the table was prepared. I had requested a table on the patio since we were celebrating my husbands birthday and they were happy to accommodate our request. Once seated, the night couldn't  have been better. One of our party is vegan and the fact that a steakhouse had a special vegan/vegetarian menu available was really awesome. The others in our party enjoyed the sea bass, short ribs and bone in rib eye. All the dishes were fantastic. Mushrooms as a side dish were terrific. As we enjoyed our slow paced meal, we also enjoyed the wonderful Bellagio fountains and music every 15 minutes- a highlight of the dinner for me! We were never rushed so they could turn our table and we sat there for dinner and dessert until 10pm. Dessert was a cinnamon bread pudding presented inside a chocolate sphere over which a warm caramel sauce is poured, melting the chocolate. It was amazing. This is a place for a special meal!

Ambiance and Atmosphere are A+, Food is excellent, Service needs a little work.  It's in the Bellagio so you expect a little upity and they sure do deliver.  If you look past the high class attitude of the staff you see true elegance and fine dining.

Our experience started off with a long wait due to a mix up with the reservation, good opportunity people watch and checkout the fountains.  They later made up for the botched reservations, but still annoying.  Very crowded for fall weekend night and the sure sign they over booked was the sight of the staff rolling out tables to setup mid evening.

Steaks are surely prime cut and the kitchen really knows their stuff.  Head waiter was a bit stuffy and kept disappearing on us.  Wife has the Rib Eye, nice and tender, cooked perfectly - rare warm center.  I went off in left field and ordered the Duck - must have been the cocktails that threw me off course (nice stiff drinks $$$).  Was expecting something different but after mulling it over a few days, came to the conclusion that it was a spectacular dish.  Hearty breast fillet that cut like a steak, cooked perfectly.  The almond crust was like candy and the red wine amaretto reduction was paired perfectly.

For the sides, the table shared the Truffle Mashed potatoes, Mac and Cheese, Roasted Mushrooms, Roasted Broccoli, and Crunchy Potatoes.  Mac and cheese seemed to be everyone's fav but it had too much depth (if there is such a thing) for me, if you like sharp cheese this one is for you.  The crunchy potatoes has a great name but in the end was just a deep fried baked potato.  The truffle mashed was nice and creamy.  The roasted vegetables were surprisingly good, the broccoli has some heat with the jalepenos.

All in all a good experience, will definitely order steak next time!
They overcooked my steak, nuff said.  At least we got a view of the fountains.

The steak and seafood are fine, but not worth the price at Prime. The New York strip did not melt in my mouth... At $60+ I expected to be wowed more. I've definitely had better steaks for much less $$. The French onion soup was delicious but the bread and cheese had already fallen into the soup upon arrival. The dessert portions are tiny. Ask for a table with a view of the fountain. And for the guys-  be sure to wear pants, as shorts are not permitted inside the restaurant. (Though the restaurant does have crappy pants to lend you)

Ok I chose due to reviews-and husbands birthday. We've been to mastros in la, craft steak in Vegas and many other steakhouses. Prime is absolutely elegant, great service, great drinks, nice menu.  We started out at the bar so we could get a table with a view. We ordered a lemon drop very good.  Got a table overlooking fountains super. The restaurant really is elegant. 

They came out with some delicious bread, my favorite the pretzel bread.  We ordered each the filet for main, and truffle mashed and steamed asparagus. The potatoes were heaven so tasty. The steak although was nice size ordered it medium, both husband and I thought it was bland and not as tender as we expected for 62 dollars. It came with dipping sauces that were good but again the steak to us was bland. That's why the 3 stars. Overall I'd return but try a different steak. I really wanted to love this place it's just soo many steakhouses and we've had a better tasting steak.

From front to back, floor to ceiling, Prime Steakhouse exudes sophistication.  Their wait staff are top echelon professionals who can actually educate patrons about the items featured in the menu.  We tried the dungeness crab cakes, bone-in rib eye, filet mignon, roasted wild mushrooms, creamed spinach, and lobster, and they were all beautifully prepared.

During dinner we noticed that they were preparing a small private banquet room that was situated close to our table. We jokingly asked one of our 3 servers if George Clooney was on the way. Our server wasn't sure, but he mentioned that he had waited on Mr. Clooney twice before.  Sweet!
Sigh. We just did not have a good time here at all.  We felt ignored for a bigger party near us and everything came out wrong.

One of the best meals I had on the strip. Unbelievable service (thanks Russell!). The mac and cheese is a must. Great wine suggestion and the steaks was out of this world. Beautiful setting and we weren't even outside. 

If you're looking for a high end steakhouse with a classic setting and old school service give this place your business. Call for reservations. I found open table didn't have many options but I got in when I called.

Pros: Amazing view of Bellagio fountains, great steak, great service. 

Cons: No complaints really. Except the people taking selfies and photos of the fountains right next to our table during entire meal. Maybe they could discourage this somehow, it really takes away from the moment.

Full review:

I went to prime for my birthday. It was also my first time visiting Las Vegas. I had an amazing meal on the patio overlooking the fountains. I definitely recommend sitting outside if the weather is nice (two other parties in front of us at the hostess station were denied patio seating, so make sure to mention it when you make your reservation if you want to sit there!). 

The service was incredible. There were several waiters in our area, all were extremely attentive, but unobtrusive.

My date and I both ordered the Dry-aged Bone-in Rib Eye. It was hands down the best steak I've ever had. It was cooked to perfection. I savored every succulent bite. It was served with 3 different steak sauces. I tasted each one, they were alright, but I don't know why anyone would want to mask the flavor of that meat! Unfortunately, the steak does not come with any sides, they must be ordered separate. 

The wine list is the size of a small novel. I finally decided on a bottle of Chianti, it was superb. Every time I neared the end of my glass a waiter would appear to refresh it. 

After the main course they brought me a complimentary dessert with a candle and "Happy Birthday" written in chocolate on the dish (I had mentioned it was my birthday on the reservation that I made far in advance). It was a nice gesture. 

Be aware, this place is on the expensive side. 2 steaks, 1 bottle of wine, 2 sides, and the tip came to about $400, but it was worth every penny! I left very happy and would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a nice dinner.

Wow. Where is the 6-star button when you need it?

My girlfriend and I came here for our 1 year anniversary dinner. I made the reservation and then called a couple days ahead of time to request a window seat (we wanted to watch the Bellagio fountains while we ate). The man said he would try but he couldn't promise anything, so I wasn't expecting anything. But they had our window table for two all ready when we showed up!

If you are looking for a fantastic steak, amazing service and an impressive wine list, this is it. Everyone from the hostess to the wait staff to the bus boys were attentive and polite and made us feel very welcome. As a couple in their young 20s on a budget, we appreciated how welcoming they were. It was one of the most expensive meals I have ever payed for (and we picked one of the the lesser expensive "budget" bottles on the wine list) so we were looking to be pampered. The employees at Prime did not disappoint. The food was even better! I had the Boston lettuce salad, 18oz. bone-in ribeye. She had the caesar salad and the 8oz. filet mignon. We shared the garlic mashed potatoes and chile broccoli. I am not a huge fan of buttery mashed potatoes but this bowl was pretty incredible. For dessert we shared a special anniversary lava cake and vanilla ice cream. They spelled out "Happy Anniversary" on the plate in chocolate syrup, and it was on the house!

I wish I could remember the name of our waiter. I want to say it started with a J (Joseph, maybe?). Anyway, he's probably mid-40s, and I do remember that his nametag says he's from Costa Mesa, CA. Leave him a good tip because he deserves it.

Can't wait to go back.

One FYI (not really a complaint) -- they prefer the men to wear jackets, but they don't have a coat check.

I must preface this review by saying that I did not actually eat here. They would not let me. 

I had reservations for two at 6 pm. Our flight arrived in Vegas at 3:30. My friend, who was traveling with me, arrived without his bag. They said it would be around 10 that night before he got it. The big problem - my friend only had shorts. The restaurant had a "no shorts" policy. I called the reservation line and asked if they would make an exception - NO. I went directly to the restaurant and asked if they would make an exception - NO. I understand policies. I have them in my business. My deal on policies is that, if circumstances dictate, I make exceptions. This is not the theory for Prime Steakhouse. At least for us, it wasn't. 

I saw many of the patrons of Prime later that night. I have to say I couldn't effectively gauge the dress code. There were hookers with body parts spilling out of all parts of their dresses (that's using the term "dress" liberally). There were men in ripped jeans (which they said they had a policy against) but I guess when you pay $400 for ripped jeans, it doesn't count. Shorts are not okay but T-shirts are??? 

I wish I could tell you about Prime, but their inane adherence to selective policies prevents me.

Eh pretty much had everything on the menu in 1 sitting.  Had a huge ribeye and lobster tail and it was good but not jaw dropping mouth watering good.  Price again is expensive as hell but thats no surprise since your in vegas.

My family and I ate here on Sunday January 11, 2015
My wife two kids, and two of my friends.
My friends had the French onion soup, both said t was delicious.  My daughter 6 years of age but a very refined young lady enjoyed the butternut squash soup with oysters, my 1 year old couldn't get enough as well.
I enjoyed the foie gras appetizer it was melt in your mouth marvelous.  The waiters couldn't believe how well behaved my children are, it's because I myself own a restaurant and I teach them proper table etiquette.  

One of my friends ordered the porterhouse in his words the steak was a 10.
Other friend ordered the filet he said it was the most tender cut he ever had.
We opted for the baked potatoes 
Our sides were Fingerling potatoes that wasn't so wonderfully, neither was the creamed spinach 
The Brussels sprouts were on point and perfect
As we're the Yukon gold mashed potatoes. 
My daughter enjoyed the sea scallops while the wife said the lamb chops were the most tender she has ever had.
I loved my dry aged bone in ribeye. 
All in all a spectacular meal, at a very upscale restaurant. 
Not cheap at all. If saving a buck or two is what you are looking for, you will not find that here.
The bill was 577.00 I had a 400 dollar resort credit from M-life so my friends covered the 177 and I covered the 140 dollar tip.
Well worth it, resort credit or not. We will be back.

Awesome experience! Spent a week in Vegas for our honeymoon, heard so many great things about Prime, decided to give them a try! Not a bit disappointed. Ambiance was beautiful and romantic. Had a table next to the glass windows where you over look Lake Bellagio and the fountain show. 

Waiter was on point, continually asked if we needed anything, etc. Paid us lots of attention, perhaps he wanted his tip, either way, he worked for it. 

I had the 8 oz filet mignon and hubby had the rack of lamb. We ordered 2 sides each, I suggest just ordering 1 each otherwise way to much food. Ordered the asparagus, spinach, yams and of course we had to try the truffle mashed potatoes...OMG, they melt in your mouth!!! Oh and we shared the butter nut squash soup very tasty. Too full to have dessert :-( 

Definitely a place to dine while in Vegas for a romantic, tasty dinner!  Make sure and make reservations, we called twice, once they didnt have any reservations left, they suggested we call back around 2:30 for any cancellations and we got lucky.  So make sure and make reservations, no walks in I'm sure.

I had the most perfect table right by the windows, overlooking the fountains. I ordered a filet (medium-rare) and my friend ordered the same, but medium. Both steaks were cooked perfectly. They came with 3 sauces and i don't know which one i loved the best. They were ALL good. For sides we got the broccoli with cheese, jalapeno, and mint and a side of mashed potatoes. Both delicious. I had the bread pudding for dessert, which i thought had too much over powering sauce. My friend had the cheescake with berries and it was amazing. The atmosphere is beautiful and elegant, the service was phenominal. I really enjoyed this place and everything about it.
went their sat nite with 11 people. Steak was tasteless. Food was just fare. overpriced. servive was good though but unfortunately you cannot eat service. Never go back. We stayed at ballagio though.

If you read my reviews I have a soft spot for steakhouses. I wanted to give Prime 4 stars but I think 3 - 3 1/2 is about right.

The restaurant itself is beautiful and the ambience is perfect in that it is not loud at all.

My friend and I both had the Bone-In Rib Eye, 18 oz - $58. A bit pricey. It was good, we both said a B-B+. Not amazing. We went for that cut as it was wet-aged and we are not fans of dry aged which they had 2 of on the menu.

The Mac and Cheese was amazing, full of Gouda goodness. We had crispy potatoes which is a twice baked potato covered in cheese and bacon. It's a glorified potato skin. Avoid it.

The bread selection was nothing special.

I had the warm chocolate cake, a molten lava chocolate creation with a tiny scoop of vanilla bean. Average.

We escaped for under $200 as we had no alcohol. I'd go back there but certainly recommend CUT, Mastros and Morels before Prime.
Really amazing steak and truffled mashed potatoes.  One of the best steakhouses I have been to.  The view of the fountains gave the 5th star.
Does not get much better than this. Our table was over looking the fountains and the steaks were fabulous. What more could you ask for? But if you did, make sure you do the desserts.

Been here three times now and I'm going to stop taking my dumb pills and stop going. First time was at CES 2013 and the second two times were at CES 2014. Never again.

The people are super nice and the service is exemplary. Decor is top notch. But I don't go to a steakhouse for service and decor. I go there for steak. Please go ahead and mistreat me but if you're going to charge me $85 for a ribeye it better be the best darn ribeye I've ever had. It needs to be at the level of J&G in Phoenix or Prime 112 in Miami for these kinds of prices. Probably even at the level of Peter Lugers (sp?) in NYC. Well it's not even close. Though I'll leave out good ol' Ruth's Chris since it's pretty hard to beat a steak that's drenched in sizzling butter. Both of the last two times I was at Prime, the ribeye was meh - gristle-y and a little on the chewy side. Totally not what I would expect from a $60-70 aged, prime ribeye. Had a piece of my neighbor's filet and it was a little better. Still rather flavorless to be honest. The sides are microscopic - they have no shame charging $14 for amounts to 4-5 Brussel sprouts. Definitely NOT sharable among 2-3 people as they say their sides are.

Given their level of service and the decor, it would just be wrong to give them a 1-star. But the food quality really just isn't there and I definitely will not go back.

Goes to show that Pavlovian principles only apply to dogs. But no really, next CES, I am not subjecting anyone to Prime.

When they say the steak has been aged for so many days as they say what does that exactly mean? Because my husband got SICK! So maybe they are not aging their steaks in the sun? Letting them spoil a little to get more of a flavor? We went to Las Vegas for my 30th birthday and I was reading reviews of this place and I thought why not try it. I have heard both positive and negative and being in the Bellagio hotel you would think that it would be great! I had the filet, garlic potatoes and mushrooms that we both shared. And my husband had some other cut. (cant remember exactly what) But obvioulsy it wasnt too good considering that early Saturday morning he was in the bathroom and it was not pretty! Basically our entire trip was ruined from this so called wonderful steakhouse. NEVER again will I come back to this place. It obviously was food poistening. So thank you Prime Steakhouse for ruining my 30th birthday weekend. You did a great job of it.

I have procrastinated on writing a review for Prime, but I now find myself fantasizing about their macaroni and cheese and realize that it's time to revisit this.  

The beet salad I started with was good, but not particularly special when compared to the rest of my meal.  In hindsight I wish I would have saved this room for dessert. 

My filet was prepared perfectly and served with three sauces - this may just be the best steak I have ever eaten, and was only made more perfect by the sides we had.  The mac and cheese, gratin dauphinois, and grilled corn were all wonderful, and three months later I still get cravings for their mac and cheese.   

Our being quite focused on the conversation at hand, service was kept low-key yet flawless.  The restaurant was fairly quiet while we were there, and has quite a lovely ambiance.

Been here twice and I'm always impressed w their service and quality.  I would probably never come on my own since it is pretty pricey.  But with an invitation by my wealthy gambling friends, any time! The steak is unbelievable. I had my first taste of Kobe beef here a few years ago and it was absolutely breath taking.  
Last night I had the seafood tower and it was delicious.  The king crab legs was phenomenal. Although I prefer to eat them hot.  I'm sure if I asked them to heat it they would have.
All in all, a beautiful restaurant in the most elaborate hotels with a gorgeous view of the water show. Excellent, expensive food.

Single dining. Sat at the Bar. Great, quick service and full attention. I'd come back anytime. The salad, soup and steak were Top Notch! Plus, the steak came with three house prepared sauces. Service was A+. Ambiance A+ with views of the Bellagio Fountain Show!

Probably a top 5 steak for me, the food was outstanding and the service was great as well.  Only issue I had was our table.  We had a reservation for over a month and the restaurant wasn't busy but they put my bachelor party in the corner by the bathrooms, it was awful.  The food is great but sadly next month I will not dine there again because we were thrown to the side with our reservation.
Food is amazing ,ambiance is superb love love this restaurant i recommend to try out the seabass and the duck

Really overpriced and pretentious.
I am from the Bay Area, so I know I am spoiled in regards to great restaurants and someone from SF recommended Prime to me...what a huge disappointment.  First of all, the staff person who showed us to our table pulled the chair out for my husband and not me - while HILARIOUS, was a tip-off that the place is "off."  Our waiter was obnoxious - condescending and LOUD voice.  We had a reservation at 6 and tickets for a show at 8 - he seemed uncertain that we would be done on time, which was ridiculous as we were completely rushed through dinner.  He treated us like rubes who just fell off the turnip truck, "Heard you heard of Alaskan king crab legs?"  Really.  "Uhhh, how do you say that word, 'craaa-bbbb?'"   D'oh - annoying.  We started with a salad, which was fine, very small portion size.  I had a filet - okay, but didn't change my world.  My husband had the lamb.  Fatty.  We split some brussel sprouts and potatoes - again, really unremarkable.  Rushed service and the very loud waiter made it a not-so-fun experience.  $230.00 later, we should've skipped it. 
We are foodies.  Prime is not for foodies.
On the plus side, elegant decor and nice views of the Bellagio fountains.

BY FAR THE BEST STEAK HOUSE EVER!!!!!!

and Beau is an awesome server. I wont go for 6 months and this guy remembers exactly hat I want to eat!

:) love this place would eat here every time I was in Vegas if I had the $$$

This is one of my favorite restaurants to visit while in Las Vegas.  It was so good that my husband and I went back another night for another delicious dinner.  I started my dinner off both nights with the Burrata and tomatoes which was absolutely delicious.  The porterhouse melted in your mouth.  The second night wasn't as good as the first night but was still a very good.  Our salads came out so quickly that we hardly had time to enjoy the bread basket, which by the way has some really good pretzel bread and a delicious raisin bread too.   I guess it was a slow night and the kitchen wasn't busy.  I'm not complaining since the food is so good here.   The waiters and bus boys are very efficient.  I'm not a big wine enthusiasts but my husband is and it is hard to find a bottle of wine for a reasonable price. 
They are there you just have to look hard for them.
Save room for desserts since they are yummy!

I know I'm a bit ridiculous for going to a steakhouse being a Vegetarian. However, I knew I would have limited options and knew what I would order prior to arriving at the restaurant. That being said, my limited amount of options is NOT the reason for my low rating. 

I went with a few girls for Valentine's Day, for fun and for a nice fancy dinner before a girls night out. We were seated and it took about five minutes before we were greeted by our server (at least who we thought was our server). He disappeared for a bit and then came back to ask what we would like to drink. I fully understand that it was a busy night, but I know that restaurant is busy in general, and can handle busy nights. After our drink orders were taking, we waited about ten minutes before receiving them, and another ten minutes until a completely different server took our orders. I understand its odd that I venture to steakhouses and don't order meat, but I don't make a fuss over what I eat; so I really didn't understand why the server had to give me a disapproving look when I didn't order a meat item. I wish I was exaggerating with the amount of time between when we would see our server (if at all) but I'm not. Our reservation was at 9:30pm and we left the restaurant close to midnight. Considering that this restaurant has earned a Triple A 4-diamond rating, I assume it solely due to the steaks, chops, and seafood options. 

On a happy note, I loved the truffle mashed potatoes! Luckily, we were seated close to a window and as always, any view of the fountains is breath-taking :).

4.5 but i do.. love LOVE love JG & his creations.

My boyfriend & i have been avid followers of the Kimchi Chronicles since his parents have told us about and cannot stop watching.  Watching JG & his wife on the show is the reason we had interest in Prime & decided to come and celebrate our V-day weekend dinner out at the Bellagio.  We booked a table through Open Table & requested a table near the windows so we could see the fountain show in the front of the hotel.  You can't hear the music, but you can hear the roar of the water.  We were seated in this smaller dining area, tucked away near the entrance, next to the water & fountains.  It just so happened that night, Carlos Santana was there with 4 other people sitting right behind us.  "Happy Birthday" never sounded so good.

As for the food, we started with the salmon & oyster tartar with black bread.  SO GOOD.  The olive oil and light oyster flavors were really good & paired well with the sashimi grade salmon.  We then ordered a salad (fairly large mixed greens salad) & soup (french onion), both good, but could have probably been happier trying another appetizer on the menu instead.  For our main course, we split the Porterhouse, roasted brussel sprouts and crispy potatoes.  My boyfriend likes his steaks cooked medium, bone to edges, the steak was perfect.  One of the dining staff members or "team 18" cut our steak for us portioning out half and half onto separate plates for us.  The brussel sprouts were were paired with pork & quince, sweet & savory.  Crispy potatoes, think of a really good potato skin with creme fraiche.  Although we were both stuffed, we couldn't skip out on dessert.  We split the cracking key lime pie.  What made it crackling was that they put in pop rocks into the filling.  Definitely a nice pleasant textural element.  The key lime was very tart and paired well with the whipped cream topping. 

Along with our meal, we shared a bottle of Tobin James Zinfandel Reserve.  Their wine list is a huge directory of wines, local and international.  I want to say that the year they brought out for us was different than what was listed in the menu, but I still love that winery so it was an easy no-brainer.  The wine was listed at $65, one of the cheapest, if not the cheapest wine in the directory, but i still love that winery!

Pat on the back JG.. too bad you only go there 3 times a year to check up on the menu.

This steakhouse inside the Bellagio is rated one of the best steakhouses in Las Vegas and from the minute you step inside you know you are in for a couple of things.  Great ambiance and very hefty price tag. Magnificently appointed from the small 8 seat bar when you first walk in to the large tables placed not to closely with views of the fountains through the large picture windows its pure Vegas.   Table for 9 on this Saturday night and we are given a large round table where we are seated very comfortably.   Fresh baskets of bread, pretzel bread, are a nice start as we peruse this shall we say ok no way around it Ridiculously overpriced menu. There I said it. 

The wine list is long as it is equally if not one of the most expensive wine lists I've ever seen.  In fact most were 300% mark up.  There was an exceptional vintage a 2008 Justin Isosceles which for $131.00 was simply marked up 110% which made it the best value on the entire list.   Note 5 bottles were consumed tonight.  The menu itself is your typical steaks & chops menu with some fish thrown in.   Don't think I'll be able to get to each appetizer and entree but I'll try. 

Appetizer Highlights:  
Shrimp Cocktail exceptional, Cesar Salad authentic and outstanding. Special tonight Burrata cheese over watercress was really unbelievably good, A dungeous crab cake also as good it gets.  Knocks off for poor Seared Foie Gras. 

Entrees: 
NY Strip Dry aged incredibly tasty and cooked  to perfection but the typical dry aging left it no juice whatsoever.  (8) out of 10

 (2) Small Bone in Rib Eye with Shishito peppers was tasty with just enough marble to give it some excellent secondary flavor (10)

Rack of Colorado Lamb was simply killer, not gamey and rich in color texture and taste. (10)

Prosciutto wrapped pork chop was dry and lacked flavor (5) Nice looking but didn't get it done.

Pan Roasted Dover Sole was fresh and tasty but completely overpriced at $65.00 (7)

Veal Chop was grilled and tasty and hanging off the bone as it should be.  Very rich flavor (10)

Filet Mignon with Shishito peppers everything a filet should be and then some (even for my friend who tried to ruin it by ordering it medium well :(   (10)

Sides: 
Mashed Yukon Gold Potatoes (6) Nothing special

Baked Potatoes large giant with all the fixings (10)

Mac & Cheese crusty topping and rich and creamy underneath (10)

Creamed Spinach lacking that extra kick (6)

Glazed Mushrooms again nothing special bland (6)

No Deserts were tried.  Service was exceptional throughout the meal from every direction.  

Bottom line is was the price tag worth it?  Really borderline as almost every entree except the Sole was top shelf, and the appetizers were great. Ambiance, service exceptional as well.  Negatives All but 1 of hundreds of wines were so overpriced we were lucky to find a bottle to order.  Sides and prices of entrees were completely outrageous.  Kind of a 4 star if you have unlimited spending in your budget as it certainly was not a 100% slam dunk perfection and 1 star off for price points and wine list.  3.5 stars is more like it but we have to be fair.

Everything was awesome except for the one thing we came for - the steak.  I am not sure what happened but the bone in rib eye was way over salted.  They took it back but the second piece of meat the brought out was way undersalted and not a quality cut.  Service and oysters awesome
The best steakhouse in town. Good staff. Great menu. Combines the best of an old school steakhouse feel with current steakhouse features. Great wine selection.

This is my first Yelp so forgive me if I seem to ramble!

I decided to book a reservation at the Prime Steakhouse after reading the Yelp reviews (thanks guys). However my boyfriend and I left disappointed. 

I had made reservations over a MONTH in advance asking for a seat with a view of the Bellagio fountain show. I informed them that this was our first time to the Bellagio and we wanted to make it special. I was told that there were no guarantees but my request will be placed. 

We arrived promptly to be seated only to be told that the wait time for a window seat was 1 hour and 1/2 to two hours. Needless to say I was disappointed, especially after making reservations so far in advance. 

We were then seated at a larger table and then waited to be serviced. One of the servers handed us a wine menu (this menu is about 35 pages!). I drink wine but I am not a wine connoisseur (and either is my bf) and didn't know what wine would go with what. While I poured over the wine menu, seemingly overwhelmed our main waiter showed up; and boy was he something. He had this total, I-hate-my-job-this-is-my-last-shift type of attitude (you all know what I'm talking about). He didn't introduce himself he just asked if we wanted wine. I felt like we were being pushed to purchase a glass (or two) of wine and I said no, I'll go with another drink for right now. He didn't seem to like that and left the wine menu just in case we changed our minds. 

We both ordered the 8oz filet mignon, truffle mashed potatoes and mushrooms, and for an appetizer the bacon wrapped shrimp and that's when the server asked us AGAIN if we were going to get some wine. Look, I know that restaurants make the bulk of their revenue off of alcohol; I understand that, however my boyfriend and I did not appreciate being "prodded" to buy wine. What was more shocking to me (especially in such an upscale place) was that he never suggested a wine pairing to go with the meal we were having.

I also noticed that two of the servers were having a argument right near me. I couldn't help overhearing their snickering and was surprised that they would be having it out near customers. 

I will say that the filet mignon and truffle mashed potatoes were amazing (if you go you must try the truffle potatoes!!). So I will give them three stars. But the service overshadowed the food. I feel that if we are going to pay around 200 bucks for food then we should be treated accordingly.

Sadly, I'm not sure if we would go there again. If you do decide to go I hope that your experience was better than ours.

Top Notch Steakhouse
--------------------------

Pretty fancy shmancy.  Make sure to wear something nice.  Very classy venue.  

Filet 10 ounce medium rare:  Perfect.  Very thick cut.  A
New York Strip 14 ounce (Soy Garlic Glazed) medium:  Not bad!  A-
GRATIN DAUPHINOIS - To Die FOR!   Absolute Must!  A+
Creme Brulee  - Wow!  Them berries and sorbet on top is something else!  A+

Save this place for a special occasion.  It really is a treat!

We just held our wedding reception at Prime on the private patio overlooking the fountains.  What an amazing experience.  EVERY single guest was in awe of how amazing the experience was and two of our friends even said it was in the top 3 of all weddings they've been to and that  they want their daughter to have her reception there when she gets married.

Rebecca and April (the events Managers with whom we worked for months leading up the event) were on top of everything.  Like any couple right before our wedding we were nervous and worried about everything being perfect.  Rebecca met us on site the day before and she guaranteed everything would be perfect.  She delivered on that guarantee.  The food was amazing, flowers beautiful and our wedding cake was so delicious -- the wait staff could not be beat by any other I have ever experienced.  They catered to our every whim and that of our guests with no hesitation.  

The Bellagio fountain show kept our guests in awe every 15 minutes right behind us.  It was like having front row seats to one of Vegas' best shows every quarter hour.  Best part was the value we got for the price we paid -- was so fair especially for such an elegant experience.

I am a tough critic as a corporate executive for an international company that hosts dinner events monthly, I am very picky about venues and quality.  I would never hesitate about referring family and friends to Rebecca and April.  I didn't expect it, but Rebecca was onsite when we arrived -- she greeted us at the door and was the first to congratulate us.  She wanted to make sure everything was set up -- not one detail was missed and we had given them a lot of little touches we wanted personally added for our guests.

Jean-Georges Vongerichten does steak, in Vegas - AND it's not going for the stupid Vegas prices I've become accustomed to... What's not to like?

I had the lamb - cooked to perfection, served with a selection of house-made sauces.  Delicious.

Well done, again JGV, well done indeed...

I spend a lot of time in Vegas (on business) and a lot of time eating cow. My pallet is open-minded enough to enjoy street meat of the gypsy varieties as well as private chef fare in the homes of UN dignitaries. After 40 some years of travel and esoteric gastro-tours all over the world I hope that of all the food genres out there that I would be considered a credible critic of steak.

Blah blah blah! Please forgive the prologue.

Jean Geaorges' Prime is essentially a perfect steakhouse. Maybe not the best but you'd be hard pressed to find much area for improvement. The setting is elegant. The service professional without being stuffy. The cheapest cuts are great. The expensive cut are heavenly. You can easily drop over $200 for a specialty cut... a la carte! Well worth it though. I went for the aged bone-in ribeye. Perfect.

All the sides are as they should be: creamed spinach, sauteed spinach, mashed potatoes, etc. The wine list is legitimate. If I were forced to find a flaw it would be in their sauces. The au poivre was too think and bit sweet. two others they offered forme to sample were lack luster, though I can't remember what they were. 

Thy to get a seat close to the windows to enjoy the view of the famous Bellagio fountain. Though really there is no bad seat in the house.

Like I said, maybe not the best ever but no one will leave disappointed.

I think Prime deserves a 5 for their yummy interpretation of nourishment.  The Prime Steak Tartare Frites is an A+, The Tomato and Mozzarella Salad is de-lish , Asparagus Salad is good enough "to write home about", The Slow Baked Salmon heavenly, The Ginger Sweet Potatoes & Truffle Mashed Potatoes & Salt Baked Potatoes all fit for a king, The Creamed Spinach & Steamed Asparagus both savory, and the Porterhouse-Kurobuta Pork Chops- & Filet Mignon mouthwatering!!  Well worth the hundreds of dollars our friend paid for :-D!!!!!!!!  We were pretty tipsy but can 98% promise the food was amazing! OH, and the view is just spectacular if you're lucky enough to sit by the windows!

I could not be happier with Prime! When you make your reservation they ask if you are celebrating anything, which we were and then they surprised us with a FREE dessert that said happy anniversary, such a sweet touch. As soon as you walk in the door they seat you, didn't even wait two seconds! Figi bottled water, amazing drinks, truffled mashed potatoes, what more could you want! There was a photographer taking pictures of your table so we got one, $45 for two poses that come in a frame, pricey but not too bad. Love Love Love this place, will definitely be back! Dont get me wrong, the place is pricey, for us its a special occasion only type, but worth every penny, be sure to sit on the patio or ask for a view of the water show in your reservation!

My first night and first time in my life ever in Vegas. This place definitely was a night to remember for my palate. This steakhouse is located lakefront of the Bellagio and it was super gorgeous inside from what I could see.
 I couldn't help but to notice it was one of those restaurants where the lights are so dim, you can't read the menu and everyone is literally whispering around the table.

 Our server was very helpful and brought out a wine list. I ordered a delicious bottle of cab! 
I took a look at the menu and lamb chops were crying out for me! So I had to!
HANDS DOWN. The best lamb chop I've had. MELT IN YOUR MOUTH GOODNESS! 
 
I couldn't pass up on deserts! CRACKLING KEY LIME PIE. Mmmm.. it was so fun to eat! Every bite crackled in your mouth because of the pop rock candy they sprinkled on the top. The key lime pie tart level was JUST RIGHT.  Such a wonderful medley! 

I can't wait to come back! I had a great experience. I just hope they would have the lights on a little brighter. The place reminds me of a dark cave. :(

I give this place a soft 3.   Let's forget that steak in Vegas is ridiculously priced for a minute.  Service was a bit slow and the $70 steak I ordered was so salty I almost couldn't eat it.  I was too impatient to send it back so I ate it.  Mine potatoes gnocchi was not too good.  It lacked texture and firmness.  Can't comment on desserts as we did not order.
The atmosphere was very dark and sleepy.   A little more light would be better,

The real thing that is dropping the star count in my eyes was the pushiness of the photographer that intrudes on your table and starts takin photos.  She shows up at dessert with the photos and basically assumes you are buying them.  When you decline she gets huffy.   For the level of restaurant and the prices I am not interested in being hustle into buying picture.   Prime should consider this and develop a softer approach.

One of the best steaks I've ever had! The richest, beefiest, most delicious Ribeye imaginable! 

Beautiful location in the fabulous Bellagio. We lucked out and got a killer table that had a view of the fountains. Make a reservation and request the view! Everyone there was dressed to kill! Dark restaurant, plush furnishing, fancy! Fabulous! 

Service was A-ok. Knowledgable and friendly enough. 

Bread basket was below par. Save calories here. 

Martini was disappointing. So very unfortunate. 
I took a chance and ordered the black and blue. A vodka martini with blue cheese stuffed olives and a sprig of rosemary. The blue cheese stuffed olives were hanging out at the bottom of the beautiful martini glass. No skewers? How am I supposed to eat the olives? Wait till the end? I hated it. I requested a side of olive juice and made it a filthy martini. Still hated it. 2nd martini- "a dirty martini please". The olive juice came on the side and olives again were sadly hanging out at the bottom. So, I have to mix my own dirty? Hated it. Skip the handcrafted cocktails and play it safe with wine or champagne. 

Bacon wrapped shrimp- heavenly. Wedge salad- meh- I've had better. Potato Dauphinoise- to die for. Brussel sprouts with pear- amazing!  The best part of the meal?  The 18oz bone in Rib Eye. Holy hell. Delicious. Cooked perfectly medium rare. So flavorful. Tender! Marbled to perfection.

Looking to splurge on an elegant steak dinner? I highly recommend this place. Skip the handcrafted cocktails. Share an appetizer and salad and be prepared for a premium steak dinner!

The highlight of my meal was the foie gras! It was absolutely perfect.  Unfortunately that's where the amazingness stops :/ had the braised ribs and scallops and they were, MEH. Forgettable,  not that great. I can't complain about the service,  staff was awesome!  But what took away from the experience was that tacky photographer pushing us to buy photos while my friend and I tried finishing our meals.  She stopped TWICE and kept interrupting our meal. Totally took away from the 5 star,  upscale experience. I kinda felt I was in a wedding and not at a wonderful restaurant prime is. Definitely not returning
Great food,great decor,great customer service I loved my first dining experience and I will be back.Jose is a great bartender

I've waited so long to be able to write this review. 

I finally got to eat here for my birthday last weekend, and wow it was SO worth the wait. We started off in the bar and were served by 2 awesome guys...Doug and (not sure other guy's name). Turns out all the bartenders have been here since it opened 13 years ago, so you know they like their jobs and they are happy to chat with you. 

2 dirty martinis with blue cheese stuffed olives please! OMG...do NOT miss these olive. 2 more please!

We had requested a special seat for my birthday so we could see the fountains, and even though we had to wait a little bit (2 more please!) it was SO worth it. Best seat in the house!

Miguel was our server and he was so nice and knowledgeable....I loved how he took time to speak with each table and we did not feel rushed or pressured. Here's what we had:

Steak Tartare - a very delicate portion of raw beef with some sort of spicy mayo...very good. I think it was a bit light for 2 people to share though. 

French Onion Soup - (BF's starter) Oh wow...super chunky, hot, cheesy deliciousness...this could be a stand-alone meal and in hindsight, it probably was too heavy to have before the steak. 

Ceasar Salad - (my starter) Honestly jut ok. Nothing special to the dressing. 

Filet - (BF's steak) Cooked a perfect medium rare with just the right amount of searing. So soft you could cut it with a spoon. 

Bone-in Filet - (my steak). There's nothing I love more than a bone-in filet. Imagine the juciest, tenderest, mouth-wateringest piece of meat, and then throw extra flavor on top of that from the bone. This was a special that night, and Miguel had to go ask Chef to find me one because they were sold out by the time I ordered. If this is on the menu when you go, do NOT pass it up. Amazing, I'm still slobbering over it. 

The only "ding" I will give them is that you can't bring in your own wine. We brought a special bottle all the way from CA for my b-day, and they would not let us cork it. I get it, they need to make money, but it seems like they could have bent the rules just this once. 

Overall, a fantastic meal. I've been asked if I think it's the best steakhouse in Vegas (that I've been to) and I think it edges out Craftsteak by a margin. 

Save your money and try this place!

Let me just say that, this is the best steakhouse in the country. We had the A5 Japanese Kobe it was out of this world. Everything about this place is just awesome. We will be back in April and I can't wait.

Keep up the good work...

The food was delicious. The ribeye, Sea Bass and scallops were the tables entrees and they were very tasty, but the risotto and the mac and cheese are incredibly good!! The service was excellent. The wine is very overpriced but it is a great selection. The experience was great, but when I asked to go to an almost empty patio to order dessert and coffee, the server brushed us off and said they don't do that anymore. So I need to get on my iPad and re-reserve just to do dessert at an empty patio? Should rethink that a little for slower nights and customers I think. Overall really good experience for us!

My friend and I had dinner here on Halloween night, 10/31/14.  We arrived without reservations!  Of course they are recommended, but we had chosen another venue and changed our minds at the last minute.  The hostess was very nice and accommodating and asked us to wait in the bar for approximately 15 minutes while a table was being readied.  That was great with us.  At the bar we enjoyed a mixed drink each.  Drinks here are about $15 pp.  We were promptly seated near the windows and had a cozy table for two.  The view onto the Strip and the Fountains of Bellagio are fantastic.  Prime is definitely an upscale venue.  We had one primary waiter and two others who assisted.  The menu is a la carte and comprehensive.  I selected the Squash Soup ($15) and it is poured into your bowl at the table.  She selected the baby Iceberg Salad ($18).  There is nothing baby about the salad; it's huge.  You will be full after eating it.  We shared and both were delicious.  For the main course we ordered the 18 oz Ribeye ($64) - just one - and I asked the waiter to split it at the table.  It was more than enough for two.  We also had the roasted Asparagus ($14), the Mushrooms (($16) and Mac and Cheese ($12).  That was too much and I told the waiter it probably was.  All of it was delicious!  The total, without tip, was $164, and that included one more mixed drink for me.

Actually, I thought the venue, service and experience overall was excellent, responsive and courteous.  The prime Ribeye was good, but not the best I've had.  I would rate it 3.5 stars, although it was cooked properly, by the time it was served, it was a bit cool.  I like a steak hot.  This was not.  I did not complain -- it was fine, just not hot.  By the time I had eaten the last morsel, it was definitely cold.  If you like rare, this is perfect for you.  

I agree with the other reviewers that this is a beautiful restaurant overlooking the fountains.  During the weekend, the fountains are active every 15 minutes, so this is quite a show while you dine.  Very romantic.

One of the best meals I have ever had.  

We were seated in the middle table at the window facing the Bellagio fountain for my birthday. For our appetizer we had the Ribbons of Tuna. OH MY GOD it was amazing. 

For the main course, we had the filet mignon with sides of spinach and truffle mashed potatoes. The filet came with the following sauces: peppercorn, soy-rice wine and bearnaise, all of which were carefully explained to us. 

Fantastic wine selection. I did not tell the waiter I was there for my birthday until the signed credit card receipt was returned. He immediately said "please...DO NOT LEAVE YET" and within a few short minutes I received a complimentary chocolate cake that was delicious. Extremely professional wait staff, great teamwork. 

Minor note: there is a photographer walking around taking photos. She was kind of cold and somewhat rude when we said we did not want out picture taken. However, we did understand that was her job. Also, it was kind of awkward but also VERY entertaining to hear all the coaching she gave the people at the next table: "Give that pretty lady a kiss!" FLASH "You are one lucky guy!" FLASH

Average, average, average. 
Food - The steak carpaccio was delicious. This was definitely the highlight of the meal. In terms of entrees the porterhouse was good but not mindblowing. Same goes for the sauces. The sauce made from grapes was good but the others were pretty standard. At the suggestion of the waiter we ordered the crispy potatoes as a side. They were literally exactly the same as TGIFridays potato skins, but maybe a little greasier.  

Service - This was mixed. Our waiter was very nice but the host/busboy/captain (?) kind of huddled and made my friends and I a little uncomfortable.

Atmosphere - The person selling photographs is tacky. The view is top notch but the other decor feels a little tired. This also definitely isn't a young or happening crowd (which I probably should have figured).

It's vegas, go somewhere better.

Eating at Prime is one of my favorite steak dining experiences....Predisposed with a warmly lit restaurant which faces the Bellagio fountains helps with that experience and really makes it special.  Every 15 minutes or so, you'll get a glimpse of the show and really creates a relaxing, decadent ambiance.  The table service / waiters, for the most part, are professional and up to par in fine dining service.  

I've had some outstanding meals here...the best ones included the Seafood Tower which included fresh oysters, gargantuan crab legs, huge prawns/shrimp, and lobster claws - all accompanied with all the dipping sauces.   As for the meal, I go for the New York strip as is my favorite cut, and sides of creamed spinach and mashed potatoes are never-miss choices.  I just love the whole experience from soup to nuts.   A great one to put on your bucket list if you're looking for a high-end steak house while in Vegas.

Not too impressed. Went with two friends and each ordered steaks. All of us ordered them medium and each was delivered medium well to well done. The server offered to exchanged them but we were running to a show and the service had already taken quite a while. For a $62 filtet - you would be better served at N9NE or the Capital Grille. Also, for some reason I find it insanely cheesy when they have the photographers running around from table to table taking professional photos and asking for $30 each. You just ruined my steak and want to charge me $30 for ONE single photograph? 

Tip - ignore their dress code of "jackets preferred for men." This must be a joke. The place was packed when we got there and not one guy was wearing a jacket. We did see one guy in a wife beater, another in sweat pants, and another in shorts (supposedly not allowed).

WOW!! This was our second time coming to Prime and we loved it just as we did the first time. I took my step-daughter, her fiancé, my cousin and my step-daughters soon to be mother in-law to celebrate my step-daughters upcoming wedding. We all enjoyed every minute of it. The food was outstanding! We were able to get a seat out on the patio and what a view! The wait staff were wonderful and they even brought out a special dessert for the soon to be married couple! We will be back in Vegas this November and would love to take my husband, son and my other two step-kids. I know they would enjoy it just as we did.

Good food. All of our entrees (dry aged rib eye, seared scallops, and lamb) and sides (gratin, mac and cheese, onion rings, and sweet potatos) were great.

Service was awful! It was as if we had two waiters they just pulled offf the Strip who had never served anyone before. From the start, we had to ask for cocktails because we weren't asked if we wanted a drink. My water was never refilled the entire night! We were going to order dessert but it took them 30 min to come take our order so we just asked for the check. Then when we were trying to pay, again no attention, we were literally waving our check in the air to try and get someone's attention. 

If you can stand being ignored all night long, the food is relatively good. The 3 star rating is my average - Good rating for the food. Awful rating for the service.

Delicious food, amazing service and I highly recommend this to everyone who dines fine.... they were so accommodating...they made special sauces for me due to my interesting dietary restrictions lol. They won my heart! Thank you to both Walter and Rob for being very caring waiters and making sure all our needs and wants were met!

I went with a few guys to Vegas for a bachelor party weekend, so we hit up a few nice restaurants.

The three of us ordered the top 3 most expensive steaks on the menu and split them, so we could all try each of the steaks.  None of them impressed me. The flavor was a little watered down. Still ok, but certainly not $70 steaks.  I've had better at Ruth's Chris, and I'm not really a Ruth's Chris fan.  The truffled mashed potatoes were incredible, but they were $14 for a little side.

I asked the waiter why there were only 2 steaks on the menu that were dry aged, and he tried to tell me that wet aged was just as good as dry aged.

Overall the service was cool, and I loved the ambiance - probably the most impressive ever. But I don't think I'll be going back.

My fiancé and I ate here for dinner 3/31/15.  We were in town for the Nightclub & Bar convention and celebrating my finance's birthday.  The meal and service did not disappoint!  

Our waiter, Rob, had worked at Prime since it opened 17 years ago!  Soft-spoken, not pushy or intrusive yet he was helpful and informative, as well as super nice, Rob was a seasoned veteran in the service industry and we benefited.  All of the additional staff assisting, bringing out wine, entrees and filling our glasses etc., were wonderful as well.

To start, I ordered the Market Tomatoes and my fiancé ordered the Baby Iceberg lettuce salad.  We told Rob we would be sharing and he offered to split them for us.  We took him up on that and we were so glad we did!  Perfect portions and no scooping or reaching over the table.

For dinner, I ordered the Peppercorn New York Steak.  Seriously one of the best New York steaks I've ever had.  I highly recommend it!  It has a bit of a spicy kick to it because of the peppercorn which I loved.  My fiancé had the Dry Aged Bone-In Rib-eye.  It was delicious too.  For sides we ordered the Brussels Sprouts with bacon and pears.  Not the best I've had but they were very good.  (I read another review on here that said they had potatoes in with them, unless they changed their recipe, those weren't potatoes, they were pears.)  And we got the Gratin potatoes...crispy, cheesy potato goodness.

It really was a spectacular meal with wonderful service.

Items Selected:
Raisin Walnut, Pretzel, White, Baguette, Salted Butter
Seared Hudson Valley Foie Gras - Strawberry Rhubarb Jam, Marcona Almonds, Shaved Raw Almonds
Klein Constantia Vin de Constance 2008
Prime Onion Soup - Gruyere & Emmentaler
Market Tomatoes - Burrata Cheese, Arugula, Balsamic Vinegar, Basil
Clouds Rest 2012 Forbidden Sauvignon Blanc
Gratin Dauphinois - Comte Cheese
Glazed Market Mushrooms
Parmesan-Crusted Organic Chicken - Artichokes & Lemon Butter
18-oz Dry Aged Bone-In Rib Eye
Sauces - Soy Rice Wine, Bearnaise, Peppercorn
Walt 2012 Pinot Noir Blue Jay Anderson Valley
Barbieri Syrah 2011 Colson Canyon Vineyard
Warm Valrhona Chocolate Cake - Vanilla Ice Cream
Coconut Souffle - White Chocolate Feuilletine & Dark Chocolate Sorbet
Yuzu Pudding Cake - Toasted Almond Sorbet
Prime Cinnamon Bread Pudding - Salted Caramel Ice Cream, Golden Delicious Apples
Double Espresso on Ice

Soon to renovate the outdoor patio, but carrying over a room thought to be one of the most gorgeous in the world, PRIME Steakhouse at Bellagio had long been on a list of fine dining experiences yet to be enjoyed in Las Vegas, an admitted mistake and given the quality of the cuisine, service, and setting, perhaps even a sin.

Toqued by Rob Moore, whose brief departure to open JG Steakhouse at Aria has seen it too grow into a place held in good regard,  it was at a two-top big enough for four that my friend and I were seated, the Bellagio water show visible through large windows to the right while the draped dining room decorated in fine art soon filled to capacity at our left.

Served by a team of at least six, Sommelier John Burke entertaining us with stories from Steve Wynn's reign as well as those of bottles sold in excess of $60K, it was in a four course meal that two-hours was spent talking, the ingredient sourcing, portions, and preparations all justifying prices that may turn many diners away.

Far more classical than Carnevino or Ramsay and certainly more elegant than Delmonico or CUT, the evening began with bubbles alongside a basket of bread and making quick work of salty pretzel batons as well as a nutty raisin loaf it would not be long before a starter of seared foie gras was presented, the acidic sauce of rhubarb perhaps the most interesting steakhouse pairing seen to this moment while shaved almonds worked wonders to meld flavors of fruit to the unctuous liver of duck.

Told that soups and salads at PRIME are far more fanciful that the typical broth or wedge, round two consisted of heirloom tomatoes dressed in milky burrata atop vinegar splashed arugula plus a truly inspired bowl of French Onion, the blend of cheeses lightly toasted atop a crispy brioche float while the potage beneath was beefy enough to be noticed, though the bulk of the flavor came from the caramelized namesake ingredient itself.

No doubt a place with more than just beef to offer, though the options for steaks are plentiful without going overboard on information about sourcing from several different farms, it was in the 18oz Dry Aged Bone-In Rib Eye cooked medium rare that $71 was invested, the quality of the product allowed to show for itself while the menu's cheapest protein shined even more brightly, the pounded half-chicken fried textbook crisp beneath a Parmesan crust as sides and sauces each proved every bit as compelling, the Soy Rice Wine and Comte Potatoes each well deserving of their server-suggested clout.

Unable to resist desserts, the menu's only service error occurring when Jean-Georges' signature molten cake was served in place of the souffle selection of the trio, suffice it to say that as good as each item was there is no doubt that those with an eye for the dramatic will be wowed by cinnamon bread pudding, the tableside saucing seeing a dome of cocoa melted into the custard soaked base as notes sweet, spiced, and salty all dance on the palate.

Trending a bit more pricey than other Steakhouses on the Strip, and somewhat limited by offering only two breeds of beef with fish and seafood not really venturing too far outside the box, PRIME is undoubtedly a place worth visiting for those looking for a 'fine dining steakhouse,' particularly those averse to loud music or looking for a more romantic night out.

This was by far the best meal I've ever had in Vegas. It's super high-class and really doesn't cater to kids at all. They sat us outside where we had a perfect view of he fountain going off. It was completely romantic and made for an unforgettable night.

My husband and I each got a Caesar salad, shared an aged rib-eye, shared a 6 oz lobster tail and got the Mac n cheese as our side. We ordered the Mac and salad thinking that the portions would be small but that wasn't the case at all. The salad was huge and we had so much food that we couldn't finish the Mac. I'll be back for sure. Loved it.

Excellent restaurant!  I made reservations for my wife and I about 2 weeks in advance.  Got a seat next to the fountains and that made the meal a memorable one to say the least.  Very fancy place, as is just about everything in the Bellagio.  

We ordered the butter poached king crab as an app.  It was basically huge chunks of crab floating in a butter sauce that was absolutely delicious.  A little rich, but that's what butter poached crab is supposed to be.  I ordered the surf and turf for my meal and the wife had a great petite filet.  Both were mouth watering dishes and couldn't have been cooked any more perfectly.  The server was excellent and really knew his stuff.  He recommended a really good wine with our meal that was the perfect pairing.  

Unfortunately we didn't have room for dessert, but that was ok becasue i could taste my lobster for the rest of the evening.  Like others have said, be prepared for a $300 bill if you like wine with your meal.  

This was one of the best meals I have ever had.  Well worth the price!

The food was delicious.  The service was good. The restaurant was quaint and we had a nice view out of our window. The prices are high but it's to be expected here. The sauces for the steak were yummy. I was so happy to have my leftovers as a late night snack.
this place is great...the steak was amazing and that seafood platter we had was slamming.

Alright, let's cut the crap. 

Nice atmosphere? Yea not bad. 
Dry Aged Rib Eye? Yea it was pretty good. 
Did I go "Goo Goo Ga Ga" over this place? Absolutely not. 

Here's the problem I have when I go to a high end steak joint: you reach a point where the quality of the steak reaches its zenith and you're basically paying extra for the ambiance and service. If you're going to take my money, by all means, please work for it! 

Maybe it's just me, but I like it when the person waiting on my table is knowledgeable about the different cuts of meat. Yea, I already know all the good stuff, and I know what I'm going to order, but I find it entertaining when they go through the menu with me. Anyone off the street can stroke my ego and say, "excellent choice, Sir". 

Very good steak but I've had better (with a better experience) at other places. 

And served with steak sauces? No no no no no no nooooo, please, that's a straight up sin in my book.

Amazing service. 
Amazing food. 
Amazing wine list. 
Amazing views. 

The house sauce for the beef is to die for. It's a homemade soy rice wine and perfectly complements the meat. 

There is a bone-in 12oz fillet that you wouldn't know it was there unless the wait staff tells you about it. It's not a special, it's just not on the menu. The truffled mashed potatoes are excellent - very rich. The gulf shrimp wrapped in bacon as an appetizer was good. 

Inside is stated decor. We sat outside on the patio, overlooking the fountains at the Bellagio. We had a new show every 15 minutes. 

There is a dress code - jacket or at least collar shirt/tie for guys. It is pricey (2 of us had $300 check). But you get what you pay for in food and service. 

I have to say that the bathrooms were not what I expected of a restaurant of this caliber. They were kind of rundown, not spacious, there were hand towels that they were out of, also out of soap. Not that I need an attendant to hand me a towel and expect a big fat tip, just a little kept up.

A mixed bag: very tasty food, but at nosebleed prices without excellent service. You cannot beat the view: you are literally on the lake at Bellagio watching those famous fountain shows. And the food items we had - dry aged prime rib, filet mignon, broccoli, French onion soup and Caesar salad - were very good. But when you're paying a couple hundred bucks for dinner, you expect great service. We had ok service, and even got our food ridiculously fast from the kitchen - almost to the point where we were skeptical of it. It literally came within 10 minutes of our ordering. Seemed odd. Our waiter was distant, unwelcoming and fairly uninterested, and it ruined our experience. So between that and the price, it's just not a great place to spend a lot of money on a meal in Las Vegas.

Very disappointing experience. The service was great,but the food was not the quality we expected. I orderded a Ceaser Salad that was a joke. My husband orderded a lettuce wedge salad that had a dressing that was extremely spicy hot and he normally likes spicy food. There was no indication on the menu that it would be spicy. Also we had steak tartare that was also too spicy. My main dish was chicken that was floating in a butter sauce that was also spicy. The sauce on the broccoli was poor.

Nice place with delicious food.  Location inside Bellagio.  The bone-in filet was melt I  your mouth delicious.   All the sides were super good.  Great service.  Highly recommend the coconut souffle...it is a beautiful dessert creation for any bucket list.

It is expensive, so go there with customers (;

WOW WOW WOWWWW, POSSIBLY ONE OF MY TOP FINE DINING EXPERIENCES!

-WHY: Fine, upscale dining at its absolute best. Probably one of my top, favorite restaurants of all time.

-ATMOSPHERE: An exquisite experience with wonderful and attentive staff. One feels like a whimsical princess or royalty as the staff all make room for individuals to pass through the restaurant with ease. Their recommendations and service is fitting for this restaurant. I loved the beautiful, classy decor and low light setting.


-SEAFOOD: Large platter of various crab legs and oysters. Delicious, fresh and as good as it gets!


-STEAK: At some steak houses, people will fight with me to ensure I order the medium well rather than well done. (I do not understand this. I absolutely hate any pink in my meat and will feel sick looking at pink so how can you know what my taste buds will enjoy?)

As snooty as this sounds, I can tell how fine the dining experience will by the response I get when ordering a well-done filet mignon. Here: no funny looks or push back on my request. (The same response for my friend's extra well-done rib-eye)

I am happy to share that a well-done filet mignon is still very tender and absolutely delicious here. No chewy, jerky style meat. They know how to cook their steaks!

All meat entrees came with an assortment of fine sauces: Soy-Rice Wine (Favorite), Béarnaise, Peppercorn, Miso-Mustard


-SIDES: Creamed Spinach (I'm still drooling over the though of this, HIGHLY RECOMMEND), Truffle Mashed Potatoes (Probably the best truffle mashed potatoes I've had in my life. HIGHLY RECOMMEND), Mac & Cheese, Glazed Market Mushrooms, French Fries, Roasted Cauliflower

Great ambiance, even greater food! highly recommend the peppered tuna steak! (Ask the waiter for their house "steak sauce"!). Great butternut squash and the tuna strip appetizer was awesome as well. 

Not cheap, but worth the experience.

I am rating this place with a 5 stars ONLY because we requested a table with a view of the fountains and they delivered on it, even though they seemed very busy! Our table had to be one of the best in the restaurant, as it was very private with a perfect view of the fountain show. 

Service was great, not too pushy, but they were always there when you needed them! Food was 4 stars. My fillet Mignon was perfect....I ate the whole thing and I'm not a steak eater, but I'm not going to be that person that goes to the steak house to order something other than steak! Sides are pretty big, and I remember ordering a side that resembled baby food, like maybe sweet potatoes, but the baby food version! Wine was delicious as well! They knew it was our 1-yr. anniversary, so they surprised us with a cute lil delicious desert that said "Happy Anniversary"! 

I love it when restaurants pay attention to detail and deliver. That is how it should always be especially when you are shelling out $$$ for one meal! 

P.S. after your meal request to have your dessert or some drinks out on the patio. We did that because we heard you could, but for whatever reason they said there were no seats available at the time even though there were...oh well!

Here on a birthday trip for my wife. We had the great opportunity to stay at the Bellagio (Her dream hotel). I decided to surprise her again with tickets to "O". Before we went to the show we ate here. 

High class, fancy shmancy. This place oozes with opulence and romance. I really enjoy going to a place like this a few times a year. The lighting is low the waiters are attentive and the food is excellent. 

We started off with the french onion soup, not the best I've ever had but very good. 

The waiter then informed me that they had A5 Japanese Wagyu beef for 50 dollars per ounce. You only live once people, might as well live as much as you can. I ordered 4 ounces. 

The $200 filet came out, and it was worth every penny. The BEST filet I have or ever will have eaten in my life. I've been to some of the best steakhouses and this without a doubt was worth the $200. For me it was a once in a lifetime, unless someone else is paying next time. Melted in my mouth and had flavor for DAYS! 

The sides were mac n cheese and scalloped potatoes. Bother were great, but all I could think about was that filet... damn that was good.

Follow Up Dinner on July 27th, after a call with the assistant manager.

The main dish was refunded and the last experience was perfect again!! 5 Stars now.

Customer Service is excellent, as my original Yelp-comment was followed up immediately. Will definitely come back.
Great food, great service, and great staff, made the evening very enjoyable and memorable. Beautiful view overlooking the lake at Bellagio.

Prime is an excellent choice for flavorful steaks like the dry aged bone in rib eye and their special for the night - bone in filet mignon. We had reservations at 8:30 and arrived 10 minutes early so we had a glass a wine at the bar as we waited for our table. The bartender seemed like he was having a bad night or maybe he was just a jerk, thank goodness we only waited a few minutes until our hostess advised us that our table was ready. Besides the wonderful steaks that were a bit charred to perfection and juicy pink on the inside, we really enjoyed the famous truffled mashed potatoes. We ordered a salad with enoki mushrooms to start off with and it was large enough to share. They have an extensive wine menu and the dim lighting gives the restaurant more of a romantic feel. I enjoyed my meal very much but may stick with Craftsteak and Cut in the future since they have much better service.

We had made reservations for our anniversary a week in advance with requests to be seated at window overlooking Bellagio Fountains. When we arrived, they were very courteous and seated us exactly as requested! What a great view.
The entire waitstaff was attentive and professional and drinks were out in no time. They did not rush us and went through the menu thoroughly if needed. I am on a special diet and they were able to accommodate without any problems!
I ordered the filet mignon with lobster, which was amazing. The filet originally came out a little over done, but they quickly remedied the situation and I had a new one cooked perfectly, and quickly without any blemish in our dining experience. The food was delicious and plentiful. The overall experience was well worth the price and we will be back every time we come to Las Vegas. It's no big secret that Las Vegas is becoming the food capital of the US, and Prime at Bellagio is definitely setting the bar!
They even brought us a dessert with a candle and decorated with anniversary wishes on it! They definitely went beyond what was expected and deserve 5 Stars! Don't miss this place!

Heard about this restaurant before but never tried, well on a whim my family and I made reservations and boy we had a fabulous dinner!  Things to know: this place is not cheap! Be prepared to spend a pretty penny for a fabulous meal (keep in mind this is the Vegas strip!) that said the service was superb; so for me worth the higher price point! Our waiter was extremely attentive and knowledgeable! What an awesome delight! The decor was traditional, elegant high end steakhouse design....very classy!  I would highly recommend this restaurant and can't wait to go back!!!!

inside the Bellagio Hotel  is The best restaurant in America ! ..
 Sea food platter for a table of 10....get your scuba gear ready and dive...I've never seen a presentation like that,..totally awsome.
