The Steak & Garlic mashed potatos, wine selection to die for, ....  The Art Deco decour  is out of this world,  phenomenal service, everything is just extraordinary...I wish I lived next door.

The best place to eat in Vegas!  No doubts!  

Took my wife to Prime for her birthday off a recommendation and the experience couldn't have been better.  A la carte style restaurant which can get a little expensive but absolutely worth the price.  Can't beat watching the fountains from inside the restaurant.  You'll want to make reservations...and early.  We decided late and had to make reservations for 5:30.  This was easily the BEST meal my wife or I have ever eaten, period!  If I could give it more stars, I would.  

We'll definitely be back when we are in Vegas again.

I would have given The Prime 5 stars, if not for one experience I had. But before I get into that, here are the positives: It is one of the most beautiful resturants in all of Las Vegas (especially if your fortunate enough to get a good table with a view of the dancing Bellagio fountains). The food is superb, and service is great. The prices are in-line with other high end resturants in Vegas. Now, as for the reason why I did not give it 5 stars: One time, when I made reservations for dinner, the hostess asked me if there was any special occasion that they should be aware of....I said yes, it was my mom's 80th birthday...the hostess then said "wonderful, I will make a note of it". When we showed up for dinner they literally gave us the worst table in the resturuant (right near the entrance, with no lake view, and people constantly walking by). There was also no complimentary cake, or anything else, for my mom (not even a "Happy Birthday" greeting). Needless to say, I was very disappointed that The Prime did nothing special for her....I am sure it was just an oversight, but I still have to subtract 1 star for that night.

Every time we come here we are never disappointed! Not only is the food delicious the service is fantastic! This is what fine dinning should be all about!  We split a filet mignon  and lobster tail. To die for and had their famous scalloped potatoes! It was perfect I would defiantly recommend coming here it is the perfect!

We had a lovely dinner last night. The host staff was very accommodating by reserving a table on the patio for our dinner. The patio was beautiful, and the view of the fountain show was spectacular. It was a very intimate, date-worthy spot. Our food was delicious, with my bone-in ribeye cooked perfectly, melting in my mouth. The service was a little spotty. My date had to ask a few different people for his soft drink several times. Our server (I cannot remember his name - he was probably in his thirties, Asian-American with glasses) was very rigid and quite inattentive. I could tell he was profiling his tables and spending the majority of his time with the wealthiest looking table in his section. His SA was very pleasant, and very attentive. The food runner did auction off our entrees, which is something that I'm not accustomed to at establishments like this, but was very pleasant. The portion size of the bacon wrapped shrimp was awkward since there were two people enjoying it, but the sauce was to die for, and the shrimp AND bacon were cooked perfectly. I would order this again, just for myself, though. I am eager to return to try more of the seafood and wine selections.
#ComingFromPeopleInTheIndustry

This is a great restaurant, especially if you are meat eater.  I was not overjoyed with my two salads, but what can you expect at a steak house?  Great ambiance.  Excellent service.  The wine list did not get me excited, but then again, wine's that go well with steak are not my thing.  I probably won't go back, but only because I don't love steak.

Awesome!
I was going to dock this place 1 star for the prices but then i realized they were pretty consistent with every other steakhouse I've eaten in.  

I went with a group 7 and we unanimously decided that this steakhouse was amongst the best we've dined in-not one complaint.  My lamb chops, although not medium well as i requested, was very tender and flavorful.  The broccoli rob that accompanied the lamb was good but a bit more bitter than i was anticipating.  Fries were great.

What sets this steakhouse apart from the rest was the ambiance.  The windows of the place looked right out on to the bellagio lake; we got great views of the water show all throughout the meal...nice little touch.  

Service was outstanding; our waiter was polite, professional and attentive.

Like i said, a standard 3 course meal with drink and tip will cost well over $100pp so be prepared for that.

Bottom line-highly recommended, particularly if you're not on a budget.

Was here for my birthday dinner and it was great.

Tried the Rib Eye and it was delicious.

Bacon wrapped jumbo shrimp were awesome.

Mash Potatoes were fluffy and creamy, asparagus was so tender.

Bread was soft and tasty.

One thing you get here is class. Great service and great food, but come here without a budget, because you will spend some dough.  

Been to enough steakhouses to say this steak was one of a few best I have ever tasted.

The prices are high not because they might be better then other places, but it's the location and a nice view.

Treat yourself to a nice dinner while you're in Vegas, would say try this one, but with many options I will probably take my money some where else to see what other great restaurant is out there next time.

This restaurant is definitely a must when visiting Las Vegas. My husband and I were referred to Prime to celebrate our anniversary, and we are so glad decided to make a reservation there. The feel is very elegant inside, yet the hostesses and servers are warm and friendly. Especially so for our server- Walter. He was incredibly friendly, chatty, and personable. We felt as if we were eating at his house with how comfortable he made us feel while dining there. 
The food was as amazing as the service. Hubby had the peppercorn steak and I had the salmon. Both were melt in your mouth goodness. They also brought a few different sauces to go with the entrees, but there was no need for sauce at all. They were delicious already without anything extra. 
The only thing that we felt kind of ruined the night was the photographer, Morgan. She was friendly, but it seemed forced and fake. When she came to take pics, she made it very posed and studio style right at our table. Beware- the pics are very expensive- something like $50 and up for two poses which she doesn't mention in the beginning. I've been to Morton's for a special occasion and they've taken our pic, but never charged for it. When i politely declined after she brought us the pics, she gave me a dirty look, and cold fake smile then left. It was a shame because this occurred at the end of the meal so despite the amazing experience in the beginning and the middle, the end part is now what's stuck in my head. 
We will definitely return to Prime next time we're in Vegas. We will ask for Walter and make sure to decline the pics in the beginning.

Quick side note- the area where you can view the Bellagio fountains is under construction until Dec 2015. Unfortunately when I booked the reservation a month before, and confirmed the day before no one ever mentioned about the construction. The view of the fountains was one of the main reasons why I made our reservation!! It was very disappointing when the hostess informed me upon checking in. Fortunately, she put us at a table that still faced Windows looking over a part of the Bellagio lake, and ending up working out anyway since we were taken care of by Walter.

Steakhouse was delicious. View was great. However it was definitely pricier than steaks I have gotten back in NYC that are better. I know being compared to a Peter Lugers, Keens or Del Friscos is a hard hand to be dealt but if you're gonna charge more than those places and then name yourself "Prime" then you're challenging someone to wonder. I wouldn't consider this steak equal. Its still great but I'm being critical for the reasons above. 

All that said, I didn't have a horrible experience. I ordered a filet mignon rare. Before you jump on me for being at a steak house and ordering filet just understand that I wasn't hungry. Everyone else ordered the bone-in rib eye med rare or rare and I got to taste it. 

My steak didn't come out rare. It came out medium. The catch is someone else ordered a filet and they got theirs rare but ordered medium. By the time I realized it was too late since my friend started eating his while I was in the bathroom. So the servers messed up. Whatever. 

Again, just want to end with this place isn't horrible. It has an average rating of 4/5 for a reason. Im being critical on purpose. When i go back to Vegas Ill be visiting a different steakhouse though. It wasn't good enough to compete with the best so I have no reason to be loyal to them when there are so many other options I have yet to try there. 

TLDR: It is overpriced and not as good as the best NYC steakhouses I have been to. Its still good. The view is great.

After reading some reviews I was a bit dissapointed that this place couldn't keep to one standard. Lucky for me I was one of the guests that enjoyed my meal and the service.

We got a table in the back of the restuarant in between the kitchen entrance and the bathroom. Not very happy about that but I guess thats what I get for making a late reservation.

There was three of us and we all kind of shared our meals. Caesar salad to start. BOO this was the worst part of the meal. I felt like the salad wasnt freshly tossed in the dressing, but was sitting there getting soggy and unpleasant. 

We ordered the porterhouse, filet, and off the menu a bone in filet. All cooked to a perfect medium rare. 

The bone in really took our breath's away. At $70 it damn well better! The other two steaks were very good as well. Nice cuts and cooked to perfection.

We ordered the mac n cheese. It was good but I have had better.

Also the broccoli with cheddar. Not that great. something about cheddar cheese to me just makes a meal cheap. 

Overall, it was a great meal and great service. We didnt have any wine with dinner but their list is very impressive. 

Make sure you call a head of time and request a table with a view of the fountains as that as truly a special event to see during dinner.

I almost feel like a jackass for giving this such a low rating, but since my experience didn't feel any special, why not be honest right?

Once arriving at Prime, I noticed that things seemed to be a little out of order. My group (4 of us) had made a reso for 8pm, and arrived about 10 minutes early. Once I went to the hostess to confirm, she had told me it would be about 20 minutes (place was not even half full). Now, I don't mind waiting at all. I've been in the restaurant biz all my life, and I know the tricks of the trade. Mainly, when a restaurant is empty and they tell you to wait, it's generally a way to get you over to the side bar to buy a round of drinks. Usually I would take the bait because Kris loves me some drankssss....but this time we decided to pass since we were drinking at the pool all day.

Once finally seated, the service was outstanding. If there was no food involved, I would give this place 5 stars on the service I recieved. By service, I mean someone who greeted us quickly, explained the menu in detail, provided a wine list, and made sure drinks were filled at any opportunity they could be filled.

Now on to the food. EHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH.

I am no food snob. I would rather eat nachos and dirty water hot dogs then have a fancy french dinner. However, I do enjoy a nice outing every now and then, and don't mind spending for it. The sides were very good. It was a few weeks back, but I remember getting a potato side that was outstanding. Also, their side of brocali was perfect.

The real problem was the steaks. 3 out of 4 of them were just horrendous. I ordered the Ribeye. I order Ribeyes' just about every where I go for steak. Mainly bc of the quantity, and the heaviness to the cut. This was probably the fattiest steak I have ever seen in my 26 years on earth. Where did they cut this from, the cows ass? Seriously, I was perplexed as to which part of the cow this fat came from. I looked around and almost laughed out loud because I thought I might have been on a game show. 

I ate up all of the side dishes, and the portions were a good size. I left about 3/4 of the steak with all of the fat cut up on the plate. Now, I would NEVERRRR complain about food at a restaurant, it's just no my style. The way I look at it, I CAME INTO YOUR KITCHEN, and you cooked for me. If I don't like it, shame on me. However, being a bartender I know that if I saw my guest barely touch his 60 or 70 dollar entree, I would ask if something was wrong. The server didn't say a word as he took my plate, which made me want to shove it down his throat. (Just kidding, wanted to add dramatic effect!)

All in all, very nice place but I am sure there has to be better options for an expensive steak. And if there isn't, Im sticking to sushi and hooters.

Prior to seeing "O" that evening, my Mom had put in her vote for a "steakhouse", and left us to decide between Fix and PRIME. After browsing through a few reviews, in addition to reading through the menu, we decided on PRIME. The restaurant itself is absolutely stunning, and the front-row seats to the fountains (both indoor and out) certainly didn't hurt. The waitstaff was out of this world - attentive, humorous, and knowledgeable (ask for Howard, you won't be disappointed.) Cocktails were perfectly balanced, and dangerously delicious. Their Gluten-Free menu was extensive, and Howard made sure every side that could be made GF was, as well as oversaw the plating to ensure neither my Mom nor I got sick. I don't believe there is a bad dish on the menu, from the Colorado Lamb to the Filet Mignon (the Steak Tartare was divine, and both the Truffle Mashed Potatoes and Ginger Sweet Potatoes were out of this world.) While certainly not a restaurant we will return to daily, this will absolutely be our go-to spot for special occasions.

Excellent steaks! Perfectly cooked (medium rare) dry-aged bone-in ribeye and bone-in filet; very succulent. Fantastic truffled mashed potatoes with real truffles and not the usual overwhelming use of truffle oil. Very good wine menu.

Over priced, over wrought, over hyped, and under performing.  The food is OK but nothing to brag about.  Everything on the menu outperforms the meat.  

There are a great number of places that I would go first to fulfill my protein desires.

For an equal, if not better, view of the fountains go to Picasso!

I love steakhouses and I had high expectations for the food and service and my party and I experienced mixed results.

First the service.  It was cordial but totally lacking in enthusiasm and warmth.  The waiter was talking super fast and it felt like he couldn't get rid of our table fast enough because we didn't order some $500 bottle of wine.  Only one person drinks in our party of 5 so what can I do?  Asking for water was also annoying - Sparkling or still?  Still.  Bottled?  No, tap is delicious thank you very much.  (then look of disappointment on the waiter's face).

The beef tartar & carpaccio and the tomato mozarella appetizers were good but not amazing.  I've had equally good at other restaurants.

We all ordered steaks and the most disappointing was the filet mignon.  It was very tender but it had ZERO beef taste and it was overcooked even when I asked for medium rare.  The best was the Kansas grass-fed rib-eye.  The porterhouse was good but again, not amazing.  I've had better steaks at restaurants that are half the price of this place.  Heck, even the reserve aged steaks at Vons are better than the filet mignon here.

The dessert selection was boring.  We shared the profiteroles and a cheesecake.  Not impressed.

Also, one odd thing - the bread they serve is cold.  I prefer warm/toasted bread with my dinner.

I guess this place isn't bad if your meal is comped by the casino or if you're on an expense account.

Excellent food, great ambiance and beautiful decor. Service was good. Sometimes I feel like the waiter is selling you to much but overall really good. I loved to not see people wearing sundresses and shorts to an elegant restaurant.
Excellent service, excellent food, excellent ambience! 5 stars if you go you must sit on the patio area, when I went it was down for remodeling so I guess I will have to come back again

My husband and I decided to treat ourselves to a pricey dinner for our 10th anniversary. A first for us! We were seated, and based on the service, we were so impressed, and resolved to do this more often. However, after we ate our food, we quickly changed our mind! For the price, our meal was DEFINITELY not worth it! I would have rather taken the money spent and put it toward the couch I've been wanting for like a year...there's only a little resentment here ;)

I would give a 5+ on service, but food, really just average, and no where near worth the price.
It was alright.  Would not return.  There are so many better steakhouses in Las Vegas.

I was very impressed with the quality of the steak and the atmosphere was nice. Had the 28 oz Ribeye and they cut it for us so that we could share. Sat right by the fountain but unfortunately we were there at 5:30pm so really couln't enjoy the show which looks better at night. It's not a Mastros but decidedly better than most in Vegas. Wine list had some really expensive selections on there but went with the waiter's suggestion which only cost 60 bucks.

After much deliberation on the choice of steakhouse to dine at on our Saturday night we picked Prime.  I have to say I'm a bit disappointed.  I really wanted the Wow factor and didn't get it.  The service was excellent.  The view overlooking the fountains was great.  The food was average. My husband tried the aged bone in rib eye. He said it was good but not better than a regular rib eye he has had elsewhere. I had the salmon.  Again, it was good but that's as far as it goes. The side dishes were tasty although it seemed like there was a lot of salt in everything. $250 for 2 meals, 2 sides and 2 cocktails.

This was my second time at Prime and I was really looking forward to the same wonderful experience I had the first time a few years back. 

To start with, this was a Monday night at about 9:00pm. My wife and I took our 2 friends there after bragging about our last experience. We did not have reservations but we were easily seated, unfortunately in the very back part of the restaurant as far away from the fountain as can be. The evening began pleasantly enough with our drink order from the bar. My wife ordered a very dirty martini and absolutely loved it. Our friend ordered a Lemon Drop and unfortunately it tasted more like syrup than anything else. She refused to send it back and made the best of it. After placing our complete order we asked the waiters assistant if we could have some bread (like we noticed the other tables were having almost immediately after being seated, not us) and the response was a bit stiff with "I'll be there as soon as I can." We were eventually served some delicious sourdough bread and pretzel bread. The bread was delicious and we made quick work of it. As it was taking a while for our food to be prepared (no complaint here as good food should take some time) we asked the waiters assistant if we could have some more of the pretzel bread. His response this time was "we are out of pretzel bread because it is so late, that is also why you didn't get any raisin bread." Let me state that 9:00pm in Las Vegas is not late. I am also not sure what the point was to tell us what we didn't get. My wife then asked for more sourdough and his response was "Are you sure? You have a lot of food coming." After making it clear that we would still like to have the bread it was brought out without any further comment. We took it with a grain of salt and let it go.

The rest of the entrees were eventually brought out and the food was fabulous. Paying a premium at a nice restaurant is a treat for most people, like us. We absolutely do not mind doing it but when the experience falls short, then it makes it so not worth it. As much as I enjoy the food at Prime, I feel that this may have been my last visit there. I will happily try one of the many other Steakhouses with excellent Yelp reviews the next time I am in Vegas.

Save your money and skip the completely overrated/flavorless Wagyu ribeye - if a $35 per ounce steak is suppose to taste like that then the world has gone completely insane.  Plus it must have been the bartenders first day, fresh out of the corner bar tending school, how is it possible to make such a subpar manhattan and don't even bother ordering a sazerac unless you want a club soda and watered down J&B on the rocks (which is not even close to the actual drink).  The only thing that was marginally good was the breadbasket. The waitstaff was incompetent and smug. I'm not sure what happened to Vegas and especially the Bellagio but 5 diamonds, really?  I wish Michelin still rated the restaurants out here.

This steakhouse is located downstairs of the Bellagio on the side by the fountains. The escalators can be found next to Giorgio Armani. Dress is business casual (no shorts). Very plush decor and dim lighting makes it a cozy dining experience. They do have a small patio area for outdoor seating as well.

You can view the menu we had on our visit on 3/1/15 since there are a few price and dish changes: https://butterfly1465.wordpress.com/2015/05/01/prime-steakhouse/

Our Order:
Potato Gnocchi
Sea Bass
Porterhouse
Dry Aged Ribeye
Bone in Filet Mignon
Bottle of Red Wine: ($188) 13528 Isoceles - Justin Vineyards & Winery from Paso Robles. 77% Cabernet Sauvignon, 12% Merlot, 11% Cabernet Franc.
Double Espresso: ($5.75) Added a twist of orange zest

The BF ordered the Bone in Filet Mignon. The meat was tender and extremely juicy. It was quite funny because as people were eating, there was a lot of moaning and comments on how good the steaks were made. The two favorite sauces were the Peppercorn and the Béarnaise sauce (made of clarified butter emulsified in egg yolks and white wine vinegar and flavored with herbs). BF wanted to try the Sea Bass and since I was still full from lunch, I obliged him (even though I didn't think it was a good idea). Unfortunately, I wasn't too fond of the fish, it had flaky chunks of meat but was slightly dry and didn't taste really fresh. I suggest just sticking to the meats here.

Service was excellent. I had requested a table close to the windows for the birthday boy and the table definitely gave us a great view of the shows. We were super lucky because it had just stopped raining and the night was clear for us to easily see the show. Our waiter was able to give us great descriptions of the food and provided fantastic recommendations. The chairs were pulled out for everyone and every time someone walked away, their napkins were folded. Drinks were constantly refilled and since there was a waiter always nearby, anything we needed was quickly retrieved.

Dinner came out to about $100/person for our group of 7 and was really worth it. With several good restaurant picks for my BF's friend's birthday, I've now been assigned as the restaurant-picker on all future trips! :D

Likely the best meal we've had in Vegas to date!

Snagged an early (5:45pm) reservation last minute on Open Table. We had skipped lunch and were hungry early, so this was great.

Dress code says jackets are recommended, but I think I only saw one or two men actually wearing one. My husband wore a button down shirt and dress pants and looked fine. I saw men in Polo shirts, so don't worry about not being snazzy enough. It's the sort of place that is fine with business casual, but you wouldn't feel out of place if you got really dressed up.

We were seated right next to the window with an amazing view of the fountains. We had a main waitress, along with another waiter and a nice young man that served our drinks and cleared our plates. My husband ordered a glass of the house cabernet. Fair warning, it was $26! This is not the place to go if money is tight.

We skipped appetizers. My husband ordered the surf and turf (large lobster tail and beautiful fillet). It was the "special" that evening and came with a $120 price tag. I opted for the salmon which came in closer to the $40 mark. Although my salmon came with (fantastic) truffle mashed potatoes, we also split the gratin dauphinois. Highly recommend. Everything was divine! The sauces that accompanied my husband's steak were delicious and I practically licked my plate clean. 

The restaurant itself is beautiful. Very opulent. Decorated in light blue and chocolate brown. Heavy drapery. Food is brought out on a rolling tray under silver domes. Fancy schmancy. I was a bit surprised that my napkin wasn't swapped out for a black one since I was wearing a black dress. Seemed like the sort of place to do that.

We ordered the cheesecake, and while nothing out of this world, it was still delicious. The bill came. $320. Whew! This is now our most expensive meal to date. But you know what? You only live once. When in Rome (Vegas), right?

Party of 6. Reservation to sit by the patio a month ago. Got there at 8 and the hostess told us its gonna be another hour wait. Thats fine... we waited. An hour later we got sat. We ordered our food and never got our food. Manager comes over and APOLOGIZES with the most bitter attitude and asks if we wanna cancel our order.... Seriously?! RUDE MANAGER but our waiter was good. Theres no point in staying waiting for food that was "on the way" for the last 40 minutes.

One of the best experiences I've ever had at a restaurant. Not only was my ribeye steak perfect but the service was outstanding. They sat us at the window so we can see the water fountain show. We loved everything about this place. Totally worth checking out for an overall Vegas experience. Awesome steaks, great service and hopefully you get lucky and have a table near a window for the water show. Can't wait to go back!

Celebrated my birthday here MLK weekend along with a group of friends and we were very satisfied!  The service was top notch. The food was delicious.  Started with the beet salad as an appetizer and shared the porterhouse -  which we were told was a 22oz cut.  Had my steak medium and the size was perfect for two people. There was 3 different sauces for the steak that you can try but the steak was good enough on its own even without the sauces.  We also shared sides of the cauliflower and steamed asparagus which was also very good. We were seated close to the window and had a great view of the fountains. 

We had our pictures taken by the photographer and it turned out to be pretty nice. We paid for our pictures and gave her a tip.  She was sweet and professional.  

Highly recommend.

If there's one weakness I have, it's a good steak.  Therefore, I tend to enjoy my steakhouses.  Prime provided me with a truly divine experience, and not only from a culinary perspective; the service, presentation, and ambiance were second to none.  Magnificently situated on the lagoon in front of the Bellagio, it's subdued and pleasing on the eyes, but provides sweeping views of the fountains every 15 minutes.  I ordered a Porterhouse and an 8oz. lobster tail.  It wasn't cheap by any means, but by golly was it worth it.  The steak was cooked to perfection, and just as I had ordered it (medium rare).  Many steakhouses and restaurants have the tendency to stray on the conservative side, particularly when it comes to raw meat.  Not this time.  The strip and filet were both delicious, flavorful, and tender, and the medley of sauces they provided only added to the experience.  The lobster tail, well, does lobster tail really need any introduction?  Highly recommended if you want to escape the hubbub of some of the more mainstream dining choices in Vegas; it was a taste of culinary serenity nestled in the middle of a zoo.

Alright, we are not hard to please. The service was way below average. Little things like forgetting water a couple of times, unfriendly interactions, etc. Had a hair in my tomato and burrata salad. Not a big deal just figured they would give me a new, hairless one... Nope the guy pondered at the table for a couple seconds debating if the hair was there or not. After deciding he took the salad back to the kitchen and came back with... An apology? Not a new one?? He asked if I wanted a different salad but if not a complementary dessert would be provided. Nice gesture.... Yeah except I already asked for dessert for my boyfriends birthday with a candle and writing on the plate when I made the reservation...that was forgotten too... The two stars are for the bone-in ribeye and the onion soup. Really bummed we spent a pretty penny and it left more to be desired. Took a doggy bag home for the ribeye and the only thing left in the box was the bone? Not coming back.

I just thought it was a typical menu with a typical steak for Vegas
The view of the water was great. 
Nothing memorable

Not up to par with Vegas standards.  Dining room is accented with blues and ivories against espresso colored wood.  Magnificent, but it did not hide the lack of bells and whistles in the meal.  The filet was less than spectacular, and the plate was barren.  You have to pay for your sides, I expect them to throw me a few spears of asparagus when I'm paying $50 for a slab of meat!  The crusted sea bass was a firmer texture, more like tuna or halibut.  I was impressed by the customer service and the austere presence of the dining room, but I certainly was not counting the days till I was coming back to this restaurant.  The fact that Las Vegas Life magazine named Prime the best steakhouse still won't bring me back here.

Very classy restaurant with kind staff and delicious food! Our steaks came out a little over cooked but our waiter was quick to fix it and they came back perfect and tender. Our side of Au gratin potatoes hit the spot, but barely big enough to share- thats ok though because our steaks were filling. We were able to watch the Bellagio fountain and it was a really nice, beautiful view. All in all this place was wonderful!

Awesome steakhouse, the service is exactly what you expect from this type of establishment and they provide great direction when it comes to selecting a bottle from their superb wine list. There's only a few good steakhouses (proper, not a nouveau style) in Vegas, this is one of them. The star rating is obviously taking into account the area - I've had slightly better in other parts of the country, but you will not go wrong with Prime.
This meal was worth every penny.  Sitting on the edge of the patio with views of the Bellagio's fountains is, in my humble opinion, the best way to enjoy an awesome steak dinner!

OK so first things first - this place is EXPENSIVE. But in the realm of steak places on the strip, it's competitive. 

Our overall experience here was wonderful. We sat near the windows and enjoyed a fantastic view of the Bellagio fountains all evening. The atmosphere is relaxed but still giving a sense of occasion, with a beautifully decorated dining room and traditional service to
match. Our server, Thomas, was friendly, engaging and helpful throughout, making us feel at home in an environment slightly
out of our comfort zone.

The food was excellent. I had the bone-in filet mignon - tender and sweet with a little extra flavour from the bone, and a delicious seasoned crust from the grill. The sprouts on the side were very good as well. My wife enjoyed her scallops very much as well. We shared a lovely warm chocolate cake for dessert followed by some nice tea (spot the English...).

One word of caution - this place has a dress code. No scruffbags in shorts or flip flops here!

This was my 3rd JG restaurant... I have been to 'Spice Market' in NYC and 'Market' in Cabo San Lucas... both top notch.

This place was fantastic... from the decor to the dessert.  

I was there with a large group of people and never felt like neglected.  We started at the bar area- martinis were great.  Cocktails were stiff.  Service was way above par.  Our server was knowledgable and fun.  Had a great sense of humor... but wasn't annoying.  Was there when you needed him yet not hovering.

The wine selection was spot on.

The seafood tower was to die for.  They gave a very large portion and it was beutifully presented.  The heirloom tomato and burata salad I had was excellent.  

I had the braised shortribs.  I also tried many other people's steaks. All fabulous.  The sides were spot on (truffle mashed.... get it!).

Desserts were also amazing.   

This place is expensive, yes... but for a special occasion you can't beat it.  The level of service makes the check worth it.  Prime was a great experience overall.  I highly reccommend it.

Drop-dead gorgeous view (if you sit on the patio). My husband and I had reservations right at 5 when the opened (as we had a show at 7) and we asked for patio seating. So incredibly worth it. The Bellagio fountains went, it was a beautiful night, they waiters were extremely accommodation, and the food - oh the food. While you will certainly pay top dollar, its worth it. The filet is melt in your mouth happiness. I would recommend this place to anyone who wants to splurge for the night before a nice show.

We'll they do it well here at prime, the restaurant is nice and if your lucky enough to get a view of the fountains even better.  Service was awesome, but i expect it to be at a place like this.  I started with the chilled seafood platter and it did not disappoint, my main was the dry bone-in ribeye  with mac and cheese side.  The steak was perfect, i found the mac and cheese a little bit on the bitter side, I'm used to a more sweet taste for my mac and cheese.  Overall, great place for a great dinner, expect great service and to be full by the end of your meal.

I made a reservation for my daughters birthday. Requested a good table and we were seated in the back of the restaurant. There were available tables by the windows. We ordered filet and sea bass. The sea bass was not good. The filet was ok, but we've had many better steaks. The gnocchi was delicious. Our service was not up to par for a restaurant with these prices.  We won't go back.

Best meal I have ever had and I know good food. But not the best dessert.
 First off all I asked for a table by the window to see the water desplay when I booked it. i got there and they had us wait for 20 minutes and then kept seating other people by the window so i was pissed but then they came over to us and said since it was so important to us to see the water show they reserved us a table outside on the patio. It was AMAZING. The food was outstanding to. Loved everything but the dessert. Will definitely be going back.

Yes, it is an excellent steakhouse....  the peppercorn new york strip was incredible.  the mashed potatoes were out of this world.   the sauteed mushrooms were the best I've ever had.
Fancy/Dressy- yes.
The service----  let's just say our server had mild anger management issues. I sinced it immediately,  I am a feeler and I picked up on his negative energy  immediately.
I should comment that as the night went on the servers  attitude elevated, but I must say I am knocking off a star because of his demeanor and poor knowledge of wine.

Experience was great except for the hostess and her huge attitude.  Made reservations more than a week in advance.  Arrived about 15 minutes early and were seated in the kitchen doorway.  When asked to be moved (lots of empty tables) we were told those were for reservations.  Pointed out we had a reservation and we were moved to a nice table.  Waiter and his staff were wonderful.  Appetizers - shrimp and salmon sushi were excellent.  Butternut squash soup amazing.  And the dinner - we had salmon, filet and ny steak were all amazing.  Side dishes excellent.  I am knocking this review from a five star to four star solely because of the extreme attitude of the hostess.  Visited many steakhouses of this caliber and never had a hostess with that attitude.

Three stars because the steak was so over salted I couldn't eat it.

Beautiful, opulent decor.  Service good, not great. Waiters seemed busy, didn't check in about main course, was difficult to keep my water glass full.

Appetizers were excellent - tuna ribbons was delicious, loved the ginger/chili/soy/whatever marinade, french onion soup among the best I've had with a subtle flavor and good blend of cheese, crab salad was pretty good.

Got the dry aged bone in rib steak and the soy garlic strip steak, both cooked medium. Quality of the meat was excellent, and temperature was perfect. Soy garlic strip was a little salty (but within expectations for an Asian marinade). Rib steak was so salty I couldn't eat it. Left over more than half. First time that has ever happened to me in a steak place. 

Split the chocolate cake dessert which was excellent.

This may have just been a fluke (judging by other positive reviews), but I won't go back. For the price (300+ for two people), the meal should be perfect.

i've been a fan of jean george restaurants for quite some time. My favs are Cafe Martinique and Dune in the Bahamas.  I've been to Prime a few times and each time I come away with a feeling that the staff really loves their job.  I usually get my usual - filet w/a lobster tail, french fries and usually whatever the waiter suggests for an appetizer.  Make sure to arrange for a reservation in advance - its a small restaurant and they sell out.  If you are staying at a suite in Bellagio - use their VIP service to try to get you a last minute reservation.  P.S. The bartenders have a terrific sense of humor.

Holy crap.....Top 3 best meals of my life for sure.  So I flew to vegas just for the evening to see my parents who were visiting and staying at the Bellagio....which was amazing in itself.  So we didn't have any set in stone dinner plans, but we were looking forward to a great meal.  I had heard prime was good, but my dad was actually the one who suggested it.  So we made reservation for 8:45 cuase my parents were going to see Criss Angel (which they said was so atrocious...) so they left early, and we were all starving so we went down to see if we could get in early, and to our surprise they sat us around 8:30 since they were super busy...It was 15 minutes- but still they did everything they could to help us out.  So we sat and were promptly greeted, and I mean service was wonderful and super friendly.  Our server even told us that they were understaffed that night (wow, they work well together) 

So let me tell you what I was super impressed with (i'm pretty easy to please) but our server came over to open our wine...we ordered the Bethel Heights Pinot Noir, which isn't a baller wine, but a really amazing Pinot.  Anyways- so he came over to present it and as he was about to open it the table next to us very rudely kept telling him to come over while he was in the midst of opening the wine.....so I told him it would be fine if he found out what they wanted....since they were making a big to-do about it....it was actually quite absurd and rude.....and he goes "No way, I am opening your wine, and you come first...." now this other table had multiple bottles of very expensive wine/champagne, and were a party of over 10.....the reason I was impressed was becuase the server didn't think about the money he was making with the other table, he made sure to take care of us and give us great service.  I was really happy.

Now the food:  WOW.  I ordered the onion soup to start....I don't think once in my life have I ever been able to finish a full onion soup.....i almost licked the bowl, it was amazing.  My mom and I decided to split the 28 ounce ribeye (very very ambitious)  We obviously didnt' even come close.  But it was cooked to absolute medium rare perfection....the truffle mashed potatoes were super super super smooth- and absolutely melted in your mouth.  We also go the broccolli....okay i'm started to get hungry just talking about this food.  Anyways service was out of this world, food was incredible and the atmosphere warm and chairs were super comfy!!  I can't wait to go back :)
Always looking forward coming to Prime. Best of everything. Great food, ambiance and staff. Thank you and Merry Xmas

Excellent service, location and atmosphere. Wait staff is on point, recommendations and service exceptional. Decor is beautiful, loved outside seating next to the fountains the mist was nice on a warm night. Beautiful and perfect evening

What a disappointment! It's too bad that Prime is a big sore spot in what is otherwise a very strong lineup of restaurants at Bellagio.

Unfortunately, we encountered service issues all night. Overall, the waitstaff seemed very slow and inattentive - which is amazing considering how many staff they seem to have just standing around - and I think some of the problems indicate poor management and training. Most noticeable was that we often had to flag down waiters to get our wine and water refilled. The food runners also kept putting food in front of the wrong people - this happened with our appetizers, entrees, and even after-dinner drinks! The most mind-boggling service failure occurred when the runners brought out all appetizers, salads, and soups at the same time, leaving a bunch of appetizers to be chucked in the middle of the table vaguely near the person who ordered them (and only after we told the runners who had ordered what).

Also, I think the way Prime does the table settings and places food could be improved; we were at a larger round table and it felt like waiters were constantly leaning over us to get to stuff nearer the middle of the table - personal space violations abound!

And even given the service problems, Prime's biggest failing was that our steaks were very poorly prepared. Mine was perhaps the worst; they offered a bone-in filet as a special, which I ordered medium rare but came out extreme 'black and blue' - gushing red in the middle while being charred on the outside. Several party members noted they had steaks that were overcooked. The steak was also very, very salty.

Originally, I was going to give +1* because of some solid sides, including the truffle mashed potatoes, macaroni and cheese, gnocchi, and Brussels sprouts; also, my tuna ribbons appetizer was tasty, with a nice spicy kick to the accompanying sauce. The problem is, who goes to Prime for appetizers and sides and ignores the steak and bad service? I wouldn't, and even though Prime is closer to a 1.5, that's why I can't in good faith rate any higher than 1*.

Disappointed all around.  

The ONLY bright spot was that we were able to nab a patio seat, so the view and the entire spectra of the water show was a major plus.
Besides that, everything else was all down hill.
We were seated 10 minutes later than my 8:30pm reservation on a busy Friday night.  This is a given and I have no problem with this, considering that we did get the patio seating.

Here are the breakdowns...


Service : There was only 2 servers, that I saw, serving the entire patio floor, of perhaps 8 table or so.  It was difficult to flag a server for help.  For a restaurant of this caliber, I shouldn't have to flag a server, much less wrestle to get their attention.
In addition, the delivery of the drinks, the bread, and the food was painfully slow.  If not for the water show at the Bellagio fountain every 15 minutes, I would've thrown my hands in the air long before we received our food.

Food: Our order was taken at about 8:50pm.  
Our drinks and bread came at around 9:00pm (10 minutes after the order was taken?)  The 3 different types of bread were all cold and stale, but we were all famished so our party took in what we had.
The food came around 9:30pm (40 minutes AFTER our order!!!)
It arrived COLD and uninspired.  The cream of spinach was so cold that I could not separate it.  The whole thing lifted from its plate as one whole lump piece.
GROSS!
None of the food was warm, or hot.  Why the food was left standing for so long is beyond me.  Our party was too tired from our delayed flight in to make an effort to flag a server to let them know of the food quality.
The porter house steak was uninspiring and overpriced at best.  The new york steak which was literally covered with peppercorn was so disgusting, that we had to return it for filet mignon...(surprisingly, the exchange only took 5 minutes!)
Filet mignon, too, was just bland.  The ahi steak I had was just overpowered by the thick crust, and once again, non inspirational.

Take away its "PRIME" location at bellagio, and this steakhouse would've been closed down long ago.

I, for one, will not be returning.

First, I should start by telling you that Prime had previously been my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas so I hope that they are able to turn their operation around. However, like many Vegas institutions, once they "jump the shark" it typically does not get better. 

The customer service has been lacking over the past several visits and it was absent on this recent dining night. I had to ask for bread three times and by the time it was brought out my bread plate was removed. Another guest requested drawn butter four times before it was brought out and by then the shellfish platter had been polished off. Additionally, several guests were forced to repeatedly ask for their drinks to be delivered. It may seem like a small detail, but the pepper mill did not work. Who is performing their quality control?

Finally, the attached photo shows just one of the two garbage cans in men's room, both of which were in nearly identical condition. 

For a restaurant at Bellagio, especially Prime, to be in this horrendous condition and without the management oversight needed to ensure a pleasant dining experience from a diner guest service experience is completely unacceptable. I have been dining here since their early days but Prime is off the list for future dining plans.

This place is pricey, but I knew what I was in for and it's worth every penny!  In fact...it was a little cheaper than I expected!  The food was amazing; the waiter was wonderful and not pushy.  He made food recommendations and even gave us travel tips!  The restaurant  is beautiful and if you can, get a window with a view of the fountains!  I will definitely go back the next time I am in Vegas!
We truly enjoy what We ate. I can easily say that this is one of the best meals I've had in Las Vegas so far. Everything was a 10 out of 10 and we enjoyed every bite!

Gorgeous view!   You can't beat the elegant cozy ambience sitting alongside the Bellagio fountains.  

Seafood platter - raw clams, raw oysters, muscles, prawns, lobster, crab. Served with a plethora of sauces, your typical vinegar, horseradish, cocktail sauce, tabasco.  Everything elevated on a bowl of ice. My does it feel grand. A bowl for shells conveniently located just underneath.  To prepare you for the next course, a warm damp dinner napkin garnished with a lemon to cleanse your hands.  

Tartar and carpaccio - if you love it raw ;) you'll love this.  The drizzled sauce makes the carpaccio. It's delicious!   

Sides - creamed spinach, truffle mashed potatoes, beans... Probably the smallest serving of side dishes I've seen.  At least you can have space to try a little bit of everything. 

Steak - filet mignon *heart eyes* if this steak could be cooked any better, I doubt it. PERFECTION. just the right texture without char to the outside... Nice and tender on the inside.   Juicy and perfectly medium rare (how it should be ;) ) For the way it is seasoned I would never even think to adulterate it with unnecessary sauces.  3 sauces come alongside.  The famous one they point out, with ginger is TO DIE FOR.  

I always appreciate good food, the best is the kind you crave. I read somewhere, that is the goal of the chef here.  With that sauce I refused to try, because I knew I didn't need it.  Icing on the cake, mission accomplished!  I already feel the withdrawals. 

Service was excellent.   With a party of 6 I would say everything went smooth.  I'm ready for a date night with Prime!

P.S.  I forgot my designer bag at the table. It was turned in to security next the to main cage in the casino.  I was able to retrieve it as soon as I realized.  Thank you much!

Perhaps this would have been a better experience if...
1. Our dining companions didn't have to leave before dinner was served b/c they were sick,
2. Their dinner was promptly delivered to their room, as promised, instead of cold and over an hour later,
3. We got to sit on the patio, as requested (patio was closed due to wind, although it didn't seem windy) or
4. The $500 dinner tab matched the quality.

Don't get me wrong, it's a dimly lit, nicely decorated restaurant, with a good menu.  The steaks were cooked correctly and the sides were tasty.  When compared to other steak restaurants we have visited, and for the price, we expected to be blown away and were not.  

If you get a chance to sit on the patio and view the fountain show while dining, I would definitely check it out.  That would be amazing.  Otherwise, save your steak appetite for somewhere more deserving your money.

My husband and I had a lovely dinner here last night. Service was phenomenal. Nice atmosphere, a little loud though. Definitely will come back. We also had a nice view from where we were sitting . We got to see the fountains of the Bellagio go off many times. A lady came over and asked if she could take our picture, we agreed. Thinking we're not going to buy these anyways. Well the pictures turned out wonderful, so we bought them. What a very nice experience and the pictures to remind us of a nice time we had here.

If you're looking for steak heaven, come here and you won't be disappointed. 

It's not cheap but the food here is worth every single penny. We ordered the bone-in rib eye and the porterhouse and both were cooked AND seasoned to perfection (very important). The steaks were juicy, tender and packed with great flavor, and every single bite tantalized our taste buds more and more. Mine was so good that I didn't want to dip any of my 16 oz steak into the three sauces provided (i thought they were a bit too strong and didn't let the steak itself shine through), but my friend had no such qualms. After declaring it the best steak he's ever had, he fell in love with the miso sauce and proceeded to dip every single piece with the sauce since he loves strong flavors. So either way, it's melt-in-your-mouth kind of good steak.

We also ordered a side of whipped sweet potato and that was also amazing. A smooth, creamy texture with a hint of ginger to really let the sweetness shine through. 

And we were seated next to the Fountains. BEST EVER.

We decided to by pass the usual, Mastro, Spago, STK, Mesa Grill, etc. ya know, what we always do, and I think it was kind of a mistake. Prime is located in the Bellagio, down a set of marble stairs facing the fountains. Now let me tell you, view and decor, absolutely me, fancy, fancy, fancy and that is 5 stars in my book, however, food..... Good, but not unforgettable. My husband ordered a $70 Porterhouse, which is a downgrade to his usual $120 Japanese Waygu, needless to say, he didn't quite like it. I thought it was perfectly cooked, he thought it to be way too salty. Oysters and wedge salad were good, and my Chilean Sea Bass was decent, but I have had better. Bread basket, I could do without, not impressive, and cocktails were ok. However, I was impressed by their Murano chandelier that hangs in one of the private dining rooms, only because I have had the pleasure to stare at the exact same one, but smaller, hanging in my parents dining room still to this day. Overall, it was  nice quiet dinner, enjoying each other and of course sitting there all gussied up, but I would probably pass and make this a one and only time.
"I am so glad we chose Prime at the Bellagio. Amazing Steakhouse! Filet was like cutting through butter.. Foie gras, fantastic. What a great dinner..."
Went back recently and they still have a phenomenal steak, wish they always had the tuscan fries though.

Prime is one of my top 3 favorite places for fine dining in the city. My husband took me here 4 years ago for our anniversary dinner, and have since then been nothing but please during our visits after. We always recommend this place to our friends looking for a nice place to enjoy a good steak and some. Patio seating is always what we asked for during reservations too.

They always say patio seating is first come first serve, but we never had to wait more than 5 minutes to be seated from our reservation time. Service is top notch. Everyone is very kind and thorough. Someone is always making sure our drinks are filled and our table is free of crumbs. 

We usually order the same things here. We share the 28oz bone in rib eye in medium, lobster Mac and cheese, some oysters and sautéed mushrooms. The steak is absolutely delicious and flavorful, cooked to perfection. It comes with a few sauces, but I only taste the sauces and not really having to use them because the steak is already perf without them. The side lobster Mac and mushrooms just go well with the steak.

The water show and night view of the strip is an extra added bonus to a romantic dinner here. Highly recommend this place, the food and the view.

Food was above average but the atmosphere was just way too stuffy and borderline snobby and the view of the water show from inside the restaurant is pedestrian at best and way too hot to sit outside. We were told seating was first come first serve but when we showed up we were sat far and away from the tables near the window, not like the place was busy at the moment there were plenty of seats next to the window to watch the water show -that simply ruined the entire experience.

So where to start. The server was generally rude. We tell him where we live and he starts talking about his timeshare there and how he can't be bothered to play at anything but the best clubs there. It was almost like he was talking down to us but kind of funny at the same time because we honestly don't really care.

I was hosting a corporate dinner there and this guy was going for the company card with no mercy. Ask for a wine selection and he suggests a bottle that is on special for $140, so I select it. Well, he billed me $255/bottle so much for it being on special, I missed that when i went over the bill because I was looking at the up charge on the steaks. 

He asks our guests if they would like something to start with, perhaps some caviar and a seafood tower made special for us. One of them spoke up and said we just came from an event where we had all of that. Before we could ask for other options, he looked annoyed and walked away, no give me a second, no i'll be right back, literally turned around and walked away. Our guests and I got a chuckle out of it. Then someone jokingly pointed out that the seafood app was $65/person and the caviar was up to an extra $200. 

The server comes back after literally 15 minutes to take our order and starts the hard sell again. As we go around the table, some of the guests order the filet and he looks at them and says "your want that bone in right?", so they said yes, well no mention that the bone in is an extra $20 per guest. Its not a big deal but its the way he did it, his intentions were so obvious, he was just so slimy. Every suggestion he made was the most expensive thing he could think of. We went along with it but even the guests got a laugh out of it when he walked away. One commented that he should be a used car salesman with how apologetically sly he thought he was being. He hit the deserts and scotch hard as well, we just played along at this point. The guy was such a tool. Anyway, the bill came, I gave him a shitty tip and got out of there. This is the first time i have given under 15% ever. I know these people live off their tips and its a big deal but this guy was just so slimy i couldn't support it. Anyway, i'll never, ever, ever go back. The rest of the meals we had in vegas were great. We hosted a dinner at Sinatra's and it was awesome, we definetly spent way more per person which really didn't matter but when we left, we felt like I had been served well and got great food. It was a relaxing environment with class. Not some guy druling over your corporate card hitting you up like a used car salesman selling an 1985 caddilac.  

Anyway, the food...
The good: 
Bone in filet was amazing. Really well cooked, well seasoned and good sized.
Salads were good as well, nothing out of this world but good.
Desert was amazing. It really shined. 

The bad
The steak tartar was terrible, its one of my favorite dishes normally but they had some kind of sour cream sauce on it and it was chopped in chunks with lots of big fat hunks. I would have sent it back but just didn't have the energy to deal with our server. He probably would have suggested that I wash the taste out with the Louis XIII and 2 ounces of caviar while he prepared a new "special for me" tartar for like $600... 

So i leave you with this. If you want to go to a "5 Star" steak dinner hosted by a shameless used car salesman, this is the spot.

Its fair to say that we won't be returning to Prime

*We made our reservation for Valentine's Day a month in advance and were only able to dine at 10 pm :( call in December perhaps)
*We called on the day of to see if we could come earlier but nothing was available (shucks)
*We were stuck in traffic and called to let them know we would be late and we were informed that we MUST arrive by 10:15pm. Arrived and our table was clearly ready (could have come earlier?) and there were several large parties that hadn't ordered their entrees (why MUST we be here at 10:15? The kitchen is clearly still open)
*Had a comp sent from our host but the front door staff was unable to locate it and after two people came to our table during our meal it was finally located (organization??)
*Our server was as bland as my filet,  he had zero personality and no enthusiasm (long shift?)
*Filet was ordered medium (preggo lady here, but it was nowhere close so I could only eat a few bites and didn't take it to go) sadly it needed the sauce they privided...not my kinda steak plus it was tough
*Husband loved his rib eye but that was the highlight of our meal, the bacon wrapped shrimp was a close second, and the creamed spinach in third
*Asparagus salad, mushrooms, fingerling potatoes, chocolate cake and creme brulee were boring at best
*There was a really nice back waiter with a unique name from LA that deserved praise. I want to say Rajuk but I'm sure I've moved the vowels around and this is as close as I remember but he was very personable, funny and kind. Give him a promotion asap!
*I really enjoyed dining at Jean Georges in the Aria and in the future I'll stick to my waygu beef. Good bye Prime.
I thought we were at the Palm's guess not. Too drunk to remember much but I know the potatoes augratain were amazing calamari was sent back.

The place came highly recommended by a friend. I won't be listening to them anymore. Ordered the dry aged ribeye , my choice, but highly touted by the waiter. I ordered it rare, but he said that would would make the meat too chewy??? I asked that it be on the rare side of medium rare. Steak arrived well done, so I asked for the next to be rare, and I would take my chances. This one came out medium well. It was supposed to be 18 oz bone in. It was a half inch thick, and couldn't have weighed 12 oz. I haven't been to the Sizzler since I was 12, but I would give the edge to the Sizzler. They offered to redo a third time, but my wife was already done. They took my steak off the bill, and I still had to pay $175 for apps my wife, 2 sides, and 2 drinks. When I asked the manager to rethink the bill, he said that was the best he could do. With all the good choices in Vegas, this should be your last choice.  P.S. I eat out 7 nights a week, and you'll see I only have 5 other reviews. I only take the time to do this if the place deserves it.

In Bellagion, near shops, downstairs next to Picasso. 
-Men need to wear jackets as indicated but they won't say anything if you don't. 
-Nice views of the Fountains, steaks were cooked very well as they cut up pieces as serve you. Sides were also good. Had to skip dessert cause the meal was a good size and was going to Mystere and Tao afterwards. 
-Lady comes by to take very good pics but its at a very good price for her
-Met Carolos Santana 
-Overall good experience

Excellent service and excellent steaks.  High quality by the glass wine menu.  I am surprised at all the poor reviews.  Glad we did not encounter any problems.  

Our reservation was on a Sunday at 5pm as we had a show to catch.  We were the first ones seated and had a very attentive wait staff.  No problems.

Each member of the party thought their steaks were one of the best that they have had.  Two of us had 18oz bone in ribeyes and two had 8oz filet mignon.  Steaks were amazing on their own and the various sauces were interesting.

One odd finding is that the broccoli was spicy at two different steak houses in Vegas.

A very good steak with one of the best views on the strip (but only a small number of tables that can enjoy same). . . 

Unfortunately, very good is as far as I go.  Three SMALL filets ordered.  Each was requested medium rare.  One was near med well, one was Med Rare and one was Medium. . . . .  unfortunately, pricing demands excellence.

Oh - and, if you do decide to bring your own bottle of wine, check with the restaraunt first. . . . . anything that is on their list will not be poured.

No problem with the policy !  But woudn't you think that if you're going to adopt that policy at least make the wine list available online through the web site.

This terrific restaurant is in the Bellagio in Las Vegas, and is outstanding. It's not cheap, but not outrageous either. The service and food are top notch and if you like steaks, this is the place. The fish is also to die for. Everything about this place is wonderful.

I went here with a girl friend of mine. I will always love this place. The menu alone is amazing with so many choices. I ordered the lobster tail and I couldn't finish it cause it was so big. This place was so good. I highly recommend going here as a part of a really complete Vegas experience. You will enjoy it. I wish I could remember our servers name, but she was very nice. Very good service. I can't wait to take more friends here. Enjoy

I went here to celebrate my graduation from UNLV due to its reputation. Everything was great, atmosphere was warm and seats comfortable. The food was very good. Only thing that bugged me is usually at high end restaurants if you tell them u are celebrating something they would bring a desert out for you. They did not, it's a small touch that goes a long way.

So,if you are thinking of eating here but haven't gone to any one of the other acclaimed steakhouses in Las Vegas, I'd highly recommend you go elsewhere.  This place was a disappointment from beginning to end for us.

First thing you need to know is that if you look at the menu, the only place the word prime shows up is in the title.  The steaks are not prime.  And they definitely do not taste like prime steaks.  They may have prime steaks on the menu, but unless it specifically says it is, it ain't.  

Secondly, the service here sucks.  No sugar coating here.  I don't want people to make the same mistake I made and eat here when there is definitely much better in this town.  Go elsewhere for good service, or at least average service.

Well, hopefully I've dissuaded you.  If not, or if you just like reading about poor dinners like watching a car accident, read on.  

We ordered the crabcakes.  And this is where the problems started.  We dutifully split it in half as usual, I began eating and noted it was good, then I bit into a crab shell.  Wow, that hasn't happened to me at any decent restaurant and I've had my share of crabcakes.  Disappointed but willing to overlook this, I bit into another piece of shell.  I'm paying a pretty decent sum for a crabcake that isn't remarkable in any way, and I'm biting into shells?  Unbelievable.

Next up, the salads.  Except we didn't order salads.  They were for the table next to us.  With some horror I realized that our steaks and another table's salads were on the sam f-ing cart, but they served their salad first!  I don't think they do that kind of thing at a Black Angus, much less a restaurant that claims to be a top steakhouse.  Horrified but willing to ignore the two insults already suffered, we got our steaks and sides after a bit of a pause.  

My steak was ok.  18 oz bone-in ribeye.  The sauces weren't special but I'm not much of a sauce guy.  However, if you are going to pride yourself on your sauces, it should generate some interest from me.  Sides were decent.  Truffled mash potatoes were creamy, creamed spinach was what I expected.  I didn't much enjoy the bread though.  I got a pretzel roll that was extremely salty.  

And then the final insult.  We finished our steaks, and waited a long time for our waiter to come back, but we didn't see him again.  The second cleaned up and brought us out the dessert menu, but that took quite some time.  At this point I hadn't seen our waiter in so long I assumed he actually left.  I thought that was incredibly rude to do that without turning the table over to someone.  Why are we ordering dessert still?  I wanted to give this place a chance to right the wrongs.  After ordering the crepe suzette (17 layers!), we waited a long time for our dessert.  A real long time.  And after finishing what I thought was a good dessert, we waited a long time for our check.  At this point our waiter returned!  We hadn't seen him since we ordered.  Apparently he had been taking care of another table.  He didn't tell us this, which would have alleviated a lot of the insult I felt by this time.  He cleared our dessert and we wanted no more of this restaurant.  It took a full 15 minutes for him to bring us our checks.  By this point we were angry.  We got here at about 6:45, and it was now 9:15.  So we spent an equal amount of time being seated, ordering and eating as we did waiting on our dessert and paying our check.  I won't be back here when there is so much better in town.

This was the most romantic place i have ever been. It came with delicious food and great view of the bellagio fountain show. I was sad that i wasnt able to have a professional photo of us taken by their photographer that goes around, but ill be sure to hang on to her next time. Maybe next time we could sit outside in the summer so we can have the full romantic experience with the water show and scenery of Paris!! Overall, we had a wonderful and unforgettable dinner here. I will definitely be back.

A friend and I decided to venture to Las Vegas to celebrate our birthday's.  I didn't initially have high expectations on experiencing awesome dining but the minute we walked into Prime the service was excellent.  I can't remember everything we ordered due to the early start in intoxication, everything was so fresh and simply melted in my mouth, I can't stop dreaming about the best mashed potatoes that I've ever had in my entire LIFE!  When dining at Prime you must try the truffle mashed potatoes, they are to die for...!

Me and the guys visited Prime once before and "wow" were we impressed. While it was one of the more pricier dinners it was certainly worth it. Their service made it feel as if we were catered upon as if it were a spa, the appetizers delectible, the steak entrees mouth watering, and their bar selection had some of the rarest cognacs & scotch wiskeys I've seen. Be sure to make a reservation far in advance and ask for a window table so that you can also be entertained by Bellagio's fountain show.

I can't have enough praise for this place. The service was impeccable. The food was memorable. The place is not cheap, but it was worth every penny. I can't wait for the opportunity to come back again. The mashed potatoes is a must. The filet mignon is tender and perfectly done. Nothing else to say! Can't wait to come back and do it again.

Good food and very cool decor.  Seating was comfy.  The restaurant was dimly lit, which I like, but might be an issue for some diners.  Definitely a place where "pretty people" go to eat/ be seen.  We had a reservation and had to wait for 10-15 minutes, but nothing major.

I cannot give 5 stars because it was not the best steak that I ever had.  For a $62 filet, I was expecting a bigger serving than 10 ounces, but it was very good and cooked properly.  Another member of my party was disappointed in the cooking of his steak, which was ordered rare, but he still ate it and said it was good.  Meat quality wasn't the best and didn't seem to be as good as my favorite Chicago steak joints.

Our server was professional and knew his stuff, even after being questioned on random food details by the foodie member of my party.  He wasn't in our face, but was very attentive and also sent over a free desert for my friends birthday.....no singing thank God!

Would never tell anyone not to go there, but there might be better steak places in Vegas.  Because it's in the Bellagio and has a view of the fountains, can be considered a destination restaurant.

Was very Happy to be able to sit on the patio for once. I feel we came at a good time. The host was very personable. Always smiling and sat us right away. Our reservation was at 6 but took us at 5:40. We got to see the fountain show 4 times while eating so that made it more perfect for out staycation. Our server was an Asian male with glasses. He was very robotic and didn't smile once. I know it's fine dining but smiling helps. A lot of the work was done for him by his assistants. I figure with all that help you would spend more time with your tables. They forgot my coke not once...but twice...

I loved the food. Can't complain AT ALL. My soy garlic glazed Ny strip was cooked to perfection. On the side I had tempura onion rings. The kitchen cooks very well here. My Favorite part of the meal was the bacon wrapped shrimp. It came with a passion fruit sauce that more than paired well with it and made it more interesting than a normal BBQ sauce that's served with that dish normally. Only negative thing is that the shrimp came with 3 pieces and there was two of us. Spending $28 for one piece of shrimp was a little extreme. 

From the host to the server assistants to the fountain show to dinner this place was a hit. The service can be more personable and empathetic. 
Manager table touch would have made this night even better. Didn't even see one all night and it wasn't busy.
#ComingFromPeopleInTheIndustry

Prime is a pricey steakhouse located inside the Bellagio Hotel. The steak and service  is on par with other high end steakhouses I've been to, but what's really special about this place is the ambiance. The setting is very intimate and you have a view of the fountain/Bellagio watershow from the restaurant. Great spot for a special occasion.

As for the food, the dungeness crab salad tastes like a very expensive california roll sans the rice--light, refreshing and tasty, but not sure if it's worth the price. The dry aged bone in rib eye was tender, beefy and flavorful, but i'd definitely suggest you split it with your dining companion(s) because it is way too much meat for one person. The chilean sea bass (which was what I ordered) was a smidgen overcooked and therefore a tad dry, but the portion was also huge at 8oz; usually restaurants give you a small filet of fish, but the portion here was double the size. This place is definitely not for those on a diet as the food is quite rich and heavy.

With Prime's level of snobbery, you'd at least think the chef would season the steaks before cooking...

If you're looking for a standard steakhouse menu set in the palace of Versailles, then Prime is probably for you.

Highlights: The menu is pretty standard fare but it's got all of the staples - steaks, potatoes, French onion soup, shrimp cocktail, creamed spinach etc. The quality of ingredients is very good and the potato dauphinoise were a very tasty side dish option. The wine list is pretty expansive as well.

Low lights: Prime's ambiance is extremely stuffy. The waitstaff does little in the way of making you feel at home and we found our server to be very impatient and overbearing. The ornate setting doesn't really compliment the menu properly, however the panoramic windows in the dining room provide a nice view of the Bellagio's water show. None of our steaks had been seasoned before cooking which is practically a cardinal sin. How would any chef hope to create the perfect crust and flavor profile without a generous helping of salt and black pepper? Seriously disappointing...

If you're staying at the Bellagio and looking for a steak dinner, Prime is a convenient option. Otherwise, go to the absolutely fantastic Carnevino at the Palazzo.

Pricey, but we weren't disappointed.  We reserved online and got a table with a view overlooking the Bellagio fountains.  The seafood platter appetizer was delicious, featuring a variety of shrimp, clams, oysters and a huge crab leg and lobster tail.  The bone-in filet was excellent - perfectly cooked and full of flavor.  The lamb was a little less than spectacular, but still good.  Despite being completely full, we had the chocolate cake and lemon tart desserts. Both were exceptional.

I love Prime and all of it's over the top velvet. It's view of  Paris' Eiffel Tower across the Fountain , is in my opinion,  the best seat in the house,  and when you are lucky enough to score that spot it really adds ambiance .

I love steak,  and i love the steak at Prime as it has been consistently tender, juicy,  and sizzling. I love getting the Miso mustard sauce with my Rib-eye and asparagus and a baked potato as my sides ( the mashed potatoes are to die for but i try and save room for dessert ) I also love their beet salad. I have not had anything other than steak as my Entree  here but i feel they have a pretty solid menu .
Chocolate Souffle is excellent !

Service is more hit than miss so coupled with the great steak meal it still gets a 5 star rating from me after more than a few visits over the years .
*Service last night was on point *~ Thank You !

Bar none the BEST STEAK I HAVE EVER TASTED! I got the Dry Aged Ribeye and it was AMAZING! The Truffle Mashed potato was a great side order for this wonderful steak. Add the fact that they gave us a great table with an amazing view of the Bellagio fountains, this was an unforgettable experience.

The service was very professional.
The Food - fantastic.  We shared a special seafood platter.  Crab, shrimp, oysters, lobster, and stone crab.  
I had the rib eye.  It was very good and the sides were great too.  Simple, prime, and light seasoning.  
I loved sitting near the windows watching the water show.
One of the finest dining experiences I've ever had.
The food was excellent. The lines were long,  but well worth the wait. Everything I ate was delicious.

We had Thanksgiving  dinner here.Outstanding ambience.Impeccable  service with waitstaff.... Fancy place so dress accordingly.I had reservations which we switched due to a conflict in schedule...somehow despite being on phone with them they didn't have our new reservation, but according  to  hostess "luckily could seat us".
Started off with bottled water, $9 a bottle  actually. Followed by $19 cocktails. Followed by a cold bread basket with 3 types of bread.Cold bread is a pet peeve of mine especially  at a higher end restaurant. Nobody likes cold bread on a cold night especially. 
Husband order huge porterhouse steak $73  ,and it came under done and had to go back.He ordered medium,it came very rare.Neighboring table sent back to rare steak as well that they had ordered medium. For these prices that's unacceptable. ...guess chef was having an off night.Fingerling potatoes were good and steak was good when it came back properly cooked.Peppercorn sauce was our pick of the three sauces offered. 
I ordered the turkey dinner special since it was turkey day after all. In retrospect the waiter really wasnt trying to sell.the special.I should have heeded this.To my surprise what came was 3 slices of what looked like Jennie  O turkey loaf,(it was tough to cut with a steak knife!)on top of a meager amount of mashed potatoes(  I think it was baby food )with a huge glop of canned  cranberry sauce ,a square of dark meat confit and a square of stuffing(the best tasting part of entire dish),reminiscent of McDonald's  fried hashbrown squares,awful Brussel sprouts ,drizzled with a tiny amount of gravy.Im not sure where the best turkey dinner was in Las Vegas on Thanksgiving  day 2015,but Prime takes the cake for one of the worst  I've ever had.I did not finish.
Skipped dessert   we were weary of loud  pretentious annoying neighbor blathering with his neighbors  about world politics, his world travels,terrorism,Donald Trump  and Hillary Clinton, and left feeling disappointed, had planned this dinner for 3 months and expected excellence,only 3 stars due to service and ambience.

Expensive even for Vegas? Maybe.   We enjoyed a very expensive meal here ($80-$100) per person without drinks included.   The ambiance was very comfortable and we liked the semi private rooms with curtains separating them.    We had four tables in our area.  We were far from the fountain, and I imagine sitting on the patio or near the fountain windows would be an awesome experience!   Our waiter was good, attentive, not overly friendly but helpful.  I had the tuna and it was cooked perfectly, however the puffed rice crust on the tuna was odd and I didn't enjoy that combination.  The Caesar salad was a unique flavor, hot and spicy.  Others in our group enjoyed the fillet and the rib eye which they reported were cooked correctly and large portions, which was nice given the price of over $80 for each, really?  The sides were good, smallish, and expensive at $12-14 each.    It was a nice meal, nice location, but $$$$$

I wanted to love this place. The dining room has an old school elegance and the outside views are spectacular. I was sadly disappointed, largely due to service issues. Despite having a reservation, we had to wait an additional 15-20 minutes to get seated. Wait staff were walking around the room but rarely stopped by without being flagged. Our waiter lacked any kind of warmth and was quite gruff when I commented that the small sample of wine he poured was too dry for my taste and requested something different. I could understand if this occurred after opening a bottle but this was a tiny pour from a wine they sell by the glass. His demeanor was condescending and rude. The food itself was very good: the oysters, bacon-wrapped shrimp, pea soup, and wagyu were all hits with the table.
