When your party of 4 is paying roughly $200 per person, however, both the food and service need to be on point. Sadly, this restaurant only delivered on the former.

This is definitely an expense account dinner.   We had a group of 8 people and the total bill with tip was $930.  Our server was very knowledgeable, albeit slightly arrogant.  The filet mignon was outstanding but the signature sauce they serve with it is TO DIE FOR.  The wine list is top notch.  The only thing I can complain about is they use wheeled carts to deliver food and they sometimes bumped into my chair.  I wasn't going to make a scene but it was a little bit annoying trying to take a sip of wine or a bite of steak and getting a little jolt.  They should move the tables a few inches if the cart cannot fit!  The decor is classic blues and golds and the view to the outside fountains is a nice touch.

Sat on the patio, and highly recommend doing so if you can get a reservation, so we got the full experience of the Bellagio water show while we ate.  Food was very good, atmosphere was top notch, water show added something you can't do at any other restaurant, but the service was a little bit slow for this level of restaurant.  The Filet was good, not the best ever, but very good.  The sauteed mushrooms are a must with your steak. 
Overall, a very good steak restaurant with an amazing show, but not the best service and not the best steak ever.... but I'm from Texas.

Sides were extremely small. Cesar salad was ok. Steaks: some thought too salty some said not enough. I got bone -in ribeye and was ok not much flavor. FYI we had a fantastic steak dinner In Vagas somewhere else

This is a long one so I'll sum it up for the skimmers: terrible service, pretentious atmosphere, as expected steakhouse food (if you want an incorrectly cooked steak), about $150/person with a drink, app and steak...spend your money elsewhere. 

I so wanted to love this place! That was however most definitely NOT the case. We started the experience by having a manager approach my brother and ask him to roll down his pants. My brother is a fashion stylist and was in Gucci and looked great, meanwhile guys in Levi's and kids in ripped jeans are walking by, no problem. But ok, fine, we get it....dress code is dress code. You would think said manager would later stop by to check on us given how he started the experience...he did not, strike 2. We just got back from a trip to Napa so we brought our own bottle of wine, we called ahead and found out the corking fee was $50...steep, but fine. When we sat down the waiter aggressively told us that the corking fee was $50, three times! As if we were stupid or he'd convince us to buy his overpriced wine? Strike 3. Our salads came and they were good, the Caesar was a typical steakhouse Caesar but the wedge was really good. Delicious blue cheese dressing. Now they were starting to redeem themselves, a little. After the salad course it took a good 30 minutes before our steaks came out. That is way too much time between courses in my opinion. When my rib eye came out it was over cooked. I order medium rare and it was at least medium plus bordering on well done. I told the waiter (new guy, maybe second in command?) that my steak was over cooked. He aggressively questioned me. Told me I needed to cut it in the middle to be sure, so I did and it was. He held it up, shined a light on it and was like, no this is our medium rare and that's what you ordered. He was so condescending and rude it was ridiculous! Finally my brother told him to take it back and cook it properly. They brought it out again and this time it was rare. I ate it because I just wanted to get out of there. Oh and during the wait, while my entire family was enjoying their meal, did said manager or waiter #1 come ask me if I needed anything or apologize? Nope. In fact, waiter #1 didn't even check on us at all after our steaks came out, he came back at the end to ask if we wanted dessert which we of course passed on. Overall, the food was fine, but not worth the inflated prices and terrible, condescending service. We will never return and will be spreading the word. If you're up for a pretentious place with staff that think they're better than you, then go ahead and drop $150/head here. If not, go elsewhere. In fact, I was at Fix, Bellagio's cheaper steakhouse and had a much better experience. My date's (a chef) steak was over cooked there and they handled it flawlessly. They took it back immediately and the manager came to check on us and bright him a scotch. My recommendation - spend your money elsewhere.

I've been to almost all of the fine dining steakhouse restaurants in Las Vegas and Prime is definitely my favorite! Almost all fine dining restaurants will have a great cut of steaks the way you would want them so in my opinion, it comes down to the unique sauces that they may or may not provide. Prime pairs their phenomenal steaks with Soy-Rice Wine, Béarnaise, and Peppercorn sauces which won't exhaust your taste palette and will keep you wanting for more!

Best meal we had in Vegas. Overlooking the fountains...ambiance reminded me of a north east steak house ( but no north east steakhouse had dancing fountains) Food was incredible. Service exceptional. Price was expensive... But worth it!

Very pricey but worth it. Took my wifey out here for a date night. Tab for 2 ran about 400. I had dry aged ribeye, she did sea bass. Both were fantastic and cooked correctly. I had the shellfish appetizer (65$ for a small main lobster, 2 oysters, 4 huge shrimp, 2 mussels, 1/4 lb king crab). It was the best appetizer I have ever eaten and was afraid i wouldn't have room for the steak lol. Wife had crab cake (25$). Small for the price but not much filler. Just lumpy crab meat. 


Servers were spot on

Dined here once and only once.... several years ago, so things might be better now.  But ---

Food was quite disappointing, especially considering that this place is located inside one of Sin City's premier casinos.  Steaks were overcooked (asked for medium but got a notch below well).

The most disappointing thing about Prime, though, is the service and overall experience.  One guy serving our table.  That was it.  At the competition, one would would get a captain and a couple of "assistants" at their table.  But not here.  And the server was neither attentive nor professional.  Saw him maybe four times the whole evening.

If you book only one lavish dinner for your Las Vegas trip, PRIME is your place.

Fiance and I came here for an anniversary on a Friday night and had the best time.

*Magnificent view of the Bellagio fountain show - ask for a table near the window!
*Best steak and truffle mashed potatoes I've ever had.  Worth every penny.
*Beautiful customer service from host to bar to table.
**TIP:  They will come by and ask to photograph you.  Let them!!  Our gal spent time making us both look as good as possible (i.e. skinny and natural, ladies) and took a few different angles from our seated position.  Before the meal is over, they will present you with the photos printed in Bellagio frames, no obligation to buy!!  They were SO beautiful, of course we did buy.. and now a small one sits at my computer in my office to look at each day.

Prime, thank you for making our dinner so memorable.

Beautiful  decor and great service. The food tasty but really nothing to write home about. Very disappointed with the size of the side orders considering the cost. Not much more to say. Will I return, probably not.

Probably the best steak I have ever had. My knife actually fell through the prime cut. The sauce selection they have blew my mind. They had a separate waiter bring out a tray with 6-8 different unique selections to choose from. The view is beautiful too, right on the water where they have the fountain show. Even though this place is really fancy, they let me stroll through in jeans and a tshirt haha.

Disappointing.  Was here several years ago and had an outstanding meal.  Visited this week and it unfortunately has taken a big step back and clearly is at best a 2nd or 3rd tier steak place in Vegas.  Location is great and the service was generally good- but the quality of the beef was truly disappointing.  Had an "aged bone-in rib eye" that was one of the toughest steaks I've had in the past 12 months.  A steak I would expect at a mass chain for a third of the price.

if you want to enjoy the beautiful setting go here.  But if you are looking for high end beef I would look for a restaurant in the top tier of Vegas steak places which this is clearly no longer in.

Was very disappointed with the meal at Prime - Being THE steakhouse at the Bellagio, I expected more.  The decor was pretty nice - has a nice view of the fountains, not as nice as the view from Picasso, but ok.  The filet mignon was cooked well, but the flavor was lacking especially from a steak that is supposed to be prime quality.  The sides were just ehh... the citrus glazed baby carrots ended up being large carrots cut up into little strips - not impressive.  The dungeness crabcake appetizer was also disappointing - being a little too fried and lacking in flavor - definitely not worth the price.  Also tried the diver scallops with sweet pea ravioli - the scallops were overcooked and the vinaigrette sauce was way too overpowering for the dish.  The service was also a bit lacking - not of the quality that one would expect when eating at a high end steak restaurant.  Overall, would not go back

There are plenty of reviews here but I'll quickly add my two cents.  Basically this place is fantastic but you are going to pay through the nose for it.  As long as you realize that, you'll be fine.

The special that night was a bone-in filet that was incredible.  I've never had such a good steak and I am well-versed in the ways of cow chunks.  Also to die for were the truffle mashed potatoes.  I could have eaten a giant bowl of these myself.

For an appetizer we had a giant bowl of seafood containing lobster, shrimp, oysters, clams, and king crab legs.  It was fantastic and would have made a nice meal by itself.

The wine is expensive.  I didn't see a single bottle for under $70.  Be prepared to spend big.

An almost perfect dinner in an almost perfect seat accompanied by almost perfect service.  The steak is certainly phenomenal, but I'll leave that to the other reviewers to rave about.  I don't think the steak is the BEST in the world, but my best might not be your best.  Once you hit a certain level of goodness, it's becomes exponentially difficult to stratify what is best and what is second or third best.  

But I think I've fallen in love with our waiter that night.  If he was my waiter at every restaurant I go to, then all my yelp reviews would probably end up with an extra star.  Friendly, engaging, accommodating, caring, smart, eloquent, polite, perceptive...I've ran out of adjectives...   Too bad he's not the person who actually bring you the food or takes away your food; they were not as A+ quality.

The restaurant is beautiful and if you're lucky or special or important enough, you'll be able to get a seat at the window/balcony and watch the fountain show every 15 min.  But don't expect to get those seats if you're not  some VVVIP.   And unfortunately, being that this is in sin city, you will occasionally see diners in t-shirt and jeans...just look away and stare at the pretty decor instead...

Side note:
I met Chef Jean-Georges Vongerichten the night before at the Grand Tasting (a Vegas Uncork'd event) and what a gentleman.  Super nice and kind and took the minute to autograph my souvenir bag :)

Couldn't wait to come here for the 50th b-day dinner, but sadly, the whole experience was ruined by the hostess.  We arrived at 9 pm, walked passed the outside patio area and asked to be seated there, since almost all of the tables were open.  This rude hostess told us that they didn't offer patio dining and to try Picasso's or Olives.  What?  I had been seated in the patio many other times.  Dismayed, we left.  Upon returning, another hostess greeted us and asked if we would like inside or outside. Right then, the original hostess popped up from behind the counter and exclaimed "I already told them we don't offer outside dining!"  We were dressed very nice and were very pleasant, yet couldn't understand why this woman was so hell-bent on not giving us a patio table.
We then took a table inside.  I asked the waiter when they stopped serving outside.  He said that there were plenty of open tables, and he would ask the hostess.  She then came to our table and told us that those table were for reservations only.  It was then 9:20 and 4 tables were open.  Not sure what was said in private, but we were then moved to the patio.  No other parties ever did take those tables until closing.
This hostess, with her condescending yet does it with a smile attitude, was by far the rudest person I have come across in a long time.  I will never go back, no matter how good the food is. The rudeness overpowers all of that and ruined what should have been a great dinner celebration.

Their filet and rib - eye were phenomenal. Seafood?--ummm.. no. It's a steak house. My dove white fish had weird slimy yet chewy texture that i couldnt get over. I had to return the dish and got scallops. It was really salty! So get the steak.

Had my 30th birthday dinner here last week.. and it was absolutely a once in a lifetime night. The food is literally the most amazing thing we have ever tasted. There is nothing that beats the 12oz fillet, the truffle mashed potatoes, and the mushrooms. The Cesar salad and onion soup are perfect ways to start your meal.. and of course, for the big finale, the lava cake with Happy 30th Birthday written in chocolate ! Pricey... and I do mean.. PRICEY.. but worth it more than you know !! The window table overlooking the Bellagio fountains was well worth it. What an amazing, unforgettable night !

Decadent and fine dining!  The service is fabulous - leaves one feeling pampered.  Never was able to reach the bottom of my glass because the staff keep an eye out for the diners' needs.

The food was well-seasoned, neatly presented and served at the right temperature.  The portions are reasonable.  Sides are definitely meant for sharing.

Several choices for vegetarians too. 

The French onion soup was served piping hot and delicious.  A bit salty but worth a try.  Chilean sea bass and beet salad were favorites.  Dover sole was delicately seasoned and also yummy.  Our table enjoyed the green beans and Brussels sprouts.  

It's a treat to see the warm chocolate cake served.  Warm, melted chocolate syrup gets poured over the chocolate dome.  Done melts revealing the cake inside.  A must see.  Fine dining!
Had free comp $$ To spend. Took 3 people and we all thought average at best. Steak not seasoned and took 10 minutes to refill a coke.

It was fine.

Foie gras, wedge-ish salad, brussel sprouts.  It was all fine.  Bartender was nice.  Ambience was OK.  Not sure what I was expecting but it wasn't a "wow".
The salad was OK at best.  My apologies, Prime... you seem like you might deserve better than that.  I will go back some day and re-evaluate.

Prime Steakhouse in the Bellagio is owned by the reknowned chef Jean-George Vongerichten. I have eaten at his name-sake restaurant in New York so I was very excited to experience the food here. My overall opinion would have to be that the restaurant was good, but fell short in a few areas.

My friend and I split two dishes, the Chilean Sea Bass served over braised mushrooms, poblano peppers and dill, and the special: a bone-in filet that was dry-aged 21 days. They served our meal first, which was a little disconcerting as it was split table-side. I was slightly cringing at the thought of the other dishes getting colder while ours was being prepared. The filet was terrific, perfectly cooked and juicy, while the sea bass was good, but rather un-inspired. The mushrooms underneath the seabass were superb, however, the poblano and dill were so mild the flavors never would have been obvious to the consumer. My friend's fiance ordered the roasted duck breast with almond crust and red wine amaretto sauce. The crust was fantastic, but sadly the duck was tough. The best dish of the evening was ordered by my friend's grandma. This was the rack of lamb with smoked chili glaze and broccoli rabe. The lamb was so tender and juicy, and the inherent flavor was fantastic. Obviously it came from a really good little lamb.

As far as the sides, I would have to say they were hit and miss. The brussell sprouts were something worth going back for. They were roasted with just the right amount of char, and the use of pistachio nuts was ingenious. Execution = perfect. The sweet potato puree, which I swear also involved butternut squash, was superb, but the parmesean broccoli was painfully overcooked and the florets were cut too large for easy sharing.

All in all, I would say that Prime definitely uses great ingredients, and the food was solid, yet for the price I think one should demand more. I think this is a case of the talented, celebrity chef opening up a restaurant in Vegas because the $$$ is there (or rather, used to be there) and in the process reliquished a bit too much power to someone not as talented as themselves.

Best Steak I've Ever Had.  I dream about this steak.

Now, lets take a step back.  Of course make a reservation.  My party made a reservation well in advance and requested to sit in the patio overlooking the Bellagio fountain. It was July and hot as balls, so they gratefully did not seat us outside, but we had a window seat to see the wonderful fountain show time and time again.  It was great.

Now the Steak.  A good steak needs no additional sauces.  This one did not, it melted in your mouth.  However, they provide sauces and they were so good.  Such a great compliment to an already great piece of meat.

It's a beautiful restaurant.  It's classy but not overly done.  The staff are knowledgable and warm.  It's an overall great experience.

Anytime I am in Las Vegas I will be eating there.

When searching for the perfect steak in Vegas, all forums and review rated Prime as one of, if not, the best. We made weeknight reservations the morning prior to our meal, dressed appropriately, 10 min. early, and were promptly seated.

We were seated away from the windows/fountains, but could still take in the sights from our table. The room is dimly lit and decor is dark in the classic steak house vibe. We didn't do wine, but had coctails with dinner. Then menu is ala carte and the sides are big enough to share. 

My fillet was perfectly prepared at med. rare and arrived with the standard three sauces on the side. My wife had the sea bass and was happy with it. She said it was nothing amazing and admitted she should have done steak and the steak house.

The service was attentive. All in all a very good meal and one of the best steaks that I have had.
Outstanding filet mignon.  Absolutely delicious Dover soul. The only thing we did not enjoy was the crab cake which was overfried and reminded me of a Mrs Paul's fishstick.

The Tomahawk for two was just the best steak I have ever had!  Drinks are expertly mixed, they sought out the rye I wanted for my Manhattan. Service was impeccable, as you would expect for the price you are paying. But, you don't go to Prime for a bargain, you go for the quality and the experience. It has great ambiance and though you can be all dolled up, it is not stuffy or snooty in the least. 

If you've got the money to indulge (you're already at the Bellagio after all), this is a must dine at place when you're in Vegas. Can not wait to go back an eat here again.

I had reservations for 4 at 7:30 pm on a Tuesday night in September.  

We did not have to wait a minute. We were seated at a  great table that had a view of the fountains.  The atmosphere is nice, very upscale and service was as expected for this type of restaurant.  However, I have had more knowledgeable servers.  

Since it was restaurant week in Vegas when we were in town, I ordered off the special menu to save lots of dollars! But I had to ask for the special restaurant week menu.  I ended up getting the bacon wrapped shrimp, salmon with bok choy and berries for dessert for $50.  My salmon was cooked perfectly and a large portion.  The bread basket had pretzel bread (delish) and a cranberry and french bread.  My husband ordered off the normal menu, he got the 12 oz filet with a side of creamed spinach.  Very good.  

Overall, the experience was good. And food was on par to what I expected.  I was not wowed though.  So I probably will not go back since there are many other restaurants on the trip worth trying.

This has been my third experience with Prime. I guess I will look for something else. Honestly the only draw here is to dine by the fountain which I guess I would advise to maybe try one of the other restaurants in the Bellagio or watch the show from the street a couple of times and get your fix. Prime markets itself as an upscale steakhouse, they have a dress code that is barely enforced. They may need to revisit this policy. I am far from a snob but if I am going to go to the work to get "dressed for dinner" and go out to enjoy the evening, it would make the experience much nicer if all the other patrons would make a little more effort to a least look nice. Both occassions we came here and had dinner were special occassions (birthday and anniversary) and I would summize that most of the other patrons were there for the same. I was the only male there in a button down shirt with collar. Really? T shirts and crappy old jeans with tennis shoes that is business attire for men? Women dressed like service staff for hooters pass for dress code? We got a table at the outside table to enjoy the fountain show during dinner, every time the show started some of the other patrons stood up and went to the fence to watch and take pictures thus blocking everyone elses view. Isnt this something that could have been done out on the street? The one woman was jumping and clapping in a leopard print dress her ass in front of some elderly woman whos view was completely blocked. I dont know it just ruined the entire experience.  I guess overall I blame management for not controlling the situation, if you have patrons behaving in a way that is disruptive, speaking loadly and inappropriate language (saying FUCK every other word) just diminishes the experience for the other patrons who are trying to have a nice meal. I dont mind this if I am at the bar but here??? Overall It is an overpriced applebees.
Heard so much about this place we just had to try it.  Great food, one of the best ribeye steak I have ever had.  Of course the service was exceptional!

I went here last Thursday with my boyfriend for my 30th birthday. We made a reservation for 6:00 and were seated right away on the patio. The view is amazing and I love how you can watch the fountain show while eating dinner.
The service was impeccable! Everyone was very nice and attentive. Unfortunately, I forget our servers name but he was really cool and made us feel relaxed and even had our salad split because we said we wanted to share it.
I had the filet mignon with the au gratin potatoes and my bf had the short ribs. The portions are a good size so go hungry! Everything was cooked perfectly and was delicious! 
They even gave me a complimentary dessert for my birthday which were delicious chocolates! 
Overall, we had a great time and I'm glad I chose this restaurant to celebrate my birthday!

My husband and I love steakhouses and of course this was one of the hot spots that we had to try. I had a couple of people recommend this restaurant and I was so excited to try it out when we got to Vegas. The decor is lux and beautiful. Very elegant but not too much. Low lighting created a great romantic atmosphere. Especially the booming of the water fountains at Bellagio.What great entertainment. 

Well with all the ambiance I was drooling for what more has to come. The service was great, staff was very nice but it wasn't outstanding for an expensive restaurant especially for Vegas. The bread and butter was nothing to rave about. So come on steak! I'm a Rib Eye fan and always order it so then I can do a fair comparison for the quality and taste of the steak. When the steak had arrived, I dived into it and kept on cutting and cutting. Well it wasn't as buttery as I hoped. The fat on it didn't taste that great. And the meat itself was okay. Don't get me wrong. I did eat a majority of it with the three accompanying sides. 2 out of 3 were good. The mushrooms I would not recommend but the potatoes with the bacon marmalade was very good. My husband didn't think his steak was amazing either but we loved seeing the fountains. 

Would I recommend this place? No not really. There are so many amazing restaurants in Vegas this one was not one of them. It wasn't that it was bad but it was just disappointing. The one steakhouse that was unforgettable is STEAK from Gordan Ramsey at the Paris. That place I give 5 stars.

The steak was severely under cooked. My steak was slightly more cooked than my guests so I ended cutting off cooked pieces from the edges to share with my guest because the waiter did not come to check on our food within a reasonable amount of time. 
We had wanted to do something a little nicer than the typical Ruth Chris or Morton's so we chose Prime in hopes it would be at a much higher standard.  It definitely was not! 
 I feel short changed with the whole experience, not just because it was pricey but because it did not end up being the special dining experience we though it would be. The service was poor and the waiter displayed an arrogant and condescending attitude during the service, which I found interesting coming from a waiter. 

When I made the reservation I had requested seating either by the window or in a booth/table combo. Neither one of these requests were accommodated.

 I was staying in a suite so we had requested that the under cooked steak be boxed we requested that the salmon that was ordered not to be boxed as the fish might spoil the steak and had also explained that the lobster had been entirely eaten which was clear to see . We had figured we could cook it thoroughly ourselves and have it later as a snack. When the steak was boxed it contained the waste and scraps from the lobster tail that was entirely eaten. It seemed like it was some sort of insult for requesting togo boxes. We threw the steak out. 

The cost of dinner for two was $400.00. I would definitely say Prime did not live up to expectations. 

Without sounding entirely negative the lobster was decent but not exemplary and the restaurant's decorations were beautiful and opulent.
Excellent food and service!  The filet was like butter!  The seafood tater was absolutely huge and divine!

Great steaks. All around great service, except when we tried to make a reservation.  We were staying at the Bellagio and decided to eat at Prime. I called the restaurant around 4 and asked for a 7 reservation for 2. The lady told me she was booked till 9:30. So I called the concierge to book a table for the following night. The concierge told me she could get me in for either night I wanted, we decided to go the first night. We got there around 6:40, there were maybe 20% of the tables occupied. We finished eating around 7:45 and there were still 50% of the tables empty. Why turn down a reservation if you're not close to full?

I'm a big fan of Jean-Georges restaurants, and Prime is no exception.

The blue curtains and velvet chairs are stunningly elegant.  The food is wonderful.  

The biggest drawback?  They don't have outdoor seating.  Prime does have the outdoor garden/patio area, which is about as close as you can get to the fountain show, but it's only for cocktails.  I think Steve Wynn's group learned from that oversight as he thought through Botero and the SW Steakhouse.  Once you experience the settings at those places, it's hard to overlook it at Prime.  

You'll have up close views of the fountain show here, but the better views of it are across the street at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant.
Had my steak Meduim well.. the steak melted in my mouth. amazing food and also amazing service!!

Classy romantic restaurant with a view!  Highly recommend getting a table near a window to watch the fountain show.  Located at the Belligio Hotel.  American Style Steak House at it's best!  Beautiful decor and attentive service.  Dry aged bone in rib eye was cooked to perfection with tasty sides.  Nice place for a romantic dinner or night to celebrate!

Gorgeous decor and Bellagio's lakeside dining room sets the stage for a great dining experience if only the human element were as perfect.  Despite arriving dressed to their code, we were seated in the very back corner by the toilets and service station.  It would have been an appetizer and go had the maitre 'd not obliged our request to move closer to the windows.  Dinner on again, we had bacon wrapped shrimp, crab cake, ribeye, lamb, cauliflower, potatoes gratin, brussels sprouts, and a soufflé.  All were good but the lamb was a bit dry, ribeye and veggies were super greasy (buttered).  Nothing wowed; this is more high priced comfort foods with a nice environment.  Wait staff was professional but not very personable.  Overall acceptable but not worth a repeat.

I have been to Vegas so many times and have never felt compelled to eat here.  We actually came because it was my friend's choice we were dining with a large group.  I'm so sorry that I did not come here earlier. 

They make a fantastic dirty martini, though I have rarely met one i didn't like. The real standout for me was our appetizers.  Most of us ordered the foie gras which was nothing short of spectacular. It was perfectly seared and absolutely delicious. 

The steaks were solid, though I've had better in Chicago and elsewhere in Vegas. The sides were amazing, the mac & cheese is very rich and very tasty.   

I honestly can't remember if we ordered desserts maybe was too many of those damn martinis. Overall I would definitely come back if nothing more for appetizers and the sides.

Reported to be one of the top steak houses on the Strip.  Frankly, I was disappointed.   The quality of the steak was just Ok.  For $60+ dollars it needs to be better.  The side orders might be big enough for Two people each.   The service is good. They get 5 stars there. But the food is not worth what they charge.

Very enjoyable experience. Classy ambiance, nice service and very good food. Some detail on each:

Ambiance - The restaurant is nicely decorated with long curtains and the tables were well spaced so that you weren't sitting on top of anyone else. They played great standards in the background (Sinatra, Tony Bennett, etc.) One of the biggest pluses is the setting -- you're right next to the Bellagio fountain. It definitely adds to the experience to be able to watch the water cannons fire off every 10 minutes. Be warned, though, I don't think every table has a good view of the fountains. You might want to request that when you make your reservation.

Service - All of the service staff, from the hostess to the busboys to our waiter Russell were very friendly. Everyone was polite and asked how you were doing. This is the kind of class you expect from a nice steakhouse. On the other hand, Russell was actually almost a little too chatty. When he found out we were from New York, he took the opportunity to tell us about his daughter's recent trip to New York with her friends and on and on he went. This happened a couple of other times too. Listen, it could've been much worse. He was very friendly and offered good advice about the food. But someone just needs to remind him that people don't go out to eat to make friends with the waiter.

Food - Smallish house cocktail list. My wife enjoyed the house cosmopolitan. I ordered a Chimay Red from the good-sized beer menu. For dinner, I had the 21-day aged bone-in filet mignon special. The waiter said it was 8-10 ounces but when the plate came out it was definitely at least 10. Was overcooked just a tad (more like medium than medium rare) but had excellent flavor anyway that was even better with some of the waiter-recommended soy ginger steak sauce. My wife had a New York strip which was served already marinated in a soy-ginger glaze. That, too, was very flavorful. We added a side of the brussel sprouts and pancetta, which we gobbled up eagerly. My wife's only complaint was that her steak knife was actually quite dull -- she traded knives with me and even though I had the more delicate cut of meat, I still had some difficulty making a clean cut in my filet. For dessert, my wife enjoyed a delicious bread pudding and I struggled to finish a large, tasty trio of raspberry, coconut and mango sorbet.

Great ambiance and great food.

I've been there twice now and enjoyed their food and service both times.  I recommend their steaks and the truffled mac and cheese/mashed potatoes.

The last time I went I got the filet mignon.  Two of my friends went with the Kobe NY strip (yes, the $300 variety).  I had a piece of each of theirs and it quite literally made my $50 filet taste and feel like a piece of beef jerky.

I agree with a lot of the other reviews. This place is really over-priced and over-rated. I almost felt uncomfortable with how pretentious the vibe was during our dining experience. The food was excellent, I will say, but a Prime Cut of meat, is a Prime Cut of meat at some point. It wasn't anything I haven't had before for half the price. This is Vegas though and I definitely knew to expect an expensive dinner. The more disappointing part was the service. I don't even think our sever told us his name. It felt very impersonal and was not an "experience" at all. Everything was rushed and he was not sincere, just very pushy. It would have sat better with me spending $260 for an entree and two sides if the dining experience was enjoyable. The wine list is very small and prices are extremely inflated. Definitely won't be back :(

Location, location, location!  The famous Bellagio fountain is right in front :) 
but not to recommend sitting outside when it is windy...all the water from fountain will spray you! I ordered Crab cake, prime onion soup, bone stake and mushed potato.  
The stake is OK, nothing special. Mushed potato(creamy/smooth) was good though.

Top 3 steaks I've ever ever had.  Frankly, its been a few days since, and I'm still thinking about it.
I ordered the New York ($56 i believe).  It was cooked to perfection.  They bring 4 different sauces (made by the chef) for the meal, but none are needed.  The steak tastes like heaven, seriously, no other description. I was full 2/3s of the way into the steak but still had to finish.  It was too good to take home.
Service is first class.  I've been to plenty of nice restaurants, and this one has some of the best service i've ever had. 
Just an unbelievable dinner.  Rarely do I get that combination of fast, courteous, and knowledgeable service along with possibly the best steak I've ever had.

I took my fiance here to celebrate the two of us getting engaged and was looking for a nice, romantic dinner.  Great atmosphere and view of the fountains!  Unfortunately, it took three tries to get my bone-in filet right. I asked for medium and got medium well-well. I sent it back and got my cut steak cooked longer until fully well. They obviously weren't listening to what I said. They re-did it again and got it right.  My fiance's peppercorn NY Strip was overcooked on the first try (ordered med. rare and received med. plus), as well.  It was sent back and replaced with a rare to medium rare steak (not perfect but acceptable).  Truffle mashed and crab mashed were great!  Steak had good flavor but I'm not sure if it was $70 quality, though. I've definitely had better steaks for half the price.  The ambiance and front row patio seating for the fountains made up for alot.

Service was below par for the level that you expect in a restaurant of this caliber.  Our waiter "forgot" about us several times.  He basically disappered from our table, only to be seen serving couples that arrived after us.  Like I mentioned before, the service was sub-par.

Great location with romantic views of the fountains but that can only take a restaurant so far.  The food and service must be kept at the same level.  The photographer that comes around and takes pictures, which will be available for purchase, did a great job.  She took some great shots and provided a great memory of a special dinner / trip.  The pictures were resonably priced, as well.

Next time, we'll try one of the many other high-end steakhouses in Vegas.

The best steak we've ever had. Our party ordered the dry aged ribeye, porterhouse, and filet minon. So delicious! It is pricey, but worth every penny. Our bill came out to $340ish before tip. In addition to the steaks, we ordered the mushrooms, mashed potatoes, Mac and cheese, French onion soup and another side I just can't remember. The mac and cheese wasn't my taste, as it had gouda and Sharp cheddar, a little too strong. The French onion soup was huge and the best I've had. I would return solely for the purpose of ordering the French onion soup. Definitely ask for a table inside and by a window so that you can view the bellagio water show while eating dinner. There is an outdoor eating area, but it's not as nice as the decor indoors.
The beet salad is a must have! Looking for a special meal? You will find it here. Not the usual casino fare. Fine dining at its best. Pricey but worth it!

This is the one of the best steakhouse choices in Las Vegas.  Nine at Palms has better ambiance - if you are more into people watching and scene than the food I would choose there.  The steak here is top quality - I shared the porterhouse, sampled someone else's kobe (which was amazing), and, luckily, did not have to pick up the check!  Definitely a more low key, quiet atmosphere........I sort of felt like going into a food coma after eating vs. hitting the clubs to party all night (this is Vegas, after all).  One highlight was the patio outside for dessert - you get a close up view of the water fountain show at Bellagio, which is a different experience than seeing it from the street.  This was fun - and would also be a cool first date thing to impress.
The dry aged ribeye was fantastic, we also has the steamed shrimp salad.

Primed with a gift card from my son and daughter-in-law to ease the financial outlay required to dine well here, Diane and I at last ventured forth to sample Prime.  And, besides finding it to be the most expensive restaurant we have each visited to date ($330.52 for 2 diners, including tax and tip, but without any alcoholic beverages), even taking into account many renowned restaurants we have frequented at some time or other across the globe, it was without doubt one of the best.  We did not scrimp on food, but did not order that extravagantly either.

After being promptly seated at one of the few booths in the cavernous restaurant as requested in our reservation, with a distant but still good view of the Bellagio Fountains, and immediately receiving black cloth napkins substituted out for the white ones on the table to cover our black pants, we decided to begin with a Shrimp Cocktail app.  After being presented with big shrimps unconventionally lying side by side on a plate, we then enjoyed the great cold and meaty morsels, which I dunked in a fresh and quite tasty Wasabi Cocktail Sauce.

Next for me was a large gargoyle-headed, and seemingly bottomless, white crock of hot and cheesy Prime Onion Soup.  With well-caramelized onions, a very generous supply of clotted Gruyere and Emmentaler Cheeses, and a few chives sprinkled on top, it was a memorable Onion Soup Gratinee that took me awhile to fully consume.  But of course I eventually did, to the last drop!

For our entree we each ordered a medium-rare 10 oz. Filet Mignon.  The tall and long, lightly charred prime-grade steaks yielded buttery, melt in the mouth meat which was quite tasty in its own right, but even better after being joined with a trio of sauces: Soy-Rice Wine Sauce, Peppercorn Sauce, and classic Bearnaise Sauce.  I enjoyed alternating forkfuls of beef with a few drops of the three sauces, and never did determine a clear favorite between the Soy-Rice Wine Sauce and the Bearnaise.  Each was an excellent flavor amplifier of the perfectly cooked beef, as were the Shishito Peppers that accompanied my Filet.

Along with our steaks we split a single wide Crab Leg from South Africa with Drawn Butter at $38.00 a pop.  I had decided in advance that if the one crab leg seemed insufficient, I would order another.  But there was no need.  In fact, because my stomach was quite full, I left 2 ounces of my steak on my plate, uneaten, which is uncharacteristic for me, and which I now regret!  

I'm sure that our sides took a toll on our bodies as well, making us very content.  For what is a steak dinner without some fine sides?  And fine sides we had!  Gratin Dauphinois Potatoes were as cheesy and as great as they looked in photos on Yelp.  We reveled in oozing Comte Cheese.  And, Roasted Glazed Market Mushrooms were a quite interesting array of several types of mushrooms, including Enoki.  Each side was easily enough for two diners, and a few mushrooms were also left behind.

Not to be overlooked were the fine slices of complimentary Sourdough Bread and great Raisin Bread with Walnuts served with an elongated slab of butter with some specks of Chive Salt on top.  Initially I thought I had encountered my first slice of salty Sourdough Bread--until I realized that the Chive Salt was causing the sensation of a burst of salt in my mouth.  But I grew to like this, and more Chive Salt Butter was ordered, quickly received, and slathered on more bread.

To finish, Diane enjoyed Warm Valrhona Cake with a molten center and a scoop of Vanilla Bean Ice Cream, while I very much liked my scoop of Chocolate Sorbet specially adorned with a brittle Chocolate Bow.

Service by three attendants was superb.  A request for decaffeinated Iced Tea was responded to with three successive pots of brewed hot decaffeinated Chamomile Tea and Relax Tea made specially for me, and poured over a large glass of ice.  Water glasses were continually filled without any need for a request, and we were regularly visited by a member of our formally clad waitstaff to see if we needed anything.  

Our seating in a corner booth was very comfortable.  And the sumptuous decor surrounding us, combined with our window view of rising jets of water from the fountains just outside and the sound of jazzy music piped in overhead, afforded a classy, upscale ambiance that, along with the wonderful food, yielded a luxurious and quite memorable five-star dining experience.
      
I am going to start saving real soon for our next visit to Prime, and highly recommend this dining experience to all!

I don't even know where to begin! This steakhouse was possibly the best meal I ever had! The sauce they accompanied with the steak was so amazing. I never liked any sauce with my steak but that sauce... whatever it was, it was like MAGIC. 

Filet Mignon: This was so tender and juicy. It literally felt like it was melting in my mouth. 

28 oz Bone in Rib eye: This was so HUGE. It could fill up two people. So if you wanted to save a bit of money, ordering the 28 oz and sharing it with another person would be a good idea. This was a little bit tougher than the filet mignon but it's still soft and very flavorful.

Yukon Gold Mashed Potatoes: This was the best mashed potato of my life! I just wanted to go back just for this. Unfortunately you can't order food in the bar area so we were never able to have some of this delicious side.

Mac and cheese: Very cheesy but it also had a soft taste and the cheese they used didn't overwhelm us. It was really delicious.



Negative: Steaks didn't come with sides. The sides were 12-18$ a piece.

PRIME is my favorite steakhouse on the Strip. I've dined here over 20+ times and the service has been outstanding each and every single visit. 

I love the location, ease of pulling into valet (Flamingo) and walking down to the escalator into the restaurant within a minute or two. I barely bump into tourists, very convenient. 

Once you enter, love the feminine décor. Elegant colors, beautiful lighting, mirrors everywhere, fabulous tables overlooking the waterfall and experienced staff all make for a fabulous evening. Not to forget, massive floral arrangements throughout the restaurant. Reminds me of home. 

LOVE the seafood tower, priced at around $200/person is great. Freshest seafood and neatly arranged. I always order this as an appetizer to start off. 

I only eat medium rare steak - (each visit) my steak has been prepared to perfection! 

I do not feel taking photos of my dishes (in this classier environment) is ideal. I have not, and will not pull out my cell to take photos. 

If you love steakhouses, you'll love PRIME ~

Last night, we enjoyed our fifth Restaurant Week meal. We had ($50.11) dinner at Prime. It was less stuffy than I imagined. It's odd, though, jackets are preferred for men but they have no coat check. Anyhow, it's a nice dining room with fountain views. We noshed on the bread basket filled with a variety of sour dough, pretzel and raisin walnut.

First Course
Tomato Gazpacho; Summer Flavors, Marcona Almonds & Olive Oil and Bacon Wrapped Shrimp; Passion Mustard & Cumin Scented Honey

Second Course
Filet Medallions; Sweet Corn, Crispy Spaetzle & Fiore Sardo Cheese

Third Course
Warm Valrhona Chocolate Cake; Vanilla Ice Cream and Summer Berries; Strawberry Gelée & Marsala Cream

The gazpacho must have been a blend of tomatoes and watermelon. It would make the perfect smoothie. Still, it was a refreshing treat with fun surprises of raspberries, strawberries, peppers, and marcona almonds. The shrimp were properly cooked and the bacon was nice and crisp. The flavor was a unique blend of sweet and smokey.

The filet was cooked to perfect and it sliced like butter. It was fantastic on its own, but coupled with the shallot sauce? Wow. We agreed the Bearnaise and au pouvoir hindered the already fabulous flavor of the steak. The spaetzle was light and tasty with the sweetness from the corn.

Dessert were tasty, but they were the weakest links of the meal. Properly executed but both just lacked pizazz. Service was attentive throughout the meal. Prior to Restaurant Week, we had never dined in a Jean-Georges Vongerichten restaurant. We've been missing out. Both Prime and Jean-Georges were highly enjoyable.

Don't be impressed with the decor, the location, the menu and the prices. When you go to a high-end steak house, you want a great steak, right? So let's keep it real, shall we? 

Our food wasn't bad but it was definitely overpriced.  I guess when I order a steak medium-well I expect it to be slightly pink, not totally gray through and through and on the tough side.  The macaroni and cheese was so sharply cheesy I honestly could not eat it.  The truffle mashed potatoes were too truffly (I didn't think that was possible until Prime). The bread basket was excellent though. 

The bar is very small so if you have to wait for a table you're pretty much standing in the foyer. 

The hosting staff has an impeccable system for knowing who is next to be seated, what time your reservation is and "remembering" your name. This impressed me a great deal.  

The waitstaff was good but a bit stuffy.  

The room was nicely appointed and appealingly quiet except for a large party that had three very young children with them (all certainly under 5 years old who spent a great deal of time crying and unhappy - why bring children to a restaurant like this?).    

With so many options in Las Vegas, I certainly wouldn't choose to dine here again.

Incredible restaurant...always excellent service - always incredible fare.  We have had dinner at Prime on every visit to Las Vegas in the last 10 years.  Prime is always top-notch, and our most recent trip for my husband's 40th birthday was no exception.  They went to great lengths to accomodate my husband's Celiac disease, even going so far as to prepare and bake gluten-free bread for the table as well as gluten free sauces and desserts.  We sat out on the patio and enjoyed the fountains immensely from that vantage. The steaks were fantastic - the sides to die for .... everything was absolutely top-notch.  Can't wait to visit again.

8/29/13
First night in Vegas, my brother in- law wanted me to try this restaurant the place itself is a little dark to the point they had to use a flashlight to look at my  steak.(which we will get to) So lets get right to the steaks. I ordered the bone in rib eye, which is one of my favorites. i ordered mine medium rare. The first steak was well done. The manager was standing behind me watching me cut it several times and finally asked is something was wrong, so i told him it was overcooked and he brought me out a new steak. Great I thought, then the second one was raw that's where the flashlight came and he looked at it. He brought it back for a refire and guess what this time it was microwaved. A microwave steak for $58 and with a name like prime I could buy a better steak in a grocery store.In between all the steaks I had to ask for another drink which the waiter never brought till I was done eating. I sent it back cause it was sitting there so long there wasn't any ice left in it. the manager took my microwave steak off the bill big deal it still cost me $300, what a waste when there so many good restaurants in Vegas

Good lord!!! We order sooo much food, we had to take some of it home!!! 

Came here for a friends birthday celebration and we sat at a nice table with a great view of the strip and Bellagio fountains. Started off with drinks of course. I ordered the Prime Car which is made of Zaya rum (my favorite rum!!!) and orange Curaçao served up with a sugar rim. It was fabulous, right up my alley, so much that I had a couple more. If you order the perfect gin and tonic, which is tangurey, tonic, cucumber and mint... Be aware that this is served in a wine glass, up with the bottle of fever-tree tonic on the side. This way it will not be watered down. 

We had two seafood platters amongst the 7 of us... And we demolished these! It had crab, lobster, oysters, mussels, clams and shrimp! Also came with a few trays of sauces. 

I ordered French onion soup, which came out to the table earlier than I expected, but was also taste worthy. 

Here comes the steak!!!! Amazing!!! I had the bone in ribeye and there were plenty of filets around the table. A steak is amazing if it doesn't need any additives... And although this needed no additives I just had to try the three sauces they offered on the table. The peppercorns had some spice too them and was my favorite! I had a couple bites of the sea bass too, and although it was good, it wasn't nearly as good as Noodles (restaurant also in Bellagio). 

Creamy spinach was a weird flavor to me. Shiitake mushrooms had ALL the flavor.  

We ordered blow job shots but really wanted Cinnamon Toast Crunch shots. I advise them to get Rum Chatta at the bar, it's becoming too popular now not to have it. 


We had a cake ordered at Jean Phillipe do we didn't order from the Prime dessert menu. 

Staff was very attentive; pulling out chairs to sit and collecting our belongings that fell on the floor. I really appreciated all their help. Would definitely come back!

In my never ending quest to find the perfect steakhouse ... I find myself this time at Jean Georges' Prime at the Bellagio.  After a rather disappointing experience at his other outpost next door, the JG Steakhouse at the Aria, I was a little skeptical to say the least ... that feeling went away the instant I entered in.

Situated "lake-side" next to the 2star Michelin PIcasso, Prime occupies one of the best locations in the hotel overlooking the famous fountains of the Bellagio.  If you reserve early enough you can easily request prime seating, pun intended, with a beautiful view of the lake, the fountains and the Vegas strip.  

As for the food, we started with the grilled foie gras with jalapeno marmalade.  The foie was excellent and cooked to perfection ... though I must admit, I find it exceedingly difficult to use the words "foie gras" and "disappointment" in the same sentence.   We opted for the 28oz bone-in rib eye for two. Now I must say that in reviewing any steakhouse in the past, I always get the rib eye and therefore I can honestly say that I'm comparing apples to apples.  The rib eye was cooked perfectly and the table side carving was a nice and sexy touch. The beef was super tender and full of flavor with the proper amount of marbling.  The steak came with several sauces - and though I don't normally use "sauce" at a high end steakhouse such as Prime ... I must admit that the soy rice wine sauce gave the steak that extra punch ... that it didn't necessarily need it was more than fine the way it was.  For the sides, the truffle mash potatoes were exceptional as well as the mac and cheese ... though I more than preferred the truffled mash version at the JG Steakhouse next door.  The lemon tart dessert was a bit of an after thought ... but then again I came here for some great steak and a great steak I had.

Again, in my eternal crusade to find the perfect steakhouse ... Prime is at the moment, the undisputed leader of the pack.  The impeccable service, the elegant interior, and most importantly, the unparalleled steaks combine to truly put this place in a class of its own.  I suspect that I will no longer be trying any other steakhouses in Vegas as I have officially found my favorite steakhouse in Vegas if not the entire planet.  The bar has undoubtedly been raised by Prime.

Been here a good handful of time.  Rib eye never disappoints.  With the miso butter sauce you can't go wrong.  I do feel that the service is lacking.  They are so busy I feel the wait staff doesn't care cause they know the customers will be there.  Unfortunate.  I don't expect anything more than having my drink refilled and check on once or twice throughout the meal.  If I can't even get that...it is really a problem.

Just excellent all round.

Service, Decor, Food and Wine all fantastics and worth the splurge.

The place is beautiful and elegant, specially if you get lake view. The food was ok, but for the price I was expecting better taste! Staff was ok. Probably my expectations were too high, I would recommend other places I.e. El Lago!

Our steaks were over cooked and dry, ordered medium rare received medium well. I'm sure this place does have great steaks but on this day they weren't. Very disappointed I'm only giving a 3 star rating because the waiter took our complaint to heart and offered to correct it. However we politely refused his offer and made the best of it.

For our last night in Vegas, three of us decided to dine at Prime. We had an amazing view of the fountains and an amazing last meal in Vegas. Pedro took great care of us and our Filet Mignons and NY Strip Steaks were amazing. I would highly recommend trying Prime.

Yeah, not the best place I have had steak.  My rib-eye was actually very good but my wife's fillet trio was just plain bad. But what really made me give Prime two stars was the service.  Mike and Walter were our servers.  Walter was great but Mike, not so much.  Basically he was just indifferent towards us.  I expect more from a $$$$ steak house.

If you happen to win a lot of money in Vegas, or if you already have an abundance, head over to Prime Steakhouse at Bellagio's to pamper your palate.  We each had the $100 surf and turf and the window seat seemed like the best one in the house.  The service, food, decor, and atmosphere were all immaculate.  The water show was just as impressive as it was on PBS's New Years 2000 special, and we kept our table far too long drinking wine and eating a couple of desserts, which is probably why it costs so much to eat there.  There are not a lot of people coming and going...every one stays for a while.

I would recommend Prime Steakhouse to anyone celebrating a special occasion or if you just won the lottery.
This place is awesome! Geat food and service went here for dinner with friends good times...

came here for a special dinner this past Saturday. I made reservations a few days in advance for a table for two at 7pm in front of the fountains. 


The day of , i came in two hours earlier before going to the spa to show my noir card as the person who took my reservation suggested to ensure the fountain view. They said no guarantees but they will try..


At 7 we came in and had to wait an additional 20 minutes. No big deal. 

Our waiter was a bit awkward. He seemed to be in character of an over anxious server in a semi mocking way. Almost like Geoffrey from fresh prince of bel air. I also noticed he didnt speak like that to any of the other tables he served, his tone of voice and personality completely changed. But he remained in this character for our table. When he approached us he didn't introduce himself or ask how we were. Just asked if we were ready to order drinks from out of nowhere. 


We ordered the aged rib eye, short ribs, shrimp cocktail , and truffle mashed potatoes. 

The short ribs were so soft and tender. It was probably the stand out if the dishes we ordered. The shrimp cocktail came with four shrimps that were basically the size of baby lobsters i felt. Very meaty and enjoyable. 

The aged rib eye was good but left me wanting for a bit more. When i bit into it i couldnt help but think this was a somewhat mediocre steak. The three sauces it came with were fun, but i was slightly disappointed in the steak itself. 

The truffle mashed potatoes were good but very whipped, borderline runny; maybe more than what I'm used to. But the truffle flavor was definitely there. 

 We sat smack in the front of the fountains in the inside of the restaurant. During winter months it can be a bit cold. All in all im glad i tried this place out. However , i think one time is enough for me.

If a six star existed, Prime would be the one to get it. I had one of the most delicious meals of my life in one of the most beautiful settings around. Imagine eating a 5 star steak meal window-side to an eye-level view the Bellagio Fountains. Picture front row access to a one-of-a-kind Bellagio Fountain show and eating as the Fountain goes off every 15 minutes in front of your window. This is an experience at Prime. 

Now, mostly everyone has described the food perfectly so I want to focus chat more about the picturesque atmosphere. Yes, the dress code exists so don't plan on coming here unless your dressed to impress. Yes this is the perfect option for a delicious high-end meal (without the cheesy Vegas vibe) and yes, this is probably one of the most fancy restaurants I've ever dined at. I really can't do justice to the restaurant's setting and while it is a little stuffy, it's perfect for a delicious and delightful dining experience. 

I can't leave this review without mentioning the food, especially since it was perfectly flawless. The wedge salad has the right amount of dressing with just enough kick and the pretzel bread that comes with the meal is buttery perfection. But let me talk about the real winners of the meal: the sides and the main courses. You know when people say Filet tastes like butter? Well now I know what they mean. I have never tasted anything so tender in my life. The short ribs are so perfectly cooked that you don't need a knife to enjoy it (maybe a little elf magic helped the chefs create these culinary creations!?) Finally, the sides. Oh the sides! Truffle mashed potatoes. They are expensive and come in a very small kettle. However, it's so rich in flavor and butter that it can easily fill up two people, especially with accompanying sides and an entree. The mac 'n cheese is just as delicious. Between those two sides, a salad and an entree, I could easily have called this my last supper and been happily content in life.

My company exhibits at a tradeshow at the Bellagio each year and we always have a group dinner one or two nights at Prime. The food is amazing and the service is great. We usually start out with the seafood sampler platter which is a jaw dropping mound of ice with lobster, crab, shrimp, oysters, etc.   I'm not a big red meat eater so I usually get seafood, although a couple times I've ordered a steak. Everything has always been delicious and the service is great.

They have a private room that seats 12 in the back which has been perfect for our group dinners. If you are staying at the Bellagio you have to try this place out. Especially if you can expense dinner. ;o)

We went to Prime on our first night in Vegas. We had eaten there before 2 years ago out on the patio. This time we made a reservation inside. You definitely need a reservation. We had a quaint table in a dining area near a large window so we could see some of the fountain. I started out with the Shrimp cocktail which was 4 large shrimp with cocktail sauce perfectly displayed on a bed of ice with lemon. They were delicious and a perfect appetizer. We both ordered the Caesar salad which was not only delicious but a nice sizable portion. I ordered the filet mignon which was superb and my companion got the dry aged bone in ribeye which he loved. We split the truffled mashed potatoes which were so creamy and delectable and a perfect portion to share. They did give us a nice bread basket with various bread including my favorite pretzel bread. We were too stuffed for dessert. The service was absolutely impeccable and friendly. Would definitely go back. Definitely pricey. Also, I might add there is a dress code which was not necessarily enforced.

Oh em gee. I am impressed! This may have been the best meal I've eaten in my life. It's a super romantic restaurant, beautiful lighting, big plush chairs. The service from start to finish was impeccable. I started with the iceberg wedge salad, and the blue cheese was divine as was the bacon. I ordered the dry-aged bone in ribeye. It was absolutely huge, cooked perfectly, and came with three sauces. I'm a sauce girl so I was excited to see bernaise, au poivre, and soy ginger brought to the table with that marvelous piece of meat. The side dish I cannot stop thinking about.... the truffle mashed potatoes. They are a must have, and I salivate even thinking about them. Such heaven. I will definitely be going back.

Loved the ambiance, elegant, classy, we got a window view of the billagio water show. Perfect! There are people there to take pictures If you want, but overpriced. 
Food was great, I feel a little overpriced for small portion sizes, i got scallops still hungry after, but we didn't get apps. Compared to other classy restaurants on strip, but nothing major, just slightly.
Breads were great, truffle mashed absolutely delicious!! Ate every bite!!! 
Severs were absolutely great: helpful, polite, gracious.

I can't say enough positive things about this place; everything I had was excellent. I went for a birthday dinner in a group of 5, made reservations, and we were seated as soon as we arrived. We probably weren't as dressed up as we could have been, but we were all presentable, and there were no issues. The table ordered a variety of things from appetizers through dessert: the french onion soup, wedge salad, filet mignon, ribeye, chicken, salmon, loaded baked potato, asparagus, lava cake, and more! We also enjoyed cocktails beforehand, and even those were noteworthy. The service was impeccable, with water refilled as needed throughout the night, without ever having to ask. They timed letting us get settled, ordering drinks, followed by appetizers, meals and desserts perfectly. I am definitely going back the next time I'm in Vegas, and would recommend this to anyone looking for a beautiful restaurant, delicious meal, and flawless service to round out your night!

Mediocre is the best way to describe Prime.  I don't want to give anyone the false impression that the food or service here is in any way bad (or even close to it), but for the money you are paying, the food falls well short of expectations.  

The high point of my trip to Prime was the service, which was outstanding as expected, service that even went as far as to bring out an extra table cloth for a member of our party who was cold due to one of the doors being left open.  The food, however, was just uninspiring.  The bottom line is that you can have food that is just as good, if not better, at a number of other places on the strip, for much less money.  Everything was prepared and presented perfectly, as expected, but it sadly doesn't make up for the fact that I've had better steaks for much less money, and the service, ambiance, and prestige of Prime Steakhouse doesn't make up the difference in price.  

I have very high expectations for Prime, and they simply were not met.

The Prime Steakhouse is an elegant restaurant tucked away within the confines of the Bellagio Hotel. Unlike the other steakhouses located on the strip, the Prime is one of those classy restaurant that caters to the sophisticated diner with high expectations in service and the quality of the food. Reservations are strongly recommended and an evening in this restaurant will set you back a minimum of $250 for two people. 

Overview: I have visited at this restaurant a total of 3 times in the past several months and I was never once disappointed. The service is outstanding and they will generally try to work with the customer to provide the best possible dining experience. One of the Prime's main selling point is that they feature dry aged beef that has been aged for over 30 days for the best possible flavor. They also have a varied selection of wines to compliment your dinner. 

PROS: An enjoyable and sophisticated atmosphere, excellent staff, and quality cuts of beef. 

CONS: The restaurant has a dress code posted requiring dinner jackets for men. However, that dress code is loosely enforced. I have seen some guests come in with a dress shirt and jeans. 

Restaurant Class: Lower-Upper 

Food: (4 out of 5 stars) The steaks are well prepared and cooked to order. And the dry aged ribeye do not disappoint. Any steak you order in this restaurant will be a quality cut of beef. The side dishes were also surprisingly good. They are also large enough to be shared. The only negative thing I noticed about the steaks was that it was a bit on the salty side for my palliate. But that can be easily remedied by ordering your steak with less salt or unsalted. 

Atmosphere: (4 out of 5 stars) If you are celebrating a special occasion or just want to have a romantic dinner, this restaurant is definitely for you. The atmosphere is relaxing yet vibrant enough to keep your attention; and the mood is sophisticated, yet subtle enough to have a little fun. Lastly, you can never go wrong with a window seat overlooking the Bellagio fountains. 

Cleanliness: (4.5 out of 5 stars) The entire dining room is kept virtually spotless and comfortable. The tables are cleaned frequently with fresh linens and table cloths. 

Service: (4 out of 5 stars) The staffs are all absolute professionals. They know their jobs and they know what the customer expects out of them. In fact, they are so detailed oriented that they will give the gentlemen wearing a dark suit a black linen instead of a white one. 

Restroom Facilities: (3.5 out of 5 stars) Despite this restaurant's location, it does have it's own facilities. And like the dinning room, the restrooms are kept relatively clean and well stocked. Additionally, the men's room also comes with complimentary amenities like lotion or hair cell.

What can I say about this place... Absolutely beautiful, I went to this steakhouse for my birthday and I couldn't of asked for anything better. Sitting on the patio is a MUST because of the incredible view, the bone in Filet Mignon might have been the juciest filet I've ever had in Las Vegas. The flavors, aromas, and a beautiful girlfriend made the perfect birthday Dinner. The only problem was when I ordered my filet the first time medium rare it was well done. The waiter returned it immediately and gave me a new Filet. Definitely going back!

came here for my birthday dinner with Justin B. and was impressed but not WOW-ed by the place...called in that morning to get reservations on a friday night and while we didnt get a window fountain seat, the water show is pretty much view-able from most of the restaurant. came in fairly dressed up for our dinner only to see other patrons wearing polo shirts, shorts and jeans - they are definitely not strict with their dress code. we were seated right away and the service was spot on.

we started off our meal with the Chilled Shellfish platter taht came with oysters, clams, mussels, king crab, lobster tail, and shrimp cocktail - we only ordered a serving for 1 person so you basically get 2 of each type of seafood which was plenty for us. everything was delicious and came with a great mustard dipping sauce!

next up was our main course - ordered the 8 oz. filet along with truffle mashed potatoes and the mac and cheese. while the filet was perfectly good and tasty, i think the side dishes really stole the show! the truffle mashed potatoes were sooo good! you could really taste the truffle and it was sweet but not overpowering by any means. the mac and cheese had a good burnt crust on the top of it and was delicious! the side dishes portions are perfect for 2 people to share.

overall great experience at Prime. nothing to complain about but i think i've just had better steaks in my life thats all (i.e. at CUT haha)....

My wife and I recently dined at Prime and were both very impressed.  I made a reservation the same day and since the restaurant overlooks the Bellagio Fountains, requested a seat with a view.  Given the last minute reservations I doubted my request would be granted but sure enough, we had front row seats to the show.  

The waitstaff was extremely professional and courteous.  They knew their menu and wine choices and made our experience extremely enjoyable.  The food was tremendous and the sides were mouth watering.  It was a bit pricey but that's what you can expect from a Vegas steak house.  I'd certainly visit again next time we are in Vegas.

Disappointing. I would recommend spending your hundreds of dollars elsewhere. Dinner started off well enough.  We were seated right away and our wine was brought promptly.  The salads were delicious as well as the soups. However when the main course came, my filet mignon wasn't seasoned at all.  Unseasoned to the point that I thought the chef just must have honestly forgotten or gotten distracted by something. I would have informed the waitress, but she never came to the table between the time our main course was served and when she brought the bill. She seemed annoyed when we then ordered a round of after dinner scotch.  After she then dropped the bill off for the second time, we never saw her again.  We waited at the table for her to come get our credit card. When after about 25 or 30 minutes she never came back, we found someone else to help us. Of course the hostess had stepped away for a moment which normally wouldn't be any issue, but it just added insult to injury having to try to spend so much money on such an unsatisfactory meal.  We were there at an off-peak time (very early dinner due to an engagement) and there were very few people in the restaurant, however I expected so much more.  We didn't want to spoil our evening by asking to see a manager and causing a commotion (we rarely complain so it was a little nerve-racking  to have to try so hard just to do so), plus we had an engagement we had to get to. We didn't feel welcome and I didn't even have a good steak at what as supposed to be an amazing steakhouse.
best in all categories

Our filet mignon was made to perfection - medium rare. The wine selection was perfect. The whole dinner and experience was amazing! The espresso at the end was very good. I didn't pay, but I'm assuming it was quite on the pricier side. Would definitely recommend for a special occasion or for a night out.

the food, the view, our server.. the overall experience......

this will be a place we'll visit everytime we're in vegas. everything was so delicious!

When I walked into this restaurant I loved the decor and comfort of my chair.  However, as the dining experience continued I found the atmosphere to be too dark.  My party and I got sleepy.  I LOVED my beet salad, but my short ribs were VERY salty.  I few others  in my party felt the same about their dishes.  The gnocchi was very disappointing.  No dessert as dessert menu was underwhelming.  I had only a glass of wine, but flipped through a very extensive wine list.  I found the waiter a little over the top and at times I became annoyed.  Lastly, the photographer who takes professional photos and puts a guilt trip on you  for not buying a proof DID NOT fit the atmosphere.  I'd go back for that beet salad!

I love steakhouses, steak, and different kinds of steak. What I love about Prime by Jean Georges, is that's its consistently good, which isn't the case with a lot of steakhouses. The service is always top notch, the dining room has a classy steakhouse feel to it, and it overlooks the beautiful Bellegio fountains. I tend to stick to the Rib Eye but the Fillet is also excellent and tender, and you can't really fo wrong with any of the starters. Been there many times and will continue to do so whenever I'm staying at the Bellagio. Never had a bad meal there.

I want to hire their interior designer for my house, it is so beautifully decorated inside! The wait staff is extremely knowledgable down to the tiniest details and funny as well, so you don't feel like your in a snooty atmosphere. The cocktails, wine, steaks, and dessert just kept outdoing themselves. Bravo Bellagio and Bon A Petit to anyone lucky enough to have the pleasure of experiencing such a magnificent meal!

My boyfriend and I chose to celebrate our 1 year anniversary at Prime Steakhouse at the Bellagio and we are so glad we did. It was wonderful! First and foremost, the food was incredible. After we shared the salmon sashimi as an appetizer, I had the seared tuna and my boyfriend had the filet mignon. Both were tender, juicy and just as we ordered. We also split the family-style side dishes, wild mushrooms and truffle mashed potatoes as sides. I insisted on the mashed potatoes after reading about how great they were on Yelp! and everyone was right - they were even better than anticipated. So creamy with a special 'bite' to them that I find impossible to describe. You really have to taste it to believe it. Drooling as I write... but I digress. Prime has an extensive wine list and the excellent staff even surprised us with a 'happy anniversary' free dessert of lava chocolate cake a la mode. Everything from the ambiance to the service to the food was perfect. The incredibly romantic view of the fountains at the Bellagio which went off frequently throughout our meal made the night even more memorable and special and the waiter didn't even complain when we asked him take a photo of us. We had a hard time getting reservations even calling a month out - we had to choose between 5:30 or 10 p.m. so I recommend making reservations as soon as you know you will be in Las Vegas and celebrating a special evening. This restaurant should be saved for special occasions though as it was a very pricey meal! But if you want to impress, this is the place to come.

Wow. People who know me know I don't just hand out 5 stars. But this place was fantastic. The steak was without a doubt the best I have ever had in my life. Perfect in every way. My boyfriend comes here every time he goes to Vegas and reports they never have had an off day. I order the 8-oz fillet and asparagus and mashed potatoes. The potatoes were very creamy and the asparagus was asparagus. Really just speedbumps on my fantastic steak journey. Additionally they give you 4 sauces to have with your steak and I couldn't decide which was more delicious or if I just wanted to taste the fantastic steak on its own. Wow. Really. I am not a foodie but every bite I wanted to stop and savor. 

The steak was so good I almost forgot the mention the appetizers. I had salmon sashimi that was extremely fresh delicious fish. I thought the sauce was a bit much. But it was a great price for great cuts of fish. Plentiful and expertly presented. My boyfriend got the crab cake and it was a single cake for $24. The taste was smooth and creamy, but for 1 cake I was a little disappointed for him and stuck to my salmon sashimi.

For the restaurant it is nice but not overly so. No pretentious feeling and a nice cozy place for a date. Decor is pleasant and chairs very comfortable. The wait staff was nice  and attentive but not disruptive.
My 2nd time dining at this restaurant and I was more impressed this time around.  Ordered ,truffle mashed potatoes, Sea Bass,  bacon wrapped shrimp and short ribs! All were delish

Excited for a night out at a very nice steakhouse.  Sat outside which gave an amazing view of the fountains, but was quite chilly even with the outdoor heaters.   Service was slow although the 4 wait staff we had were attentive.   When the meals finally came we were definitely underwhelmed.  My filet was overcooked... ordered it medium and there was no pink inside.   My husband had the peppercorn crusted NY strip ordered medium and his was absolutely rare to medium-rare - red cold center.  We did not send them back... we were cold and had already been there an hour and a half.  Sides and salads were good as were our drinks.   Nothing over the top, but good.  Overall have had a much better steak from Flemings back in our hometown... for a much more reasonable price.  For the price of our meal and after the recommendation from friends  I had expected much more.
The service and food were outstanding. Best view in town if you get a table by the fountain! Highly recommend!

One of the Best Restaurants that I have ever been too.

So my girlfriend and I went to Vegas to celebrate our 2 year anniversary and I wanted to book a nice dinner with a nice view of the Bellagio Fountains. I eventually decided to make an online reservation at Prime with a request to have a table with a view of the Bellagio Fountains. 

So we get to the restaurant and noticed some available outside seating and it turned out that one of those seats outside right next to the water was ours! 

So my girlfriend had the filet mignon and I had the 18oz bone-in prime rib. We decided to share the sides which were buttered mushrooms, creamed spinach, and garlic mashed potatoes along with some red wine. Let me tell you, the meal was ABSOLUTELY AMAZING. The steak was cooked perfectly and the sides accompanied the meal well. The view of the fountains was so picturesque and there were speakers that played the music of the fountain show. It was a magical night.

I think what made this night mostly memorable were the little things that made you feel like you were high-class. The host and server greeted us "Happy Anniversary".
