They even brought out a little lava flow cake for dessert with the words "Happy Anniversary" written in chocolate syrup. They even had a professional photographer who took photos of us which we eventually bought 2 of them as souvenirs for our night.

The only thing of note is that this restaurant is not for the budget-conscious. A dinner for 2 can easily set you back a $200+ if you go all-out, but my girlfriend and I don't go out to eat at restaurants all the time and this was a special occasion so I didn't really flinch twice at the prices. We got what we paid for.

Great restaurant! Amazing steak. Highly-recommended for a romantic night! Will definitely go back again!

Prime is a great steakhouse.

The view of the water show at the Bellagio is fantastic, should you opt for the outdoor seating.

The steaks are wonderful, as was the Seafood Shellfish to share amongst the non-selfish :) - - clams, mussels, oysters, shrimp, crab and lobster

The service is good as well.

I had the bone-in-fillet mignon, which was perfect!

This can be what I'd say one of the better ambient sort of romantic steakhouses in Las Vegas, a good place for a meat eating date.

The prices are of course higher than your typical meat and potatoes restaurant, but if you're accustomed to paying $50-80 for a steak, this is a good place.  The avg meal after tax/tip with a drink or appetizer should set you back about $150 per person at minimum, and once you add bottles of wine and the high end appetizers you're closer to $200-250+ per person to do it the right decadent way not holding back and just having a good time... YOLO !!!

I came here to celebrate my B-day weekend, and I was VERY impressed.  First off, AMAZING service.  Our server was very friendly and paid the perfect amount of attention.  He also recommended a DELICIOUS Cabernet to pair with our steak (not TOO expensive either).  We started with the crab cakes which was heaven in my mouth.  Even the complimentary bread & butter was epic! I ordered the Filet Mignon, Onion Rings, Truffle Mashed Potatoes, Potato Gratin and corn.  ALLLLLL amazing. My favorite were the truffle mashed potatoes if I HAD to choose one.  They brought me a complimentary chocolate cake for my bday which was so nice :) We also ordered a creme brulee & coffee.  All were delicious. Finally, our server brought us free tickets for the Bank nightclub, where we went after we saw "O." Must say...great weekend at the Bellagio.  Will definitely come back for the next special occasion :)

Way overrated, especially for the price. I had the iceberg salad with vinaigrette to start and the dressing was very strange, tasted like soy sauce. For my entree I ordered scallops and they were great! My husband shared a few bites of his ribeye with me and we both found it to be pretty bland. It was served with three sauces that I didn't try because a great steak shouldn't need a sauce. Our sides were macaroni and fries. The macaroni was delicious but the fries were just average everyday boring fries. Service was great. I understand that the restaurant is classy and upscale but I'm pretty sure this is one of the last few that doesn't allow shorts, nice shorts, not talking cutoffs or cargos here....but jeans are acceptable, strange to me. My poor husband had to borrow a pair of their pants which they have on hand because apparently it's a common issue and even stranger he had to walk through the entire restaurant in his shorts to get to the restroom to change. Seems pointless.
The food was amazing. The host was completely helpful and the view was awesome. Will be back for sure!

There's no shortage of steakhouses on the strip, but this place has something that none of the other spots have...a patio with a stunning view of the Bellagio fountains and Vegas strip.  I HIGHLY recommend asking to sit on the patio when dining here.  It's an unforgettable experience.  

I got my go-to steak which is the cajun bone-in ribeye. Theirs is dry-aged and cooked perfectly.  I ended up splitting mine with a buddy who made the horrid decision of going to a steakhouse and ordering the salmon (whoops), but still left full.  The menu offers a wide selection of cuts, including A-5 Wagyu at $45/ounce, and a huge selection of sides (truffle mashed potatoes, creamed spinach, Glazed Mushrooms) that round out your meal nicely. 

If I'm in Vegas, I always make it a priority to visit this place.

This is a 5 star review! If your visiting Las Vegas or looking to have a possible life alternating steak then this is the place. 

I'm usually on top of snapping a few photos of everyone dinner plate. However, it was a special night celebrating my brothers bday and I got so excited to try all the dishes, I forgot. I've been on a health kick lately so this was a cheat meal. I must say FAITHFULLY cheated. It was delicious!! My brother enjoyed his dinner, too. That was my biggest mission. He religiously and generously is a high profile high roller in the family who has been to all the top spots around town. So it's hard to server this man a good, GREAT steak. The server suggested a the old aged prime rib! In addition, they brought 3 different house steak sauces to our table. Generally, I never care for the extra sauces but I couldn't resist. You have to try all 3 of them. That's exactly what I got and exactly what I recommend. Any restaurant at the Bellagio is generally a hit. Plan accordingly and treat yourself! MY TASTEBUDS WERE IMPRESSED!!!

Lack of one star is the service! I felt like the nagging customer reminding them we needed a refill, we needed a dessert menu, we needed our bill, we needed our server. It was towards closing time so most of the staff were occupied cleaning the tables down. :(
I order bone in age rib eye, medium well. Very dry. My wife order filet Mignon medium well, very good. But service not to good. I think for this price much better Steak house around.

Ok first of all, this review isn't based on the quality of food, but on the experience I had with my friends and my girlfriend. 
      My girlfriend, our friends and I, had made reservations for tonight, about a month ago, at 8 pm (7/1/16) for my girlfriend's birthday. We came for dinner and were told that we would have to wait an hour to be seated outside as we requested, which was fine because we really wanted to see the view for our dinner. So we waited a little over an hour and were finally seated at 9:08 The server was polite and very professional when taking our orders. And the wait began.
       So after waiting an hour to be seated, we had waited for over an hour with still no food. And let me remind you that this dinner was to celebrate my girlfriend's birthday. So we were all hungry and anxious, waiting for our food and my girlfriend is getting upset. Our server who was very polite and apologetic, had to repeatedly go and check on our food. 
       After about an hour with no food except bread and water our server had came back to apologize another time and had told us that the manager would come speak to us about the horrendous wait time for our food. The so called "manager" came to our table to apologize. I had to give her a piece of mind to give her a sense of what we were going through. Waiting an hour to be seated and another hour with NO FOOD! And on my girlfriend's birthday too..  This "manager" INTERUPTS me MIDSENTENCE to explain to me why we had to wait an hour to be seated. I understand why it took so long to be seated, that's fine. I just wanted her understand how we felt having to wait for so long. But to interrupt me after I had to wait AN HOUR without FOOD, to give me the same "your food will be right out" response and excuses as to why the food was taking so long. I had told her that this was unacceptable and she tells me in this disrespectful tone "What do you want me to do? Cancel the order? Bring out more bread?" 
        First of all, if you have to ask the guest what you want her to do, then you should not be the manager.
        Second, are you implying that you want me to cancel the order? Are you challenging me that I won't? The amount of disrespect was appalling. Why? Because we were a younger group of guest in their early 20s? That's another thing I noticed. This establishment seems to favor guests of an older crowd and seems to treat younger guests like children.  I felt like she was belittling me for voicing my opinion against this terrible experience. 
           Third, please don't offer me more bread when I've been waiting a whole hour for real food. It made me feel as though it would take even longer for the food to come out. 
            We ended up leaving the restaurant without eating dinner. Mainly because of how that manager was speaking to me. If this "manager" knew how to talk to a distraught guest, we would have given them our business. But this manager's disrespectful tone was the last straw. 
             I'm sure the food would have been delicious if it had gotten to us in time. I felt bad for our servers for being embarrassed do to a kitchen error. They were respectful and kind, but the manager was disrespectful despite her apologizing. 
             It's not the mistakes, but how they are corrected that matters. And this "manager" never learned that lesson.

Let me begin by saying this is the most elegant steakhouse I've been to. ( Although CUT is my favorite steak wise ) It is beautifully situated on the lakeside level of the Bellagio hotel. We were seated right by the elegantly draped huge windows that overlook the Bellagio fountain show and smashing chocolate brown and light blue decor.  The posh surroundings are warm, welcoming and yes... romantic.  The staff was very courteous and very knowledgeable on their selections of wine and food.   Although there are many other notable restaurants to choose from at while in Vegas, we didn't want to be late to our cirque de soleil - O show so dining here seemed to be the most practical solution. On to the food..

APPETIZERS 
1. Shrimp cocktail  =  Succulent and delicious 
 2. Butter-Poached King Crab w/ apple-chive Salad & Brioche = How can you possibly go wrong here? Melt in your mouth sensation as soon as it touched a taste bud. The chucks of crab were huge which i would have expected for an almost $30 dollar appetizer. Hehe. Well worth the price.
3. Caesar salad = Your typical Caesar salad with a little twist, the parmesan baked cone. So cheesy! 
MAIN COURSE
1. Bone-in Rib Eye Steak 18 oz = We both opted for the same steak and unfortunately I was NOT impressed. The quality of the meat is honestly not worth mentioning.  It wasn't very juicy or marbleized as other steaks I have tried.  Very mediocre, which I was not expecting.. sadly.  I almost forgot to mention that there are three different sauces for the steak that are provided, but for good steak the sauce just gets in the way. Well at least, in my opinion. =)
2. Bone-in Rib Eye Steak 18 oz
SIDES
1. Truffle mash potato = Ahhhh, SO GOOD.  I absolutely love anything that has truffle in it!  The flavor will explode in your mouth!  A definite must try for yourself!  
2. Mac and Cheese = I tasted white cheddar here.  Rather tasty. 
3. Steamed asparagus = Perfectly seasoned, but wasn't cooked enough.
OTHERS
1. Grey hound = Refreshing and light. 
2. Red Zinfandel = Recommended by our server, GREAT! Not too acidic or dry. Went well with my steak.
3. Red wine =  I forgot this one. 

Overall,  the atmosphere is close to perfection, but the food was very mediocre in taste with the exception of the Truffle mash potatoes and appetizers.  Although I was not impressed by the steak, I would return to try the seafood on their menu and the butter king crab again.  One thing I like about Prime is that they cater to their clientele. If something is not to your liking, they will do whatever they can to make sure you are pleased. The staff is exceptionally warm and personable too. Would return, but no steak for me! How ironic to say at a steakhouse.. 

1 out of 5. 5 being the highest
Food - 3 , truffle mash potatoes gets a 4!
Ambiance- 4
Service- 4
Price - Total with tip $308.00

By NO MEANS is this going to be a disappointing meal.The ambiance was outstanding. Anyone considering eating here, really should try it. Now, for starters, I am a local. When we go for steak dinner, we have ONE place that we always go to and it never fails. (God willing, it never will) The Golden Steer. For my dad's birthday, we wanted to do something different this year so we tried PRIME. While waiting for our table we sat at the bar. You can tell these guys have been working here for a while. They had a great attitude and had stories for days. When we were seated, we could't be happier. We sat in a small room to the right (most private area) and were right by the window on the water watching the fountains in full light. It was stunning. We started with the Seafood Tower. Magnificent. It was beautiful and of course delicious. Here is my complaint: they brought us a serving for three people, which there were three of us. But, if you have ordered a seafood platter before, it is not customary to serve per person because there is SO MUCH. Most places have offered to make it for a person or two less than what is in your party. Afterall, this is an appetizer. $67/person. I wish our server would have been a little more honest with us. This is something that will happen when you're on the strip. Some of the wait staff will try to take advantage of you. Especially when in fine dining and they are only going to turn their tables once or twice on a busy evening. So needless to say, we had way too big of an appetizer. 

For entrees we ordered the Bone-In Ribeye, and two peppercorn NY Strips. $61 for the NY and I believe $70 for the Ribeye. We got sauteed mushrooms, creamed spinach, and mashed potatoes for the sides. We also ordered some bernaise for the steaks. Yeah yeah, so I like sauce with my steak. The steaks were great. Cooked perfectly as well. But, first world problem, it just didn't melt in our mouths. It was missing that perfect tender melt in your mouth feeling that just disappears with a couple of chews. There was just something missing. They did however have a really nice char on them that left a crispy crust. The mashed potatoes though. My god. It was like a pot of melted butter. You had to eat them with a spoon. They were the best I have ever had. The sauteed mushrooms were great too. It is a wild mushroom blend fyi. The creamed spinach was okay. Nothing to write home about.

Total Bill: $544 (Tip not included.) We left a $100 tip. So this was a little over $200/person. 

I am very happy I went. It was a memorable dinner filled with good company, lots of alcohol, and some professional pictures taken by their house photographer. (Completely unnecessary but we were drunk by this point) So if you are considering going to PRIME while you're visiting in town, do it. I am sure you won't be disappointed.

The Good

Ribeye was solid. Very good, but nothing spectacular in comparison to other high end steakhouses.

The sides were magnificent. The truffle mashed potatoes were a truly unique treat, and the mac n cheese was also tasty.

We were seated with a direct view of the Bellagio Fountains, which was pretty cool.  

The Bad

Waiter was some serial killer looking old man. Not only was he a ghost during the meal, he told me to "hold on" when I tried to hand back the bill. The couple next to us shared our agitated sentiment. Then again, we were the only "young" people in the establishment. We actually became acquainted, and I invited them to join our table at the club later haha...only in Vegas.

Overall

My rating is leaning towards 3.5, as I really enjoyed the sides, but I can't ignore the atrocious service.

In the interest of full disclosure, dinner was hosted by someone who has been here before, has the means to make dinner phenomenal and even had a favorite server (Russell).

We started off the evening with a GIGANTIC seafood plateau with lobster, rock crab claws, king crab legs, oysters, huge prawns and a trio of delicious sauces.  Our server did us a service and suggested we ordered the plateau for four people even though we had five.  This appetizer alone filled me up half-way!!  Everything was super fresh and sweet.

That evening, Prime was featuring Tasmanian lobster tails.  You can add it to your dish as a "surf and turf" option, have it as an entree or order one for the table.  Our host went with one for the table and let me tell you...never in my life had I seen such a gargantuan lobster tail.  It was probably a foot long and 10 inches around.  It was presented, carved up and served to us with plenty left for the middle of the table.  Sweetest lobster I've ever had.  The flesh was firm yet tender (indescribeable).  No drawn butter necesary!

So Prime's thing is steak.  I went with our host's suggestion for the 5-peppercorn New York strip.  I'm really glad I did!  The flavor was bold and delicious.  It's what I like to call "fancy steak".  I had a few bites of our host's filet and that was melt-in-your-mouth delicious as well.  They give you three sauces to go with your steak and we ignored them all.
For sides, we had their spicy mac and cheese, truffle mashed potatoes (DROOL...I could have had the whole thing on my own), sauteed mushrooms, and specially ordered caramelized onions.  All were great sides.

Alas, due to the giantness of our appetizer, I had to give up trying to finish my steak.  Meanwhile, my husband had no problems finishing his porterhouse.

We were contemplating dessert when someone let slip to our server that it was hubby and my wedding anniversary.  The dessert menus were respectfully plucked out of our hands and in short order, their signature chocolate lava cake was brought out to us, served with a delicious home made caramel ice cream.  They wrote Happy Anniversary on the platter which made it all the more special. 

Prime has a great wine list of which I did not get to see.  However, the wines we had were delicious.  I brought the first two bottles (Kamen, CS, 2005) which opened up beautifully.  (NOTE: Their corkage fee is $35 but their policy is that they will only allow it if the wine is not already on their list).  Second was a D.R. Stephens CS 2005 and finally, the crowning glory, the Penfolds Grange 2001 (?).  I was in expensive wine heaven.  If wine tasted like this at a reasonable price, I'd have to have Al Anon on speed dial!

Our evening was fantastic.  Service was perfect.  It felt like we had an army of people waiting on us and constantly bringing us more water, constantly pouring us more wine.  Our server was almost embarassed that he caught our host pouring his own water and ran right over to take the bottle from him.  The best part was service was friendly, humorous and not at all snooty like a lot of fancy places.

This was definitely an experience to remember, even if I did stumble a little on the way out.  Just a little!!

Let's just start by saying that Vegas has become an over-priced, over-hyped, self-indulgent toilet of a town, if it wasn't already.  Second, I have never enjoyed any meal I have gotten in Vegas, nor has it been worth the price or crappy service that accompanied it.  Letting that color my view of "fine" (and I say that with a grain of salt) Vegas dining, it could be hard for me to put that out of my head.  I had recently eaten at Brand in the Monte Carlo.  So I had a feeling of what was to come.  Let's start with bartenders at the entrance of Prime.  Complete jerks.  Just because I am in my early/mid-20's doesn't mean I am poor or not going to spend beau-coup dollars.  The food is horribly overpriced, but when you are trying to cultivate a "superior," asshole feel to your restaurant, that's okay.  The problem is Las Vegas is miles from any reasonable agricultural area or the ocean.  That raises some flags for me.  Maybe that is why it cost more to eat there, but when you look at craigslist for jobs and homes, you see that cost of living is not insane in the Vegas area, so maybe I can just chalk it up as a "tourist trap."
The food was actually okay.  I got a lamb dish that was small, but reasonably cooked and came with a tasty mint sauce.  I also got a side of mac and cheese which was decadent beyond all belief but relatively standard for such an easy dish.  We split one bottle of wine for  our group because the prices were psychotic.  While the list was very voluminous, it wasn't worth paying for half the bottles on there since you were paying well over 150% over store retail.  I have a problem with this restaurant because it is no different from every other crap offering that every casino in Vegas has.
The service was average, but our waiter was clearly perturbed with the average age of our table.  We tipped well anyways but we felt like he made a thinly veiled comment regarding our ability to pay and the possibility of us ditching the bill.  That cost him $20 as we left since one of our party, who works in restaurants, had said he never heard such a comment.
Filet mignon and service was excellent!!

We've been here a number of times and the food is great.(hence the extra star) Service tonight was horrible. Waiter took a very long time to take our drink order and then even longer to take our food order. I had to ask him to take our salad plates after he let them sit for at least 15 minutes after we were finished. When our guest asked if he could have a pretzel role put in his to go bag, he said "we don't have anymore, unless you want me to go look thru the trash." He was rude and offensive. We will not be back. I was too appalled spend any extra time waiting to speak with management, as we had guests with us for business.

If management cares:
Check # 9083228
Server: team # 15
Table 26

Nice ambience with good steak.  Beer tartare with carpaccio was delicious.  Dessert drinks are overpriced but good. The filet mignon was cooked perfectly. The soy miso accompaniment sauce is my favorite !

My family and I went to Prime this weekend and thought that we were going to be in for a treat - we scored a table last minute on the beautiful patio and could not wait for our food.  The problem was all we did was wait - 20 minutes for water, 60 minutes for bread, and we had to ask twice to order wine and our food...you get the picture.  

After over an hour had gone by and we still did not have our appetizers - one french onion soup and one Caesar salad - my sister and I finally went into the restaurant and asked to speak with the manager.  After briefly explaining the situation to the manager, he informed us he would "look into it."  As we returned to our table, we found that our appetizers had finally made it.  The french onion soup had good flavor but was really greasy.  The Caesar salad was extremely bland.  

As we were taking our first bites of the appetizers, we saw the manager pop his head out on the balcony and presumed that he was coming to speak to us.  Instead, he never came back.  At this point, we were all happy to have a bit of food and prepared to sit back, relax and enjoy the entrees with our wine.

Again, we were disappointed as the entrees took much longer than expected to arrive.  When they finally did arrive, we were surprised to find that the food was pretty terrible.  The salmon was woefully undercooked (more than raw in the middle). The sea bass was far overcooked, chewy and fishy.   The seared tuna appeared to be covered in some sort of batter and flash fried.  The chicken entree was just blah.  Though we were starving, not a one of us came close to finishing our meal. 

Given the disappointing service and food, we asked to speak with the manager again.  When he approached our table, I asked why he had never spoken to us the first time - he mentioned that he saw we had a our starters and thought everything was fine.  After listening to our complaints on the food, he gave us a couple of excuses that really made no sense (it's a big restaurant, the patio is more relaxed).  

After confirming that our experience was sub-par, he then asked what we would like him to do about of experience.  We instead asked him what he thought he should do and suggested that the restaurant at least consider correcting the bill a bit given the poor quality of the food.  We were pleasantly surprised when he returned with the bill for the wine, soup and salad only - all of the entrees had been removed.   

We enjoy fine dining and thought that we had been so lucky to get into Prime - unfortunately, our night was almost ruined by this experience.  I would prefer to give this restaurant no stars because everything was just so terrible from the food to the service to the manager's response.  However, I to give the restaurant credit for two things - the manager properly adjusted the bill so that we did not feel like we had been robbed and the atmosphere is quite lovely.  Would I go back? No, but if you decide to go, stick with a couple of drinks and a fun appetizer or two and then move on to a restaurant with more consistent food.

Went here for my boyfriends birthday dinner. As soon as we walked in, we were seated right away. I loved the way that the place looked and the service was outstanding! I asked where the restroom was, and our waiter walked me directly to it, even opening the door for me. When I came back my napkin was neatly folded on the table.They really cater to you and make you feel special.

The reason why I only gave this 3 stars is because my boyfriend (who was the birthday boy) ordered the porterhouse and wanted it medium. He started to eat it and when he got towards the center, it was clearly rare. He continued to just eat the edges, but he barely put a dent in it. He stated that he didn't want to complain, but he was not happy at all that he couldn't even eat his steak. We brought it up to the waiter, which offered to bring out another one. My boyfriend declined since he had a little bit of it, and was not about to try to start eating another one. 

With that said, I loved the food. Pricey, but I was prepared to spend $$$$. I wish that my boyfriend could have enjoyed it more but they made up for it. He got a free dessert and he loved everything else, but his porterhouse. Again the service was great, sort of a long wait in between courses, but you have the fountain to watch.

This was my first time at this beautiful restaurant!! The ambiance was awesome. Definitely try to get a table with the view of the fountains. The food was delicious..worth every penny.  I had the caramelized scallops and my husband had the bone in filet mignon. The service was good...a little dry but good! We will definitely be going back!

I was the maid-of-honor for a dear friend of mine so of course I planned a trip to Vegas for her bachelorette party! My job was to secure the hotel and pick which buffets we were to eat at (we purchases the $45 for 24 hours of buffets pass) and my sister's job was to pick one nice spot for dinner. That was how we ended up at Prime Steakhouse in Bellagio.

The food was amazing. This was what we ordered:

- Prime onion soup with gruyere cheese = absolutely divine. What's not to like about anything gruyere.
- Filet Mignon with shishito peppers. I had it medium rare because that's how I like mine to be done = melted in my mouth. Lightly seasoned but was very tasty and so tender.
- Peppercorn New York steak (this was what the bride ordered). Done medium rare. I had a taste and it was so good. Nice and meaty and lots of flavor.
- Caramelized scallops = so good! It has a slight sweet kick but also very savory. The scallops filled you up because they were huge.  
- Some of the sides we ordered were the summer corn, creamed spinach and truffle mashed potatoes and mac and cheese. All were superb! Well-made and delicious!

We made reservations and got there right on the dot. We were immediately greeted and seated right away. Our server and all the workers were very attentive throughout the whole dinner, refilling our water glass, making sure our cocktails tasted right, brushing the bread crumbs off our table, etc. Since it was a bachelorette party dinner, there was also a photographer that was there and took pictures of our party. She had it all printed on glossy paper and framed for us by the end of dinner and asked if we wanted to purchase any. We bought two for the bride as a memorable gift.

The restaurant was very clean and the set-up was done well. I couldn't get over how beautiful the restroom was! I could literally live in there! lol.

Prime Steakhouse did me well! I was very satisfied by the quality of the food and staff. 

There are so many good places to eat in Vegas and I'm on a mission to try them all so I probably won't be back to Prime anytime soon. But I highly recommend it! Try it out, pure Vegas experience alright!

Never been to Vegas until now.  Did a Top 10 search on Best Steakhouses of Las Vegas and PRIME was on all the lists.  So off we go for a dinner out with the guys.  Total of seven of us & with tax/tip added onto our bill (without any alcoholic drinks, but with 4 sodas) the total came up to $830.  Was it worth it?  Read on.

The food was the BEST!  All of our steaks were cooked to "almost" perfection.  I say almost because for a few of us, we ordered our steaks medium and we got medium rare.  No big deal & I can only imagine how hard it is to get a steak to be that perfectly cooked between med.rare and medium so no deduction in rating for that.

Our orders ranged from Filet Mignon (with bone attached) cuts to the traditional Rib Eye.  Sides included cream corn, caesar salad, stuffed potato, crispy potatoes, truffle mashed potatoes and onion soup.  ALL of it was superbly made.  We cannot say enough about the cream corn and truffle mashed potatoes.  The food was impeccable and the service was top notch.  One of the guys on the table has dogs so we asked for the bones to be placed in a box after our meal.  The server did one better and scooped more bones from the kitchen (that they were going to discard anyways) and packed it along with ours.  Totally cool....the dogs will be eating in heaven I tell you.

Word of warning though.....the extra condiments for your stuffed potato (sour cream, chives, bacon, cheese) are ala carte.  The water served to your table is priced per bottle.  Yup, water is not free.  And soda refills are also not free.  The soda refill charge was no real surprise to me....but the charge for the water & the condiments for the stuffed potato were, so consider yourself warned.  :)

All in all, the dinner was excellent and the restaurant is a great place to impress that special lady in your life.  The food is prepared top-notch and the service is second to none.  Will we ever go there again?  That is a definite YES.....though I might not drink so much water next time.  :)

Fantastic service, atmosphere and food.  We ate until we couldn't anymore.

My first visit here was spring break in college and my roommate who had not eaten steak in years (he went veg for a while) decided he would break down and try it since we were in such a highly regarded steakhouse.

He loved it and raves about it to this day.  Good times.

After carefully researching LV steakhouses - and having been to a good many before - we decided on Prime for dinner before seeing Love a few weeks ago.

I am giving it three stars on a straight ratings system.  Grading on a curve, using other top-end steakhouses as a reference, I would give it two stars.

The food was good, but not great.  The small lobster tail in my $100+ (DANG!) surf and turf was overcooked.  I've never sent anything back at a nice restaurant before and I rarely send anything back period, but that had to be resolved.  Staff was cool about it and handled it perfectly.

Service was good, but not amazing.  Our waiter was nice enough, but was not allowed to taste the bottle of wine that we brought, which was kind of a drag.  We never even smelled the somalier.  Where the eff was (s)he?

Finally, as we finished dinner and the wildly overpriced Chteau DY'quem, we were asked to move out to the frikken patio!  The restaurant was nowhere near full.  

Turns out, however, that last half an hour after dinner was the highlight of the meal:  we got to enjoy the water show, finish our wine and cast occasional glances at TV's own Tom Selleck sitting nearby.

Unlike meals that I have had at other fine establishments, looking back, nothing about Prime (other than the patio scene) stands out to me.

Here's the thing:  when dropping major coin of this sort, I expect to be dazzled.  Good does not cut it.  Prime just didn't dazzle me.

What is up with the restaurants at The Bellagio? First a totally disastrous outing with Michael Mina. An entirely mediocre experience at Olive and last night Jean-George's troops were struggling for mediocrity.

Upon making reservations, we were alerted to the dress code. Jackets required. I dressed well and upon arriving a large portion of the clientele was jacketless...some downright funky. If you're going to state the rules, stick with them.

Upon being seated in the beautiful surroundings we were offered menus and the wine list. The wine selection was broad and deep. The markups were also broad and deep. I know many of the wines represented and they were unreasonably priced. Silly. A glass of Veuve Cliquot was considerably more than what I'd pay for a bottle. 

The food....well, it was mixed. The bread was awesome. The sourdough was excellent but the pretzel bread was the real winner. We each got a piece. When I asked for another I was told they were running low and there would be no more pretzel bread for us. That was really too bad because it was the best thing on the table all evening. It was that good. I began with a salad...Heirloom Tomatoes, Burrata Cheese, Mussini Balsamic & Basil. The tomatoes were purple...a bit firm but OK. The dish was, well, ok. Kinda bland but passable. I had a steak waiting for me, right?

Unfortunately, yes. A Peppercorn New York Steak with Red Onion Compote. The compote was good. The steak was very tough. Cooked to a good medium rare, it was stringy and hard to eat. I ate less than half of it. Too much work. My guest is lactose intolerant which means no butter. The kitchen could not see it's way to prepare the carrots without butter. Same with the Brussels Sprouts. Maybe if we knew Jean-Georges Vongerichten...the enfant terrible of the food scene. Ah well. 

I wonder if Jean-Georges has ever been in Las Vegas. Nonetheless, I'd advise to wander across the hall to Picasso or head off to the Palms to visit Alize. Now they know what they're doing.

1.5 stars.

Before anything, let me just say that this restaurant is expensive, so don't go here unless you're ready to pay top dollar for a fancy meal. It's a very classy place and while there is no jacket required, you really should plan to dress appropriately.

As you might expect, it has wonderful ambiance and upper echelon service. The steaks are aged well and cooked to perfection. If you want surf and turf, you may have to ask for it because it's not on the menu. Usually the server will inform you though that they do offer it and quote you a price. 

My buddy and I had a fantastic meal here and would definitely go back. I got a kick out of the waiter's reaction when I asked for ketchup to go with my fries. He said half jokingly, "Here we don't call it ketchup; we call it "sauce internationale." I thought that was hilarious.

If you can get over the prices, the steaks are absolutely fantastic. The Dry Aged Ribeye is probably the best restaurant steak I've ever eaten in my life. Service was attentive, but our server actually argued with us a bit over whether or not there was lactose in one of the dishes. He brought out an ingredient list to prove his point. Bad form. Thankfully, the food overpowered the service... when steaks are that good, the service isn't enough to take away from my 5-star rating.

格式高いホテルのステーキハウスに来てみました！
nice view！！ベラジオの有名な噴水を見ながらのディナー
目の前が噴水でとっても良い席を用意してもらえました〜。

そんなにお腹は空いていなかったので軽くオーダー。
appetizerはoyster
こっちのoysterのsourceは美味しい

サラダはシーザーサラダ
これはもう定番！！量も丁度よくて良かったです。

メインディッシュはsteak！！
フィレとリブがミックスされてるボーンsteak。
これを綺麗に切り分けてきて貰えました。
さすが格式高いベラジオのレストランは接客も最高ですね
ミディアムレアでオーダー！柔らかくて美味しい(*^^*)

ドリンクは乾杯はsparkling！
その後はナパヴァレーの赤ワインをボトルで。
とてもステキな時間が過ごせました〜！
美味しかったです！

I was so looking forward to my ahi tuna.  The chef must not like fish... I get peppercorns on steak but with fish, being a delicate protein, he killed it.  Couldn't even taste it.  And at $60, I expected so much more!  Having worked at fine dining restaurants and dined at many, I was very disappointed.  My wine glass sat empty for more than 10 minutes without being addressed.  Not a place to go to impress.

This place is amazing!  Great views of the fountains, wonderful service, and most of all,  perfect food.  The aged bone-in ribeye was delicious, and the truffled mashed potatoes were to die for.  The three sauces provided tasted so good with the steak, especially the soy-miso sauce.  This place is expensive, but worth getting dressed up for!

It's a steak house, with gorgeous decor, great food, and top notch service. What's not to love?

The space is beautiful, perfect for a date night. Also, during the day, you can dine on their patio, which over looks the fountains.

Service is exceptional. We split the foie gras and the bone-in Rib-eye, both of which were perfectly plated and didn't look like a split. The Rib-eye was cut for us, at our table, because, that's what civilized steak houses do.

Though the Rib-eye was delicious, the foie gras was the star of our dinner. I could literally have eaten four more plates of it. It was to die for. I still dream about that foie gras. Needless to say, if you're at all a fan of foie gras, ORDER IT!

Food: 5
Ambience: 5
Service: 5
Value: 5

I've been to Prime a couple times now and both times were enjoyable. 

Besides the food (which I will get into shortly), I want to highlight the service. 
The servers and other restaurant staff here are professional, accommodating and most importantly, have good timing on when to be at the table for any needs. I don't think this can be trained, and believe it is the servers' experience and intuition after many years in the industry. 

On to the food... Standouts: 

Foie Gras - if you love Foie, you will love theirs. Perfectly seared and flavored, with nice acidity on the plate to complement. 

Carpaccio and Tartare duo - This is the best of both worlds. When I see Carpaccio and Tartare on the menu, I usually have an inner battle on which one to choose. Well Prime must have thought of this too and decided, why not put both on a plate! The tartare and carpaccio are fresh and the presentation is beautiful with the latticed cream (but side note, a bit too saucy for me and I would ask for less sauce or on the side next time). 

Sea Bass entree - It's not a petite piece! It is a large piece of fish and cooked well. 

Truffled Mash - Buttery with bits of Black Truffle folded in and garnished on top!  

Next time I will be back for the Dover Sole as (I was told) they de-bone right in front of you. 

All in all if you are looking for fine dining and great food, Prime is solid.

I will be back and will probably bring the family when they are in town again.

Prime Steakhouse was amazing! Yes Woohoo! As good as it gets!

The service was impeccable. That coming from me is pretty big, since I think I go out more to test establishments on their customer services more than the food.

The ambiance was breathtaking, you cant beat having a romantic dinner with your husband as the Bellagio fountains shoot off synchronized with music next to you...in Vegas.

The food. THE FOOD! My husband says his steak was the BEST steak he's ever had in his life. Now that's a bold statement since we've eaten at some great steakhouses.

The lobster I had melted, as in melted in my mouth. The butter that it came with was perfect. I know its just melted butter but it was the best pair with the lobster. 

Writing this review is making my mouth water just remembering the smell, the taste, the juices, the delicious wine I had.

Most definitely check this place out. Make sure to reserve a table with fountain view.

Wow!!!  From the service to the food was excellent!  Top notch wine list especially from Napa.  Appetizer to main entre was superb.  One of the best beet salad I've ever had...  The grilled salmon was perfectly prepared...  Lol this restaurant is known for steaks!  With we spent about $200 per person including wine.  Enjoy!!!

This past weekend was my second trip to Prime and I was not impressed either time. 
The only thing that really saved the night was the awesome company; my BF, his family and our casino host. 
I really wanted to love this place, the setting is amazing and so is the decor.

First, we made reservations for eight o'clock, but when we arrived on time the table was not set. We ended up standing around for ten minutes. Keep in mind it was a birthday dinner for my BF's mom and our casino host was eating with us. You would think the employees of Prime would have their shit together since the restaurant was not even that busy. 

After being seated our waiter was horrible. 
I ordered a glass of champagne and he forgot it, not once but three different times! Mine was not the only beverage he forgot on more than one occasion.

Our table of eight ordered the shell fish appetizer, which cost around four hundred dollars. The crab, shrimp and oysters were good but the lobster was awful. It was chewy and flavorless. 
Seriously about an hour after we had our appetizer our main courses come out. Our table ordered everything from the duck, to sea bass to stake, no one was that thrilled. The food was mediocre, defiantly not worth the price. 

The kicker to the entire night was "dress code". 
They are suppose to enforce a dressy attire and yet I saw guys in Affliction shirts and girls in jean skirts. 

Moral of the story, save you money and eat at one of the other amazing restaurants in the Bellagio.
Awesome classy place out of the old time Vegas era.  Loved the food and quality and service. For those special dates or just feeling like spoiling oneself.

As far as Las Vegas goes this was good food, expensive, but good. If it were in Chicago I would have never came back to this restaurant again because it's way overpriced. But it's pretty and since most of the food I had in Vegas was god awful Prime was worth every penny I paid for it. Which for an appetizer, water, 2 cokes, 2 entrees and 2 sides was around $180 I believe.

*** 1/2 stars

This is a luxurious looking restaurnat with a view of the Bellagio fountains to boot. We had a beautiful corner table that was cozy and romantic. 

The food was excellent traditional steak house fare. We started with some excellent crab cakes for appetizers. Followed by the peppercorn crusted NY strip for me and the bone in filet special for my girlfriend. Both steaks were aged well and flavorful. I have never been a fan of doucing my steak in sauce. However, I have to admit that the miso mustrad was a nice compliment to the steak. Truffle mash was a perfect side. The surprising highlight of the evening was that they has a mille crepe on their menu for dessert. The only time I have had a good rendition of this dessert outside Paris was at Lady M in NYC. Prime's Version gets an A+ from me. Perfectly textured crepes stacked with a layer of cream in between. 

The big downer of the evening was the impersonal service. While our waiter was attentive and we were checked on by couple other people over the course of the evening. It just seemed like no one really cared. This might be a contrast to our luxurious experience at Twist the previous night. 

I have to take away some points for service. Although, I think I may not be the only one that thinks so. I did notice that this restaurant had a 4 diamond rating, while possesing the makings of a 5 diamond restaurant. It isnow clear to me what type of restaurnat garners that extra star.

Wow! 

From the food to the service to the atmosphere - this place is one of my all time favorites...ever!

Sit outside, if the weather permits, and enjoy a front row seat to the watershow.  The peppercorn crusted strip is prepared to perfection...and there are really no words for the chocolate lava cake (so make sure you leave some room).

Wonderful experience...top to bottom!

We were staying at the Bellagio and a customer requested steak. Looking at Yelp reviews, Prime was THE place.  Wait staff was accommodating.  Filet was average - nothing special.  Truffle mash potatoes and creamed corn were about the same thin consistency.  Customer even asked which was the corn and which was the potatoes! Although I will expense this meal, I'm sure there are better meals to be had at a better price, even in Vegas.

Wow..what an experience.  Prime is absolutely beautiful inside and the level of service matches the prices they offer.  I was wearing black pants so the white napkin was replaced with a dark one.  We had two servers and they attention was consistent without being obtrusive.  I had the aged bone in ribeye which was amazing.  Their prices are not for the weak of heart but you need to know that in this town, it is par for the course.

**waiter name: Brandon
**team #20

Came here this past Saturday (3/28) for my birthday dinner that was suggested by Maribel T. I went on Yelp! and trusted my fellow Yelpers with over 400 reviews and 4 stars. Made reservations through open table for 7 people at 9:30 after our jabbawockeez show. My friend told me they closed at 10, but they still took my reservations so we were fine.

We made it to the restaurant a little before 9:30, I went up to the hostess that we were there, we didn't get seated right away. Probably took 15 minutes or so to get seated, not sure why when I had made reservations, tables were vacant and it was close to closing so they weren't busy! We finally got seated and several of my friends noticed our waiter was "sassy"!

Food:
* Filet Mingon ($66) medium rare. I ended up getting a steak, well duh! Something you should order at a steakhouse, haha! My steak was perfectly cooked and all 3 sauce that they gave me were delish that I couldn't choose which one was my favorite! 

*truffle mashed potatoes, they were yummy!! I totally recommend!

Service: 
Our waiter had a stupid, awkward, sarcastic, rude, dry personality! Since the moment we sat down half my party were annoyed by him. My friend asked where the restroom was and pointed one side and when she was getting up he told her something else. Towards the end, the waiter came up he asked if we wanted dessert. We said no thank you and he stayed saying "talk to me" leaving us in an awkward situation as if he would not leave until we ordered. Not only did we have a problem with our waiter but the other two waiters cleaning the table next to us were very unprofessional. They are cracking inappropriate jokes to each other that it made me feel like I was eating in a "ghetto" steakhouse; they were obnoxiously loud. One of the waiters continued to crack jokes across the table while he refilled our glasses with water. We would say thank you, and normally we get a "my pleasure" but nothing from the waiters here. A friend of mine asked for a to go box for her food, the waiter brought back her food in a to go box and said "here's your doggy, I mean your food." They were such jerks! We felt treated like dirt as if we weren't paying customers!

 I've been to several steakhouses in California and service was always superior, always exceeded my expectations. The food was good but it does not outweigh the terrible service we received. 

When my friend went to the restroom, the lady was cleaning the stall but told my friend to use it and she will clean it after. My friend said she'd wait for the other stall...obviously she didn't want to clean it twice. As an employee, you should treat your customers as if you just opened. Just because you're about to close the restaurant, doesn't mean you should rush your customers out of the restaurant or act inappropriate. 

This dinner was for my "golden bday" (28th bday on the 28th) and it ruined all of our nights with the service. I don't recommend anyone coming to this place, especially if you care about customer service. The employees here act like they're in high school, very unprofessional and immature!

We came back recently because of Karina and Christian and had a much better experience. The service was spot on and the food was better. We were celebrating a friend's birthday and ordered a variety of steaks/dishes. I really liked the updated version of the Caesar salad. I also thought the sides were spectacular this time around. The onion rings, mashed potatoes, brussel sprouts, and mushrooms were all fantastic. The steak was just as I remembered, especially the miso one. I really appreciate them getting back to me about my first experience, and would happily recommend Prime to family and friends in the future.

One of the best meals I've had in a very long time.

I had the scallops and my guest had the rib eye. We also had the macaroni and cheese and creamed spinach and shared a creme brûlée for desert. The waiter was also incredible, the view is fantastic, and the ambiance was classy and sophisticated. We spent around $300 between the two of us and was worth every penny.

It's become a tradition for the sales team I'm on to come here each year. When I dine out, my top priorities are food, service, and ambiance (in that order). Prime exceeds my expectations every visit.

If you like steak, this is the place to get it! Try the steak sauce they recommend that is only available at Prime. My favorite dishes are the tuna ribbon salad and Dover sole. We always get the chocolate dessert as well:)

Make sure to request a table by the window, so you can get front row seats to the water show in front of Caesar's. Fantastic experience all around every time!

My party of 3 arrived at Prime at 8:45pm and it was already a full house. We were offered to sit outside or we could wait 15min for a table inside. We decided to wait and sit inside because it is really hot outside in Las Vegas right now. 

For starters, I got the French Onion soup. It came out piping hot from the oven with melted Gruyere cheese on top(the best part). 

My friend got the caviar and she really enjoyed it. 1 oz was plenty for 1 person.

My other friend got the tomato salad. She said the tomatoes came out freezing cold (so just be warned if you have sensitive teeth).

Main entree:
28 oz bone in ribeye (medium). I shared this with another person and we finished it. It was good with the peppercorn sauce

Sides:
Truffle Mashed Potatoes
Sautéed garlic spinach

Look, Prime is a high-end Steakhouse in the Bellagio - that's right, the Bellagio not Circus Circus, Excalibur or any other lower rent hotel.  So you can expect a pricey meal.  But here you really get what you pay for.  Steak was excellent (had the Peppercorn New York Steak, mid-rare).  Cooked to perfection and the service was impeccable.  Wine selection follows the theme of being pricey, but the server had good pairing recommendations that tied the meal together nicely.  Our table shared a few sides (asparagus, broccoli, and the mashed potatoes) all of which were excellent.  If you are in the market for a $100-$120 per person Steakhouse meal in Las Vegas, then I would highly recommend Prime.  I would definitely return on my next visit, unless the casino gods dictate that I take a more thrifty approach.

We had some money to spend with the Food & Dining Credit at the Bellagio, so we opted for the Prime Steakhouse for beau's birthday dinner. We got to sit front row at the Bellagio Fountains! Unfortunately it was too hot outside, otherwise we might have enjoyed the accompanying music also.

The first bite of everything was super delicious, in fact, I was assured that I had made the right decision on the location. It certainly had a lot of accolades on the website, highly acclaimed and even won 2014 Open Table's award. Bravo! It was love at first bite, and then, sadly, towards the end and 5 glasses of water later, not so much.

The steak was carted in with three signature sauces. I was rather glad they didn't make you choose on the spot and instead, left three small gravy boats for you to try them. Unfortunately the steak was just fine on its own, and the sauce wasn't entirely necessary. Though conclusively we decided that if you need sauce on a steak then something else entirely is prohibiting your experience...

The lamb chops were so divine at first bite, but through it all, about 40% ended up being lamb fat instead of lamb chops, and well, it just couldn't justify the amount spent on the entree. The sauce was overly salted, and thus ended up drinking 5 glasses by the conclusion of the evening. Pretty strange considering there were only three chops.

The sides however were less disappointing, I absolutely loved (and subsequently murdered) the entire ramekin of truffle mash. I highly recommend this even though the entrees themselves seemed lacking. The peas were also divine. A bit cheating with the bacon, but well put together. It was, however, a tad hard to eat due to the different shapes of peas...

Well, besides the truffle mash potatoes, the birthday dessert was divine. They had just made the lava cake and it was perfectly rich without being too sweet. The ice cream was a prefect touch. Very tasty.

Top items: Service, Truffle Mash, Free Dessert.

Needless to say, won't be back. Sure, maybe we ordered the wrong items, but just so you know, a restaurant shouldn't make bad items choices on the menu. Haha.

Steak that's more tender than a newborn baby and tastier than Chelsea Clinton covered in chocolate. What? Don't judge me.

Excellent service, excellent meal, excellent ambiance. You're coming here for steak, so don't be ridiculous and get anything else.

PS. This is my 69th review. 69!

We have dined at Prime a couple of times, and it has never disappointed. The food is always incredible; the service flawless. Our last visit we shared a caprese salad, porterhouse, and creamed spinach. We topped our meal with an amazing bottle of wine. The location is just... sexy, and special. Definitely a great place to visit in Vegas.

Ohhhh yes. Ohhhhhh yes yes yes yes yes yes yes.... 

Mmmmmmmmmm.

Yes. 

Filet mignon & truffle mashed potatoes.

That is all.

Wow! I went here in a party of 8 and was seated at a window side table with a gorgeous view of the remarkable Bellagio fountains! The view was amazing, the restaurant's decor was extremely elegant with a modern touch and the ambiance was superb. My dining experience here was amazing and let me tell you why... 

1.) Appetizers set the bar super high for the coming meal
For those who love raw stuff-
*We started with two large Seafood Platters. Served in an elegant setting that had the oysters, lobster, crab, prawns, mussel and clams over ice. Underneath the setting was another bowl that was conveniently placed (yet still hidden) for the shells. Everything in the seafood platter was extremely fresh and of great quality. I'm usually not a fan of oysters but these oysters were to die for. Alongside the sauces which include: cocktail, horseradish, and vinegar, *dont forget to ask your waiter for melted butter and Tabasco* best and most fresh seafood platter I have ever indulged in!
*The Steak Tartare and Carpaccio was another great choice that we started our meal. Served with Tarragon Aioli and Grilled Crostini, I highly recommend this especially if you are drinking wine.

2.) I think the Steaks are made in heaven
*The filet Mignon, medium rare, melts in your mouth. The steak cut so easily and was tenderly moist. It was perfectly seasoned and charred on the outside but exactly medium rare on the inside just how I like and wanted. It was served with a zesty roasted green chili, perfect to change up your palate.
*The bone in rib eye steak was just as tasty! Seasoned more than the filet Mignon and a little more "fatty" I would recommend this for those who like their steaks more flavorful. This too melted in my mouth!

3.) The sides are small and properly portioned 
*The glazed market mushrooms and truffle mashed potatoes were my favorite but I also was able to taste the creamed spinach and steamed asparagus. The mushrooms and mashed potatoes are a must order! I'm just glad they we're small portions or else I would've eaten all the sides and wouldn't have room for the main course! 

4.) The service was amazing!
*i wish I remembered our waiters name but he was awesome, I wish I could give him credit. After a couple of martinis, I forgot to ask. He was attentive, personable and funny. The dining experience definitely would not be the same without him and the incredible staff.

Great steaks, great views, great service!

Mama Bear wanted a nice place to dine at for Christmas Eve in Vegas, I of course, did my due diligence to find her just that. But because it was a holiday, reservation by the patio/windows were all full. :( So reserve ahead of time during the holidays!

FOOD:
We ordered filet mignons, short ribs ($41.00), and their Chilean Sea Bass ($45.00) with a side order of Ginger Sweet Potatoes, Jumbo Asparagus, and Butternut Squash Soup. I would stick with the Filet Mignon ($67.00), definitely their specialty. It was soooo good. The meat just melted in my mouth, it also came with three different sauces to complement the meat, but I prefer mine plain. The cut was perfect, no tendon was to be found, and the quality was absolutely perfect! My grandmother also really liked their sea bass, said it was cooked perfectly and she absolutely loved her Butternut Squash Soup. Their Asparagus and Sweet Potato Mash are highly recommended, both very good quality and light side dishes to pair with the steaks. The short rib was okay, while the meat was very tender and juicy, the enormous amount of heavy sauce just ruined the dish for me. We also got a basket of bread as appetizers! The raisin bread was highlight of the basket. :)

SERVICE:
Our waiter was just terrific, he was very personable and knew how to talk and draw his customers in. He made a lot of great recommendations and was also making sure we got what we needed including all allergies and special diet restrictions. The food could take a while, but they provide bread as you wait.

ATMOSPHERE:
They do have a dress code that they enforce- business causal is more like business formal. All the men were in clean-cut suits and the women in nice dresses and heels. The lighting is dim and very classy, it's a quiet place that don't allow kids under 6 years old to dine in. Although from looking around, no kids seemed to be around the restaurant.

Lastly, they have complimentary self-parking for Bellagio if you're dining in!

Great view, but as expensive as you probably would expect from a Bellagio steakhouse. Each side is like $15 bucks and I think my ribeye was like $70 for maybe a 16oz or something.

Two stars mostly though due to my steak being badly charred on the outside. I really should have sent it back, but I probably didn't since I had been drinking. Sigh.

We started our dinner off with the seafood platter -- crab legs, oysters, mussels and shrimp served of ice.  It was fresh; especially the oysters! I remember the oysters melting in my mouth as I squeezed a lemon on top and slurped each one into my mouth! I ordered the fillet mignon and my fiance ordered the rib-eye.  The fillet mignon was great; grilled exactly how I liked it -- medium rare.  I personally enjoyed the rib-eye only because the cut was more tender.  We were told the meat has been aged for a period of time which indeed brought out the flavor in the beef. Can't wait to go back to this place the next time we visit! 

The service was phenomenal; waiters are well attentive to your needs. They are very personal & are consistently checking up on you making sure the food is tasting great. We got a lakeside view next to the window, so we got the chance to see the water show in front of the Bellagio nemerous of times. It's much more pleasurable to watch from the inside of the restaurant rather than standing with the crowd of tourists outside. I enjoyed the romantic ambiance of the restaurant... quiet, dimmed lights and tables covered in white table cloths with candles lit on the table. There was a photographer that came around each table to take pictures; she even showed us how to pose for the camera. But unfortunately we left too soon before she was able to come back to our table. We were given two complimentary guest passes two the Bank night club as well at the end of our dinner.  

If you're a steak-lover, this place is a must try!

The drone of hopeful millionaires waned as the six of us dipped into the paneled honeycomb of Bellagio's steakhouse, Prime. We had drifted away from the hoots and hollers of night owls and seemingly onto the set of a high budget film that hadn't decided whether its focus was Old Hollywood, Gone with the Wind or French Victorian. Blue, velvet drapes careened from ceiling to floor, busting from a girdle of gold chords that could easily fashion Scarlett's next dress. Fountains flitted outside the window like children intent on a game of tag and added just enough Disneyland amusement to complete this abstract portrait. 

Despite swiveled heads and rubber necks, we arrived at our table unscathed and dwarfed by an immense painting resembling Venus's sister (staring wide-eyed at our plates to ensure we ate all our vegetables). An ocean of carpet, thick enough to swallow any signs of dropped silverware, necessitated "Alice in Wonderland-like" gold knockers on the back of each chair for easy towing. 

Auditioning for the stereotypical role of "Jeeves", our waiter ascended with a raised nostril of disgust (Scene 1: sniffing dirty sweat sock) and upon ordering drinks (Scene 2: serving a stiff cocktail of contention), one of my culinary colleagues murmured, "I feel like the waiter thinks he's better than me." 

We laughed, but the apparent exasperation wasn't funny. Jeeves's superiority was stifling from the first wrinkle of his nose to his wafting stench of arrogance, and not only did it lessen our experience, but lowered the overall standard of the restaurant. A true upscale establishment ensures the customer's comfort at all costs and Jeeves couldn't even spare a dime.

Our annoyance was overridden by a dining cart bearing silver orbs of secrecy, each cover lifted and replaced in the edible version of "find the queen". My fork first tore at symbiotic landmarks of top grade tuna and avocado wading in ginger/ soy with its light, rejuvenating effects similar to a Fountain of Youth (for the palate). The salad set posed an ordinary looking Caesar like a diminutive wallflower, but beneath his classic cover laid a defined body and final punch of citrus that lifted his status to "crowd pleaser Caesar". 

Unfortunately, the crispy goat cheese fondue did not rival Caesar for top billing and was a disappointment in concept and taste. This tomb of fondue bandaged goat cheese (head to toe) in a fried, phyllo sarcophagus that trapped the necessary tart-n-creamy catalyst. "The curse of teeth rotting sweetness" attacked an unassuming frisee salad with grapes and pear vinaigrette (its pungent antidote only inches away).

The "meat and greet" came next with the promise of the protein packed main course that had led us here. My lamb chops, encrusted with chili crumbs, were ordered at medium rare, but arrived closer to rare. Still delectable, I ravaged them, dipping sporadically in the bevy of sauces accompanying the meal (barnaise, spicy pepper, etc.) The steak au poivre was paved with a thick asphalt of peppercorns (not a pothole of naked meat to be seen) with a potency that could remove tar. The tearing and coughing induced by this dish might be used as protection in a dark alley- the original pepper spray. 

Two of our other carnivorous constituents ordered the porterhouse- one requesting medium rare and the other medium. A couple bites into the meal, the medium rare "requestee" found himself in the middle of medium man's steak. Medium man had already manhandled the "mis-steak" placed before him (cooked almost exactly like the other) and munched happily on what he thought to be his order. This was inexcusable- not only did these prices demand perfection (around $50 a steak), but the moniker of "steakhouse" insists on the chefs' aptitude for mastering meat temperatures. This was a blunder that couldn't be overlooked as easily as Jeeves's snippy quips and would be the resounding memory of the meal (though thoughts of their lumpy, heavily salted mashed potatoes would be reminisced of fondly).

I could now empathize with Dr. Malfi's attraction to Tony Soprano. I was immediately enamored with this piece of work's over-the-top and muddled alter egos, but inconsistency and a mafia sized payoff eventually marred my fond feelings. As Prime puckered for its "kiss of death" in my final farewell, I still admired its larger than life character, but couldn't trust Prime's rep enough to invest that type of dough.
Excellent powerhouse steak but we did wait over an hour for food

Was stuck between 4-5 stars, but quality of food won the day.  This was one of the best meals I've ever had.

The lobster, broccoli, capaccio and au gratin potatoes were some of the best versions of each I've ever tasted, and my entire party agreed.  My steak was just okay, cooked perfectly but a little light on flavor, however the sauce (soy, rice wine vinegar, etc.?) was amazing.  I wanted to bathe in it.

The place is definitely upscale, and though we weren't dressed like slobs, we were clearly underdressed a bit, which may have accounted for the very average and not overly attentive service.  Maybe they thought we couldn't afford the place, but the service was decidedly average.  The waiter was nice, but didn't seem to take much time at our table to make suggestions, explain the menu or stop by to make sure we were doing okay.  Considering I spent $250+ on my portion alone, I would have expected that to be elite as well.

Still, like I said before, food rules the day ultimately at restaurants and in that regard it was amazing.

I would suggest a sport coat for guys at the least and not just a buttoned-up shirt or nice sweater like we had on, as most parties seemed a little more dressed up.  Other than that, amazing.

Slow service and my table was ignored.  Ive been to other fine dining restaurants even in Bellagio (such as Picasso and Jasmine) (other places such as Delmonico, Craft Steak House, etc) that provided great to amazing service.  I never felt so ignored at a steak house before.  Other places they are attentive and ready to assist, not this place.  I kept having to flag people down.

The food was decent, I ordered a tomato salad and seabass instead of a filet.  I felt for a tomato salad it was really lacking on the tomatoes.  It seemed like 1 1/2 small round tomatoes.  Could I at least get the other half of the second tomato for that price? Fresh cheese and the seabass's sauce was tasty.  Would I go back even if it had better service the next time around? No.

Wow.  I can stop this review after the next sentence (although, I most likely won't).  "The Bone-In Filet is Amazing!"  I ordered it medium rare, and it was just delicious.  Cooked with just salt and pepper, the flavor was amazing.  I have never had a bone-in filet before, and I am now ecstatic that I have!  The following day during lunch, I was eating my mediocre sandwich wishing that I kept the remaining part of the bone from the filet to gnaw on.  It was just outrageously good.

In addition, we obviously ordered some wine, side dishes, a couple apps, and dessert.  Favorite app was the Foie Gras because we are not allowed to eat it in CA.  It was a special treat to have.  Best dessert was the creme brulee.  Very light and flavorful.

Prime is one of my favorite steak places that I have been.  5 stars!

I eat out 14 times a week, all over the U.S. I think it's time to start giving honest feedback; helping others make informed dining decisions. 

Table for 2:

+Extremely upscale decor
+Very romantic
+Steak was good, but over cooked. 
+Lobsters for app
+Great wine list
+Expect a very large bill for your elite steakhouse experience. 
+Get a table on the patio, overlooking the Bellagio fountains. 

Overall Grade: 92% out of 100%
I would highly recommend this restaurant.

We dined here on New Year's Day 2008 and it was a great way to kick off the new year.  This is probably one of the more elegant restaurants that you'll find in Las Vegas.  Our waiter, whose name escapes me, was from Lancaster, PA was very friendly and very helpful.  He suggested a Cable-Car martini for my wife and the drink did not disappoint.  To this day I think this is her favorite drink.  We started things off with a crab cake which was very tasty.  For dinner my wife ordered the Filet and I ordered the Porterhouse along with some mashed potatoes and some creamed spinach.  The steak was of course cooked to perfection and the accompaniment of sauces, while weren't needed for such a fine steak, certainly were also very good.

Our bill was over $200 with tip, but this was one of the most memorable meals that my wife and I have ever had.  Every bite of food was perfect and we can't wait to go back.

I went there for my birthday with my partner and sister.  The waiter kept referring to us as "Sir".  My sister felt offended after 2 "sirs".  Then the assistant waiter comes over and says sir again.  I used that opportunity to tell her my sister is present and she was getting offended and annoyed.  Instead of appologizing she makes an inappropriate casual yet pointed joke with sarcasm.  We were all shocked by her behavior and later i asked the waiter that we get an apology for her response.  She came over and apologized.  I can't believe a Jean Georges' restaurant would have such bad training.  It unfortunately ruined the evening.  The food is good, the price is high, but the service was far from up to par.  We will not go there again.

My favorite restaurant in Vegas and I wish I had one closer!  Every time we go to Vegas my husband knows no matter what, he has to make a reservation here.  Without fail every time I am there I order the tuna extremely rare and it comes rolled in rice puffs.  I don't care for the sauce that it comes with so I order the soy rice wine sauce and oh my gosh... heaven on a plate!  The other thing at prime that I have and I have about three of them every time is the martini called the cable car which is one of the Bellagio's signature martinis.  I dream about this meal and that drink!  On a side note... I love the bartender in the front.  He has been there for many years and he is just a delight!
just had dessert and wine here, fantastic stuff.  not getting into details but the lemon tart was awesome.  also, the view of the water show from the patio is breathtaking.  definitely go.

Foods are very good! The steak is melted in the mouth ! Love the mashed potato ! The waiter are good, they pay attentions to you as long as you're done your plate, they will come take it away. But one waiter is kind of look mean, others are very nice! Remember to make a reservation before you go
Soooooo good the steak was top quality!!!!! filet.mignon amazing!! service was nice as well as the view great water show while you eat!

I went to this place expecting it to be amazing since it was top rated in vegas but when my fiance and i went there on our recent vaction it soo was not what we expected the waiter didnt tell us any of the specials they had he gave us horrible food suggestions! for a place so "upscale" you would the food would be out of this world im very disappointed i went there the night before i went to CUT inside the PALAZZO/VENETIAN and that was the BEST place ever! it was also top rated in vegas.

Had a company dinner here and my first thought from looking at the prices on the menu was that this would just be an expensive meal for sub-par food. I was wrong. I had the best steak I've ever had. The drinks were good and the service was friendly. Oh and being able to watch the fountain show at the Bellagio from your dinner table isn't so bad either.

I stopped by at Prime tonight after a grueling 9 hour business meeting.  When I arrived, I was seated at a great table close to the window where I could see the Bellagio Fountain Show in the background.  After I ordered my Whiskey, I had a chance to truly appreciate the beauty of this restaurant.  The decor is very upscale, romantic and very ornate.  A great place for a power business dinner or a date.

For dinner, I ordered the Butternut Squash Soup, Bone-in Rib-eye Steak, Potato Gnocchi and their Banana Tart for desert.

My entire meal was amazing.  Each dish was perfectly prepared and super yummy!  
If you want a great steak dinner in one of Las Vegas' most romantic places, come to the Prime!

The food, fountain show and sexy decor rocks!!

Had dinner at prime at Saturday, way overpriced for the quality and taste, service was OK not excellent, I would say the best part of dinner was dessert and the bread, had the bone in filet medium rare and it was just ok have had much better steaks at other vegas steakhouses including delmonicos and delfriscos, I give it 3 stars only because of ambiance and location next to the lake, also the potato neoche was very good

I mean where do we start?
The atmosphere: very laid back, but dress nice. The views of the bellagio fountain show is breathtaking, the waiters are super informative and very funny guys. We had seafood platters which included every seafood you can think of, lamb chops, ny strip and filet, along with caesar salad mash potatos, mac and cheese(to die for), asparagus, mushrooms, i mean you name it.

Most def will be back. Thanks to the CHEF!

When you pay PRIME prices you expect PRIME service and PRIME food. This was at least our fifth visit to PRIME and very likely our last.

We have celebrated birthdays and anniversaries at PRIME and on December 23, 2010 were looking for a quiet getaway and a splurge on dinner with perfect service as we had enjoyed in the past. We arrived at our reservation time. Our prior request for a table by the window was not honored but it was a nice table and we were happy when we were seated. In all past visits I would have given PRIME a five star rating. We ordered drinks and appetizers. We soon noticed that the highly attentive, though not imposing service we have come to love and expect at PRIME was not present. Drinks took over 10 minutes and bread took 20. The shrimp cocktail was amazing as usual, keeping in mind that 4 shrimp for $20 ought to be amazing. 

We each ordered the Baby Iceberg Lettuce with Crispy Bacon & Maytag Bleu Cheese Dressing. This was served about 30 minutes into our visit. (By then my husband was ready for another drink and started trying to catch someone's eye to request one. Our waiter was occupied with the table of 5 seated next to us. Finally my husband asked someone else for another drink. It took at least 15-20 more minutes for the drink to arrive and the person who brought it was not our waiter and not until after we had complained to the manager.) For $18 each you might expect some interesting salad presentation. I enjoyed eating the salad but not the fact that I had to cut the lettuce myself. It looked like they had just cut a center slice of the baby lettuce head and plopped it on a plate. My husband thought the salad was too rich as there were blue cheese chunks and heavy blue cheese dressing along with very thick bacon. 

For the main course we each ordered the small filet mignon $44 for 8oz. These don't come with any side dishes so we also ordered sides of potatoes and mushrooms to share. We had been there about an hour by now and my drink was empty, our waters were empty and our waiter was now taking an order at a third table. I asked a staff member passing by if I could please speak to a manager. The General Manager came right to our table. I told her we were sad that the service was so poor and that our waiter seemed not to have time for us. My husband still did not have the second drink. The Manager was extremely polite and said she was very sorry and that she would take care of things. This did get things going -- though we did not like to have to complain to get decent service. My husband's second drink came a minute after she walked away. Then the filet were served but again not by our waiter. I suspect they had been sitting "up" for a while. The filet were cold to the touch but each had two small charred green chili peppers sizzling next to them. The charred pepper smell was overpowering to the point that it hit the sinus right as they lifted off the silver cover.  Within that same minute sides were delivered. We got the mushrooms but instead of potatoes, we got creamed spinach. 

That was it. The dinner we had been looking forward to for months was ruined. Since neither of us like hot peppers or spinach, we decided to leave. I asked for the manager again and told her that we needed to leave as the wrong side and hot peppers along with the poor service had ruined our dinner. I asked her to please charge what we had eaten up to that point to our room, but she declined to do so. She was very empathetic and offered to reseat us and start over or send whatever we wanted back to our room. This was a kind offer but we were just not up for either as our experience was ruined. By then it was around 9pm and we were just tired of trying to beg for service in what is supposed to be a four star place. 

After many good dinners and fond memories of the exceptionally fine service, superior food and decor as well as the beautiful view of the fountains, I don't think we will go back. This awful experience has ruined it for us. Given that this hotel opened in 1998, we both wondered whether the waiters we had so very much enjoyed in prior visits had moved on to newer places or were just not working.

This area has always been my home and close to my college. I came to look at a place here and i was blown away- the apts are amazing and i was treated like a vip- i usually dont take the time to review but i walked out with a wow factor- the manager shannon really took the time to talk to me and make my move seamless- i appreciated her professionalism - i canf wait to have some wine from my patio- and look at the city-
Really good location well kept for older property.  Friendly staff.  Plan on moving in

Hello!
This is for any tenants who currently reside at PRIME: many of your neighbors have gotten together and want to start a tenant association.

We want to let all of you know that there is a way to resolve the issues you may have, good or bad. I spoke to a resident the other night who was in tears because she does not know how to communicate her concerns to someone other than the management team that is on site. In speaking with our neighbors there appears to be more of us who have valid issues and feel like we have been bullied and have no recourse except to move.

Well for a brand new tenant like myself, moving out of a place that I want to live because of the way I am being treated is not a good option for me. We are not asking for anything but transparency and respect.
